    71 #ifdef HAVE_X_WINDOWS
    72 typedef struct x_bitmap_record Bitmap_Record;
    73 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
    74 #define GET_PIXEL(ximg, x, y) XGetPixel (ximg, x, y)
    75 #define PUT_PIXEL XPutPixel
    76 #define NO_PIXMAP None
    77 
    78 #define PIX_MASK_RETAIN 0
    79 #define PIX_MASK_DRAW   1
    80 #endif  /* !USE_CAIRO */
    81 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS */
    82 
    83 #if defined(USE_CAIRO) || defined(HAVE_NS)
    84 #define RGB_TO_ULONG(r, g, b) (((r) << 16) | ((g) << 8) | (b))
    85 #ifndef HAVE_NS
    86 #define ARGB_TO_ULONG(a, r, g, b) (((a) << 24) | ((r) << 16) | ((g) << 8) | (b))
    87 #endif
    88 #define RED_FROM_ULONG(color)   (((color) >> 16) & 0xff)
    89 #define GREEN_FROM_ULONG(color) (((color) >> 8) & 0xff)
    90 #define BLUE_FROM_ULONG(color)  ((color) & 0xff)
    91 #define RED16_FROM_ULONG(color)         (RED_FROM_ULONG (color) * 0x101)
    92 #define GREEN16_FROM_ULONG(color)       (GREEN_FROM_ULONG (color) * 0x101)
    93 #define BLUE16_FROM_ULONG(color)        (BLUE_FROM_ULONG (color) * 0x101)
    94 #endif
    95 
    96 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
    97 #define GET_PIXEL image_pix_context_get_pixel
    98 #define PUT_PIXEL image_pix_container_put_pixel
    99 #define NO_PIXMAP 0
   100 
   101 #define PIX_MASK_RETAIN 0
   102 #define PIX_MASK_DRAW   255
   103 
   104 static unsigned long image_alloc_image_color (struct frame *, struct image *,
   105                                               Lisp_Object, unsigned long);
   106 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
   107 
   108 #if defined HAVE_PGTK && defined HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK
   109 /* In pgtk, we don't want to create scaled image.  If we create scaled
   110  * image on scale=2.0 environment, the created image is half size and
   111  * Gdk scales it back, and the result is blurry.  To avoid this, we
   112  * hold original size image as far as we can, and let Gdk to scale it
   113  * when it is shown.  */
   114 # define DONT_CREATE_TRANSFORMED_IMAGEMAGICK_IMAGE
   115 #endif
   116 
   117 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
   118 
   119 /* We need (or want) w32.h only when we're _not_ compiling for Cygwin.  */
   120 #ifdef WINDOWSNT
   121 # include "w32common.h"
   122 # include "w32.h"
   123 #endif
   124 
   125 typedef struct w32_bitmap_record Bitmap_Record;
   126 #define GET_PIXEL(ximg, x, y) GetPixel (ximg, x, y)
   127 #define PUT_PIXEL XPutPixel
   128 #define NO_PIXMAP 0
   129 
   130 #define PIX_MASK_RETAIN 0
   131 #define PIX_MASK_DRAW   1
   132 
   133 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */

   136 typedef struct ns_bitmap_record Bitmap_Record;

   139 #define PUT_PIXEL XPutPixel
   140 #define NO_PIXMAP 0
   141 
   142 #define PIX_MASK_RETAIN 0
   143 #define PIX_MASK_DRAW   1
   144 
   145 #endif /* HAVE_NS */

   149 #endif /* HAVE_PGTK */

   152      && ! (defined HAVE_NTGUI || defined USE_CAIRO || defined HAVE_NS))

   157 #ifdef HAVE_HAIKU
   158 #include "haiku_support.h"
   159 typedef struct haiku_bitmap_record Bitmap_Record;

   161 #define GET_PIXEL(ximg, x, y) haiku_get_pixel (ximg, x, y)
   162 #define PUT_PIXEL haiku_put_pixel
   163 #define NO_PIXMAP 0
   164 
   165 #define PIX_MASK_RETAIN 0
   166 #define PIX_MASK_DRAW   1
   167 
   168 #define RGB_TO_ULONG(r, g, b) (((r) << 16) | ((g) << 8) | (b))
   169 #define RED_FROM_ULONG(color)   (((color) >> 16) & 0xff)
   170 #define GREEN_FROM_ULONG(color) (((color) >> 8) & 0xff)
   171 #define BLUE_FROM_ULONG(color)  ((color) & 0xff)
   172 #define RED16_FROM_ULONG(color)         (RED_FROM_ULONG (color) * 0x101)
   173 #define GREEN16_FROM_ULONG(color)       (GREEN_FROM_ULONG (color) * 0x101)
   174 #define BLUE16_FROM_ULONG(color)        (BLUE_FROM_ULONG (color) * 0x101)
   175 
   176 #endif

   180 
   181 typedef struct android_bitmap_record Bitmap_Record;
   182 
   183 typedef struct android_image XImage;
   184 typedef android_pixmap Pixmap;
   185 
   186 #define GET_PIXEL(ximg, x, y)           android_get_pixel (ximg, x, y)
   187 #define PUT_PIXEL(ximg, x, y, pixel)    android_put_pixel (ximg, x, y, pixel)
   188 #define NO_PIXMAP                       0
   189 
   190 #define PIX_MASK_RETAIN 0
   191 #define PIX_MASK_DRAW   1
   192 
   193 #define RGB_TO_ULONG(r, g, b) (((r) << 16) | ((g) << 8) | (b))
   194 #define RED_FROM_ULONG(color)   (((color) >> 16) & 0xff)
   195 #define GREEN_FROM_ULONG(color) (((color) >> 8) & 0xff)
   196 #define BLUE_FROM_ULONG(color)  ((color) & 0xff)
   197 #define RED16_FROM_ULONG(color)         (RED_FROM_ULONG (color) * 0x101)
   198 #define GREEN16_FROM_ULONG(color)       (GREEN_FROM_ULONG (color) * 0x101)
   199 #define BLUE16_FROM_ULONG(color)        (BLUE_FROM_ULONG (color) * 0x101)
   200 
   201 #endif

   203 static void image_disable_image (struct frame *, struct image *);
   204 static void image_edge_detection (struct frame *, struct image *, Lisp_Object,
   205                                   Lisp_Object);

   207 static void init_color_table (void);
   208 static unsigned long lookup_rgb_color (struct frame *f, int r, int g, int b);
   209 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
   210 static void free_color_table (void);

   217 
   218 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
   219 
   220 static Emacs_Pix_Container
   221 image_create_pix_container (unsigned int width, unsigned int height,
   222                             unsigned int depth)
   223 {
   224   Emacs_Pix_Container pimg;
   225 
   226   pimg = xmalloc (sizeof (*pimg));
   227   pimg->width = width;
   228   pimg->height = height;
   229   pimg->bits_per_pixel = depth == 1 ? 8 : 32;
   230   pimg->bytes_per_line = cairo_format_stride_for_width ((depth == 1
   231                                                          ? CAIRO_FORMAT_A8
   232                                                          : CAIRO_FORMAT_RGB24),
   233                                                         width);
   234   pimg->data = xmalloc (pimg->bytes_per_line * height);
   235 
   236   return pimg;
   237 }
   238 
   239 static void
   240 image_pix_container_put_pixel (Emacs_Pix_Container image,
   241                                int x, int y, unsigned long pixel)
   242 {
   243   if (image->bits_per_pixel == 32)
   244     ((uint32_t *)(image->data + y * image->bytes_per_line))[x] = pixel;
   245   else
   246     ((uint8_t *)(image->data + y * image->bytes_per_line))[x] = pixel;
   247 }
   248 
   249 static unsigned long
   250 image_pix_context_get_pixel (Emacs_Pix_Context image, int x, int y)
   251 {
   252   if (image->bits_per_pixel == 32)
   253     return ((uint32_t *)(image->data + y * image->bytes_per_line))[x];
   254   else
   255     return ((uint8_t *)(image->data + y * image->bytes_per_line))[x];
   256 }
   257 
   258 static Emacs_Pix_Container
   259 image_pix_container_create_from_bitmap_data (struct frame *f,
   260                                              char *data, unsigned int width,
   261                                              unsigned int height,
   262                                              unsigned long fg,
   263                                              unsigned long bg)
   264 {
   265   Emacs_Pix_Container pimg = image_create_pix_container (width, height, 0);
   266   int bytes_per_line = (width + (CHAR_BIT - 1)) / CHAR_BIT;
   267 
   268   for (int y = 0; y < height; y++)
   269     {
   270       for (int x = 0; x < width; x++)
   271         PUT_PIXEL (pimg, x, y,
   272                    (data[x / CHAR_BIT] >> (x % CHAR_BIT)) & 1 ? fg : bg);
   273       data += bytes_per_line;
   274     }
   275 
   276   return pimg;
   277 }
   278 
   279 static cairo_surface_t *
   280 cr_create_surface_from_pix_containers (Emacs_Pix_Container pimg,
   281                                        Emacs_Pix_Container mask)
   282 {
   283   cairo_surface_t *surface;
   284 
   285   if (mask)
   286     {
   287       int x, y;
   288 
   289       for (y = 0; y < pimg->height; y++)
   290         for (x = 0; x < pimg->width; x++)
   291           {
   292             unsigned long color, alpha;
   293             int r, g, b;
   294 
   295             color = GET_PIXEL (pimg, x, y);
   296             alpha = GET_PIXEL (mask, x, y);
   297             r = (RED_FROM_ULONG (color) * alpha + 0x7f) / 0xff;
   298             g = (GREEN_FROM_ULONG (color) * alpha + 0x7f) / 0xff;
   299             b = (BLUE_FROM_ULONG (color) * alpha + 0x7f) / 0xff;
   300             PUT_PIXEL (pimg, x, y, ARGB_TO_ULONG (alpha, r, g, b));
   301           }
   302       xfree (mask->data);
   303       mask->data = NULL;
   304     }
   305   surface = cairo_image_surface_create_for_data ((unsigned char *) pimg->data,
   306                                                  (mask ? CAIRO_FORMAT_ARGB32
   307                                                   : CAIRO_FORMAT_RGB24),
   308                                                  pimg->width, pimg->height,
   309                                                  pimg->bytes_per_line);
   310   static const cairo_user_data_key_t key;
   311   cairo_surface_set_user_data (surface, &key, pimg->data, xfree);
   312   pimg->data = NULL;
   313 
   314   return surface;
   315 }
   316 
   317 static void
   318 cr_put_image_to_cr_data (struct image *img)
   319 {
   320   cairo_pattern_t *pattern = NULL;
   321   cairo_surface_t *surface = cr_create_surface_from_pix_containers (img->pixmap,
   322                                                                     img->mask);
   323   if (surface)
   324     {
   325       pattern = cairo_pattern_create_for_surface (surface);
   326       if (img->cr_data)
   327         {
   328           cairo_matrix_t matrix;
   329           cairo_pattern_get_matrix (img->cr_data, &matrix);
   330           cairo_pattern_set_matrix (pattern, &matrix);
   331           cairo_pattern_set_filter
   332             (pattern, cairo_pattern_get_filter (img->cr_data));
   333           cairo_pattern_destroy (img->cr_data);
   334         }
   335       cairo_surface_destroy (surface);
   336     }
   337 
   338   img->cr_data = pattern;
   339 }
   340 
   341 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
   342 
   343 #ifdef HAVE_NS
   344 /* Use with images created by ns_image_for_XPM.  */
   345 static unsigned long
   346 XGetPixel (Emacs_Pix_Container image, int x, int y)
   347 {
   348   return ns_get_pixel (image, x, y);
   349 }
   350 
   351 /* Use with images created by ns_image_for_XPM; alpha set to 1;
   352    pixel is assumed to be in RGB form.  */
   353 static void
   354 XPutPixel (Emacs_Pix_Container image, int x, int y, unsigned long pixel)
   355 {
   356   ns_put_pixel (image, x, y, pixel);
   357 }
   358 #endif /* HAVE_NS */
   359 
   360 /* Code to deal with bitmaps.  Bitmaps are referenced by their bitmap
   361    id, which is just an int that this section returns.  Bitmaps are
   362    reference counted so they can be shared among frames.
   363 
   364    Bitmap indices are guaranteed to be > 0, so a negative number can
   365    be used to indicate no bitmap.
   366 
   367    If you use image_create_bitmap_from_data, then you must keep track
   368    of the bitmaps yourself.  That is, creating a bitmap from the same
   369    data more than once will not be caught.  */
   370 
   371 /* Functions to access the contents of a bitmap, given an id.  */
   372 
   373 #ifdef HAVE_X_WINDOWS
   374 static int
   375 x_bitmap_height (struct frame *f, ptrdiff_t id)
   376 {
   377   return FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->bitmaps[id - 1].height;
   378 }
   379 
   380 static int
   381 x_bitmap_width (struct frame *f, ptrdiff_t id)
   382 {
   383   return FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->bitmaps[id - 1].width;
   384 }
   385 
   386 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
   387 cairo_pattern_t *
   388 x_bitmap_stipple (struct frame *f, Pixmap pixmap)
   389 {
   390   Display_Info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
   391 
   392   for (ptrdiff_t i = 0; i < dpyinfo->bitmaps_last; i++)
   393     {
   394       struct x_bitmap_record *bm = dpyinfo->bitmaps + i;
   395 
   396       if (bm->refcount && bm->pixmap == pixmap && bm->depth == 1)
   397         {
   398           if (bm->stipple == NULL)
   399             {
   400               cairo_surface_t *surface
   401                 = cairo_xlib_surface_create_for_bitmap (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
   402                                                         pixmap,
   403                                                         FRAME_X_SCREEN (f),
   404                                                         bm->width, bm->height);
   405               cairo_pattern_t *pattern
   406                 = cairo_pattern_create_for_surface (surface);
   407               cairo_surface_destroy (surface);
   408               cairo_pattern_set_extend (pattern, CAIRO_EXTEND_REPEAT);
   409               bm->stipple = pattern;
   410             }
   411 
   412           return bm->stipple;
   413         }
   414     }
   415 
   416   return NULL;
   417 }
   418 
   419 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
   420 #endif
   421 
   422 #if defined (HAVE_X_WINDOWS) || defined (HAVE_NTGUI)
   423 ptrdiff_t
   424 image_bitmap_pixmap (struct frame *f, ptrdiff_t id)
   425 {
   426   /* HAVE_NTGUI needs the explicit cast here.  */
   427   return (ptrdiff_t) FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->bitmaps[id - 1].pixmap;
   428 }
   429 #endif
   430 
   431 #ifdef HAVE_X_WINDOWS
   432 int
   433 x_bitmap_mask (struct frame *f, ptrdiff_t id)
   434 {
   435   return FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->bitmaps[id - 1].mask;
   436 }
   437 #endif
   438 
   439 /* Allocate a new bitmap record.  Returns index of new record.  */
   440 
   441 static ptrdiff_t
   442 image_allocate_bitmap_record (struct frame *f)
   443 {
   444   Display_Info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
   445   ptrdiff_t i;
   446 
   447   if (dpyinfo->bitmaps_last < dpyinfo->bitmaps_size)
   448     return ++dpyinfo->bitmaps_last;
   449 
   450   for (i = 0; i < dpyinfo->bitmaps_size; ++i)
   451     if (dpyinfo->bitmaps[i].refcount == 0)
   452       return i + 1;
   453 
   454   dpyinfo->bitmaps =
   455     xpalloc (dpyinfo->bitmaps, &dpyinfo->bitmaps_size,
   456              10, -1, sizeof *dpyinfo->bitmaps);
   457   return ++dpyinfo->bitmaps_last;
   458 }
   459 
   460 /* Add one reference to the reference count of the bitmap with id ID.  */
   461 
   462 void
   463 image_reference_bitmap (struct frame *f, ptrdiff_t id)
   464 {
   465   ++FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->bitmaps[id - 1].refcount;
   466 }
   467 
   468 #ifdef HAVE_PGTK
   469 static cairo_pattern_t *
   470 image_create_pattern_from_pixbuf (struct frame *f, GdkPixbuf * pixbuf)
   471 {
   472   GdkPixbuf *pb = gdk_pixbuf_add_alpha (pixbuf, TRUE, 255, 255, 255);
   473   cairo_surface_t *surface =
   474     cairo_surface_create_similar_image (cairo_get_target
   475                                         (f->output_data.pgtk->cr_context),
   476                                         CAIRO_FORMAT_A1,
   477                                         gdk_pixbuf_get_width (pb),
   478                                         gdk_pixbuf_get_height (pb));
   479 
   480   cairo_t *cr = cairo_create (surface);
   481   gdk_cairo_set_source_pixbuf (cr, pb, 0, 0);
   482   cairo_set_operator (cr, CAIRO_OPERATOR_SOURCE);
   483   cairo_paint (cr);
   484   cairo_destroy (cr);
   485 
   486   cairo_pattern_t *pat = cairo_pattern_create_for_surface (surface);
   487   cairo_pattern_set_extend (pat, CAIRO_EXTEND_REPEAT);
   488 
   489   cairo_surface_destroy (surface);
   490   g_object_unref (pb);
   491 
   492   return pat;
   493 }
   494 #endif
   495 
   496 /* Create a bitmap for frame F from a HEIGHT x WIDTH array of bits at BITS.  */
   497 
   498 ptrdiff_t
   499 image_create_bitmap_from_data (struct frame *f, char *bits,
   500                                unsigned int width, unsigned int height)
   501 {
   502   Display_Info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
   503   ptrdiff_t id;
   504 
   505 #ifdef HAVE_X_WINDOWS
   506   Pixmap bitmap;
   507   bitmap = XCreateBitmapFromData (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
   508                                   dpyinfo->root_window,
   509                                   bits, width, height);
   510   if (! bitmap)
   511     return -1;
   512 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS */
   513 
   514 #if defined HAVE_ANDROID && !defined ANDROID_STUBIFY
   515   android_pixmap bitmap;
   516 
   517   bitmap = android_create_bitmap_from_data (bits, width, height);
   518 
   519   if (!bitmap)
   520     return -1;
   521 #elif defined HAVE_ANDROID
   522   ((void) dpyinfo);
   523   emacs_abort ();
   524 #endif /* HAVE_ANDROID && !defined ANDROID_STUBIFY */
   525 
   526 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
   527   Lisp_Object frame UNINIT;     /* The value is not used.  */
   528   Emacs_Pixmap bitmap;
   529   bitmap = CreateBitmap (width, height,
   530                          FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (XFRAME (frame))->n_planes,
   531                          FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (XFRAME (frame))->n_cbits,
   532                          bits);
   533   if (! bitmap)
   534     return -1;
   535 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
   536 
   537 #ifdef HAVE_NS
   538   void *bitmap = ns_image_from_XBM (bits, width, height, 0, 0);
   539   if (!bitmap)
   540       return -1;
   541 #endif
   542 
   543 #ifdef HAVE_PGTK
   544   GdkPixbuf *pixbuf = gdk_pixbuf_new (GDK_COLORSPACE_RGB,
   545                                       FALSE,
   546                                       8,
   547                                       width,
   548                                       height);
   549   {
   550     char *sp = bits;
   551     int mask = 0x01;
   552     unsigned char *buf = gdk_pixbuf_get_pixels (pixbuf);
   553     int rowstride = gdk_pixbuf_get_rowstride (pixbuf);
   554     for (int y = 0; y < height; y++)
   555       {
   556         unsigned char *dp = buf + rowstride * y;
   557         for (int x = 0; x < width; x++)
   558           {
   559             if (*sp & mask)
   560               {
   561                 *dp++ = 0xff;
   562                 *dp++ = 0xff;
   563                 *dp++ = 0xff;
   564               }
   565             else
   566               {
   567                 *dp++ = 0x00;
   568                 *dp++ = 0x00;
   569                 *dp++ = 0x00;
   570               }
   571             if ((mask <<= 1) >= 0x100)
   572               {
   573                 mask = 0x01;
   574                 sp++;
   575               }
   576           }
   577         if (mask != 0x01)
   578           {
   579             mask = 0x01;
   580             sp++;
   581           }
   582       }
   583   }
   584 #endif /* HAVE_PGTK */
   585 
   586 #ifdef HAVE_HAIKU
   587   void *bitmap, *stipple;
   588   int bytes_per_line, x, y;
   589 
   590   bitmap = BBitmap_new (width, height, false);
   591 
   592   if (!bitmap)
   593     return -1;
   594 
   595   bytes_per_line = (width + 7) / 8;
   596   stipple = xmalloc (height * bytes_per_line);
   597   memcpy (stipple, bits, height * bytes_per_line);
   598 
   599   for (y = 0; y < height; y++)
   600     {
   601       for (x = 0; x < width; x++)
   602         PUT_PIXEL (bitmap, x, y, ((bits[8] >> (x % 8)) & 1
   603                                   ? f->foreground_pixel
   604                                   : f->background_pixel));
   605       bits += bytes_per_line;
   606     }
   607 #endif
   608 
   609   id = image_allocate_bitmap_record (f);
   610 
   611 #ifdef HAVE_NS
   612   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].img = bitmap;
   613   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].depth = 1;
   614 #endif
   615 
   616 #ifdef HAVE_PGTK
   617   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].img = pixbuf;
   618   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].depth = 1;
   619   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].pattern =
   620     image_create_pattern_from_pixbuf (f, pixbuf);
   621 #endif
   622 
   623 #ifdef HAVE_HAIKU
   624   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].img = bitmap;
   625   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].depth = 1;
   626   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].stipple_bits = stipple;
   627   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].stipple_foreground
   628     = f->foreground_pixel & 0xffffffff;
   629   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].stipple_background
   630     = f->background_pixel & 0xffffffff;
   631 #endif
   632 
   633   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].file = NULL;
   634   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].height = height;
   635   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].width = width;
   636   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].refcount = 1;
   637 
   638 #if defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID
   639 #ifndef ANDROID_STUBIFY
   640   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].pixmap = bitmap;
   641 #endif /* ANDROID_STUBIFY */
   642   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].have_mask = false;
   643   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].depth = 1;
   644 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
   645   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].stipple = NULL;
   646 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
   647 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS || HAVE_ANDROID */
   648 
   649 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
   650   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].pixmap = bitmap;
   651   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].hinst = NULL;
   652   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].depth = 1;
   653 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
   654 
   655   return id;
   656 }
   657 
   658 #if defined HAVE_ANDROID && !defined ANDROID_STUBIFY
   659 #include "android.h"
   660 
   661 /* This abstraction allows directly loading images from assets without
   662    copying them to a file descriptor first.  */
   663 typedef struct android_fd_or_asset image_fd;
   664 #else /* !defined HAVE_ANDROID || defined ANDROID_STUBIFY */
   665 typedef int image_fd;
   666 #endif /* defined HAVE_ANDROID && !defined ANDROID_STUBIFY */
   667 
   668 #if defined HAVE_HAIKU || defined HAVE_NS || defined HAVE_ANDROID
   669 static char *slurp_file (image_fd, ptrdiff_t *);
   670 static Lisp_Object image_find_image_fd (Lisp_Object, image_fd *);
   671 static bool xbm_read_bitmap_data (struct frame *, char *, char *,
   672                                   int *, int *, char **, bool);
   673 #endif
   674 
   675 /* Create bitmap from file FILE for frame F.  */
   676 
   677 ptrdiff_t
   678 image_create_bitmap_from_file (struct frame *f, Lisp_Object file)
   679 {
   680 #if defined (HAVE_NTGUI)
   681   return -1;  /* W32_TODO : bitmap support */
   682 #else
   683   Display_Info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
   684 #endif
   685 
   686 #ifdef HAVE_NS
   687   ptrdiff_t id, size;
   688   int fd, width, height, rc;
   689   char *contents, *data;
   690   void *bitmap;
   691 
   692   if (!STRINGP (image_find_image_fd (file, &fd)))
   693     return -1;
   694 
   695   contents = slurp_file (fd, &size);
   696 
   697   if (!contents)
   698     return -1;
   699 
   700   rc = xbm_read_bitmap_data (f, contents, contents + size,
   701                              &width, &height, &data, 0);
   702 
   703   if (!rc)
   704     {
   705       xfree (contents);
   706       return -1;
   707     }
   708 
   709   bitmap = ns_image_from_XBM (data, width, height, 0, 0);
   710 
   711   if (!bitmap)
   712     {
   713       xfree (contents);
   714       xfree (data);
   715       return -1;
   716     }
   717 
   718   id = image_allocate_bitmap_record (f);
   719   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].img = bitmap;
   720   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].refcount = 1;
   721   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].file = xlispstrdup (file);
   722   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].depth = 1;
   723   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].height = ns_image_width (bitmap);
   724   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].width = ns_image_height (bitmap);
   725 
   726   xfree (contents);
   727   xfree (data);
   728   return id;
   729 #endif
   730 
   731 #ifdef HAVE_PGTK
   732   GError *err = NULL;
   733   ptrdiff_t id;
   734   void * bitmap = gdk_pixbuf_new_from_file (SSDATA (file), &err);
   735 
   736   if (!bitmap)
   737     {
   738       g_error_free (err);
   739       return -1;
   740     }
   741 
   742   id = image_allocate_bitmap_record (f);
   743 
   744   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].img = bitmap;
   745   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].refcount = 1;
   746   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].file = xlispstrdup (file);
   747   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].height = gdk_pixbuf_get_width (bitmap);
   748   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].width = gdk_pixbuf_get_height (bitmap);
   749   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].pattern
   750     = image_create_pattern_from_pixbuf (f, bitmap);
   751   return id;
   752 #endif
   753 
   754 #ifdef HAVE_X_WINDOWS
   755   unsigned int width, height;
   756   Pixmap bitmap;
   757   int xhot, yhot, result;
   758   ptrdiff_t id;
   759   Lisp_Object found;
   760   char *filename;
   761 
   762   /* Look for an existing bitmap with the same name.  */
   763   for (id = 0; id < dpyinfo->bitmaps_last; ++id)
   764     {
   765       if (dpyinfo->bitmaps[id].refcount
   766           && dpyinfo->bitmaps[id].file
   767           && !strcmp (dpyinfo->bitmaps[id].file, SSDATA (file)))
   768         {
   769           ++dpyinfo->bitmaps[id].refcount;
   770           return id + 1;
   771         }
   772     }
   773 
   774   /* Search bitmap-file-path for the file, if appropriate.  */
   775   if (openp (Vx_bitmap_file_path, file, Qnil, &found,
   776              make_fixnum (R_OK), false, false, NULL)
   777       < 0)
   778     return -1;
   779 
   780   filename = SSDATA (found);
   781 
   782   result = XReadBitmapFile (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
   783                             dpyinfo->root_window,
   784                             filename, &width, &height, &bitmap,
   785                             &xhot, &yhot);
   786   if (result != BitmapSuccess)
   787     return -1;
   788 
   789   id = image_allocate_bitmap_record (f);
   790   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].pixmap = bitmap;
   791   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].have_mask = false;
   792   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].refcount = 1;
   793   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].file = xlispstrdup (file);
   794   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].depth = 1;
   795   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].height = height;
   796   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].width = width;
   797 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
   798   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].stipple = NULL;
   799 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
   800 
   801   return id;
   802 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS */
   803 
   804 #ifdef HAVE_HAIKU
   805   ptrdiff_t id, size;
   806   int fd, width, height, rc, bytes_per_line, x, y;
   807   char *contents, *data, *tmp;
   808   void *bitmap;
   809   Lisp_Object found;
   810 
   811   /* Look for an existing bitmap with the same name.  */
   812   for (id = 0; id < dpyinfo->bitmaps_last; ++id)
   813     {
   814       if (dpyinfo->bitmaps[id].refcount
   815           && dpyinfo->bitmaps[id].file
   816           && !strcmp (dpyinfo->bitmaps[id].file, SSDATA (file)))
   817         {
   818           ++dpyinfo->bitmaps[id].refcount;
   819           return id + 1;
   820         }
   821     }
   822 
   823   /* Search bitmap-file-path for the file, if appropriate.  */
   824   if (openp (Vx_bitmap_file_path, file, Qnil, &found,
   825              make_fixnum (R_OK), false, false, NULL)
   826       < 0)
   827     return -1;
   828 
   829   if (!STRINGP (image_find_image_fd (file, &fd))
   830       && !STRINGP (image_find_image_fd (found, &fd)))
   831     return -1;
   832 
   833   contents = slurp_file (fd, &size);
   834 
   835   if (!contents)
   836     return -1;
   837 
   838   rc = xbm_read_bitmap_data (f, contents, contents + size,
   839                              &width, &height, &data, 0);
   840 
   841   if (!rc)
   842     {
   843       xfree (contents);
   844       return -1;
   845     }
   846 
   847   bitmap = BBitmap_new (width, height, false);
   848 
   849   if (!bitmap)
   850     {
   851       xfree (contents);
   852       xfree (data);
   853       return -1;
   854     }
   855 
   856   id = image_allocate_bitmap_record (f);
   857 
   858   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].img = bitmap;
   859   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].depth = 1;
   860   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].file = xlispstrdup (file);
   861   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].height = height;
   862   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].width = width;
   863   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].refcount = 1;
   864   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].stipple_foreground
   865     = f->foreground_pixel & 0xffffffff;
   866   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].stipple_background
   867     = f->background_pixel & 0xffffffff;
   868   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].stipple_bits = data;
   869 
   870   bytes_per_line = (width + 7) / 8;
   871   tmp = data;
   872 
   873   for (y = 0; y < height; y++)
   874     {
   875       for (x = 0; x < width; x++)
   876         PUT_PIXEL (bitmap, x, y, ((tmp[x / 8] >> (x % 8)) & 1
   877                                   ? f->foreground_pixel
   878                                   : f->background_pixel));
   879 
   880       tmp += bytes_per_line;
   881     }
   882 
   883   xfree (contents);
   884   return id;
   885 #endif
   886 
   887 #ifdef HAVE_ANDROID
   888 #ifdef ANDROID_STUBIFY
   889   ((void) dpyinfo);
   890 
   891   /* This function should never be called when building stubs.  */
   892   emacs_abort ();
   893 #else
   894   ptrdiff_t id, size;
   895   int width, height, rc;
   896   image_fd fd;
   897   char *contents, *data;
   898   Lisp_Object found;
   899   android_pixmap bitmap;
   900 
   901   /* Look for an existing bitmap with the same name.  */
   902   for (id = 0; id < dpyinfo->bitmaps_last; ++id)
   903     {
   904       if (dpyinfo->bitmaps[id].refcount
   905           && dpyinfo->bitmaps[id].file
   906           && !strcmp (dpyinfo->bitmaps[id].file, SSDATA (file)))
   907         {
   908           ++dpyinfo->bitmaps[id].refcount;
   909           return id + 1;
   910         }
   911     }
   912 
   913   /* Search bitmap-file-path for the file, if appropriate.  */
   914   if (openp (Vx_bitmap_file_path, file, Qnil, &found,
   915              make_fixnum (R_OK), false, false, NULL)
   916       < 0)
   917     return -1;
   918 
   919   if (!STRINGP (image_find_image_fd (file, &fd))
   920       && !STRINGP (image_find_image_fd (found, &fd)))
   921     return -1;
   922 
   923   contents = slurp_file (fd, &size);
   924 
   925   if (!contents)
   926     return -1;
   927 
   928   rc = xbm_read_bitmap_data (f, contents, contents + size,
   929                              &width, &height, &data, 0);
   930 
   931   if (!rc)
   932     {
   933       xfree (contents);
   934       return -1;
   935     }
   936 
   937   xfree (contents);
   938   bitmap = android_create_bitmap_from_data (data, width, height);
   939   xfree (data);
   940 
   941   id = image_allocate_bitmap_record (f);
   942   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].pixmap = bitmap;
   943   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].have_mask = false;
   944   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].refcount = 1;
   945   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].file = xlispstrdup (file);
   946   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].depth = 1;
   947   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].height = height;
   948   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].width = width;
   949 
   950   return id;
   951 #endif
   952 #endif
   953 }
   954 
   955 /* Free bitmap B.  */
   956 
   957 static void
   958 free_bitmap_record (Display_Info *dpyinfo, Bitmap_Record *bm)
   959 {
   960 #ifdef HAVE_X_WINDOWS
   961   /* Free the pixmap and mask.  Only do this if DPYINFO->display is
   962      still set, which may not be the case if the connection has
   963      already been closed in response to an IO error.  */
   964 
   965   if (dpyinfo->display)
   966     {
   967       XFreePixmap (dpyinfo->display, bm->pixmap);
   968       if (bm->have_mask)
   969         XFreePixmap (dpyinfo->display, bm->mask);
   970     }
   971 
   972 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
   973   if (bm->stipple)
   974     cairo_pattern_destroy (bm->stipple);
   975 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
   976 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS */
   977 
   978 #if defined HAVE_ANDROID && !defined ANDROID_STUBIFY
   979   android_free_pixmap (bm->pixmap);
   980 
   981   if (bm->have_mask)
   982     android_free_pixmap (bm->pixmap);
   983 #endif
   984 
   985 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
   986   DeleteObject (bm->pixmap);
   987 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
   988 
   989 #ifdef HAVE_NS
   990   ns_release_object (bm->img);
   991 #endif
   992 
   993 #ifdef HAVE_PGTK
   994   if (bm->pattern != NULL)
   995     cairo_pattern_destroy (bm->pattern);
   996 #endif
   997 
   998 #ifdef HAVE_HAIKU
   999   BBitmap_free (bm->img);
  1000 
  1001   if (bm->stipple_bits)
  1002     xfree (bm->stipple_bits);
  1003 #endif
  1004 
  1005   if (bm->file)
  1006     {
  1007       xfree (bm->file);
  1008       bm->file = NULL;
  1009     }
  1010 }
  1011 
  1012 /* Remove reference to bitmap with id number ID.  */
  1013 
  1014 void
  1015 image_destroy_bitmap (struct frame *f, ptrdiff_t id)
  1016 {
  1017   Display_Info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  1018 
  1019   if (id > 0)
  1020     {
  1021       Bitmap_Record *bm = &dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1];
  1022 
  1023       if (--bm->refcount == 0)
  1024         {
  1025           block_input ();
  1026           free_bitmap_record (dpyinfo, bm);
  1027           unblock_input ();
  1028         }
  1029     }
  1030 }
  1031 
  1032 /* Free all the bitmaps for the display specified by DPYINFO.  */
  1033 
  1034 void
  1035 image_destroy_all_bitmaps (Display_Info *dpyinfo)
  1036 {
  1037   ptrdiff_t i;
  1038   Bitmap_Record *bm = dpyinfo->bitmaps;
  1039 
  1040   for (i = 0; i < dpyinfo->bitmaps_last; i++, bm++)
  1041     if (bm->refcount > 0)
  1042       free_bitmap_record (dpyinfo, bm);
  1043 
  1044   dpyinfo->bitmaps_last = 0;
  1045 }
  1046 
  1047 #ifndef HAVE_XRENDER
  1048 /* Required for the definition of image_create_x_image_and_pixmap_1 below.  */
  1049 typedef void Picture;
  1050 #endif
  1051 
  1052 static bool image_create_x_image_and_pixmap_1 (struct frame *, int, int, int,
  1053                                                Emacs_Pix_Container *,
  1054                                                Emacs_Pixmap *, Picture *);
  1055 static void image_destroy_x_image (Emacs_Pix_Container);
  1056 
  1057 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  1058 static HDC image_get_x_image_or_dc (struct frame *, struct image *,
  1059                                     bool, HGDIOBJ *);
  1060 static void image_unget_x_image_or_dc (struct image *, bool,
  1061                                        HDC, HGDIOBJ);
  1062 #else
  1063 static Emacs_Pix_Container image_get_x_image (struct frame *, struct image *,
  1064                                               bool);
  1065 static void image_unget_x_image (struct image *, bool, Emacs_Pix_Container);
  1066 #define image_get_x_image_or_dc(f, img, mask_p, dummy)  \
  1067   image_get_x_image (f, img, mask_p)
  1068 #define image_unget_x_image_or_dc(img, mask_p, ximg, dummy)     \
  1069   image_unget_x_image (img, mask_p, ximg)
  1070 #endif
  1071 
  1072 #if defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  1073 
  1074 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
  1075 static void image_sync_to_pixmaps (struct frame *, struct image *);
  1076 #endif  /* !USE_CAIRO */
  1077 
  1078 /* We are working on X-specific data structures here even with cairo.
  1079    So we use X-specific versions of image construction/destruction
  1080    functions and inline the specific case of four_corners_best.  */
  1081 
  1082 static bool x_create_x_image_and_pixmap (struct frame *, int, int, int,
  1083                                          XImage **, Pixmap *);
  1084 static void x_destroy_x_image (XImage *);
  1085 
  1086 #if defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS
  1087 
  1088 /* Create a mask of a bitmap. Note is this not a perfect mask.
  1089    It's nicer with some borders in this context */
  1090 
  1091 void
  1092 x_create_bitmap_mask (struct frame *f, ptrdiff_t id)
  1093 {
  1094   Pixmap pixmap, mask;
  1095   XImage *ximg, *mask_img;
  1096   unsigned long width, height;
  1097   bool result;
  1098   unsigned long bg UNINIT;
  1099   unsigned long x, y, xp, xm, yp, ym;
  1100   GC gc;
  1101 
  1102   Display_Info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  1103 
  1104   if (!(id > 0))
  1105     return;
  1106 
  1107   pixmap = image_bitmap_pixmap (f, id);
  1108   width = x_bitmap_width (f, id);
  1109   height = x_bitmap_height (f, id);
  1110 
  1111   block_input ();
  1112   ximg = XGetImage (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), pixmap, 0, 0, width, height,
  1113                     ~0, ZPixmap);
  1114 
  1115   if (!ximg)
  1116     {
  1117       unblock_input ();
  1118       return;
  1119     }
  1120 
  1121   result = x_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, width, height, 1, &mask_img, &mask);
  1122 
  1123   unblock_input ();
  1124   if (!result)
  1125     {
  1126       XDestroyImage (ximg);
  1127       return;
  1128     }
  1129 
  1130   unsigned long corner_pixels[4];
  1131   corner_pixels[0] = XGetPixel (ximg, 0, 0);
  1132   corner_pixels[1] = XGetPixel (ximg, width - 1, 0);
  1133   corner_pixels[2] = XGetPixel (ximg, width - 1, height - 1);
  1134   corner_pixels[3] = XGetPixel (ximg, 0, height - 1);
  1135   int i, best_count;
  1136   for (i = best_count = 0; i < 4; ++i)
  1137     {
  1138       int j, n;
  1139 
  1140       for (j = n = 0; j < 4; ++j)
  1141         if (corner_pixels[i] == corner_pixels[j])
  1142           ++n;
  1143 
  1144       if (n > best_count)
  1145         bg = corner_pixels[i], best_count = n;
  1146     }
  1147 
  1148   for (y = 0; y < ximg->height; ++y)
  1149     {
  1150       for (x = 0; x < ximg->width; ++x)
  1151         {
  1152           xp = x != ximg->width - 1 ? x + 1 : 0;
  1153           xm = x != 0 ? x - 1 : ximg->width - 1;
  1154           yp = y != ximg->height - 1 ? y + 1 : 0;
  1155           ym = y != 0 ? y - 1 : ximg->height - 1;
  1156           if (XGetPixel (ximg, x, y) == bg
  1157               && XGetPixel (ximg, x, yp) == bg
  1158               && XGetPixel (ximg, x, ym) == bg
  1159               && XGetPixel (ximg, xp, y) == bg
  1160               && XGetPixel (ximg, xp, yp) == bg
  1161               && XGetPixel (ximg, xp, ym) == bg
  1162               && XGetPixel (ximg, xm, y) == bg
  1163               && XGetPixel (ximg, xm, yp) == bg
  1164               && XGetPixel (ximg, xm, ym) == bg)
  1165             XPutPixel (mask_img, x, y, 0);
  1166           else
  1167             XPutPixel (mask_img, x, y, 1);
  1168         }
  1169     }
  1170 
  1171   eassert (input_blocked_p ());
  1172   gc = XCreateGC (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), mask, 0, NULL);
  1173   XPutImage (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), mask, gc, mask_img, 0, 0, 0, 0,
  1174              width, height);
  1175   XFreeGC (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc);
  1176 
  1177   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].have_mask = true;
  1178   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].mask = mask;
  1179 
  1180   XDestroyImage (ximg);
  1181   x_destroy_x_image (mask_img);
  1182 }
  1183 
  1184 #endif
  1185 
  1186 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID*/
  1187 
  1188 /***********************************************************************
  1189                             Image types
  1190  ***********************************************************************/
  1191 
  1192 /* Each image format (JPEG, TIFF, ...) supported is described by
  1193    a structure of the type below.  */
  1194 
  1195 struct image_type
  1196 {
  1197   /* Index of a symbol uniquely identifying the image type, e.g., 'jpeg'.  */
  1198   int type;
  1199 
  1200   /* Check that SPEC is a valid image specification for the given
  1201      image type.  Value is true if SPEC is valid.  */
  1202   bool (*valid_p) (Lisp_Object spec);
  1203 
  1204   /* Load IMG which is used on frame F from information contained in
  1205      IMG->spec.  Value is true if successful.  */
  1206   bool (*load_img) (struct frame *f, struct image *img);
  1207 
  1208   /* Free resources of image IMG which is used on frame F.  */
  1209   void (*free_img) (struct frame *f, struct image *img);
  1210 
  1211 #ifdef WINDOWSNT
  1212   /* Initialization function (used for dynamic loading of image
  1213      libraries on Windows), or NULL if none.  */
  1214   bool (*init) (void);
  1215   /* An initializer for the init field.  */
  1216 #endif
  1217 #if defined HAVE_RSVG || defined HAVE_PNG || defined HAVE_GIF || \
  1218   defined HAVE_TIFF || defined HAVE_JPEG || defined HAVE_XPM || \
  1219   defined HAVE_NS || defined HAVE_HAIKU || defined HAVE_PGTK || \
  1220   defined HAVE_WEBP || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  1221 # ifdef WINDOWSNT
  1222 #  define IMAGE_TYPE_INIT(f) f
  1223 # else
  1224 #  define IMAGE_TYPE_INIT(f)
  1225 # endif
  1226 #endif
  1227 };
  1228 
  1229 /* Forward function prototypes.  */
  1230 
  1231 static struct image_type const *lookup_image_type (Lisp_Object);
  1232 static void image_laplace (struct frame *, struct image *);
  1233 static void image_emboss (struct frame *, struct image *);
  1234 static void image_build_heuristic_mask (struct frame *, struct image *,
  1235                                     Lisp_Object);
  1236 
  1237 static void
  1238 add_image_type (Lisp_Object type)
  1239 {
  1240   Vimage_types = Fcons (type, Vimage_types);
  1241 }
  1242 
  1243 
  1244 /* Value is true if OBJECT is a valid Lisp image specification.  A
  1245    valid image specification is a list whose car is the symbol
  1246    `image', and whose rest is a property list.  The property list must
  1247    contain a value for key `:type'.  That value must be the name of a
  1248    supported image type.  The rest of the property list depends on the
  1249    image type.  */
  1250 
  1251 bool
  1252 valid_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
  1253 {
  1254   if (IMAGEP (object))
  1255     {
  1256       Lisp_Object tail = XCDR (object);
  1257       FOR_EACH_TAIL_SAFE (tail)
  1258         {
  1259           if (EQ (XCAR (tail), QCtype))
  1260             {
  1261               tail = XCDR (tail);
  1262               if (CONSP (tail))
  1263                 {
  1264                   struct image_type const *type =
  1265                     lookup_image_type (XCAR (tail));
  1266                   if (type)
  1267                     return type->valid_p (object);
  1268                 }
  1269               break;
  1270             }
  1271           tail = XCDR (tail);
  1272           if (! CONSP (tail))
  1273             return false;
  1274         }
  1275     }
  1276 
  1277   return false;
  1278 }
  1279 
  1280 /* Log error message with format string FORMAT and trailing arguments.
  1281    Signaling an error, e.g. when an image cannot be loaded, is not a
  1282    good idea because this would interrupt redisplay, and the error
  1283    message display would lead to another redisplay.  This function
  1284    therefore simply displays a message.  */
  1285 
  1286 static void
  1287 image_error (const char *format, ...)
  1288 {
  1289   va_list ap;
  1290   va_start (ap, format);
  1291   vadd_to_log (format, ap);
  1292   va_end (ap);
  1293 }
  1294 
  1295 static void
  1296 image_size_error (void)
  1297 {
  1298   image_error ("Invalid image size (see `max-image-size')");
  1299 }
  1300 
  1301 
  1302 /***********************************************************************
  1303                          Image specifications
  1304  ***********************************************************************/
  1305 
  1306 enum image_value_type
  1307 {
  1308   IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,
  1309   IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,
  1310   IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,
  1311   IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,
  1312   IMAGE_POSITIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,
  1313   IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR,
  1314   IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,
  1315   IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,
  1316   IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,
  1317   IMAGE_FUNCTION_VALUE,
  1318   IMAGE_NUMBER_VALUE,
  1319   IMAGE_BOOL_VALUE
  1320 };
  1321 
  1322 /* Structure used when parsing image specifications.  */
  1323 
  1324 struct image_keyword
  1325 {
  1326   /* Name of keyword.  */
  1327   const char *name;
  1328 
  1329   /* The type of value allowed.  */
  1330   enum image_value_type type;
  1331 
  1332   /* True means key must be present.  */
  1333   bool mandatory_p;
  1334 
  1335   /* Used to recognize duplicate keywords in a property list.  */
  1336   bool count;
  1337 
  1338   /* The value that was found.  */
  1339   Lisp_Object value;
  1340 };
  1341 
  1342 
  1343 /* Parse image spec SPEC according to KEYWORDS.  A valid image spec
  1344    has the format (image KEYWORD VALUE ...).  One of the keyword/
  1345    value pairs must be `:type TYPE'.  KEYWORDS is a vector of
  1346    image_keywords structures of size NKEYWORDS describing other
  1347    allowed keyword/value pairs.  Value is true if SPEC is valid.  */
  1348 
  1349 static bool
  1350 parse_image_spec (Lisp_Object spec, struct image_keyword *keywords,
  1351                   int nkeywords, Lisp_Object type)
  1352 {
  1353   int i;
  1354   Lisp_Object plist;
  1355 
  1356   if (!IMAGEP (spec))
  1357     return false;
  1358 
  1359   plist = XCDR (spec);
  1360   FOR_EACH_TAIL_SAFE (plist)
  1361     {
  1362       Lisp_Object key, value;
  1363 
  1364       /* First element of a pair must be a symbol.  */
  1365       key = XCAR (plist);
  1366       plist = XCDR (plist);
  1367       if (!SYMBOLP (key))
  1368         return false;
  1369 
  1370       /* There must follow a value.  */
  1371       if (!CONSP (plist))
  1372         return false;
  1373       value = XCAR (plist);
  1374 
  1375       /* Find key in KEYWORDS.  Error if not found.  */
  1376       for (i = 0; i < nkeywords; ++i)
  1377         if (strcmp (keywords[i].name, SSDATA (SYMBOL_NAME (key))) == 0)
  1378           break;
  1379 
  1380       if (i == nkeywords)
  1381         goto maybe_done;
  1382 
  1383       /* Record that we recognized the keyword.  If a keyword
  1384          was found more than once, it's an error.  */
  1385       keywords[i].value = value;
  1386       if (keywords[i].count)
  1387         return false;
  1388       keywords[i].count = true;
  1389 
  1390       /* Check type of value against allowed type.  */
  1391       switch (keywords[i].type)
  1392         {
  1393         case IMAGE_STRING_VALUE:
  1394           if (!STRINGP (value))
  1395             return false;
  1396           break;
  1397 
  1398         case IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE:
  1399           if (!STRINGP (value) && !NILP (value))
  1400             return false;
  1401           break;
  1402 
  1403         case IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE:
  1404           if (!SYMBOLP (value))
  1405             return false;
  1406           break;
  1407 
  1408         case IMAGE_POSITIVE_INTEGER_VALUE:
  1409           if (! RANGED_FIXNUMP (1, value, INT_MAX))
  1410             return false;
  1411           break;
  1412 
  1413         case IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR:
  1414           if (RANGED_FIXNUMP (0, value, INT_MAX))
  1415             break;
  1416           if (CONSP (value)
  1417               && RANGED_FIXNUMP (0, XCAR (value), INT_MAX)
  1418               && RANGED_FIXNUMP (0, XCDR (value), INT_MAX))
  1419             break;
  1420           return false;
  1421 
  1422         case IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE:
  1423           if (SYMBOLP (value) && EQ (value, Qcenter))
  1424             break;
  1425           else if (RANGED_FIXNUMP (0, value, 100))
  1426             break;
  1427           return false;
  1428 
  1429         case IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE:
  1430           /* Unlike the other integer-related cases, this one does not
  1431              verify that VALUE fits in 'int'.  This is because callers
  1432              want EMACS_INT.  */
  1433           if (!FIXNUMP (value) || XFIXNUM (value) < 0)
  1434             return false;
  1435           break;
  1436 
  1437         case IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE:
  1438           break;
  1439 
  1440         case IMAGE_FUNCTION_VALUE:
  1441           value = indirect_function (value);
  1442           if (FUNCTIONP (value))
  1443             break;
  1444           return false;
  1445 
  1446         case IMAGE_NUMBER_VALUE:
  1447           if (! NUMBERP (value))
  1448             return false;
  1449           break;
  1450 
  1451         case IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE:
  1452           if (! TYPE_RANGED_FIXNUMP (int, value))
  1453             return false;
  1454           break;
  1455 
  1456         case IMAGE_BOOL_VALUE:
  1457           if (!NILP (value) && !EQ (value, Qt))
  1458             return false;
  1459           break;
  1460 
  1461         default:
  1462           emacs_abort ();
  1463           break;
  1464         }
  1465 
  1466       if (EQ (key, QCtype)
  1467           && !(EQ (type, value) || EQ (type, Qnative_image)))
  1468         return false;
  1469 
  1470     maybe_done:
  1471       if (NILP (XCDR (plist)))
  1472         {
  1473           /* Check that all mandatory fields are present.  */
  1474           for (i = 0; i < nkeywords; ++i)
  1475             if (keywords[i].mandatory_p && keywords[i].count == 0)
  1476               return false;
  1477 
  1478           return true;
  1479         }
  1480     }
  1481 
  1482   return false;
  1483 }
  1484 
  1485 
  1486 /* Return the value of KEY in image specification SPEC.  Value is nil
  1487    if KEY is not present in SPEC.  Set *FOUND depending on whether KEY
  1488    was found in SPEC.  */
  1489 
  1490 static Lisp_Object
  1491 image_spec_value (Lisp_Object spec, Lisp_Object key, bool *found)
  1492 {
  1493   Lisp_Object tail;
  1494 
  1495   eassert (valid_image_p (spec));
  1496 
  1497   tail = XCDR (spec);
  1498   FOR_EACH_TAIL_SAFE (tail)
  1499     {
  1500       if (EQ (XCAR (tail), key))
  1501         {
  1502           if (found)
  1503             *found = 1;
  1504           return XCAR (XCDR (tail));
  1505         }
  1506       tail = XCDR (tail);
  1507       if (! CONSP (tail))
  1508         break;
  1509     }
  1510 
  1511   if (found)
  1512     *found = 0;
  1513   return Qnil;
  1514 }
  1515 
  1516 
  1517 DEFUN ("image-size", Fimage_size, Simage_size, 1, 3, 0,
  1518        doc: /* Return the size of image SPEC as pair (WIDTH . HEIGHT).
  1519 PIXELS non-nil means return the size in pixels, otherwise return the
  1520 size in canonical character units.
  1521 
  1522 FRAME is the frame on which the image will be displayed.  FRAME nil
  1523 or omitted means use the selected frame.
  1524 
  1525 Calling this function will result in the image being stored in the
  1526 image cache.  If this is not desirable, call `image-flush' after
  1527 calling this function.  */)
  1528   (Lisp_Object spec, Lisp_Object pixels, Lisp_Object frame)
  1529 {
  1530   Lisp_Object size;
  1531 
  1532   size = Qnil;
  1533   if (valid_image_p (spec))
  1534     {
  1535       struct frame *f = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
  1536       ptrdiff_t id = lookup_image (f, spec, -1);
  1537       struct image *img = IMAGE_FROM_ID (f, id);
  1538       int width = img->width + 2 * img->hmargin;
  1539       int height = img->height + 2 * img->vmargin;
  1540 
  1541       if (NILP (pixels))
  1542         size = Fcons (make_float ((double) width / FRAME_COLUMN_WIDTH (f)),
  1543                       make_float ((double) height / FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (f)));
  1544       else
  1545         size = Fcons (make_fixnum (width), make_fixnum (height));
  1546     }
  1547   else
  1548     error ("Invalid image specification");
  1549 
  1550   return size;
  1551 }
  1552 
  1553 
  1554 DEFUN ("image-mask-p", Fimage_mask_p, Simage_mask_p, 1, 2, 0,
  1555        doc: /* Return t if image SPEC has a mask bitmap.
  1556 FRAME is the frame on which the image will be displayed.  FRAME nil
  1557 or omitted means use the selected frame.  */)
  1558   (Lisp_Object spec, Lisp_Object frame)
  1559 {
  1560   Lisp_Object mask;
  1561 
  1562   mask = Qnil;
  1563   if (valid_image_p (spec))
  1564     {
  1565       struct frame *f = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
  1566       ptrdiff_t id = lookup_image (f, spec, -1);
  1567       struct image *img = IMAGE_FROM_ID (f, id);
  1568       if (img->mask)
  1569         mask = Qt;
  1570     }
  1571   else
  1572     error ("Invalid image specification");
  1573 
  1574   return mask;
  1575 }
  1576 
  1577 DEFUN ("image-metadata", Fimage_metadata, Simage_metadata, 1, 2, 0,
  1578        doc: /* Return metadata for image SPEC.
  1579 FRAME is the frame on which the image will be displayed.  FRAME nil
  1580 or omitted means use the selected frame.  */)
  1581   (Lisp_Object spec, Lisp_Object frame)
  1582 {
  1583   Lisp_Object ext;
  1584 
  1585   ext = Qnil;
  1586   if (valid_image_p (spec))
  1587     {
  1588       struct frame *f = decode_window_system_frame (frame);
  1589       ptrdiff_t id = lookup_image (f, spec, -1);
  1590       struct image *img = IMAGE_FROM_ID (f, id);
  1591       ext = img->lisp_data;
  1592     }
  1593 
  1594   return ext;
  1595 }
  1596 
  1597 
  1598 /***********************************************************************
  1599                  Image type independent image structures
  1600  ***********************************************************************/
  1601 
  1602 #define MAX_IMAGE_SIZE 10.0
  1603 /* Allocate and return a new image structure for image specification
  1604    SPEC.  SPEC has a hash value of HASH.  */
  1605 
  1606 static struct image *
  1607 make_image (Lisp_Object spec, EMACS_UINT hash)
  1608 {
  1609   struct image *img = xzalloc (sizeof *img);
  1610   Lisp_Object file = image_spec_value (spec, QCfile, NULL);
  1611 
  1612   eassert (valid_image_p (spec));
  1613   img->dependencies = NILP (file) ? Qnil : list1 (file);
  1614   img->type = lookup_image_type (image_spec_value (spec, QCtype, NULL));
  1615   eassert (img->type != NULL);
  1616   img->spec = spec;
  1617   img->lisp_data = Qnil;
  1618   img->ascent = DEFAULT_IMAGE_ASCENT;
  1619   img->hash = hash;
  1620   img->corners[BOT_CORNER] = -1;  /* Full image */
  1621   return img;
  1622 }
  1623 
  1624 
  1625 /* Free image IMG which was used on frame F, including its resources.  */
  1626 
  1627 static void
  1628 free_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  1629 {
  1630   if (img)
  1631     {
  1632       struct image_cache *c = FRAME_IMAGE_CACHE (f);
  1633 
  1634       /* Remove IMG from the hash table of its cache.  */
  1635       if (img->prev)
  1636         img->prev->next = img->next;
  1637       else
  1638         c->buckets[img->hash % IMAGE_CACHE_BUCKETS_SIZE] = img->next;
  1639 
  1640       if (img->next)
  1641         img->next->prev = img->prev;
  1642 
  1643       c->images[img->id] = NULL;
  1644 
  1645 #if !defined USE_CAIRO && defined HAVE_XRENDER
  1646       if (img->picture)
  1647         XRenderFreePicture (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), img->picture);
  1648       if (img->mask_picture)
  1649         XRenderFreePicture (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), img->mask_picture);
  1650 #endif
  1651 
  1652       /* Free resources, then free IMG.  */
  1653       img->type->free_img (f, img);
  1654       xfree (img->face_font_family);
  1655       xfree (img);
  1656     }
  1657 }
  1658 
  1659 /* Return true if the given widths and heights are valid for display.  */
  1660 
  1661 static bool
  1662 check_image_size (struct frame *f, int width, int height)
  1663 {
  1664   int w, h;
  1665 
  1666   if (width <= 0 || height <= 0)
  1667     return 0;
  1668 
  1669   if (FIXNUMP (Vmax_image_size))
  1670     return (width <= XFIXNUM (Vmax_image_size)
  1671             && height <= XFIXNUM (Vmax_image_size));
  1672   else if (FLOATP (Vmax_image_size))
  1673     {
  1674       if (f != NULL)
  1675         {
  1676           w = FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f);
  1677           h = FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f);
  1678         }
  1679       else
  1680         w = h = 1024;  /* Arbitrary size for unknown frame. */
  1681       return (width <= XFLOAT_DATA (Vmax_image_size) * w
  1682               && height <= XFLOAT_DATA (Vmax_image_size) * h);
  1683     }
  1684   else
  1685     return 1;
  1686 }
  1687 
  1688 /* Prepare image IMG for display on frame F.  Must be called before
  1689    drawing an image.  */
  1690 
  1691 void
  1692 prepare_image_for_display (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  1693 {
  1694   /* We're about to display IMG, so set its timestamp to `now'.  */
  1695   img->timestamp = current_timespec ();
  1696 
  1697   /* If IMG doesn't have a pixmap yet, load it now, using the image
  1698      type dependent loader function.  */
  1699   if (img->pixmap == NO_PIXMAP && !img->load_failed_p)
  1700     img->load_failed_p = ! img->type->load_img (f, img);
  1701 
  1702 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  1703   if (!img->load_failed_p)
  1704     {
  1705       block_input ();
  1706       if (img->cr_data == NULL || (cairo_pattern_get_type (img->cr_data)
  1707                                    != CAIRO_PATTERN_TYPE_SURFACE))
  1708         {
  1709           /* Fill in the background/background_transparent field while
  1710              we have img->pixmap->data/img->mask->data.  */
  1711           IMAGE_BACKGROUND (img, f, img->pixmap);
  1712           IMAGE_BACKGROUND_TRANSPARENT (img, f, img->mask);
  1713           cr_put_image_to_cr_data (img);
  1714           if (img->cr_data == NULL)
  1715             {
  1716               img->load_failed_p = 1;
  1717               img->type->free_img (f, img);
  1718             }
  1719         }
  1720       unblock_input ();
  1721     }
  1722 #elif defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  1723   if (!img->load_failed_p)
  1724     {
  1725       block_input ();
  1726       image_sync_to_pixmaps (f, img);
  1727       unblock_input ();
  1728     }
  1729 #endif
  1730 }
  1731 
  1732 
  1733 /* Value is the number of pixels for the ascent of image IMG when
  1734    drawn in face FACE.  */
  1735 
  1736 int
  1737 image_ascent (struct image *img, struct face *face, struct glyph_slice *slice)
  1738 {
  1739   int height;
  1740   int ascent;
  1741 
  1742   if (slice->height == img->height)
  1743     height = img->height + img->vmargin;
  1744   else if (slice->y == 0)
  1745     height = slice->height + img->vmargin;
  1746   else
  1747     height = slice->height;
  1748 
  1749   if (img->ascent == CENTERED_IMAGE_ASCENT)
  1750     {
  1751       if (face->font)
  1752         {
  1753 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  1754           /* W32 specific version.  Why?. ++kfs  */
  1755           ascent = height / 2 - (FONT_DESCENT (face->font)
  1756                                  - FONT_BASE (face->font)) / 2;
  1757 #else
  1758           /* This expression is arranged so that if the image can't be
  1759              exactly centered, it will be moved slightly up.  This is
  1760              because a typical font is `top-heavy' (due to the presence
  1761              uppercase letters), so the image placement should err towards
  1762              being top-heavy too.  It also just generally looks better.  */
  1763           ascent = (height + FONT_BASE (face->font)
  1764                     - FONT_DESCENT (face->font) + 1) / 2;
  1765 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  1766         }
  1767       else
  1768         ascent = height / 2;
  1769     }
  1770   else
  1771     ascent = height * (img->ascent / 100.0);
  1772 
  1773   return ascent;
  1774 }
  1775 
  1776 
  1777 /* Image background colors.  */
  1778 
  1779 /* Find the "best" corner color of a bitmap.
  1780    On W32, PIMG is assumed to a device context with the bitmap selected.  */
  1781 
  1782 static RGB_PIXEL_COLOR
  1783 four_corners_best (Emacs_Pix_Context pimg, int *corners,
  1784                    unsigned long width, unsigned long height)
  1785 {
  1786   RGB_PIXEL_COLOR corner_pixels[4];
  1787   RGB_PIXEL_COLOR best UNINIT;
  1788   int i, best_count;
  1789 
  1790   if (corners && corners[BOT_CORNER] >= 0)
  1791     {
  1792       /* Get the colors at the corner_pixels of pimg.  */
  1793       corner_pixels[0] = GET_PIXEL (pimg, corners[LEFT_CORNER], corners[TOP_CORNER]);
  1794       corner_pixels[1] = GET_PIXEL (pimg, corners[RIGHT_CORNER] - 1, corners[TOP_CORNER]);
  1795       corner_pixels[2] = GET_PIXEL (pimg, corners[RIGHT_CORNER] - 1, corners[BOT_CORNER] - 1);
  1796       corner_pixels[3] = GET_PIXEL (pimg, corners[LEFT_CORNER], corners[BOT_CORNER] - 1);
  1797     }
  1798   else
  1799 
  1800     {
  1801       /* Get the colors at the corner_pixels of pimg.  */
  1802       corner_pixels[0] = GET_PIXEL (pimg, 0, 0);
  1803       corner_pixels[1] = GET_PIXEL (pimg, width - 1, 0);
  1804       corner_pixels[2] = GET_PIXEL (pimg, width - 1, height - 1);
  1805       corner_pixels[3] = GET_PIXEL (pimg, 0, height - 1);
  1806     }
  1807   /* Choose the most frequently found color as background.  */
  1808   for (i = best_count = 0; i < 4; ++i)
  1809     {
  1810       int j, n;
  1811 
  1812       for (j = n = 0; j < 4; ++j)
  1813         if (corner_pixels[i] == corner_pixels[j])
  1814           ++n;
  1815 
  1816       if (n > best_count)
  1817         best = corner_pixels[i], best_count = n;
  1818     }
  1819 
  1820   return best;
  1821 }
  1822 
  1823 /* Return the `background' field of IMG.  If IMG doesn't have one yet,
  1824    it is guessed heuristically.  If non-zero, XIMG is an existing
  1825    Emacs_Pix_Context object (device context with the image selected on
  1826    W32) to use for the heuristic.  */
  1827 
  1828 RGB_PIXEL_COLOR
  1829 image_background (struct image *img, struct frame *f, Emacs_Pix_Context pimg)
  1830 {
  1831   if (! img->background_valid)
  1832     /* IMG doesn't have a background yet, try to guess a reasonable value.  */
  1833     {
  1834       bool free_pimg = !pimg;
  1835 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  1836       HGDIOBJ prev;
  1837 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  1838 
  1839       if (free_pimg)
  1840         pimg = image_get_x_image_or_dc (f, img, 0, &prev);
  1841 
  1842       RGB_PIXEL_COLOR bg
  1843         = four_corners_best (pimg, img->corners, img->width, img->height);
  1844 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  1845       {
  1846         char color_name[30];
  1847         sprintf (color_name, "#%04x%04x%04x",
  1848                  (unsigned int) RED16_FROM_ULONG (bg),
  1849                  (unsigned int) GREEN16_FROM_ULONG (bg),
  1850                  (unsigned int) BLUE16_FROM_ULONG (bg));
  1851         bg = image_alloc_image_color (f, img, build_string (color_name), 0);
  1852       }
  1853 #endif
  1854       img->background = bg;
  1855 
  1856       if (free_pimg)
  1857         image_unget_x_image_or_dc (img, 0, pimg, prev);
  1858 
  1859       img->background_valid = 1;
  1860     }
  1861 
  1862   return img->background;
  1863 }
  1864 
  1865 /* Return the `background_transparent' field of IMG.  If IMG doesn't
  1866    have one yet, it is guessed heuristically.  If non-zero, MASK is an
  1867    existing Emacs_Pix_Context (XImage* on X) object to use for the
  1868    heuristic.  */
  1869 
  1870 int
  1871 image_background_transparent (struct image *img, struct frame *f,
  1872                               Emacs_Pix_Context mask)
  1873 {
  1874   if (! img->background_transparent_valid)
  1875     /* IMG doesn't have a background yet, try to guess a reasonable value.  */
  1876     {
  1877       if (img->mask)
  1878         {
  1879           bool free_mask = !mask;
  1880 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  1881           HGDIOBJ prev;
  1882 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  1883 
  1884           if (free_mask)
  1885             mask = image_get_x_image_or_dc (f, img, 1, &prev);
  1886 
  1887           img->background_transparent
  1888             = (four_corners_best (mask, img->corners, img->width, img->height) == PIX_MASK_RETAIN);
  1889 
  1890           if (free_mask)
  1891             image_unget_x_image_or_dc (img, 1, mask, prev);
  1892         }
  1893       else
  1894         img->background_transparent = 0;
  1895 
  1896       img->background_transparent_valid = 1;
  1897     }
  1898 
  1899   return img->background_transparent;
  1900 }
  1901 
  1902 /***********************************************************************
  1903                   Helper functions for X image types
  1904  ***********************************************************************/
  1905 
  1906 /* Clear X resources of image IMG on frame F according to FLAGS.
  1907    FLAGS is bitwise-or of the following masks:
  1908    CLEAR_IMAGE_PIXMAP free the pixmap if any.
  1909    CLEAR_IMAGE_MASK means clear the mask pixmap if any.
  1910    CLEAR_IMAGE_COLORS means free colors allocated for the image, if
  1911      any.  */
  1912 
  1913 #define CLEAR_IMAGE_PIXMAP      (1 << 0)
  1914 #define CLEAR_IMAGE_MASK        (1 << 1)
  1915 #define CLEAR_IMAGE_COLORS      (1 << 2)
  1916 
  1917 static void
  1918 image_clear_image_1 (struct frame *f, struct image *img, int flags)
  1919 {
  1920   if (flags & CLEAR_IMAGE_PIXMAP)
  1921     {
  1922       if (img->pixmap)
  1923         {
  1924           FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->free_pixmap (f, img->pixmap);
  1925           img->pixmap = NO_PIXMAP;
  1926           /* NOTE (HAVE_NS): background color is NOT an indexed color! */
  1927           img->background_valid = 0;
  1928         }
  1929 #if (defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID) && !defined USE_CAIRO
  1930       if (img->ximg)
  1931         {
  1932           image_destroy_x_image (img->ximg);
  1933           img->ximg = NULL;
  1934           img->background_valid = 0;
  1935         }
  1936 #endif
  1937     }
  1938 
  1939   if (flags & CLEAR_IMAGE_MASK)
  1940     {
  1941       if (img->mask)
  1942         {
  1943           FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->free_pixmap (f, img->mask);
  1944           img->mask = NO_PIXMAP;
  1945           img->background_transparent_valid = 0;
  1946         }
  1947 #if (defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID) && !defined USE_CAIRO
  1948       if (img->mask_img)
  1949         {
  1950           image_destroy_x_image (img->mask_img);
  1951           img->mask_img = NULL;
  1952           img->background_transparent_valid = 0;
  1953         }
  1954 #endif
  1955     }
  1956 
  1957   if ((flags & CLEAR_IMAGE_COLORS) && img->ncolors)
  1958     {
  1959       /* W32_TODO: color table support.  */
  1960 #if defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS && !defined USE_CAIRO
  1961       x_free_colors (f, img->colors, img->ncolors);
  1962 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS && !USE_CAIRO */
  1963       xfree (img->colors);
  1964       img->colors = NULL;
  1965       img->ncolors = 0;
  1966     }
  1967 
  1968 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  1969   if (img->cr_data)
  1970     {
  1971       cairo_pattern_destroy (img->cr_data);
  1972       img->cr_data = NULL;
  1973     }
  1974 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
  1975 }
  1976 
  1977 /* Free X resources of image IMG which is used on frame F.  */
  1978 
  1979 static void
  1980 image_clear_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  1981 {
  1982   block_input ();
  1983   image_clear_image_1 (f, img,
  1984                        (CLEAR_IMAGE_PIXMAP
  1985                         | CLEAR_IMAGE_MASK
  1986                         | CLEAR_IMAGE_COLORS));
  1987   unblock_input ();
  1988 }
  1989 
  1990 
  1991 /* Allocate color COLOR_NAME for image IMG on frame F.  If color
  1992    cannot be allocated, use DFLT.  Add a newly allocated color to
  1993    IMG->colors, so that it can be freed again.  Value is the pixel
  1994    color.  */
  1995 
  1996 static unsigned long
  1997 image_alloc_image_color (struct frame *f, struct image *img,
  1998                          Lisp_Object color_name, unsigned long dflt)
  1999 {
  2000   Emacs_Color color;
  2001   unsigned long result;
  2002 
  2003   eassert (STRINGP (color_name));
  2004 
  2005   if (FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->defined_color_hook (f,
  2006                                               SSDATA (color_name),
  2007                                               &color,
  2008                                               true,
  2009                                               false)
  2010       && img->ncolors < min (min (PTRDIFF_MAX, SIZE_MAX) / sizeof *img->colors,
  2011                              INT_MAX))
  2012     {
  2013       /* This isn't called frequently so we get away with simply
  2014          reallocating the color vector to the needed size, here.  */
  2015       ptrdiff_t ncolors = img->ncolors + 1;
  2016       img->colors = xrealloc (img->colors, ncolors * sizeof *img->colors);
  2017       img->colors[ncolors - 1] = color.pixel;
  2018       img->ncolors = ncolors;
  2019       result = color.pixel;
  2020     }
  2021   else
  2022     result = dflt;
  2023 
  2024   return result;
  2025 }
  2026 
  2027 
  2028 
  2029 /***********************************************************************
  2030                              Image Cache
  2031  ***********************************************************************/
  2032 
  2033 static void cache_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img);
  2034 
  2035 /* Return a new, initialized image cache that is allocated from the
  2036    heap.  Call free_image_cache to free an image cache.  */
  2037 
  2038 struct image_cache *
  2039 make_image_cache (void)
  2040 {
  2041   struct image_cache *c = xmalloc (sizeof *c);
  2042 
  2043   c->size = 50;
  2044   c->used = c->refcount = 0;
  2045   c->images = xmalloc (c->size * sizeof *c->images);
  2046   c->buckets = xzalloc (IMAGE_CACHE_BUCKETS_SIZE * sizeof *c->buckets);
  2047   return c;
  2048 }
  2049 
  2050 /* Find an image matching SPEC in the cache, and return it.  If no
  2051    image is found, return NULL.  */
  2052 static struct image *
  2053 search_image_cache (struct frame *f, Lisp_Object spec, EMACS_UINT hash,
  2054                     unsigned long foreground, unsigned long background,
  2055                     int font_size, char *font_family, bool ignore_colors)
  2056 {
  2057   struct image *img;
  2058   struct image_cache *c = FRAME_IMAGE_CACHE (f);
  2059   int i = hash % IMAGE_CACHE_BUCKETS_SIZE;
  2060 
  2061   if (!c) return NULL;
  2062 
  2063   /* If the image spec does not specify a background color, the cached
  2064      image must have the same background color as the current frame.
  2065      The foreground color must also match, for the sake of monochrome
  2066      images.
  2067 
  2068      In fact, we could ignore the foreground color matching condition
  2069      for color images, or if the image spec specifies :foreground;
  2070      similarly we could ignore the background color matching condition
  2071      for formats that don't use transparency (such as jpeg), or if the
  2072      image spec specifies :background.  However, the extra memory
  2073      usage is probably negligible in practice, so we don't bother.  */
  2074 
  2075   for (img = c->buckets[i]; img; img = img->next)
  2076     if (img->hash == hash
  2077         && !NILP (Fequal (img->spec, spec))
  2078         && (ignore_colors || (img->face_foreground == foreground
  2079                               && img->face_background == background
  2080                               && img->face_font_size == font_size
  2081                               && (font_family
  2082                                   &&!strcmp (font_family, img->face_font_family)))))
  2083       break;
  2084   return img;
  2085 }
  2086 
  2087 
  2088 /* Filter out image elements that don't affect display, but will
  2089    disrupt finding the image in the cache.  This should perhaps be
  2090    user-configurable, but for now it's hard-coded (but new elements
  2091    can be added at will).  */
  2092 static Lisp_Object
  2093 filter_image_spec (Lisp_Object spec)
  2094 {
  2095   Lisp_Object out = Qnil;
  2096 
  2097   /* Skip past the `image' element.  */
  2098   if (CONSP (spec))
  2099     spec = XCDR (spec);
  2100 
  2101   while (CONSP (spec))
  2102     {
  2103       Lisp_Object key = XCAR (spec);
  2104       spec = XCDR (spec);
  2105       if (CONSP (spec))
  2106         {
  2107           Lisp_Object value = XCAR (spec);
  2108           spec = XCDR (spec);
  2109 
  2110           /* Some animation-related data doesn't affect display, but
  2111              breaks the image cache.  Filter those out.  */
  2112           if (!(EQ (key, QCanimate_buffer)
  2113                 || EQ (key, QCanimate_tardiness)
  2114                 || EQ (key, QCanimate_position)
  2115                 || EQ (key, QCanimate_multi_frame_data)))
  2116             {
  2117               out = Fcons (value, out);
  2118               out = Fcons (key, out);
  2119             }
  2120         }
  2121     }
  2122   return out;
  2123 }
  2124 
  2125 /* Search frame F for an image with spec SPEC, and free it.  */
  2126 
  2127 static void
  2128 uncache_image (struct frame *f, Lisp_Object spec)
  2129 {
  2130   struct image *img;
  2131   EMACS_UINT hash = sxhash (filter_image_spec (spec));
  2132 
  2133   /* Because the background colors are based on the current face, we
  2134      can have multiple copies of an image with the same spec. We want
  2135      to remove them all to ensure the user doesn't see an old version
  2136      of the image when the face changes.  */
  2137   while ((img = search_image_cache (f, spec, hash, 0, 0, 0, NULL, true)))
  2138     {
  2139       free_image (f, img);
  2140       /* As display glyphs may still be referring to the image ID, we
  2141          must garbage the frame (Bug#6426).  */
  2142       SET_FRAME_GARBAGED (f);
  2143     }
  2144 }
  2145 
  2146 
  2147 /* Free image cache of frame F.  Be aware that X frames share images
  2148    caches.  */
  2149 
  2150 void
  2151 free_image_cache (struct frame *f)
  2152 {
  2153   struct image_cache *c = FRAME_IMAGE_CACHE (f);
  2154   if (c)
  2155     {
  2156       ptrdiff_t i;
  2157 
  2158       /* Cache should not be referenced by any frame when freed.  */
  2159       eassert (c->refcount == 0);
  2160 
  2161       for (i = 0; i < c->used; ++i)
  2162         free_image (f, c->images[i]);
  2163       xfree (c->images);
  2164       xfree (c->buckets);
  2165       xfree (c);
  2166       FRAME_IMAGE_CACHE (f) = NULL;
  2167     }
  2168 }
  2169 
  2170 
  2171 /* Clear image cache of frame F.  FILTER=t means free all images.
  2172    FILTER=nil means clear only images that haven't been
  2173    displayed for some time.
  2174    Else, only free the images which have FILTER in their `dependencies'.
  2175    Should be called from time to time to reduce the number of loaded images.
  2176    If image-cache-eviction-delay is non-nil, this frees images in the cache
  2177    which weren't displayed for at least that many seconds.  */
  2178 
  2179 static void
  2180 clear_image_cache (struct frame *f, Lisp_Object filter)
  2181 {
  2182   struct image_cache *c = FRAME_IMAGE_CACHE (f);
  2183 
  2184   if (c && !f->inhibit_clear_image_cache)
  2185     {
  2186       ptrdiff_t i, nfreed = 0;
  2187 
  2188       /* Block input so that we won't be interrupted by a SIGIO
  2189          while being in an inconsistent state.  */
  2190       block_input ();
  2191 
  2192       if (!NILP (filter))
  2193         {
  2194           /* Filter image cache.  */
  2195           for (i = 0; i < c->used; ++i)
  2196             {
  2197               struct image *img = c->images[i];
  2198               if (img && (EQ (Qt, filter)
  2199                           || !NILP (Fmember (filter, img->dependencies))))
  2200                 {
  2201                   free_image (f, img);
  2202                   ++nfreed;
  2203                 }
  2204             }
  2205         }
  2206       else if (FIXNUMP (Vimage_cache_eviction_delay))
  2207         {
  2208           /* Free cache based on timestamp.  */
  2209           struct timespec old, t;
  2210           double delay;
  2211           ptrdiff_t nimages = 0;
  2212 
  2213           for (i = 0; i < c->used; ++i)
  2214             if (c->images[i])
  2215               nimages++;
  2216 
  2217           /* If the number of cached images has grown unusually large,
  2218              decrease the cache eviction delay (Bug#6230).  */
  2219           delay = XFIXNUM (Vimage_cache_eviction_delay);
  2220           if (nimages > 40)
  2221             delay = 1600 * delay / nimages / nimages;
  2222           delay = max (delay, 1);
  2223 
  2224           t = current_timespec ();
  2225           old = timespec_sub (t, dtotimespec (delay));
  2226 
  2227           for (i = 0; i < c->used; ++i)
  2228             {
  2229               struct image *img = c->images[i];
  2230               if (img && timespec_cmp (img->timestamp, old) < 0)
  2231                 {
  2232                   free_image (f, img);
  2233                   ++nfreed;
  2234                 }
  2235             }
  2236         }
  2237 
  2238       /* We may be clearing the image cache because, for example,
  2239          Emacs was iconified for a longer period of time.  In that
  2240          case, current matrices may still contain references to
  2241          images freed above.  So, clear these matrices.  */
  2242       if (nfreed)
  2243         {
  2244           Lisp_Object tail, frame;
  2245 
  2246           FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
  2247             {
  2248               struct frame *fr = XFRAME (frame);
  2249               if (FRAME_IMAGE_CACHE (fr) == c)
  2250                 clear_current_matrices (fr);
  2251             }
  2252 
  2253           windows_or_buffers_changed = 19;
  2254         }
  2255 
  2256       unblock_input ();
  2257     }
  2258 }
  2259 
  2260 void
  2261 clear_image_caches (Lisp_Object filter)
  2262 {
  2263   /* FIXME: We want to do
  2264    * struct terminal *t;
  2265    * for (t = terminal_list; t; t = t->next_terminal)
  2266    *   clear_image_cache (t, filter); */
  2267   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
  2268   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
  2269     if (FRAME_WINDOW_P (XFRAME (frame)))
  2270       clear_image_cache (XFRAME (frame), filter);
  2271 }
  2272 
  2273 DEFUN ("clear-image-cache", Fclear_image_cache, Sclear_image_cache,
  2274        0, 2, 0,
  2275        doc: /* Clear the image cache.
  2276 FILTER nil or a frame means clear all images in the selected frame.
  2277 FILTER t means clear the image caches of all frames.
  2278 Anything else means clear only those images that refer to FILTER,
  2279 which is then usually a filename.
  2280 
  2281 This function also clears the image animation cache.  If
  2282 ANIMATION-CACHE is non-nil, only the image spec `eq' with
  2283 ANIMATION-CACHE is removed, and other image cache entries are not
  2284 evicted.  */)
  2285   (Lisp_Object filter, Lisp_Object animation_cache)
  2286 {
  2287   if (!NILP (animation_cache))
  2288     {
  2289 #if defined (HAVE_WEBP) || defined (HAVE_GIF)
  2290       anim_prune_animation_cache (XCDR (animation_cache));
  2291 #endif
  2292       return Qnil;
  2293     }
  2294 
  2295   if (! (NILP (filter) || FRAMEP (filter)))
  2296     clear_image_caches (filter);
  2297   else
  2298     clear_image_cache (decode_window_system_frame (filter), Qt);
  2299 
  2300   /* Also clear the animation caches.  */
  2301   image_prune_animation_caches (true);
  2302 
  2303   return Qnil;
  2304 }
  2305 
  2306 static size_t
  2307 image_size_in_bytes (struct image *img)
  2308 {
  2309   size_t size = 0;
  2310 
  2311 #if defined USE_CAIRO
  2312   Emacs_Pixmap pm = img->pixmap;
  2313   if (pm)
  2314     size += pm->height * pm->bytes_per_line;
  2315   Emacs_Pixmap msk = img->mask;
  2316   if (msk)
  2317     size += msk->height * msk->bytes_per_line;
  2318 
  2319 #elif defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  2320   /* Use a nominal depth of 24 and a bpp of 32 for pixmap and 1 bpp
