  2321      for mask, to avoid having to query the server. */
  2322   if (img->pixmap != NO_PIXMAP)
  2323     size += img->width * img->height * 4;
  2324   if (img->mask != NO_PIXMAP)
  2325     size += img->width * img->height / 8;
  2326 
  2327   if (img->ximg && img->ximg->data)
  2328     size += img->ximg->bytes_per_line * img->ximg->height;
  2329   if (img->mask_img && img->mask_img->data)
  2330     size += img->mask_img->bytes_per_line * img->mask_img->height;
  2331 
  2332 #elif defined HAVE_NS
  2333   if (img->pixmap)
  2334     size += ns_image_size_in_bytes (img->pixmap);
  2335   if (img->mask)
  2336     size += ns_image_size_in_bytes (img->mask);
  2337 
  2338 #elif defined HAVE_NTGUI
  2339   if (img->pixmap)
  2340     size += w32_image_size (img->pixmap);
  2341   if (img->mask)
  2342     size += w32_image_size (img->mask);
  2343 
  2344 #elif defined HAVE_HAIKU
  2345   if (img->pixmap)
  2346     size += BBitmap_bytes_length (img->pixmap);
  2347   if (img->mask)
  2348     size += BBitmap_bytes_length (img->mask);
  2349 #endif
  2350 
  2351   return size;
  2352 }
  2353 
  2354 static size_t
  2355 image_frame_cache_size (struct frame *f)
  2356 {
  2357   struct image_cache *c = FRAME_IMAGE_CACHE (f);
  2358   if (!c)
  2359     return 0;
  2360 
  2361   size_t total = 0;
  2362   for (ptrdiff_t i = 0; i < c->used; ++i)
  2363     {
  2364       struct image *img = c->images[i];
  2365       total += img ? image_size_in_bytes (img) : 0;
  2366     }
  2367   return total;
  2368 }
  2369 
  2370 DEFUN ("image-flush", Fimage_flush, Simage_flush,
  2371        1, 2, 0,
  2372        doc: /* Flush the image with specification SPEC on frame FRAME.
  2373 This removes the image from the Emacs image cache.  If SPEC specifies
  2374 an image file, the next redisplay of this image will read from the
  2375 current contents of that file.
  2376 
  2377 FRAME nil or omitted means use the selected frame.
  2378 FRAME t means refresh the image on all frames.  */)
  2379   (Lisp_Object spec, Lisp_Object frame)
  2380 {
  2381   if (!valid_image_p (spec))
  2382     error ("Invalid image specification");
  2383 
  2384   if (EQ (frame, Qt))
  2385     {
  2386       Lisp_Object tail;
  2387       FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
  2388         {
  2389           struct frame *f = XFRAME (frame);
  2390           if (FRAME_WINDOW_P (f))
  2391             uncache_image (f, spec);
  2392         }
  2393     }
  2394   else
  2395     uncache_image (decode_window_system_frame (frame), spec);
  2396 
  2397   return Qnil;
  2398 }
  2399 
  2400 
  2401 /* Compute masks and transform image IMG on frame F, as specified
  2402    by the image's specification,  */
  2403 
  2404 static void
  2405 postprocess_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  2406 {
  2407   /* Manipulation of the image's mask.  */
  2408   if (img->pixmap)
  2409     {
  2410       Lisp_Object conversion, spec;
  2411       Lisp_Object mask;
  2412 
  2413       spec = img->spec;
  2414 
  2415       /* `:heuristic-mask t'
  2416          `:mask heuristic'
  2417          means build a mask heuristically.
  2418          `:heuristic-mask (R G B)'
  2419          `:mask (heuristic (R G B))'
  2420          means build a mask from color (R G B) in the
  2421          image.
  2422          `:mask nil'
  2423          means remove a mask, if any.  */
  2424 
  2425       mask = image_spec_value (spec, QCheuristic_mask, NULL);
  2426       if (!NILP (mask))
  2427         image_build_heuristic_mask (f, img, mask);
  2428       else
  2429         {
  2430           bool found_p;
  2431 
  2432           mask = image_spec_value (spec, QCmask, &found_p);
  2433 
  2434           if (EQ (mask, Qheuristic))
  2435             image_build_heuristic_mask (f, img, Qt);
  2436           else if (CONSP (mask)
  2437                    && EQ (XCAR (mask), Qheuristic))
  2438             {
  2439               if (CONSP (XCDR (mask)))
  2440                 image_build_heuristic_mask (f, img, XCAR (XCDR (mask)));
  2441               else
  2442                 image_build_heuristic_mask (f, img, XCDR (mask));
  2443             }
  2444           else if (NILP (mask) && found_p && img->mask)
  2445             image_clear_image_1 (f, img, CLEAR_IMAGE_MASK);
  2446         }
  2447 
  2448 
  2449       /* Should we apply an image transformation algorithm?  */
  2450       conversion = image_spec_value (spec, QCconversion, NULL);
  2451       if (EQ (conversion, Qdisabled))
  2452         image_disable_image (f, img);
  2453       else if (EQ (conversion, Qlaplace))
  2454         image_laplace (f, img);
  2455       else if (EQ (conversion, Qemboss))
  2456         image_emboss (f, img);
  2457       else if (CONSP (conversion)
  2458                && EQ (XCAR (conversion), Qedge_detection))
  2459         {
  2460           Lisp_Object tem;
  2461           tem = XCDR (conversion);
  2462           if (CONSP (tem))
  2463             image_edge_detection (f, img,
  2464                                   plist_get (tem, QCmatrix),
  2465                                   plist_get (tem, QCcolor_adjustment));
  2466         }
  2467     }
  2468 }
  2469 
  2470 #if defined (HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK) || defined (HAVE_NATIVE_TRANSFORMS)
  2471 /* Scale an image size by returning SIZE / DIVISOR * MULTIPLIER,
  2472    safely rounded and clipped to int range.  */
  2473 
  2474 static int
  2475 scale_image_size (int size, double divisor, double multiplier)
  2476 {
  2477   if (divisor != 0)
  2478     {
  2479       double scaled = size * multiplier / divisor;
  2480       if (scaled < INT_MAX)
  2481         {
  2482           /* Use ceil, as rounding can discard fractional SVG pixels.  */
  2483           return ceil (scaled);
  2484         }
  2485     }
  2486   return INT_MAX;
  2487 }
  2488 
  2489 /* Return a size, in pixels, from the value specified by SYMBOL, which
  2490    may be an integer or a pair of the form (VALUE . 'em) where VALUE
  2491    is a float that is multiplied by the font size to get the final
  2492    dimension.
  2493 
  2494    If the value doesn't exist in the image spec, or is invalid, return
  2495    -1.
  2496 */
  2497 static int
  2498 image_get_dimension (struct image *img, Lisp_Object symbol)
  2499 {
  2500   Lisp_Object value = image_spec_value (img->spec, symbol, NULL);
  2501 
  2502   if (FIXNATP (value))
  2503     return min (XFIXNAT (value), INT_MAX);
  2504   if (CONSP (value) && NUMBERP (CAR (value)) && EQ (Qem, CDR (value)))
  2505     return scale_image_size (img->face_font_size, 1, XFLOATINT (CAR (value)));
  2506 
  2507   return -1;
  2508 }
  2509 
  2510 /* Compute the desired size of an image with native size WIDTH x HEIGHT.
  2511    Use IMG to deduce the size.  Store the desired size into
  2512    *D_WIDTH x *D_HEIGHT.  Store -1 x -1 if the native size is OK.  */
  2513 static void
  2514 compute_image_size (double width, double height,
  2515                     struct image *img,
  2516                     int *d_width, int *d_height)
  2517 {
  2518   double scale = 1;
  2519   Lisp_Object value = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCscale, NULL);
  2520   if (NUMBERP (value))
  2521     {
  2522       double dval = XFLOATINT (value);
  2523       if (0 <= dval)
  2524         scale = dval;
  2525     }
  2526 
  2527   /* If width and/or height is set in the display spec assume we want
  2528      to scale to those values.  If either h or w is unspecified, the
  2529      unspecified should be calculated from the specified to preserve
  2530      aspect ratio.  */
  2531   int desired_width = image_get_dimension (img, QCwidth), max_width;
  2532   if (desired_width < 0)
  2533     max_width = image_get_dimension (img, QCmax_width);
  2534   else
  2535     {
  2536       desired_width = scale_image_size (desired_width, 1, scale);
  2537       /* :width overrides :max-width. */
  2538       max_width = -1;
  2539     }
  2540 
  2541   int desired_height = image_get_dimension (img, QCheight), max_height;
  2542   if (desired_height < 0)
  2543     max_height = image_get_dimension (img, QCmax_height);
  2544   else
  2545     {
  2546       desired_height = scale_image_size (desired_height, 1, scale);
  2547       /* :height overrides :max-height. */
  2548       max_height = -1;
  2549     }
  2550 
  2551   /* If we have both width/height set explicitly, we skip past all the
  2552      aspect ratio-preserving computations below. */
  2553   if (0 <= desired_width && 0 <= desired_height)
  2554     goto out;
  2555 
  2556   if (0 <= desired_width)
  2557     /* Width known, calculate height. */
  2558     desired_height = scale_image_size (desired_width, width, height);
  2559   else if (0 <= desired_height)
  2560     /* Height known, calculate width. */
  2561     desired_width = scale_image_size (desired_height, height, width);
  2562   else
  2563     {
  2564       desired_width = scale_image_size (width, 1, scale);
  2565       desired_height = scale_image_size (height, 1, scale);
  2566     }
  2567 
  2568   if (0 <= max_width && max_width < desired_width)
  2569     {
  2570       /* The image is wider than :max-width. */
  2571       desired_width = max_width;
  2572       desired_height = scale_image_size (desired_width, width, height);
  2573     }
  2574 
  2575   if (0 <= max_height && max_height < desired_height)
  2576     {
  2577       /* The image is higher than :max-height. */
  2578       desired_height = max_height;
  2579       desired_width = scale_image_size (desired_height, height, width);
  2580     }
  2581 
  2582  out:
  2583   *d_width = desired_width;
  2584   *d_height = desired_height;
  2585 }
  2586 
  2587 /* image_set_rotation and image_set_transform use affine
  2588    transformation matrices to perform various transforms on the image.
  2589    The matrix is a 2D array of doubles.  It is laid out like this:
  2590 
  2591    m[0][0] = m11 | m[1][0] = m12 | m[2][0] = tx
  2592    --------------+---------------+-------------
  2593    m[0][1] = m21 | m[1][1] = m22 | m[2][1] = ty
  2594    --------------+---------------+-------------
  2595    m[0][2] = 0   | m[1][2] = 0   | m[2][2] = 1
  2596 
  2597    tx and ty represent translations, m11 and m22 represent scaling
  2598    transforms and m21 and m12 represent shear transforms.  Most
  2599    graphics toolkits don't require the third row, however it is
  2600    necessary for multiplication.
  2601 
  2602    Transforms are done by creating a matrix for each action we wish to
  2603    take, then multiplying the transformation matrix by each of those
  2604    matrices in order (matrix multiplication is not commutative).
  2605    After we've done that we can use our modified transformation matrix
  2606    to transform points.  We take the x and y coordinates and convert
  2607    them into a 3x1 matrix and multiply that by the transformation
  2608    matrix and it gives us a new, transformed, set of coordinates:
  2609 
  2610        [m11 m12 tx]   [x]   [m11*x+m12*y+tx*1]   [x']
  2611        [m21 m22 ty] X [y] = [m21*x+m22*y+ty*1] = [y']
  2612        [  0   0  1]   [1]   [     0*x+0*y+1*1]   [ 1]
  2613 
  2614    We don't have to worry about the last step as the graphics toolkit
  2615    will do it for us.
  2616 
  2617    The three transforms we are concerned with are translation, scaling
  2618    and rotation.  The translation matrix looks like this:
  2619 
  2620        [1 0 tx]
  2621        [0 1 ty]
  2622        [0 0  1]
  2623 
  2624    Where tx and ty are the amount to translate the origin in the x and
  2625    y coordinates, respectively.  Since we are translating the origin
  2626    and not the image data itself, it can appear backwards in use, for
  2627    example to move the image 10 pixels to the right, you would set tx
  2628    to -10.
  2629 
  2630    To scale we use:
  2631 
  2632        [x 0 0]
  2633        [0 y 0]
  2634        [0 0 1]
  2635 
  2636    Where x and y are the amounts to scale in the x and y dimensions.
  2637    Values smaller than 1 make the image larger, values larger than 1
  2638    make it smaller.  Negative values flip the image.  For example to
  2639    double the image size set x and y to 0.5.
  2640 
  2641    To rotate we use:
  2642 
  2643        [ cos(r) sin(r) 0]
  2644        [-sin(r) cos(r) 0]
  2645        [      0      0 1]
  2646 
  2647    Where r is the angle of rotation required.  Rotation occurs around
  2648    the origin, not the center of the image.  Note that this is
  2649    normally considered a counter-clockwise rotation, however because
  2650    our y axis is reversed, (0, 0) at the top left, it works as a
  2651    clockwise rotation.
  2652 
  2653    The full process of rotating an image is to move the origin to the
  2654    center of the image (width/2, height/2), perform the rotation, and
  2655    finally move the origin back to the top left of the image, which
  2656    may now be a different corner.
  2657 
  2658    Note that different GUI backends (X, Cairo, w32, NS, Haiku,
  2659    Android) want the transform matrix defined as transform from the
  2660    original image to the transformed image, while others want the
  2661    matrix to describe the transform of the space, which boils down to
  2662    inverting the matrix.
  2663 
  2664    It's possible to pre-calculate the matrix multiplications and just
  2665    generate one transform matrix that will do everything we need in a
  2666    single step, but the maths for each element is much more complex
  2667    and performing the steps separately makes for more readable code.  */
  2668 
  2669 typedef double matrix3x3[3][3];
  2670 
  2671 static void
  2672 matrix3x3_mult (matrix3x3 a, matrix3x3 b, matrix3x3 result)
  2673 {
  2674   for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
  2675     for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
  2676       {
  2677         double sum = 0;
  2678         for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++)
  2679           sum += a[i][k] * b[k][j];
  2680         result[i][j] = sum;
  2681       }
  2682 }
  2683 
  2684 static void
  2685 compute_image_rotation (struct image *img, double *rotation)
  2686 {
  2687   bool foundp = false;
  2688   Lisp_Object value = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCrotation, &foundp);
  2689   if (!foundp)
  2690     return;
  2691   if (! NUMBERP (value))
  2692     {
  2693       image_error ("Invalid image `:rotation' parameter");
  2694       return;
  2695     }
  2696 
  2697   Lisp_Object reduced_angle = Fmod (value, make_fixnum (360));
  2698   if (FLOATP (reduced_angle))
  2699     *rotation = XFLOAT_DATA (reduced_angle);
  2700   else
  2701     *rotation = XFIXNUM (reduced_angle);
  2702 }
  2703 
  2704 #ifdef HAVE_ANDROID
  2705 
  2706 static void
  2707 matrix_identity (matrix3x3 matrix)
  2708 {
  2709   memset (matrix, 0, sizeof (matrix3x3));
  2710 
  2711   matrix[0][0] = 1.0;
  2712   matrix[1][1] = 1.0;
  2713   matrix[2][2] = 1.0;
  2714 }
  2715 
  2716 /* Translate the matrix TRANSFORM to X, Y, and then perform clockwise
  2717    rotation by the given angle THETA in radians and translate back.
  2718    As the transform is being performed in a coordinate system where Y
  2719    grows downwards, the given angle describes a clockwise
  2720    rotation.  */
  2721 
  2722 static void
  2723 matrix_rotate (matrix3x3 transform, double theta, double x, double y)
  2724 {
  2725   matrix3x3 temp, copy;
  2726 
  2727   /* 1. Translate the matrix so X and Y are in the center.  */
  2728 
  2729   matrix_identity (temp);
  2730   memcpy (copy, transform, sizeof copy);
  2731 
  2732   temp[0][2] = x;
  2733   temp[1][2] = y;
  2734 
  2735   matrix3x3_mult (copy, temp, transform);
  2736   matrix_identity (temp);
  2737   memcpy (copy, transform, sizeof copy);
  2738 
  2739   /* 2. Rotate the matrix counter-clockwise, assuming a coordinate
  2740      system where Y grows downwards.  */
  2741 
  2742   temp[0][0] = cos (theta);
  2743   temp[0][1] = -sin (theta);
  2744   temp[1][0] = sinf (theta);
  2745   temp[1][1] = cosf (theta);
  2746 
  2747   matrix3x3_mult (copy, temp, transform);
  2748   matrix_identity (temp);
  2749   memcpy (copy, transform, sizeof copy);
  2750 
  2751   /* 3. Translate back.  */
  2752 
  2753   temp[0][2] = -x;
  2754   temp[1][2] = -y;
  2755 
  2756   matrix3x3_mult (copy, temp, transform);
  2757 }
  2758 
  2759 /* Scale the matrix TRANSFORM by -1, and then apply a TX of width, in
  2760    effect flipping the image horizontally.  */
  2761 
  2762 static void
  2763 matrix_mirror_horizontal (matrix3x3 transform, double width)
  2764 {
  2765   matrix3x3 temp, copy;
  2766 
  2767   matrix_identity (temp);
  2768   memcpy (copy, transform, sizeof copy);
  2769 
  2770   temp[0][0] = -1.0f;
  2771   temp[0][2] = width;
  2772 
  2773   matrix3x3_mult (copy, temp, transform);
  2774 }
  2775 
  2776 static void
  2777 matrix_translate (matrix3x3 transform, float tx, float ty)
  2778 {
  2779   matrix3x3 temp, copy;
  2780 
  2781   matrix_identity (temp);
  2782   memcpy (copy, transform, sizeof copy);
  2783 
  2784   /* Set the tx and ty.  */
  2785   temp[0][2] = tx;
  2786   temp[1][2] = ty;
  2787 
  2788   /* Multiply it with the transform.  */
  2789   matrix3x3_mult (copy, temp, transform);
  2790 }
  2791 
  2792 #endif
  2793 
  2794 static void
  2795 image_set_transform (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  2796 {
  2797   bool flip;
  2798 
  2799 #if defined HAVE_HAIKU
  2800   matrix3x3 identity = {
  2801     { 1, 0, 0 },
  2802     { 0, 1, 0 },
  2803     { 0, 0, 1 },
  2804   };
  2805 
  2806   img->original_width = img->width;
  2807   img->original_height = img->height;
  2808   img->use_bilinear_filtering = false;
  2809 
  2810   memcpy (&img->transform, identity, sizeof identity);
  2811 #endif
  2812 
  2813 #if defined HAVE_ANDROID
  2814   matrix3x3 identity = {
  2815     { 1, 0, 0 },
  2816     { 0, 1, 0 },
  2817     { 0, 0, 1 },
  2818   };
  2819 #endif
  2820 
  2821 # if (defined HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK \
  2822       && !defined DONT_CREATE_TRANSFORMED_IMAGEMAGICK_IMAGE)
  2823   /* ImageMagick images already have the correct transform.  */
  2824   if (EQ (image_spec_value (img->spec, QCtype, NULL), Qimagemagick))
  2825     return;
  2826 # endif
  2827 
  2828 # if !defined USE_CAIRO && defined HAVE_XRENDER
  2829   if (!img->picture)
  2830     return;
  2831 
  2832   /* Store the original dimensions as we'll overwrite them later.  */
  2833   img->original_width = img->width;
  2834   img->original_height = img->height;
  2835 # endif
  2836 
  2837   /* Determine size.  */
  2838   int width, height;
  2839 
  2840 #ifdef HAVE_RSVG
  2841   /* SVGs are pre-scaled to the correct size.  */
  2842   if (EQ (image_spec_value (img->spec, QCtype, NULL), Qsvg))
  2843     {
  2844       width = img->width / FRAME_SCALE_FACTOR (f);
  2845       height = img->height / FRAME_SCALE_FACTOR (f);
  2846     }
  2847   else
  2848 #endif
  2849     compute_image_size (img->width, img->height, img, &width, &height);
  2850 
  2851   /* Determine rotation.  */
  2852   double rotation = 0.0;
  2853   compute_image_rotation (img, &rotation);
  2854 
  2855   /* Determine flipping.  */
  2856   flip = !NILP (image_spec_value (img->spec, QCflip, NULL));
  2857 
  2858 # if defined USE_CAIRO || defined HAVE_XRENDER || defined HAVE_NS || defined HAVE_HAIKU \
  2859   || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  2860   /* We want scale up operations to use a nearest neighbor filter to
  2861      show real pixels instead of munging them, but scale down
  2862      operations to use a blended filter, to avoid aliasing and the like.
  2863 
  2864      TODO: implement for Windows.  */
  2865   bool smoothing;
  2866   Lisp_Object s = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCtransform_smoothing, NULL);
  2867   if (NILP (s))
  2868     smoothing = (width < img->width) || (height < img->height);
  2869   else
  2870     smoothing = !NILP (s);
  2871 # endif
  2872 
  2873 #ifdef HAVE_HAIKU
  2874   img->use_bilinear_filtering = smoothing;
  2875 #endif
  2876 
  2877   /* Perform scale transformation.  */
  2878 
  2879   matrix3x3 matrix
  2880     = {
  2881 # if defined USE_CAIRO || defined HAVE_XRENDER || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  2882         [0][0] = (!IEEE_FLOATING_POINT && width == 0 ? DBL_MAX
  2883                   : img->width / (double) width),
  2884         [1][1] = (!IEEE_FLOATING_POINT && height == 0 ? DBL_MAX
  2885                   : img->height / (double) height),
  2886 # elif defined HAVE_NTGUI || defined HAVE_NS || defined HAVE_HAIKU
  2887         [0][0] = (!IEEE_FLOATING_POINT && img->width == 0 ? DBL_MAX
  2888                   : width / (double) img->width),
  2889         [1][1] = (!IEEE_FLOATING_POINT && img->height == 0 ? DBL_MAX
  2890                   : height / (double) img->height),
  2891 # else
  2892         [0][0] = 1, [1][1] = 1,
  2893 # endif
  2894         [2][2] = 1 };
  2895   img->width = width;
  2896   img->height = height;
  2897 
  2898   /* Perform rotation transformation.  */
  2899 
  2900   int rotate_flag = -1;
  2901 
  2902   /* Haiku needs this, since the transformation is done on the basis
  2903      of the view, and not the image.  */
  2904 #if defined HAVE_HAIKU
  2905   int extra_tx, extra_ty;
  2906 
  2907   extra_tx = 0;
  2908   extra_ty = 0;
  2909 #endif
  2910 
  2911   if (rotation == 0 && !flip)
  2912     rotate_flag = 0;
  2913   else
  2914     {
  2915 #ifndef HAVE_ANDROID
  2916 # if (defined USE_CAIRO || defined HAVE_XRENDER         \
  2917       || defined HAVE_NTGUI || defined HAVE_NS          \
  2918       || defined HAVE_HAIKU)
  2919       int cos_r, sin_r;
  2920       if (rotation == 0)
  2921         {
  2922           /* FLIP is always true here.  As this will rotate by 0
  2923              degrees, it has no visible effect.  Applying only
  2924              translation matrix to the image would be sufficient for
  2925              horizontal flipping, but writing special handling for
  2926              this case would increase code complexity somewhat.  */
  2927           cos_r = 1;
  2928           sin_r = 0;
  2929           rotate_flag = 1;
  2930 
  2931 #ifdef HAVE_HAIKU
  2932           extra_tx = width;
  2933           extra_ty = 0;
  2934 #endif
  2935         }
  2936       else if (rotation == 90)
  2937         {
  2938           width = img->height;
  2939           height = img->width;
  2940           cos_r = 0;
  2941           sin_r = 1;
  2942           rotate_flag = 1;
  2943 
  2944 #if defined HAVE_HAIKU
  2945           if (!flip)
  2946             extra_ty = height;
  2947           extra_tx = 0;
  2948 #endif
  2949         }
  2950       else if (rotation == 180)
  2951         {
  2952           cos_r = -1;
  2953           sin_r = 0;
  2954           rotate_flag = 1;
  2955 
  2956 #ifdef HAVE_HAIKU
  2957           if (!flip)
  2958             extra_tx = width;
  2959           extra_ty = height;
  2960 #endif
  2961         }
  2962       else if (rotation == 270)
  2963         {
  2964           width = img->height;
  2965           height = img->width;
  2966           cos_r = 0;
  2967           sin_r = -1;
  2968           rotate_flag = 1;
  2969 
  2970 #ifdef HAVE_HAIKU
  2971           extra_tx = width;
  2972 
  2973           if (flip)
  2974             extra_ty = height;
  2975 #endif
  2976         }
  2977 
  2978       if (0 < rotate_flag)
  2979         {
  2980 #  if defined USE_CAIRO || defined HAVE_XRENDER || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  2981           /* 1. Translate so (0, 0) is in the center of the image.  */
  2982           matrix3x3 t
  2983             = { [0][0] = 1,
  2984                                         [1][1] = 1,
  2985                 [2][0] = img->width*.5, [2][1] = img->height*.5, [2][2] = 1 };
  2986           matrix3x3 u;
  2987           matrix3x3_mult (t, matrix, u);
  2988 
  2989           /* 2. Rotate.  */
  2990           matrix3x3 rot = { [0][0] = cos_r, [0][1] = -sin_r,
  2991                             [1][0] = sin_r, [1][1] = cos_r,
  2992                                                              [2][2] = 1 };
  2993           matrix3x3 v;
  2994           matrix3x3_mult (rot, u, v);
  2995 
  2996           /* 3. Translate back.  Flip horizontally if requested.  */
  2997           t[2][0] = width * -.5;
  2998           t[2][1] = height * -.5;
  2999           if (flip)
  3000             {
  3001               t[0][0] = -t[0][0];
  3002               t[2][0] = -t[2][0];
  3003             }
  3004           matrix3x3_mult (t, v, matrix);
  3005 #  else
  3006           /* 1. Translate so (0, 0) is in the center of the image.  */
  3007           matrix3x3 t
  3008             = { [0][0] = 1,
  3009                                          [1][1] = 1,
  3010                 [2][0] = img->width*-.5, [2][1] = img->height*-.5, [2][2] = 1 };
  3011           matrix3x3 u;
  3012           matrix3x3_mult (matrix, t, u);
  3013 
  3014           /* 2. Rotate.  */
  3015           matrix3x3 rot = { [0][0] = cos_r,  [0][1] = sin_r,
  3016                             [1][0] = -sin_r, [1][1] = cos_r,
  3017                                                              [2][2] = 1 };
  3018           matrix3x3 v;
  3019           matrix3x3_mult (u, rot, v);
  3020 
  3021           /* 3. Translate back.  Flip horizontally if requested.  */
  3022           t[2][0] = width * .5;
  3023           t[2][1] = height * .5;
  3024           if (flip) t[0][0] = -t[0][0];
  3025           matrix3x3_mult (v, t, matrix);
  3026 #  endif
  3027           img->width = width;
  3028           img->height = height;
  3029         }
  3030 # endif
  3031 #else
  3032       /* Calculate the inverse transform from the destination to the
  3033          source.  The matrix is currently identity with scale
  3034          applied.
  3035 
  3036          This code makes more sense to me than what lies above.  But
  3037          I'm not touching what works.  */
  3038 
  3039       if (rotation != 0 && rotation != 90
  3040           && rotation != 180 && rotation != 270)
  3041         {
  3042           rotate_flag = 0;
  3043           goto bail;
  3044         }
  3045 
  3046       rotate_flag = 1;
  3047 
  3048       switch ((int) rotation + (flip ? 1 : 0))
  3049         {
  3050         case 0:
  3051           break;
  3052 
  3053         case 90:
  3054           /* Rotate the image 90 degrees clockwise.  IOW, rotate the
  3055              destination by 90 degrees counterclockwise, which is 270
  3056              degrees clockwise.  */
  3057           matrix_rotate (matrix, M_PI * 1.5, 0, 0);
  3058           matrix_translate (matrix, -height, 0);
  3059           break;
  3060 
  3061         case 180:
  3062           /* Apply clockwise 180 degree rotation around the
  3063              center.  */
  3064           matrix_rotate (matrix, M_PI, width / 2.0, height / 2.0);
  3065           break;
  3066 
  3067         case 270:
  3068           /* Apply 270 degree counterclockwise rotation to the
  3069              destination, which is 90 degrees clockwise.  */
  3070           matrix_rotate (matrix, M_PI * 0.5, 0, 0);
  3071           matrix_translate (matrix, 0, -width);
  3072           break;
  3073 
  3074         case 1:
  3075           /* Flipped.  Apply horizontal flip.  */
  3076           matrix_mirror_horizontal (matrix, width);
  3077           break;
  3078 
  3079         case 91:
  3080           /* Apply a flip but otherwise treat this the same as 90.  */
  3081           matrix_rotate (matrix, M_PI * 1.5, 0, 0);
  3082           matrix_translate (matrix, -height, 0);
  3083           matrix_mirror_horizontal (matrix, height);
  3084           break;
  3085 
  3086         case 181:
  3087           /* Flipped 180 degrees.  Apply a flip and treat this the
  3088              same as 180.  */
  3089           matrix_rotate (matrix, M_PI, width / 2.0, height / 2.0);
  3090           matrix_mirror_horizontal (matrix, width);
  3091           break;
  3092 
  3093         case 271:
  3094           /* Flipped 270 degrees.  Apply a flip and treat this the
  3095              same as 270.  */
  3096           matrix_rotate (matrix, M_PI * 0.5, 0, 0);
  3097           matrix_translate (matrix, 0, -width);
  3098           matrix_mirror_horizontal (matrix, height);
  3099           break;
  3100         }
  3101 
  3102       /* Now set img->width and img->height.  Flip them if the
  3103          rotation being applied requires so.  */
  3104 
  3105       if (rotation != 270 && rotation != 90)
  3106         {
  3107           img->width = width;
  3108           img->height = height;
  3109         }
  3110       else
  3111         {
  3112           img->height = width;
  3113           img->width = height;
  3114         }
  3115     bail:
  3116       ;
  3117 #endif
  3118     }
  3119 
  3120   if (rotate_flag < 0)
  3121     image_error ("No native support for rotation by %g degrees",
  3122                  make_float (rotation));
  3123 
  3124 # if defined (HAVE_NS)
  3125   /* Under NS the transform is applied to the drawing surface at
  3126      drawing time, so store it for later.  */
  3127   ns_image_set_transform (img->pixmap, matrix);
  3128   ns_image_set_smoothing (img->pixmap, smoothing);
  3129 # elif defined USE_CAIRO
  3130   cairo_matrix_t cr_matrix = {matrix[0][0], matrix[0][1], matrix[1][0],
  3131                               matrix[1][1], matrix[2][0], matrix[2][1]};
  3132   cairo_pattern_t *pattern = cairo_pattern_create_rgb (0, 0, 0);
  3133   cairo_pattern_set_matrix (pattern, &cr_matrix);
  3134   cairo_pattern_set_filter (pattern, smoothing
  3135                             ? CAIRO_FILTER_BEST : CAIRO_FILTER_NEAREST);
  3136   /* Dummy solid color pattern just to record pattern matrix.  */
  3137   img->cr_data = pattern;
  3138 # elif defined (HAVE_XRENDER)
  3139   if (img->picture)
  3140     {
  3141       XTransform tmat
  3142         = {{{XDoubleToFixed (matrix[0][0]),
  3143              XDoubleToFixed (matrix[1][0]),
  3144              XDoubleToFixed (matrix[2][0])},
  3145             {XDoubleToFixed (matrix[0][1]),
  3146              XDoubleToFixed (matrix[1][1]),
  3147              XDoubleToFixed (matrix[2][1])},
  3148             {XDoubleToFixed (matrix[0][2]),
  3149              XDoubleToFixed (matrix[1][2]),
  3150              XDoubleToFixed (matrix[2][2])}}};
  3151 
  3152       XRenderSetPictureFilter (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), img->picture,
  3153                                smoothing ? FilterBest : FilterNearest, 0, 0);
  3154       XRenderSetPictureTransform (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), img->picture, &tmat);
  3155 
  3156       if (img->mask_picture)
  3157         {
  3158           XRenderSetPictureFilter (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), img->mask_picture,
  3159                                    smoothing ? FilterBest : FilterNearest, 0, 0);
  3160           XRenderSetPictureTransform (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), img->mask_picture,
  3161                                       &tmat);
  3162         }
  3163     }
  3164 # elif defined HAVE_NTGUI
  3165   /* Store the transform matrix for application at draw time.  */
  3166   img->xform.eM11 = matrix[0][0];
  3167   img->xform.eM12 = matrix[0][1];
  3168   img->xform.eM21 = matrix[1][0];
  3169   img->xform.eM22 = matrix[1][1];
  3170   img->xform.eDx  = matrix[2][0];
  3171   img->xform.eDy  = matrix[2][1];
  3172 # elif defined HAVE_HAIKU
  3173   /* Store the transform in the struct image for later.  */
  3174   memcpy (&img->transform, &matrix, sizeof matrix);
  3175 
  3176   /* Also add the extra translations.   */
  3177   if (rotate_flag)
  3178     {
  3179       img->transform[0][2] = extra_tx;
  3180       img->transform[1][2] = extra_ty;
  3181     }
  3182 # elif defined HAVE_ANDROID
  3183   /* Create a new image of the right size, then turn it into a pixmap
  3184      and set that as img->pixmap.  Destroy img->mask for now (this is
  3185      not right.)  */
  3186 
  3187   struct android_image *transformed_image, *image;
  3188   struct android_transform transform;
  3189 
  3190   /* If there is no transform, simply return.  */
  3191   if (!memcmp (&matrix, &identity, sizeof matrix))
  3192     return;
  3193 
  3194   /* First, get the source image.  */
  3195   image = image_get_x_image (f, img, false);
  3196 
  3197   /* Make the transformed image.  */
  3198   transformed_image = android_create_image (image->depth,
  3199                                             ANDROID_Z_PIXMAP,
  3200                                             NULL, img->width,
  3201                                             img->height);
  3202 
  3203   /* Allocate memory for that image.  */
  3204   transformed_image->data
  3205     = xmalloc (transformed_image->bytes_per_line
  3206                * transformed_image->height);
  3207 
  3208   /* Do the transform.  */
  3209   transform.m1 = matrix[0][0];
  3210   transform.m2 = matrix[0][1];
  3211   transform.m3 = matrix[0][2];
  3212   transform.m4 = matrix[1][0];
  3213   transform.m5 = matrix[1][1];
  3214   transform.m6 = matrix[1][2];
  3215 
  3216   if (image->depth == 24 && smoothing)
  3217     android_project_image_bilinear (image, transformed_image,
  3218                                     &transform);
  3219   else
  3220     android_project_image_nearest (image, transformed_image,
  3221                                    &transform);
  3222 
  3223   image_unget_x_image (img, false, image);
  3224 
  3225   /* Now replace the image.  */
  3226 
  3227   if (img->ximg)
  3228     image_destroy_x_image (img->ximg);
  3229 
  3230   img->ximg = transformed_image;
  3231 
  3232 #ifndef ANDROID_STUBIFY
  3233   /* Then replace the pixmap.  */
  3234   android_free_pixmap (img->pixmap);
  3235 
  3236   /* In case android_create_pixmap signals.  */
  3237   img->pixmap = ANDROID_NONE;
  3238   img->pixmap = android_create_pixmap (img->width, img->height,
  3239                                        transformed_image->depth);
  3240   android_put_image (img->pixmap, transformed_image);
  3241 #else
  3242   emacs_abort ();
  3243 #endif
  3244 
  3245   /* Now, transform the mask.  The mask should be depth 1, and is
  3246      always transformed using a nearest neighbor filter.  */
  3247 
  3248   if (img->mask_img || img->mask)
  3249     {
  3250       image = image_get_x_image (f, img, true);
  3251       transformed_image = android_create_image (1, ANDROID_Z_PIXMAP,
  3252                                                 NULL, img->width,
  3253                                                 img->height);
  3254       transformed_image->data
  3255         = xmalloc (transformed_image->bytes_per_line
  3256                    * transformed_image->height);
  3257       android_project_image_nearest (image, transformed_image,
  3258                                      &transform);
  3259       image_unget_x_image (img, true, image);
  3260 
  3261       /* Now replace the image.  */
  3262 
  3263       if (img->mask_img)
  3264         image_destroy_x_image (img->mask_img);
  3265 
  3266       img->mask_img = transformed_image;
  3267 
  3268 #ifndef ANDROID_STUBIFY
  3269       if (img->mask)
  3270         android_free_pixmap (img->mask);
  3271 
  3272       img->mask = ANDROID_NONE;
  3273       img->mask = android_create_pixmap (img->width, img->height, 1);
  3274       android_put_image (img->mask, transformed_image);
  3275 #endif
  3276     }
  3277 
  3278   /* Done! */
  3279 #endif
  3280 }
  3281 
  3282 #endif /* HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK || HAVE_NATIVE_TRANSFORMS */
  3283 
  3284 /* Return the id of image with Lisp specification SPEC on frame F.
  3285    SPEC must be a valid Lisp image specification (see valid_image_p).  */
  3286 
  3287 ptrdiff_t
  3288 lookup_image (struct frame *f, Lisp_Object spec, int face_id)
  3289 {
  3290   struct image *img;
  3291   EMACS_UINT hash;
  3292 
  3293   if (FRAME_FACE_CACHE (f) == NULL)
  3294     init_frame_faces (f);
  3295   if (FRAME_FACE_CACHE (f)->used == 0)
  3296     recompute_basic_faces (f);
  3297   if (face_id < 0 || face_id >= FRAME_FACE_CACHE (f)->used)
  3298     face_id = DEFAULT_FACE_ID;
  3299 
  3300   struct face *face = FACE_FROM_ID (f, face_id);
  3301   unsigned long foreground = face->foreground;
  3302   unsigned long background = face->background;
  3303   int font_size = face->font->pixel_size;
  3304   char *font_family = SSDATA (face->lface[LFACE_FAMILY_INDEX]);
  3305 
  3306   /* F must be a window-system frame, and SPEC must be a valid image
  3307      specification.  */
  3308   eassert (FRAME_WINDOW_P (f));
  3309   eassert (valid_image_p (spec));
  3310 
  3311   /* Look up SPEC in the hash table of the image cache.  */
  3312   hash = sxhash (filter_image_spec (spec));
  3313   img = search_image_cache (f, spec, hash, foreground, background,
  3314                             font_size, font_family, false);
  3315   if (img && img->load_failed_p)
  3316     {
  3317       free_image (f, img);
  3318       img = NULL;
  3319     }
  3320 
  3321   /* If not found, create a new image and cache it.  */
  3322   if (img == NULL)
  3323     {
  3324       block_input ();
  3325       img = make_image (spec, hash);
  3326       cache_image (f, img);
  3327       img->face_foreground = foreground;
  3328       img->face_background = background;
  3329       img->face_font_size = font_size;
  3330       img->face_font_family = xmalloc (strlen (font_family) + 1);
  3331       strcpy (img->face_font_family, font_family);
  3332       img->load_failed_p = ! img->type->load_img (f, img);
  3333 
  3334       /* If we can't load the image, and we don't have a width and
  3335          height, use some arbitrary width and height so that we can
  3336          draw a rectangle for it.  */
  3337       if (img->load_failed_p)
  3338         {
  3339           Lisp_Object value;
  3340 
  3341           value = image_spec_value (spec, QCwidth, NULL);
  3342           img->width = (FIXNUMP (value)
  3343                         ? XFIXNAT (value) : DEFAULT_IMAGE_WIDTH);
  3344           value = image_spec_value (spec, QCheight, NULL);
  3345           img->height = (FIXNUMP (value)
  3346                          ? XFIXNAT (value) : DEFAULT_IMAGE_HEIGHT);
  3347         }
  3348       else
  3349         {
  3350           /* Handle image type independent image attributes
  3351              `:ascent ASCENT', `:margin MARGIN', `:relief RELIEF',
  3352              `:background COLOR'.  */
  3353           Lisp_Object ascent, margin, relief, bg;
  3354           int relief_bound;
  3355 
  3356           ascent = image_spec_value (spec, QCascent, NULL);
  3357           if (FIXNUMP (ascent))
  3358             img->ascent = XFIXNUM (ascent);
  3359           else if (EQ (ascent, Qcenter))
  3360             img->ascent = CENTERED_IMAGE_ASCENT;
  3361 
  3362           margin = image_spec_value (spec, QCmargin, NULL);
  3363           if (FIXNUMP (margin))
  3364             img->vmargin = img->hmargin = XFIXNUM (margin);
  3365           else if (CONSP (margin))
  3366             {
  3367               img->hmargin = XFIXNUM (XCAR (margin));
  3368               img->vmargin = XFIXNUM (XCDR (margin));
  3369             }
  3370 
  3371           relief = image_spec_value (spec, QCrelief, NULL);
  3372           relief_bound = INT_MAX - max (img->hmargin, img->vmargin);
  3373           if (RANGED_FIXNUMP (- relief_bound, relief, relief_bound))
  3374             {
  3375               img->relief = XFIXNUM (relief);
  3376               img->hmargin += eabs (img->relief);
  3377               img->vmargin += eabs (img->relief);
  3378             }
  3379 
  3380           if (! img->background_valid)
  3381             {
  3382               bg = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL);
  3383               if (!NILP (bg))
  3384                 {
  3385                   img->background
  3386                     = image_alloc_image_color (f, img, bg, background);
  3387                   img->background_valid = 1;
  3388                 }
  3389             }
  3390 
  3391           /* Do image transformations and compute masks, unless we
  3392              don't have the image yet.  */
  3393           if (!EQ (builtin_lisp_symbol (img->type->type), Qpostscript))
  3394             postprocess_image (f, img);
  3395 
  3396           /* postprocess_image above may modify the image or the mask,
  3397              relying on the image's real width and height, so
  3398              image_set_transform must be called after it.  */
  3399 #ifdef HAVE_NATIVE_TRANSFORMS
  3400           image_set_transform (f, img);
  3401 #endif
  3402         }
  3403 
  3404       unblock_input ();
  3405     }
  3406 
  3407   /* IMG is now being used, so set its timestamp to the current
  3408      time.  */
  3409   img->timestamp = current_timespec ();
  3410 
  3411   /* Value is the image id.  */
  3412   return img->id;
  3413 }
  3414 
  3415 
  3416 /* Cache image IMG in the image cache of frame F.  */
  3417 
  3418 static void
  3419 cache_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  3420 {
  3421   struct image_cache *c = FRAME_IMAGE_CACHE (f);
  3422   ptrdiff_t i;
  3423 
  3424   if (!c)
  3425     c = FRAME_IMAGE_CACHE (f) = make_image_cache ();
  3426 
  3427   /* Find a free slot in c->images.  */
  3428   for (i = 0; i < c->used; ++i)
  3429     if (c->images[i] == NULL)
  3430       break;
  3431 
  3432   /* If no free slot found, maybe enlarge c->images.  */
  3433   if (i == c->used && c->used == c->size)
  3434     c->images = xpalloc (c->images, &c->size, 1, -1, sizeof *c->images);
  3435 
  3436   /* Add IMG to c->images, and assign IMG an id.  */
  3437   c->images[i] = img;
  3438   img->id = i;
  3439   if (i == c->used)
  3440     ++c->used;
  3441 
  3442   /* Add IMG to the cache's hash table.  */
  3443   i = img->hash % IMAGE_CACHE_BUCKETS_SIZE;
  3444   img->next = c->buckets[i];
  3445   if (img->next)
  3446     img->next->prev = img;
  3447   img->prev = NULL;
  3448   c->buckets[i] = img;
  3449 }
  3450 
  3451 
  3452 #if defined (HAVE_WEBP) || defined (HAVE_GIF)
  3453 
  3454 /* To speed animations up, we keep a cache (based on EQ-ness of the
  3455    image spec/object) where we put the animator iterator.  */
  3456 
  3457 struct anim_cache
  3458 {
  3459   Lisp_Object spec;
  3460   /* For webp, this will be an iterator, and for libgif, a gif handle.  */
  3461   void *handle;
  3462   /* If we need to maintain temporary data of some sort.  */
  3463   void *temp;
  3464   /* A function to call to free the handle.  */
  3465   void (*destructor) (void *);
  3466   int index, width, height, frames;
  3467   /* This is used to be able to say something about the cache size.
  3468      We don't actually know how much memory the different libraries
  3469      actually use here (since these cache structures are opaque), so
  3470      this is mostly just the size of the original image file.  */
  3471   int byte_size;
  3472   struct timespec update_time;
  3473   struct anim_cache *next;
  3474 };
  3475 
  3476 static struct anim_cache *anim_cache = NULL;
  3477 
  3478 static struct anim_cache *
  3479 anim_create_cache (Lisp_Object spec)
  3480 {
  3481   struct anim_cache *cache = xmalloc (sizeof (struct anim_cache));
  3482   cache->handle = NULL;
  3483   cache->temp = NULL;
  3484 
  3485   cache->index = -1;
  3486   cache->next = NULL;
  3487   cache->spec = spec;
  3488   cache->byte_size = 0;
  3489   return cache;
  3490 }
  3491 
  3492 /* Discard cached images that haven't been used for a minute.  If
  3493    CLEAR is t, remove all animation cache entries.  If CLEAR is
  3494    anything other than nil or t, only remove the entries that have a
  3495    spec `eq' to CLEAR.  */
  3496 static void
  3497 anim_prune_animation_cache (Lisp_Object clear)
  3498 {
  3499   struct anim_cache **pcache = &anim_cache;
  3500   struct timespec old = timespec_sub (current_timespec (),
  3501                                       make_timespec (60, 0));
  3502 
  3503   while (*pcache)
  3504     {
  3505       struct anim_cache *cache = *pcache;
  3506       if (EQ (clear, Qt)
  3507           || (EQ (clear, Qnil) && timespec_cmp (old, cache->update_time) > 0)
  3508           || EQ (clear, cache->spec))
  3509         {
  3510           if (cache->handle)
  3511             cache->destructor (cache);
  3512           if (cache->temp)
  3513             xfree (cache->temp);
  3514           *pcache = cache->next;
  3515           xfree (cache);
  3516         }
  3517       else
  3518         pcache = &cache->next;
  3519     }
  3520 }
  3521 
  3522 static struct anim_cache *
  3523 anim_get_animation_cache (Lisp_Object spec)
  3524 {
  3525   struct anim_cache *cache;
  3526   struct anim_cache **pcache = &anim_cache;
  3527 
  3528   anim_prune_animation_cache (Qnil);
  3529 
  3530   while (1)
  3531     {
  3532       cache = *pcache;
  3533       if (! cache)
  3534         {
  3535           *pcache = cache = anim_create_cache (spec);
  3536           break;
  3537         }
  3538       if (EQ (spec, cache->spec))
  3539         break;
  3540       pcache = &cache->next;
  3541     }
  3542 
  3543   cache->update_time = current_timespec ();
  3544   return cache;
  3545 }
  3546 
  3547 #endif  /* HAVE_WEBP || HAVE_GIF */
  3548 
  3549 /* Call FN on every image in the image cache of frame F.  Used to mark
  3550    Lisp Objects in the image cache.  */
  3551 
  3552 /* Mark Lisp objects in image IMG.  */
  3553 
  3554 static void
  3555 mark_image (struct image *img)
  3556 {
  3557   mark_object (img->spec);
  3558   mark_object (img->dependencies);
  3559 
  3560   if (!NILP (img->lisp_data))
  3561     mark_object (img->lisp_data);
  3562 }
  3563 
  3564 
  3565 void
  3566 mark_image_cache (struct image_cache *c)
  3567 {
  3568   if (c)
  3569     {
  3570       ptrdiff_t i;
  3571       for (i = 0; i < c->used; ++i)
  3572         if (c->images[i])
  3573           mark_image (c->images[i]);
  3574     }
  3575 
  3576 #if defined HAVE_WEBP || defined HAVE_GIF
  3577   for (struct anim_cache *cache = anim_cache; cache; cache = cache->next)
  3578     mark_object (cache->spec);
  3579 #endif
  3580 }
  3581 
  3582 
  3583 
  3584 /***********************************************************************
  3585                           X / NS / W32 support code
  3586              Most of this code is shared with Android to make
  3587              it easier to maintain.
  3588  ***********************************************************************/
  3589 
  3590 #if defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  3591 
  3592 static bool
  3593 x_check_image_size (XImage *ximg, int width, int height)
  3594 {
  3595   /* Respect Xlib's limits: it cannot deal with images that have more
  3596      than INT_MAX (and/or UINT_MAX) bytes.  And respect Emacs's limits
  3597      of PTRDIFF_MAX (and/or SIZE_MAX) bytes for any object.  */
  3598   enum
  3599   {
  3600     XLIB_BYTES_MAX = min (INT_MAX, UINT_MAX),
  3601     X_IMAGE_BYTES_MAX = min (XLIB_BYTES_MAX, min (PTRDIFF_MAX, SIZE_MAX))
  3602   };
  3603 
  3604   int bitmap_pad, depth, bytes_per_line;
  3605   if (ximg)
  3606     {
  3607 #ifndef HAVE_ANDROID
  3608       bitmap_pad = ximg->bitmap_pad;
  3609 #else
  3610       bitmap_pad = (ximg->depth == 1 ? 8 : 32);
  3611 #endif
  3612       depth = ximg->depth;
  3613       bytes_per_line = ximg->bytes_per_line;
  3614     }
  3615   else
  3616     {
  3617       bitmap_pad = 8;
  3618       depth = 1;
  3619       bytes_per_line = (width >> 3) + ((width & 7) != 0);
  3620     }
  3621   return (width <= (INT_MAX - (bitmap_pad - 1)) / depth
  3622           && height <= X_IMAGE_BYTES_MAX / bytes_per_line);
  3623 }
  3624 
  3625 static bool
  3626 x_create_x_image_and_pixmap (struct frame *f, int width, int height, int depth,
  3627                              XImage **ximg, Pixmap *pixmap)
  3628 {
  3629 #ifndef HAVE_ANDROID
  3630   Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  3631   Drawable drawable = FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f);
  3632 #endif
  3633 
  3634   eassert (input_blocked_p ());
  3635 
  3636   if (depth <= 0)
  3637     depth = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->n_planes;
  3638 #ifndef HAVE_ANDROID
  3639   *ximg = XCreateImage (display, FRAME_X_VISUAL (f),
  3640                         depth, ZPixmap, 0, NULL, width, height,
  3641                         depth > 16 ? 32 : depth > 8 ? 16 : 8, 0);
  3642 #else
  3643   *ximg = android_create_image (depth, ANDROID_Z_PIXMAP, NULL, width,
  3644                                 height);
  3645 #endif
  3646   if (*ximg == NULL)
  3647     {
  3648       image_error ("Unable to allocate X image");
  3649       return 0;
  3650     }
  3651 
  3652   if (! x_check_image_size (*ximg, width, height))
  3653     {
  3654       x_destroy_x_image (*ximg);
  3655       *ximg = NULL;
  3656       image_error ("Image too large (%dx%d)",
  3657                    make_fixnum (width), make_fixnum (height));
  3658       return 0;
  3659     }
  3660 
  3661   /* Allocate image raster.  */
  3662   (*ximg)->data = xmalloc ((*ximg)->bytes_per_line * height);
  3663 
  3664   /* Allocate a pixmap of the same size.  */
  3665 #ifndef HAVE_ANDROID
  3666   *pixmap = XCreatePixmap (display, drawable, width, height, depth);
  3667 #else
  3668 #ifndef ANDROID_STUBIFY
  3669   *pixmap = android_create_pixmap (width, height, depth);
  3670 #else
  3671   emacs_abort ();
  3672 #endif
  3673 #endif
  3674   if (*pixmap == NO_PIXMAP)
  3675     {
  3676       x_destroy_x_image (*ximg);
  3677       *ximg = NULL;
  3678       image_error ("Unable to create X pixmap");
  3679       return 0;
  3680     }
  3681 
  3682   return 1;
  3683 }
  3684 
  3685 static void
  3686 x_destroy_x_image (XImage *ximg)
  3687 {
  3688   if (ximg)
  3689     {
  3690       xfree (ximg->data);
  3691       ximg->data = NULL;
  3692     }
  3693 
  3694 #ifndef HAVE_ANDROID
  3695   XDestroyImage (ximg);
  3696 #else
  3697   android_destroy_image (ximg);
  3698 #endif
  3699 }
  3700 
  3701 # if !defined USE_CAIRO && defined HAVE_XRENDER
  3702 /* Create and return an XRender Picture for XRender transforms.  */
  3703 static Picture
  3704 x_create_xrender_picture (struct frame *f, Emacs_Pixmap pixmap, int depth)
  3705 {
  3706   Picture p;
  3707   Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  3708 
  3709   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xrender_supported_p)
  3710     {
  3711       if (depth <= 0)
  3712         depth = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->n_planes;
  3713       if (depth == 32 || depth == 24 || depth == 8 || depth == 4 || depth == 1)
  3714         {
  3715           /* FIXME: Do we need to handle all possible bit depths?
  3716              XRenderFindStandardFormat supports PictStandardARGB32,
  3717              PictStandardRGB24, PictStandardA8, PictStandardA4,
  3718              PictStandardA1, and PictStandardNUM (what is this?!).
  3719 
  3720              XRenderFindFormat may support more, but I don't
  3721              understand the documentation.  */
  3722           XRenderPictFormat *format;
  3723           format = XRenderFindStandardFormat (display,
  3724                                               depth == 32 ? PictStandardARGB32
  3725                                               : depth == 24 ? PictStandardRGB24
  3726                                               : depth == 8 ? PictStandardA8
  3727                                               : depth == 4 ? PictStandardA4
  3728                                               : PictStandardA1);
  3729 
  3730           /* Set the Picture repeat to "pad".  This means when
  3731              operations look at pixels outside the image area they
  3732              will use the value of the nearest real pixel instead of
  3733              using a transparent black pixel.  */
  3734           XRenderPictureAttributes attr;
  3735           unsigned long attr_mask = CPRepeat;
  3736           attr.repeat = RepeatPad;
  3737 
  3738           p = XRenderCreatePicture (display, pixmap, format, attr_mask, &attr);
  3739         }
  3740       else
  3741         {
  3742           image_error ("Specified image bit depth is not supported by XRender");
  3743           return 0;
  3744         }
  3745     }
  3746   else
  3747     {
  3748       /* XRender not supported on this display.  */
  3749       return 0;
  3750     }
  3751 
  3752   return p;
  3753 }
  3754 # endif /* !defined USE_CAIRO && defined HAVE_XRENDER */
  3755 #endif  /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS */
  3756 
  3757 /* Return true if XIMG's size WIDTH x HEIGHT doesn't break the
  3758    windowing system.
  3759    WIDTH and HEIGHT must both be positive.
  3760    If XIMG is null, assume it is a bitmap.  */
  3761 
  3762 static bool
  3763 image_check_image_size (Emacs_Pix_Container ximg, int width, int height)
  3764 {
  3765 #if (defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID) && !defined USE_CAIRO
  3766   return x_check_image_size (ximg, width, height);
  3767 #else
  3768   /* FIXME: Implement this check for the HAVE_NS and HAVE_NTGUI cases.
  3769      For now, assume that every image size is allowed on these systems.  */
  3770   return 1;
  3771 #endif
  3772 }
  3773 
  3774 /* Create an Emacs_Pix_Container and a pixmap of size WIDTH x
  3775    HEIGHT for use on frame F.  Set *PIMG and *PIXMAP to the
  3776    Emacs_Pix_Container and Emacs_Pixmap created.  Set (*PIMG)->data
  3777    to a raster of WIDTH x HEIGHT pixels allocated via xmalloc.  Print
  3778    error messages via image_error if an error occurs.  Value is true
  3779    if successful.
  3780 
  3781    On W32, a DEPTH of zero signifies a 24 bit image, otherwise DEPTH
  3782    should indicate the bit depth of the image.  */
  3783 
  3784 static bool
  3785 image_create_x_image_and_pixmap_1 (struct frame *f, int width, int height, int depth,
  3786                                    Emacs_Pix_Container *pimg,
  3787                                    Emacs_Pixmap *pixmap, Picture *picture)
  3788 {
  3789 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  3790   eassert (input_blocked_p ());
  3791 
  3792   /* Allocate a pixmap of the same size.  */
  3793   *pixmap = image_create_pix_container (width, height, depth);
  3794   if (*pixmap == NO_PIXMAP)
  3795     {
  3796       *pimg = NULL;
  3797       image_error ("Unable to create X pixmap", Qnil, Qnil);
  3798       return 0;
  3799     }
  3800 
  3801   *pimg = *pixmap;
  3802   return 1;
  3803 #elif defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  3804   if (!x_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, width, height, depth, pimg, pixmap))
  3805     return 0;
  3806 # ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
  3807   if (picture)
  3808     *picture = x_create_xrender_picture (f, *pixmap, depth);
  3809 # endif
  3810 
  3811   return 1;
  3812 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS */
  3813 
  3814 #ifdef HAVE_HAIKU
  3815   if (depth == 0)
  3816     depth = 24;
  3817 
  3818   if (depth != 24 && depth != 1)
  3819     {
  3820       *pimg = NULL;
  3821       image_error ("Invalid image bit depth specified");
  3822       return 0;
  3823     }
  3824 
  3825   *pixmap = BBitmap_new (width, height, depth == 1);
  3826 
  3827   if (*pixmap == NO_PIXMAP)
  3828     {
  3829       *pimg = NULL;
  3830       image_error ("Unable to create pixmap", Qnil, Qnil);
  3831       return 0;
  3832     }
  3833 
  3834   *pimg = *pixmap;
  3835   return 1;
  3836 #endif
  3837 
  3838 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  3839 
  3840   BITMAPINFOHEADER *header;
  3841   HDC hdc;
  3842   int scanline_width_bits;
  3843   int remainder;
  3844   int palette_colors = 0;
  3845 
  3846   if (depth == 0)
  3847     depth = 24;
  3848 
  3849   if (depth != 1 && depth != 4 && depth != 8
  3850       && depth != 16 && depth != 24 && depth != 32)
  3851     {
  3852       image_error ("Invalid image bit depth specified");
  3853       return 0;
  3854     }
  3855 
  3856   scanline_width_bits = width * depth;
  3857   remainder = scanline_width_bits % 32;
  3858 
  3859   if (remainder)
  3860     scanline_width_bits += 32 - remainder;
  3861 
  3862   /* Bitmaps with a depth less than 16 need a palette.  */
  3863   /* BITMAPINFO structure already contains the first RGBQUAD.  */
  3864   if (depth < 16)
  3865     palette_colors = 1 << (depth - 1);
  3866 
  3867   *pimg = xmalloc (sizeof (XImage) + palette_colors * sizeof (RGBQUAD));
  3868 
  3869   header = &(*pimg)->info.bmiHeader;
  3870   memset (&(*pimg)->info, 0, sizeof (BITMAPINFO));
  3871   header->biSize = sizeof (*header);
  3872   header->biWidth = width;
  3873   header->biHeight = -height;  /* negative indicates a top-down bitmap.  */
  3874   header->biPlanes = 1;
  3875   header->biBitCount = depth;
  3876   header->biCompression = BI_RGB;
  3877   header->biClrUsed = palette_colors;
  3878 
  3879   /* TODO: fill in palette.  */
  3880   if (depth == 1)
  3881     {
  3882       (*pimg)->info.bmiColors[0].rgbBlue = 0;
  3883       (*pimg)->info.bmiColors[0].rgbGreen = 0;
  3884       (*pimg)->info.bmiColors[0].rgbRed = 0;
  3885       (*pimg)->info.bmiColors[0].rgbReserved = 0;
  3886       /* bmiColors is a variable-length array declared by w32api
  3887          headers as bmiColors[1], which triggers a warning under
  3888          -Warray-bounds; shut that up.  */
  3889 #     if GNUC_PREREQ (4, 4, 0)
  3890 #      pragma GCC push_options
  3891 #      pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Warray-bounds"
  3892 #     endif
  3893       (*pimg)->info.bmiColors[1].rgbBlue = 255;
  3894       (*pimg)->info.bmiColors[1].rgbGreen = 255;
  3895       (*pimg)->info.bmiColors[1].rgbRed = 255;
  3896       (*pimg)->info.bmiColors[1].rgbReserved = 0;
  3897 #     if GNUC_PREREQ (4, 4, 0)
  3898 #      pragma GCC pop_options
  3899 #     endif
  3900     }
  3901 
  3902   hdc = get_frame_dc (f);
  3903 
  3904   /* Create a DIBSection and raster array for the bitmap,
  3905      and store its handle in *pixmap.  */
  3906   *pixmap = CreateDIBSection (hdc, &(*pimg)->info,
  3907                               (depth < 16) ? DIB_PAL_COLORS : DIB_RGB_COLORS,
  3908                               /* casting avoids a GCC warning */
  3909                               (void **) &(*pimg)->data, NULL, 0);
  3910 
  3911   /* Realize display palette and garbage all frames. */
  3912   release_frame_dc (f, hdc);
  3913 
  3914   if (*pixmap == NULL)
  3915     {
  3916       DWORD err = GetLastError ();
  3917       Lisp_Object errcode;
  3918       /* All system errors are < 10000, so the following is safe.  */
  3919       XSETINT (errcode, err);
  3920       image_error ("Unable to create bitmap, error code %d", errcode);
  3921       image_destroy_x_image (*pimg);
  3922       *pimg = NULL;
  3923       return 0;
  3924     }
  3925 
  3926   return 1;
  3927 
  3928 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  3929 
  3930 #ifdef HAVE_NS
  3931   *pixmap = ns_image_for_XPM (width, height, depth);
  3932   if (*pixmap == 0)
  3933     {
  3934       *pimg = NULL;
  3935       image_error ("Unable to allocate NSImage for XPM pixmap");
  3936       return 0;
  3937     }
  3938   *pimg = *pixmap;
  3939   return 1;
  3940 #endif
  3941 }
  3942 
  3943 
  3944 /* Destroy Emacs_Pix_Container PIMG.  Free data associated with PIMG.  */
  3945 
  3946 static void
  3947 image_destroy_x_image (Emacs_Pix_Container pimg)
  3948 {
  3949 #if (defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID) && !defined USE_CAIRO
  3950   x_destroy_x_image (pimg);
  3951 #else
  3952   eassert (input_blocked_p ());
  3953   if (pimg)
  3954     {
  3955 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  3956 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
  3957 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  3958       /* Data will be freed by DestroyObject.  */
  3959       pimg->data = NULL;
  3960       xfree (pimg);
  3961 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  3962 #ifdef HAVE_NS
  3963       ns_release_object (pimg);
  3964 #endif /* HAVE_NS */
  3965     }
  3966 #endif
  3967 }
  3968 
  3969 
  3970 /* Put Emacs_Pix_Container PIMG into pixmap PIXMAP on frame F.
  3971    WIDTH and HEIGHT are width and height of both the image and
  3972    pixmap.  */
  3973 
  3974 static void
  3975 gui_put_x_image (struct frame *f, Emacs_Pix_Container pimg,
  3976                  Emacs_Pixmap pixmap, int width, int height)
  3977 {
  3978 #if defined USE_CAIRO || defined HAVE_HAIKU
  3979   eassert (pimg == pixmap);
  3980 #elif defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS
  3981   GC gc;
  3982 
  3983   eassert (input_blocked_p ());
  3984   gc = XCreateGC (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), pixmap, 0, NULL);
  3985   XPutImage (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), pixmap, gc, pimg, 0, 0, 0, 0,
  3986              pimg->width, pimg->height);
  3987   XFreeGC (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc);
  3988 #elif defined HAVE_ANDROID
  3989   android_put_image (pixmap, pimg);
  3990 #endif
  3991 
  3992 #ifdef HAVE_NS
  3993   eassert (pimg == pixmap);
  3994   ns_retain_object (pimg);
  3995 #endif
  3996 }
  3997 
  3998 /* Thin wrapper for image_create_x_image_and_pixmap_1, so that it matches
  3999    with image_put_x_image.  */
  4000 
  4001 static bool
  4002 image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (struct frame *f, struct image *img,
  4003                                  int width, int height, int depth,
  4004                                  Emacs_Pix_Container *ximg, bool mask_p)
  4005 {
  4006   eassert ((!mask_p ? img->pixmap : img->mask) == NO_PIXMAP);
  4007 
  4008   Picture *picture = NULL;
  4009 #if !defined USE_CAIRO && defined HAVE_XRENDER
  4010   picture = !mask_p ? &img->picture : &img->mask_picture;
  4011 #endif
  4012   return image_create_x_image_and_pixmap_1 (f, width, height, depth, ximg,
  4013                                             !mask_p ? &img->pixmap : &img->mask,
  4014                                             picture);
  4015 }
  4016 
  4017 /* Put pixel image PIMG into image IMG on frame F, as a mask if and only
  4018    if MASK_P.  On X, this simply records PIMG on a member of IMG, so
  4019    it can be put into the pixmap afterwards via image_sync_to_pixmaps.
  4020    On the other platforms, it puts PIMG into the pixmap, then frees
  4021    the pixel image and its buffer.  */
  4022 
  4023 static void
  4024 image_put_x_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img, Emacs_Pix_Container ximg,
  4025                    bool mask_p)
  4026 {
  4027 #if (defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID) && !defined USE_CAIRO
  4028   if (!mask_p)
  4029     {
  4030       eassert (img->ximg == NULL);
  4031       img->ximg = ximg;
  4032     }
  4033   else
  4034     {
  4035       eassert (img->mask_img == NULL);
  4036       img->mask_img = ximg;
  4037     }
  4038 #else
  4039   gui_put_x_image (f, ximg, !mask_p ? img->pixmap : img->mask,
  4040                    img->width, img->height);
  4041   image_destroy_x_image (ximg);
  4042 #endif
  4043 }
  4044 
  4045 #if (defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID) && !defined USE_CAIRO
  4046 /* Put the X images recorded in IMG on frame F into pixmaps, then free
  4047    the X images and their buffers.  */
  4048 
  4049 static void
  4050 image_sync_to_pixmaps (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  4051 {
  4052   if (img->ximg)
  4053     {
  4054       gui_put_x_image (f, img->ximg, img->pixmap, img->width, img->height);
  4055       image_destroy_x_image (img->ximg);
  4056       img->ximg = NULL;
  4057     }
  4058   if (img->mask_img)
  4059     {
  4060       gui_put_x_image (f, img->mask_img, img->mask, img->width, img->height);
  4061       image_destroy_x_image (img->mask_img);
  4062       img->mask_img = NULL;
  4063     }
  4064 }
  4065 #endif
  4066 
  4067 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  4068 /* Create a memory device context for IMG on frame F.  It stores the
  4069    currently selected GDI object into *PREV for future restoration by
  4070    image_unget_x_image_or_dc.  */
  4071 
  4072 static HDC
  4073 image_get_x_image_or_dc (struct frame *f, struct image *img, bool mask_p,
  4074                          HGDIOBJ *prev)
  4075 {
  4076   HDC frame_dc = get_frame_dc (f);
  4077   HDC ximg = CreateCompatibleDC (frame_dc);
  4078 
  4079   release_frame_dc (f, frame_dc);
  4080   *prev = SelectObject (ximg, !mask_p ? img->pixmap : img->mask);
  4081 
  4082   return ximg;
  4083 }
  4084 
  4085 static void
  4086 image_unget_x_image_or_dc (struct image *img, bool mask_p,
  4087                            HDC ximg, HGDIOBJ prev)
  4088 {
  4089   SelectObject (ximg, prev);
  4090   DeleteDC (ximg);
  4091 }
  4092 #else  /* !HAVE_NTGUI */
  4093 /* Get the X image for IMG on frame F.  The resulting X image data
  4094    should be treated as read-only at least on X.  */
  4095 
  4096 static Emacs_Pix_Container
  4097 image_get_x_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img, bool mask_p)
  4098 {
  4099 #if defined USE_CAIRO || defined (HAVE_HAIKU)
  4100   return !mask_p ? img->pixmap : img->mask;
  4101 #elif defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  4102   XImage *ximg_in_img = !mask_p ? img->ximg : img->mask_img;
  4103 
  4104   if (ximg_in_img)
  4105     return ximg_in_img;
  4106 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
  4107   else if (img->picture)
  4108     return XGetImage (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), !mask_p ? img->pixmap : img->mask,
  4109                       0, 0, img->original_width, img->original_height, ~0, ZPixmap);
  4110 #endif
  4111 #ifndef HAVE_ANDROID
  4112   else
  4113     return XGetImage (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), !mask_p ? img->pixmap : img->mask,
  4114                       0, 0, img->width, img->height, ~0, ZPixmap);
  4115 #else
  4116   else
  4117     return android_get_image (!mask_p ? img->pixmap : img->mask,
  4118                               ANDROID_Z_PIXMAP);
  4119 #endif
  4120 #elif defined (HAVE_NS)
  4121   Emacs_Pix_Container pixmap = !mask_p ? img->pixmap : img->mask;
  4122 
  4123   ns_retain_object (pixmap);
  4124   return pixmap;
  4125 #endif
  4126 }
  4127 
  4128 static void
  4129 image_unget_x_image (struct image *img, bool mask_p, Emacs_Pix_Container ximg)
  4130 {
  4131 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  4132 #elif defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  4133   XImage *ximg_in_img = !mask_p ? img->ximg : img->mask_img;
  4134 
  4135   if (ximg_in_img)
  4136     eassert (ximg == ximg_in_img);
  4137 #ifdef HAVE_ANDROID
  4138   else
  4139     android_destroy_image (ximg);
  4140 #else
  4141   else
  4142     XDestroyImage (ximg);
  4143 #endif
  4144 #elif defined (HAVE_NS)
  4145   ns_release_object (ximg);
  4146 #endif
  4147 }
  4148 #endif  /* !HAVE_NTGUI */
  4149 
  4150 
  4151 /***********************************************************************
  4152                               File Handling
  4153  ***********************************************************************/
  4154 
  4155 /* Find image file FILE.  Look in data-directory/images, then
  4156    x-bitmap-file-path.  Value is the full name of the file
  4157    found, or nil if not found.  If PFD is nonnull store into *PFD a
  4158    readable file descriptor for the file, opened in binary mode.  If
  4159    PFD is null, do not open the file.  */
  4160 
  4161 static Lisp_Object
  4162 image_find_image_fd (Lisp_Object file, image_fd *pfd)
  4163 {
  4164   Lisp_Object file_found, search_path;
  4165   int fd;
  4166   void *platform;
  4167 
  4168   /* TODO I think this should use something like image-load-path
  4169      instead.  Unfortunately, that can contain non-string elements.  */
  4170   search_path = Fcons (Fexpand_file_name (build_string ("images"),
  4171                                           Vdata_directory),
  4172                        Vx_bitmap_file_path);
  4173 
  4174   /* Try to find FILE in data-directory/images, then x-bitmap-file-path.  */
  4175   platform = NULL;
  4176   fd = openp (search_path, file, Qnil, &file_found,
  4177               pfd ? Qt : make_fixnum (R_OK), false, false,
  4178               pfd ? &platform : NULL);
  4179   if (fd == -2)
  4180     {
  4181       /* The file exists locally, but has a file name handler.
  4182          (This happens, e.g., under Auto Image File Mode.)
  4183          'openp' didn't open the file, so we should, because the
  4184          caller expects that.  */
  4185       Lisp_Object encoded_name = ENCODE_FILE (file_found);
  4186       fd = emacs_open (SSDATA (encoded_name), O_RDONLY, 0);
  4187     }
  4188   /* FD is -3 if PLATFORM is set to a valid asset file descriptor on
  4189      Android.  */
  4190   else if (fd < 0 && fd != -3)
  4191     return Qnil;
  4192 
  4193 #if !defined HAVE_ANDROID || defined ANDROID_STUBIFY
  4194   if (pfd)
  4195     *pfd = fd;
  4196 #else
  4197   /* Construct an asset file descriptor.  */
  4198 
  4199   if (pfd)
  4200     {
  4201       pfd->fd = fd;
  4202       pfd->asset = platform;
  4203     }
  4204 #endif
  4205   return file_found;
  4206 }
  4207 
  4208 /* Find image file FILE.  Look in data-directory/images, then
  4209    x-bitmap-file-path.  Value is the full name of the file found, or
  4210    nil if not found.  */
  4211 
  4212 Lisp_Object
  4213 image_find_image_file (Lisp_Object file)
  4214 {
  4215   return image_find_image_fd (file, 0);
  4216 }
  4217 
  4218 #if defined HAVE_ANDROID && !defined ANDROID_STUBIFY
  4219 
  4220 static void
  4221 close_android_fd (void *ptr)
  4222 {
  4223   android_close_asset (*(struct android_fd_or_asset *) ptr);
  4224 }
  4225 
  4226 #endif
  4227 
  4228 /* Read FILE into memory.  Value is a pointer to a buffer allocated
  4229    with xmalloc holding FILE's contents.  Value is null if an error
  4230    occurred.  FD is a file descriptor open for reading FILE.  Set
  4231    *SIZE to the size of the file.  */
  4232 
  4233 static char *
  4234 slurp_file (image_fd fd, ptrdiff_t *size)
  4235 {
  4236 #if !defined HAVE_ANDROID || defined ANDROID_STUBIFY
  4237   FILE *fp = fdopen (fd, "rb");
  4238 
  4239   char *buf = NULL;
  4240   struct stat st;
  4241 
  4242   if (fp)
  4243     {
  4244       specpdl_ref count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  4245       record_unwind_protect_ptr (fclose_unwind, fp);
  4246 
  4247       if (sys_fstat (fileno (fp), &st) == 0
  4248           && 0 <= st.st_size && st.st_size < min (PTRDIFF_MAX, SIZE_MAX))
  4249         {
  4250           /* Report an error if we read past the purported EOF.
  4251              This can happen if the file grows as we read it.  */
  4252           ptrdiff_t buflen = st.st_size;
  4253           buf = xmalloc (buflen + 1);
  4254           if (fread (buf, 1, buflen + 1, fp) == buflen)
  4255             *size = buflen;
  4256           else
  4257             {
  4258               xfree (buf);
  4259               buf = NULL;
  4260             }
  4261         }
  4262 
  4263       unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  4264     }
  4265 #else
  4266   char *buf;
  4267   struct stat st;
  4268   specpdl_ref count;
  4269 
  4270   if (!android_asset_fstat (fd, &st)
  4271       && (0 <= st.st_size
  4272           && st.st_size < min (PTRDIFF_MAX, SIZE_MAX)))
  4273     {
  4274       count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
  4275       record_unwind_protect_ptr (close_android_fd, &fd);
  4276       buf = xmalloc (st.st_size + 1);
  4277 
  4278       /* Read one byte past the end of the file.  That allows
  4279          detecting if the file grows as it is being read.  */
  4280 
  4281       if (android_asset_read (fd, buf,
  4282                               st.st_size + 1) == st.st_size)
  4283         *size = st.st_size;
  4284       else
  4285         {
  4286           xfree (buf);
  4287           buf = NULL;
  4288         }
  4289 
  4290       unbind_to (count, Qnil);
  4291     }
  4292   else
  4293     {
  4294       buf = NULL;
  4295       android_close_asset (fd);
  4296     }
  4297 #endif
  4298 
  4299   return buf;
  4300 }
  4301 
  4302 
  4303 
  4304 /***********************************************************************
  4305                               XBM images
  4306  ***********************************************************************/
  4307 
  4308 static bool xbm_file_p (Lisp_Object);
  4309 
  4310 
  4311 /* Indices of image specification fields in xbm_format, below.  */
  4312 
  4313 enum xbm_keyword_index
  4314 {
  4315   XBM_TYPE,
  4316   XBM_FILE,
  4317   XBM_WIDTH,
  4318   XBM_HEIGHT,
  4319   XBM_STRIDE,
  4320   XBM_DATA,
  4321   XBM_FOREGROUND,
  4322   XBM_BACKGROUND,
  4323   XBM_ASCENT,
  4324   XBM_MARGIN,
  4325   XBM_RELIEF,
  4326   XBM_ALGORITHM,
  4327   XBM_HEURISTIC_MASK,
  4328   XBM_MASK,
  4329   XBM_DATA_WIDTH,
  4330   XBM_DATA_HEIGHT,
  4331   XBM_LAST
  4332 };
  4333 
  4334 /* Vector of image_keyword structures describing the format
  4335    of valid XBM image specifications.  */
  4336 
  4337 static const struct image_keyword xbm_format[XBM_LAST] =
  4338 {
  4339   {":type",             IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     1},
  4340   {":file",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  4341   {":width",            IMAGE_POSITIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,           0},
  4342   {":height",           IMAGE_POSITIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,           0},
  4343   {":stride",           IMAGE_POSITIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,           0},
  4344   {":data",             IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  4345   {":foreground",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0},
  4346   {":background",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0},
  4347   {":ascent",           IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,                     0},
  4348   {":margin",           IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR, 0},
  4349   {":relief",           IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
  4350   {":conversion",       IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  4351   {":heuristic-mask",   IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  4352   {":mask",             IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  4353   {":data-width",       IMAGE_POSITIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,           0},
  4354   {":data-height",      IMAGE_POSITIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,           0}
  4355 };
  4356 
  4357 /* Tokens returned from xbm_scan.  */
  4358 
  4359 enum xbm_token
  4360 {
  4361   XBM_TK_IDENT = 256,
  4362   XBM_TK_NUMBER,
  4363   XBM_TK_OVERFLOW
  4364 };
  4365 
  4366 
  4367 /* Return true if OBJECT is a valid XBM-type image specification.
  4368    A valid specification is a list starting with the symbol `image'
  4369    The rest of the list is a property list which must contain an
  4370    entry `:type xbm'.
  4371 
  4372    If the specification specifies a file to load, it must contain
  4373    an entry `:file FILENAME' where FILENAME is a string.
  4374 
  4375    If the specification is for a bitmap loaded from memory it must
  4376    contain `:data-width WIDTH', `:data-height HEIGHT', and `:data DATA',
  4377    where WIDTH and HEIGHT are integers > 0.  DATA may be:
  4378 
  4379    1. a string large enough to hold the bitmap data, i.e. it must
  4380    have a size >= (WIDTH + 7) / 8 * HEIGHT
  4381 
  4382    2. a bool-vector of size >= WIDTH * HEIGHT
  4383 
  4384    3. a vector of strings or bool-vectors, one for each line of the
  4385    bitmap.
  4386 
  4387    4. a string containing an in-memory XBM file.
  4388 
  4389    Both the file and data forms may contain the additional entries
  4390    `:background COLOR' and `:foreground COLOR'.  If not present,
  4391    foreground and background of the frame on which the image is
  4392    displayed is used.  */
  4393 
  4394 static bool
  4395 xbm_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
  4396 {
  4397   struct image_keyword kw[XBM_LAST];
  4398 
  4399   memcpy (kw, xbm_format, sizeof kw);
  4400   if (!parse_image_spec (object, kw, XBM_LAST, Qxbm))
  4401     return 0;
  4402 
  4403   eassert (EQ (kw[XBM_TYPE].value, Qxbm));
  4404 
  4405   if (kw[XBM_FILE].count)
  4406     {
  4407       if (kw[XBM_DATA].count)
  4408         return 0;
  4409     }
  4410   else if (kw[XBM_DATA].count && xbm_file_p (kw[XBM_DATA].value))
  4411     {
  4412       /* In-memory XBM file.  */
  4413       if (kw[XBM_FILE].count)
  4414         return 0;
  4415     }
  4416   else
  4417     {
  4418       Lisp_Object data;
  4419       int width, height, stride;
  4420 
  4421       /* Entries for `:width', `:height' and `:data' must be present.  */
  4422       if (!kw[XBM_DATA_WIDTH].count
  4423           || !kw[XBM_DATA_HEIGHT].count
  4424           || !kw[XBM_DATA].count)
  4425         return 0;
  4426 
  4427       data = kw[XBM_DATA].value;
  4428       width = XFIXNAT (kw[XBM_DATA_WIDTH].value);
  4429       height = XFIXNAT (kw[XBM_DATA_HEIGHT].value);
  4430 
  4431       if (!kw[XBM_STRIDE].count)
  4432         stride = width;
  4433       else
  4434         stride = XFIXNAT (kw[XBM_STRIDE].value);
  4435 
  4436       /* Check type of data, and width and height against contents of
  4437          data.  */
  4438       if (VECTORP (data))
  4439         {
  4440           EMACS_INT i;
  4441 
  4442           /* Number of elements of the vector must be >= height.  */
  4443           if (ASIZE (data) < height)
  4444             return 0;
  4445 
  4446           /* Each string or bool-vector in data must be large enough
  4447              for one line of the image.  */
  4448           for (i = 0; i < height; ++i)
  4449             {
  4450               Lisp_Object elt = AREF (data, i);
  4451 
  4452               if (STRINGP (elt))
  4453                 {
  4454                   if (SCHARS (elt) < stride / CHAR_BIT)
  4455                     return 0;
  4456                 }
  4457               else if (BOOL_VECTOR_P (elt))
  4458                 {
  4459                   if (bool_vector_size (elt) < width)
  4460                     return 0;
  4461                 }
  4462               else
  4463                 return 0;
  4464             }
  4465         }
  4466       else if (STRINGP (data))
  4467         {
  4468           if (SCHARS (data) < stride / CHAR_BIT * height)
  4469             return 0;
  4470         }
  4471       else if (BOOL_VECTOR_P (data))
  4472         {
  4473           if (height > 1 && stride != (width + CHAR_BIT - 1)
  4474               / CHAR_BIT * CHAR_BIT)
  4475             return 0;
  4476 
  4477           if (bool_vector_size (data) / height < stride)
  4478             return 0;
  4479         }
  4480       else
  4481         return 0;
  4482     }
  4483 
  4484   return 1;
  4485 }
  4486 
  4487 
  4488 /* Scan a bitmap file.  FP is the stream to read from.  Value is
  4489    either an enumerator from enum xbm_token, or a character for a
  4490    single-character token, or 0 at end of file.  If scanning an
  4491    identifier, store the lexeme of the identifier in SVAL.  If
  4492    scanning a number, store its value in *IVAL.  */
  4493 
  4494 static int
  4495 xbm_scan (char **s, char *end, char *sval, int *ival)
  4496 {
  4497   unsigned char c UNINIT;
  4498   char *sval_end = sval + BUFSIZ;
  4499 
  4500  loop:
  4501 
  4502   /* Skip white space.  */
  4503   while (*s < end && (c = *(*s)++, c_isspace (c)))
  4504     ;
  4505 
  4506   if (*s >= end)
  4507     c = 0;
  4508   else if (c_isdigit (c))
  4509     {
  4510       int value = 0, digit;
  4511       bool overflow = false;
  4512 
  4513       if (c == '0' && *s < end)
  4514         {
  4515           c = *(*s)++;
  4516           if (c == 'x' || c == 'X')
  4517             {
  4518               while (*s < end)
  4519                 {
  4520                   c = *(*s)++;
