  4521                   digit = char_hexdigit (c);
  4522                   if (digit < 0)
  4523                     break;
  4524                   overflow |= ckd_mul (&value, value, 16);
  4525                   value += digit;
  4526                 }
  4527             }
  4528           else if ('0' <= c && c <= '7')
  4529             {
  4530               value = c - '0';
  4531               while (*s < end
  4532                      && (c = *(*s)++, '0' <= c && c <= '7'))
  4533                 {
  4534                   overflow |= ckd_mul (&value, value, 8);
  4535                   value += c - '0';
  4536                 }
  4537             }
  4538         }
  4539       else
  4540         {
  4541           value = c - '0';
  4542           while (*s < end
  4543                  && (c = *(*s)++, c_isdigit (c)))
  4544             {
  4545               overflow |= ckd_mul (&value, value, 10);
  4546               overflow |= ckd_add (&value, value, c - '0');
  4547             }
  4548         }
  4549 
  4550       if (*s < end)
  4551         *s = *s - 1;
  4552       *ival = value;
  4553       return overflow ? XBM_TK_OVERFLOW : XBM_TK_NUMBER;
  4554     }
  4555   /* Character literal.  XBM images typically contain hex escape
  4556      sequences and not actual characters, so we only try to handle
  4557      that here.  */
  4558   else if (c == '\'')
  4559     {
  4560       int value = 0, digit;
  4561       bool overflow = false;
  4562 
  4563       if (*s == end)
  4564         return 0;
  4565 
  4566       c = *(*s)++;
  4567 
  4568       if (c != '\\' || *s == end)
  4569         return 0;
  4570 
  4571       c = *(*s)++;
  4572 
  4573       if (c == 'x')
  4574         {
  4575           while (*s < end)
  4576             {
  4577               c = *(*s)++;
  4578 
  4579               if (c == '\'')
  4580                 {
  4581                   *ival = value;
  4582                   return overflow ? XBM_TK_OVERFLOW : XBM_TK_NUMBER;
  4583                 }
  4584 
  4585               digit = char_hexdigit (c);
  4586 
  4587               if (digit < 0)
  4588                 return 0;
  4589 
  4590               overflow |= ckd_mul (&value, value, 16);
  4591               value += digit;
  4592             }
  4593         }
  4594 
  4595       return 0;
  4596     }
  4597   else if (c_isalpha (c) || c == '_')
  4598     {
  4599       *sval++ = c;
  4600       while (*s < end && sval < sval_end
  4601              && (c = *(*s)++, (c_isalnum (c) || c == '_')))
  4602         *sval++ = c;
  4603       *sval = 0;
  4604       if (*s < end)
  4605         *s = *s - 1;
  4606       return XBM_TK_IDENT;
  4607     }
  4608   else if (c == '/' && **s == '*')
  4609     {
  4610       /* C-style comment.  */
  4611       ++*s;
  4612       while (**s && (**s != '*' || *(*s + 1) != '/'))
  4613         ++*s;
  4614       if (**s)
  4615         {
  4616           *s += 2;
  4617           goto loop;
  4618         }
  4619     }
  4620 
  4621   return c;
  4622 }
  4623 
  4624 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  4625 
  4626 /* Create a Windows bitmap from X bitmap data.  */
  4627 static HBITMAP
  4628 w32_create_pixmap_from_bitmap_data (int width, int height, char *data)
  4629 {
  4630   static unsigned char swap_nibble[16]
  4631     = { 0x0, 0x8, 0x4, 0xc,    /* 0000 1000 0100 1100 */
  4632         0x2, 0xa, 0x6, 0xe,    /* 0010 1010 0110 1110 */
  4633         0x1, 0x9, 0x5, 0xd,    /* 0001 1001 0101 1101 */
  4634         0x3, 0xb, 0x7, 0xf };  /* 0011 1011 0111 1111 */
  4635   int i, j, w1, w2;
  4636   unsigned char *bits, *p;
  4637   HBITMAP bmp;
  4638 
  4639   w1 = (width + 7) / 8;         /* nb of 8bits elt in X bitmap */
  4640   w2 = ((width + 15) / 16) * 2; /* nb of 16bits elt in W32 bitmap */
  4641   bits = alloca (height * w2);
  4642   memset (bits, 0, height * w2);
  4643   for (i = 0; i < height; i++)
  4644     {
  4645       p = bits + i*w2;
  4646       for (j = 0; j < w1; j++)
  4647         {
  4648           /* Bitswap XBM bytes to match how Windows does things.  */
  4649           unsigned char c = *data++;
  4650           *p++ = (unsigned char)((swap_nibble[c & 0xf] << 4)
  4651                                  | (swap_nibble[(c>>4) & 0xf]));
  4652         }
  4653     }
  4654   bmp = CreateBitmap (width, height, 1, 1, (char *) bits);
  4655 
  4656   return bmp;
  4657 }
  4658 
  4659 static void
  4660 convert_mono_to_color_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img,
  4661                              COLORREF foreground, COLORREF background)
  4662 {
  4663   HDC hdc, old_img_dc, new_img_dc;
  4664   HGDIOBJ old_prev, new_prev;
  4665   HBITMAP new_pixmap;
  4666 
  4667   hdc = get_frame_dc (f);
  4668   old_img_dc = CreateCompatibleDC (hdc);
  4669   new_img_dc = CreateCompatibleDC (hdc);
  4670   new_pixmap = CreateCompatibleBitmap (hdc, img->width, img->height);
  4671   release_frame_dc (f, hdc);
  4672   old_prev = SelectObject (old_img_dc, img->pixmap);
  4673   new_prev = SelectObject (new_img_dc, new_pixmap);
  4674   SetTextColor (new_img_dc, foreground);
  4675   SetBkColor (new_img_dc, background);
  4676 
  4677   BitBlt (new_img_dc, 0, 0, img->width, img->height, old_img_dc,
  4678           0, 0, SRCCOPY);
  4679 
  4680   SelectObject (old_img_dc, old_prev);
  4681   SelectObject (new_img_dc, new_prev);
  4682   DeleteDC (old_img_dc);
  4683   DeleteDC (new_img_dc);
  4684   DeleteObject (img->pixmap);
  4685   if (new_pixmap == 0)
  4686     fputs ("Failed to convert image to color.\n", stderr);
  4687   else
  4688     img->pixmap = new_pixmap;
  4689 }
  4690 
  4691 #define XBM_BIT_SHUFFLE(b) (~(b))
  4692 
  4693 #else
  4694 
  4695 #define XBM_BIT_SHUFFLE(b) (b)
  4696 
  4697 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  4698 
  4699 
  4700 static void
  4701 Create_Pixmap_From_Bitmap_Data (struct frame *f, struct image *img, char *data,
  4702                                 RGB_PIXEL_COLOR fg, RGB_PIXEL_COLOR bg,
  4703                                 bool non_default_colors)
  4704 {
  4705 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  4706   Emacs_Color fgbg[] = {{.pixel = fg}, {.pixel = bg}};
  4707   FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->query_colors (f, fgbg, ARRAYELTS (fgbg));
  4708   fg = lookup_rgb_color (f, fgbg[0].red, fgbg[0].green, fgbg[0].blue);
  4709   bg = lookup_rgb_color (f, fgbg[1].red, fgbg[1].green, fgbg[1].blue);
  4710   img->pixmap
  4711     = image_pix_container_create_from_bitmap_data (f, data, img->width,
  4712                                                    img->height, fg, bg);
  4713 #elif defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS
  4714   img->pixmap
  4715     = XCreatePixmapFromBitmapData (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  4716                                    FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
  4717                                    data,
  4718                                    img->width, img->height,
  4719                                    fg, bg,
  4720                                    FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->n_planes);
  4721 # if !defined USE_CAIRO && defined HAVE_XRENDER
  4722   if (img->pixmap)
  4723     img->picture = x_create_xrender_picture (f, img->pixmap, 0);
  4724 # endif
  4725 
  4726 #elif defined HAVE_ANDROID
  4727 #ifndef ANDROID_STUBIFY
  4728   img->pixmap
  4729     = android_create_pixmap_from_bitmap_data (data, img->width, img->height,
  4730                                               fg, bg,
  4731                                               FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->n_planes);
  4732 #else
  4733   emacs_abort ();
  4734 #endif
  4735 #elif defined HAVE_NTGUI
  4736   img->pixmap
  4737     = w32_create_pixmap_from_bitmap_data (img->width, img->height, data);
  4738 
  4739   /* If colors were specified, transfer the bitmap to a color one.  */
  4740   if (non_default_colors)
  4741     convert_mono_to_color_image (f, img, fg, bg);
  4742 #elif defined HAVE_NS
  4743   img->pixmap = ns_image_from_XBM (data, img->width, img->height, fg, bg);
  4744 #elif defined HAVE_HAIKU
  4745   img->pixmap = BBitmap_new (img->width, img->height, 0);
  4746 
  4747   if (img->pixmap)
  4748     {
  4749       int bytes_per_line = (img->width + 7) / 8;
  4750 
  4751       for (int y = 0; y < img->height; y++)
  4752         {
  4753           for (int x = 0; x < img->width; x++)
  4754             PUT_PIXEL (img->pixmap, x, y,
  4755                        (data[x / 8] >> (x % 8)) & 1 ? fg : bg);
  4756           data += bytes_per_line;
  4757         }
  4758     }
  4759 #endif
  4760 }
  4761 
  4762 
  4763 
  4764 /* Replacement for XReadBitmapFileData which isn't available under old
  4765    X versions.  CONTENTS is a pointer to a buffer to parse; END is the
  4766    buffer's end.  Set *WIDTH and *HEIGHT to the width and height of
  4767    the image.  Return in *DATA the bitmap data allocated with xmalloc.
  4768    Value is true if successful.  DATA null means just test if
  4769    CONTENTS looks like an in-memory XBM file.  If INHIBIT_IMAGE_ERROR,
  4770    inhibit the call to image_error when the image size is invalid (the
  4771    bitmap remains unread).  */
  4772 
  4773 static bool
  4774 xbm_read_bitmap_data (struct frame *f, char *contents, char *end,
  4775                       int *width, int *height, char **data,
  4776                       bool inhibit_image_error)
  4777 {
  4778   char *s = contents;
  4779   char buffer[BUFSIZ];
  4780   bool padding_p = 0;
  4781   bool v10 = 0;
  4782   int bytes_per_line, i, nbytes;
  4783   char *p;
  4784   int value;
  4785   int LA1;
  4786 
  4787 #define match() \
  4788      LA1 = xbm_scan (&s, end, buffer, &value)
  4789 
  4790 #define expect(TOKEN)           \
  4791   do                            \
  4792     {                           \
  4793       if (LA1 != (TOKEN))       \
  4794         goto failure;           \
  4795       match ();                 \
  4796     }                           \
  4797   while (0)
  4798 
  4799 #define expect_ident(IDENT)                                     \
  4800      if (LA1 == XBM_TK_IDENT && strcmp (buffer, (IDENT)) == 0)  \
  4801        match ();                                                \
  4802      else                                                       \
  4803        goto failure
  4804 
  4805   *width = *height = -1;
  4806   if (data)
  4807     *data = NULL;
  4808   LA1 = xbm_scan (&s, end, buffer, &value);
  4809 
  4810   /* Parse defines for width, height and hot-spots.  */
  4811   while (LA1 == '#')
  4812     {
  4813       match ();
  4814       expect_ident ("define");
  4815       expect (XBM_TK_IDENT);
  4816 
  4817       if (LA1 == XBM_TK_NUMBER)
  4818         {
  4819           char *q = strrchr (buffer, '_');
  4820           q = q ? q + 1 : buffer;
  4821           if (strcmp (q, "width") == 0)
  4822             *width = value;
  4823           else if (strcmp (q, "height") == 0)
  4824             *height = value;
  4825         }
  4826       expect (XBM_TK_NUMBER);
  4827     }
  4828 
  4829   if (!check_image_size (f, *width, *height))
  4830     {
  4831       if (!inhibit_image_error)
  4832         image_size_error ();
  4833       goto failure;
  4834     }
  4835   else if (data == NULL)
  4836     goto success;
  4837 
  4838   /* Parse bits.  Must start with `static'.  */
  4839   expect_ident ("static");
  4840   if (LA1 == XBM_TK_IDENT)
  4841     {
  4842       if (strcmp (buffer, "unsigned") == 0)
  4843         {
  4844           match ();
  4845           expect_ident ("char");
  4846         }
  4847       else if (strcmp (buffer, "short") == 0)
  4848         {
  4849           match ();
  4850           v10 = 1;
  4851           if (*width % 16 && *width % 16 < 9)
  4852             padding_p = 1;
  4853         }
  4854       else if (strcmp (buffer, "char") == 0)
  4855         match ();
  4856       else
  4857         goto failure;
  4858     }
  4859   else
  4860     goto failure;
  4861 
  4862   expect (XBM_TK_IDENT);
  4863   expect ('[');
  4864   expect (']');
  4865   expect ('=');
  4866   expect ('{');
  4867 
  4868   if (! image_check_image_size (0, *width, *height))
  4869     {
  4870       if (!inhibit_image_error)
  4871         image_error ("Image too large (%dx%d)",
  4872                      make_fixnum (*width), make_fixnum (*height));
  4873       goto failure;
  4874     }
  4875   bytes_per_line = (*width + 7) / 8 + padding_p;
  4876   nbytes = bytes_per_line * *height;
  4877   p = *data = xmalloc (nbytes);
  4878 
  4879   if (v10)
  4880     {
  4881       for (i = 0; i < nbytes; i += 2)
  4882         {
  4883           int val = value;
  4884           expect (XBM_TK_NUMBER);
  4885 
  4886           *p++ = XBM_BIT_SHUFFLE (val);
  4887           if (!padding_p || ((i + 2) % bytes_per_line))
  4888             *p++ = XBM_BIT_SHUFFLE (value >> 8);
  4889 
  4890           if (LA1 == ',' || LA1 == '}')
  4891             match ();
  4892           else
  4893             goto failure;
  4894         }
  4895     }
  4896   else
  4897     {
  4898       for (i = 0; i < nbytes; ++i)
  4899         {
  4900           int val = value;
  4901           expect (XBM_TK_NUMBER);
  4902 
  4903           *p++ = XBM_BIT_SHUFFLE (val);
  4904 
  4905           if (LA1 == ',' || LA1 == '}')
  4906             match ();
  4907           else
  4908             goto failure;
  4909         }
  4910     }
  4911 
  4912  success:
  4913   return 1;
  4914 
  4915  failure:
  4916 
  4917   if (data && *data)
  4918     {
  4919       xfree (*data);
  4920       *data = NULL;
  4921     }
  4922   return 0;
  4923 
  4924 #undef match
  4925 #undef expect
  4926 #undef expect_ident
  4927 }
  4928 
  4929 
  4930 /* Load XBM image IMG which will be displayed on frame F from buffer
  4931    CONTENTS.  END is the end of the buffer.  Value is true if
  4932    successful.  */
  4933 
  4934 static bool
  4935 xbm_load_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img, char *contents, char *end)
  4936 {
  4937   bool rc;
  4938   char *data;
  4939   bool success_p = 0;
  4940 
  4941   rc = xbm_read_bitmap_data (f, contents, end, &img->width, &img->height,
  4942                              &data, 0);
  4943 
  4944   if (rc)
  4945     {
  4946       unsigned long foreground = img->face_foreground;
  4947       unsigned long background = img->face_background;
  4948       bool non_default_colors = 0;
  4949       Lisp_Object value;
  4950 
  4951       eassert (img->width > 0 && img->height > 0);
  4952 
  4953       /* Get foreground and background colors, maybe allocate colors.  */
  4954       value = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCforeground, NULL);
  4955       if (!NILP (value))
  4956         {
  4957           foreground = image_alloc_image_color (f, img, value, foreground);
  4958           non_default_colors = 1;
  4959         }
  4960       value = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL);
  4961       if (!NILP (value))
  4962         {
  4963           background = image_alloc_image_color (f, img, value, background);
  4964           img->background = background;
  4965           img->background_valid = 1;
  4966           non_default_colors = 1;
  4967         }
  4968 
  4969       if (image_check_image_size (0, img->width, img->height))
  4970         Create_Pixmap_From_Bitmap_Data (f, img, data,
  4971                                         foreground, background,
  4972                                         non_default_colors);
  4973       else
  4974         img->pixmap = NO_PIXMAP;
  4975       xfree (data);
  4976 
  4977       if (img->pixmap == NO_PIXMAP)
  4978         {
  4979           image_clear_image (f, img);
  4980           image_error ("Unable to create X pixmap for `%s'", img->spec);
  4981         }
  4982       else
  4983         success_p = 1;
  4984     }
  4985   else
  4986     image_error ("Error loading XBM image `%s'", img->spec);
  4987 
  4988   return success_p;
  4989 }
  4990 
  4991 
  4992 /* Value is true if DATA looks like an in-memory XBM file.  */
  4993 
  4994 static bool
  4995 xbm_file_p (Lisp_Object data)
  4996 {
  4997   int w, h;
  4998   return (STRINGP (data)
  4999           && xbm_read_bitmap_data (NULL, SSDATA (data),
  5000                                    SSDATA (data) + SBYTES (data),
  5001                                    &w, &h, NULL, 1));
  5002 }
  5003 
  5004 
  5005 /* Fill image IMG which is used on frame F with pixmap data.  Value is
  5006    true if successful.  */
  5007 
  5008 static bool
  5009 xbm_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  5010 {
  5011   bool success_p = 0;
  5012   Lisp_Object file_name;
  5013 
  5014   eassert (xbm_image_p (img->spec));
  5015 
  5016   /* If IMG->spec specifies a file name, create a non-file spec from it.  */
  5017   file_name = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCfile, NULL);
  5018   if (STRINGP (file_name))
  5019     {
  5020       image_fd fd;
  5021       Lisp_Object file = image_find_image_fd (file_name, &fd);
  5022       if (!STRINGP (file))
  5023         {
  5024           image_error ("Cannot find image file `%s'", file_name);
  5025           return 0;
  5026         }
  5027 
  5028       ptrdiff_t size;
  5029       char *contents = slurp_file (fd, &size);
  5030       if (contents == NULL)
  5031         {
  5032           image_error ("Error loading XBM image `%s'", file);
  5033           return 0;
  5034         }
  5035 
  5036       success_p = xbm_load_image (f, img, contents, contents + size);
  5037       xfree (contents);
  5038     }
  5039   else
  5040     {
  5041       struct image_keyword fmt[XBM_LAST];
  5042       Lisp_Object data;
  5043       unsigned long foreground = img->face_foreground;
  5044       unsigned long background = img->face_background;
  5045       bool non_default_colors = 0;
  5046       char *bits;
  5047       bool parsed_p;
  5048       bool in_memory_file_p = 0;
  5049 
  5050       /* See if data looks like an in-memory XBM file.  */
  5051       data = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL);
  5052       in_memory_file_p = xbm_file_p (data);
  5053 
  5054       /* Parse the image specification.  */
  5055       memcpy (fmt, xbm_format, sizeof fmt);
  5056       parsed_p = parse_image_spec (img->spec, fmt, XBM_LAST, Qxbm);
  5057       eassert (parsed_p);
  5058 
  5059       /* Get specified width, and height.  */
  5060       if (!in_memory_file_p)
  5061         {
  5062           img->width = XFIXNAT (fmt[XBM_DATA_WIDTH].value);
  5063           img->height = XFIXNAT (fmt[XBM_DATA_HEIGHT].value);
  5064           eassert (img->width > 0 && img->height > 0);
  5065           if (!check_image_size (f, img->width, img->height))
  5066             {
  5067               image_size_error ();
  5068               return 0;
  5069             }
  5070         }
  5071 
  5072       /* Get foreground and background colors, maybe allocate colors.  */
  5073       if (fmt[XBM_FOREGROUND].count
  5074           && STRINGP (fmt[XBM_FOREGROUND].value))
  5075         {
  5076           foreground = image_alloc_image_color (f,
  5077                                                 img,
  5078                                                 fmt[XBM_FOREGROUND].value,
  5079                                                 foreground);
  5080           non_default_colors = 1;
  5081         }
  5082 
  5083       if (fmt[XBM_BACKGROUND].count
  5084           && STRINGP (fmt[XBM_BACKGROUND].value))
  5085         {
  5086           background = image_alloc_image_color (f,
  5087                                                 img,
  5088                                                 fmt[XBM_BACKGROUND].value,
  5089                                                 background);
  5090           non_default_colors = 1;
  5091         }
  5092 
  5093       if (in_memory_file_p)
  5094         success_p = xbm_load_image (f, img, SSDATA (data),
  5095                                     SSDATA (data) + SBYTES (data));
  5096       else
  5097         {
  5098           USE_SAFE_ALLOCA;
  5099 
  5100           if (VECTORP (data))
  5101             {
  5102               int i;
  5103               char *p;
  5104               int nbytes = (img->width + CHAR_BIT - 1) / CHAR_BIT;
  5105 
  5106               SAFE_NALLOCA (bits, nbytes, img->height);
  5107               p = bits;
  5108               for (i = 0; i < img->height; ++i, p += nbytes)
  5109                 {
  5110                   Lisp_Object line = AREF (data, i);
  5111                   if (STRINGP (line))
  5112                     memcpy (p, SDATA (line), nbytes);
  5113                   else
  5114                     memcpy (p, bool_vector_data (line), nbytes);
  5115                 }
  5116             }
  5117           else if (STRINGP (data))
  5118             bits = SSDATA (data);
  5119           else
  5120             bits = (char *) bool_vector_data (data);
  5121 
  5122 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  5123           {
  5124             char *invertedBits;
  5125             int nbytes, i;
  5126             /* Windows mono bitmaps are reversed compared with X.  */
  5127             invertedBits = bits;
  5128             nbytes = (img->width + CHAR_BIT - 1) / CHAR_BIT * img->height;
  5129             SAFE_NALLOCA (bits, 1, nbytes);
  5130             for (i = 0; i < nbytes; i++)
  5131               bits[i] = XBM_BIT_SHUFFLE (invertedBits[i]);
  5132           }
  5133 #endif
  5134           /* Create the pixmap.  */
  5135 
  5136           if (image_check_image_size (0, img->width, img->height))
  5137             Create_Pixmap_From_Bitmap_Data (f, img, bits,
  5138                                             foreground, background,
  5139                                             non_default_colors);
  5140           else
  5141             img->pixmap = NO_PIXMAP;
  5142 
  5143           if (img->pixmap)
  5144             success_p = 1;
  5145           else
  5146             {
  5147               image_error ("Unable to create pixmap for XBM image `%s'",
  5148                            img->spec);
  5149               image_clear_image (f, img);
  5150             }
  5151 
  5152           SAFE_FREE ();
  5153         }
  5154     }
  5155 
  5156   return success_p;
  5157 }
  5158 
  5159 
  5160 
  5161 /***********************************************************************
  5162                               XPM images
  5163  ***********************************************************************/
  5164 
  5165 #if defined (HAVE_XPM) || defined (HAVE_NS) || defined (HAVE_PGTK) \
  5166   || defined (HAVE_ANDROID)
  5167 
  5168 static bool xpm_image_p (Lisp_Object object);
  5169 static bool xpm_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img);
  5170 
  5171 #endif /* HAVE_XPM || HAVE_NS */
  5172 
  5173 #ifdef HAVE_XPM
  5174 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  5175 /* Indicate to xpm.h that we don't have Xlib.  */
  5176 #define FOR_MSW
  5177 /* simx.h in xpm defines XColor and XImage differently than Emacs.  */
  5178 /* It also defines Display the same way as Emacs, but gcc 3.3 still barfs.  */
  5179 #define XColor xpm_XColor
  5180 #define XImage xpm_XImage
  5181 #define Display xpm_Display
  5182 #ifdef CYGWIN
  5183 #include "noX/xpm.h"
  5184 #else  /* not CYGWIN */
  5185 #include "X11/xpm.h"
  5186 #endif  /* not CYGWIN */
  5187 #undef FOR_MSW
  5188 #undef XColor
  5189 #undef XImage
  5190 #undef Display
  5191 #else  /* not HAVE_NTGUI */
  5192 #include "X11/xpm.h"
  5193 #endif /* not HAVE_NTGUI */
  5194 #endif /* HAVE_XPM */
  5195 
  5196 #if defined HAVE_XPM || defined USE_CAIRO || defined HAVE_NS    \
  5197   || defined HAVE_HAIKU || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  5198 
  5199 /* Indices of image specification fields in xpm_format, below.  */
  5200 
  5201 enum xpm_keyword_index
  5202 {
  5203   XPM_TYPE,
  5204   XPM_FILE,
  5205   XPM_DATA,
  5206   XPM_ASCENT,
  5207   XPM_MARGIN,
  5208   XPM_RELIEF,
  5209   XPM_ALGORITHM,
  5210   XPM_HEURISTIC_MASK,
  5211   XPM_MASK,
  5212   XPM_COLOR_SYMBOLS,
  5213   XPM_BACKGROUND,
  5214   XPM_LAST
  5215 };
  5216 
  5217 #if defined HAVE_XPM || defined HAVE_NS || defined HAVE_HAIKU   \
  5218   || defined HAVE_PGTK || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  5219 /* Vector of image_keyword structures describing the format
  5220    of valid XPM image specifications.  */
  5221 
  5222 static const struct image_keyword xpm_format[XPM_LAST] =
  5223 {
  5224   {":type",             IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     1},
  5225   {":file",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  5226   {":data",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  5227   {":ascent",           IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,                     0},
  5228   {":margin",           IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR, 0},
  5229   {":relief",           IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
  5230   {":conversion",       IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  5231   {":heuristic-mask",   IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  5232   {":mask",             IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  5233   {":color-symbols",    IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  5234   {":background",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0}
  5235 };
  5236 #endif  /* HAVE_XPM || HAVE_NS || HAVE_HAIKU || HAVE_PGTK */
  5237 
  5238 #if defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS && !defined USE_CAIRO
  5239 
  5240 /* Define ALLOC_XPM_COLORS if we can use Emacs' own color allocation
  5241    functions for allocating image colors.  Our own functions handle
  5242    color allocation failures more gracefully than the ones on the XPM
  5243    lib.  */
  5244 
  5245 #if defined XpmAllocColor && defined XpmFreeColors && defined XpmColorClosure
  5246 #define ALLOC_XPM_COLORS
  5247 #endif
  5248 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS && !USE_CAIRO */
  5249 
  5250 #ifdef ALLOC_XPM_COLORS
  5251 
  5252 static struct xpm_cached_color *xpm_cache_color (struct frame *, char *,
  5253                                                  XColor *, int);
  5254 
  5255 /* An entry in a hash table used to cache color definitions of named
  5256    colors.  This cache is necessary to speed up XPM image loading in
  5257    case we do color allocations ourselves.  Without it, we would need
  5258    a call to XParseColor per pixel in the image.
  5259 
  5260    FIXME Now that we're using x_parse_color and its cache, reevaluate
  5261    the need for this caching layer.  */
  5262 
  5263 struct xpm_cached_color
  5264 {
  5265   /* Next in collision chain.  */
  5266   struct xpm_cached_color *next;
  5267 
  5268   /* Color definition (RGB and pixel color).  */
  5269   XColor color;
  5270 
  5271   /* Color name.  */
  5272   char name[FLEXIBLE_ARRAY_MEMBER];
  5273 };
  5274 
  5275 /* The hash table used for the color cache, and its bucket vector
  5276    size (which should be prime).  */
  5277 
  5278 #define XPM_COLOR_CACHE_BUCKETS 1009
  5279 static struct xpm_cached_color **xpm_color_cache;
  5280 
  5281 /* Initialize the color cache.  */
  5282 
  5283 static void
  5284 xpm_init_color_cache (struct frame *f, XpmAttributes *attrs)
  5285 {
  5286   size_t nbytes = XPM_COLOR_CACHE_BUCKETS * sizeof *xpm_color_cache;
  5287   xpm_color_cache = xzalloc (nbytes);
  5288   init_color_table ();
  5289 
  5290   if (attrs->valuemask & XpmColorSymbols)
  5291     {
  5292       int i;
  5293       XColor color;
  5294 
  5295       for (i = 0; i < attrs->numsymbols; ++i)
  5296         if (x_parse_color (f, attrs->colorsymbols[i].value, &color))
  5297           {
  5298             color.pixel = lookup_rgb_color (f, color.red, color.green,
  5299                                             color.blue);
  5300             xpm_cache_color (f, attrs->colorsymbols[i].name, &color, -1);
  5301           }
  5302     }
  5303 }
  5304 
  5305 /* Free the color cache.  */
  5306 
  5307 static void
  5308 xpm_free_color_cache (void)
  5309 {
  5310   struct xpm_cached_color *p, *next;
  5311   int i;
  5312 
  5313   for (i = 0; i < XPM_COLOR_CACHE_BUCKETS; ++i)
  5314     for (p = xpm_color_cache[i]; p; p = next)
  5315       {
  5316         next = p->next;
  5317         xfree (p);
  5318       }
  5319 
  5320   xfree (xpm_color_cache);
  5321   xpm_color_cache = NULL;
  5322   free_color_table ();
  5323 }
  5324 
  5325 /* Return the bucket index for color named COLOR_NAME in the color
  5326    cache.  */
  5327 
  5328 static int
  5329 xpm_color_bucket (char *color_name)
  5330 {
  5331   EMACS_UINT hash = hash_string (color_name, strlen (color_name));
  5332   return hash % XPM_COLOR_CACHE_BUCKETS;
  5333 }
  5334 
  5335 
  5336 /* On frame F, cache values COLOR for color with name COLOR_NAME.
  5337    BUCKET, if >= 0, is a precomputed bucket index.  Value is the cache
  5338    entry added.  */
  5339 
  5340 static struct xpm_cached_color *
  5341 xpm_cache_color (struct frame *f, char *color_name, XColor *color, int bucket)
  5342 {
  5343   size_t nbytes;
  5344   struct xpm_cached_color *p;
  5345 
  5346   if (bucket < 0)
  5347     bucket = xpm_color_bucket (color_name);
  5348 
  5349   nbytes = FLEXSIZEOF (struct xpm_cached_color, name, strlen (color_name) + 1);
  5350   p = xmalloc (nbytes);
  5351   strcpy (p->name, color_name);
  5352   p->color = *color;
  5353   p->next = xpm_color_cache[bucket];
  5354   xpm_color_cache[bucket] = p;
  5355   return p;
  5356 }
  5357 
  5358 /* Look up color COLOR_NAME for frame F in the color cache.  If found,
  5359    return the cached definition in *COLOR.  Otherwise, make a new
  5360    entry in the cache and allocate the color.  Value is false if color
  5361    allocation failed.  */
  5362 
  5363 static bool
  5364 xpm_lookup_color (struct frame *f, char *color_name, XColor *color)
  5365 {
  5366   struct xpm_cached_color *p;
  5367   int h = xpm_color_bucket (color_name);
  5368 
  5369   for (p = xpm_color_cache[h]; p; p = p->next)
  5370     if (strcmp (p->name, color_name) == 0)
  5371       break;
  5372 
  5373   if (p != NULL)
  5374     *color = p->color;
  5375   else if (x_parse_color (f, color_name, color))
  5376     {
  5377       color->pixel = lookup_rgb_color (f, color->red, color->green,
  5378                                        color->blue);
  5379       p = xpm_cache_color (f, color_name, color, h);
  5380     }
  5381   /* You get `opaque' at least from ImageMagick converting pbm to xpm
  5382      with transparency, and it's useful.  */
  5383   else if (strcmp ("opaque", color_name) == 0)
  5384     {
  5385       memset (color, 0, sizeof (XColor));  /* Is this necessary/correct?  */
  5386       color->pixel = FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f);
  5387       p = xpm_cache_color (f, color_name, color, h);
  5388     }
  5389 
  5390   return p != NULL;
  5391 }
  5392 
  5393 
  5394 /* Callback for allocating color COLOR_NAME.  Called from the XPM lib.
  5395    CLOSURE is a pointer to the frame on which we allocate the
  5396    color.  Return in *COLOR the allocated color.  Value is non-zero
  5397    if successful.  */
  5398 
  5399 static int
  5400 xpm_alloc_color (Display *dpy, Colormap cmap, char *color_name, XColor *color,
  5401                  void *closure)
  5402 {
  5403   return xpm_lookup_color (closure, color_name, color);
  5404 }
  5405 
  5406 
  5407 /* Callback for freeing NPIXELS colors contained in PIXELS.  CLOSURE
  5408    is a pointer to the frame on which we allocate the color.  Value is
  5409    non-zero if successful.  */
  5410 
  5411 static int
  5412 xpm_free_colors (Display *dpy, Colormap cmap, Pixel *pixels, int npixels, void *closure)
  5413 {
  5414   return 1;
  5415 }
  5416 
  5417 #endif /* ALLOC_XPM_COLORS */
  5418 
  5419 
  5420 #ifdef WINDOWSNT
  5421 
  5422 /* XPM library details.  */
  5423 
  5424 DEF_DLL_FN (void, XpmFreeAttributes, (XpmAttributes *));
  5425 DEF_DLL_FN (int, XpmCreateImageFromBuffer,
  5426             (Display *, char *, xpm_XImage **,
  5427              xpm_XImage **, XpmAttributes *));
  5428 DEF_DLL_FN (int, XpmReadFileToImage,
  5429             (Display *, char *, xpm_XImage **,
  5430              xpm_XImage **, XpmAttributes *));
  5431 DEF_DLL_FN (void, XImageFree, (xpm_XImage *));
  5432 
  5433 static bool
  5434 init_xpm_functions (void)
  5435 {
  5436   HMODULE library;
  5437 
  5438   if (!(library = w32_delayed_load (Qxpm)))
  5439     return 0;
  5440 
  5441   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, XpmFreeAttributes);
  5442   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, XpmCreateImageFromBuffer);
  5443   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, XpmReadFileToImage);
  5444   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, XImageFree);
  5445   return 1;
  5446 }
  5447 
  5448 # undef XImageFree
  5449 # undef XpmCreateImageFromBuffer
  5450 # undef XpmFreeAttributes
  5451 # undef XpmReadFileToImage
  5452 
  5453 # define XImageFree fn_XImageFree
  5454 # define XpmCreateImageFromBuffer fn_XpmCreateImageFromBuffer
  5455 # define XpmFreeAttributes fn_XpmFreeAttributes
  5456 # define XpmReadFileToImage fn_XpmReadFileToImage
  5457 
  5458 #endif /* WINDOWSNT */
  5459 
  5460 #if defined HAVE_XPM || defined HAVE_NS || defined HAVE_HAIKU   \
  5461   || defined HAVE_PGTK || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  5462 /* Value is true if COLOR_SYMBOLS is a valid color symbols list
  5463    for XPM images.  Such a list must consist of conses whose car and
  5464    cdr are strings.  */
  5465 
  5466 static bool
  5467 xpm_valid_color_symbols_p (Lisp_Object color_symbols)
  5468 {
  5469   while (CONSP (color_symbols))
  5470     {
  5471       Lisp_Object sym = XCAR (color_symbols);
  5472       if (!CONSP (sym)
  5473           || !STRINGP (XCAR (sym))
  5474           || !STRINGP (XCDR (sym)))
  5475         break;
  5476       color_symbols = XCDR (color_symbols);
  5477     }
  5478 
  5479   return NILP (color_symbols);
  5480 }
  5481 
  5482 /* Value is true if OBJECT is a valid XPM image specification.  */
  5483 
  5484 static bool
  5485 xpm_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
  5486 {
  5487   struct image_keyword fmt[XPM_LAST];
  5488   memcpy (fmt, xpm_format, sizeof fmt);
  5489   return (parse_image_spec (object, fmt, XPM_LAST, Qxpm)
  5490           /* Either `:file' or `:data' must be present.  */
  5491           && fmt[XPM_FILE].count + fmt[XPM_DATA].count == 1
  5492           /* Either no `:color-symbols' or it's a list of conses
  5493              whose car and cdr are strings.  */
  5494           && (! fmt[XPM_COLOR_SYMBOLS].count
  5495               || xpm_valid_color_symbols_p (fmt[XPM_COLOR_SYMBOLS].value)));
  5496 }
  5497 #endif  /* HAVE_XPM || HAVE_NS || HAVE_HAIKU || HAVE_PGTK || HAVE_ANDROID */
  5498 
  5499 #endif /* HAVE_XPM || USE_CAIRO || HAVE_NS || HAVE_HAIKU || HAVE_ANDROID */
  5500 
  5501 #if defined HAVE_XPM && defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS && !defined USE_GTK
  5502 ptrdiff_t
  5503 x_create_bitmap_from_xpm_data (struct frame *f, const char **bits)
  5504 {
  5505   Display_Info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  5506   ptrdiff_t id;
  5507   int rc;
  5508   XpmAttributes attrs;
  5509   Pixmap bitmap, mask;
  5510 
  5511   memset (&attrs, 0, sizeof attrs);
  5512 
  5513   attrs.visual = FRAME_X_VISUAL (f);
  5514   attrs.colormap = FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f);
  5515   attrs.valuemask |= XpmVisual;
  5516   attrs.valuemask |= XpmColormap;
  5517 
  5518 #ifdef ALLOC_XPM_COLORS
  5519   attrs.color_closure = f;
  5520   attrs.alloc_color = xpm_alloc_color;
  5521   attrs.free_colors = xpm_free_colors;
  5522   attrs.valuemask |= XpmAllocColor | XpmFreeColors | XpmColorClosure;
  5523   xpm_init_color_cache (f, &attrs);
  5524 #endif
  5525 
  5526   rc = XpmCreatePixmapFromData (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
  5527                                 (char **) bits, &bitmap, &mask, &attrs);
  5528   if (rc != XpmSuccess)
  5529     {
  5530       XpmFreeAttributes (&attrs);
  5531       return -1;
  5532     }
  5533 
  5534   id = image_allocate_bitmap_record (f);
  5535   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].pixmap = bitmap;
  5536   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].have_mask = true;
  5537   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].mask = mask;
  5538   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].file = NULL;
  5539   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].height = attrs.height;
  5540   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].width = attrs.width;
  5541   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].depth = attrs.depth;
  5542   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].refcount = 1;
  5543 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  5544   dpyinfo->bitmaps[id - 1].stipple = NULL;
  5545 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
  5546 
  5547 #ifdef ALLOC_XPM_COLORS
  5548   xpm_free_color_cache ();
  5549 #endif
  5550   XpmFreeAttributes (&attrs);
  5551   return id;
  5552 }
  5553 #endif /* defined (HAVE_XPM) && defined (HAVE_X_WINDOWS) */
  5554 
  5555 /* Load image IMG which will be displayed on frame F.  Value is
  5556    true if successful.  */
  5557 
  5558 #if defined HAVE_XPM && !defined USE_CAIRO
  5559 
  5560 static bool
  5561 xpm_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  5562 {
  5563   int rc;
  5564   XpmAttributes attrs;
  5565   Lisp_Object specified_file, color_symbols;
  5566   USE_SAFE_ALLOCA;
  5567 
  5568 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  5569   HDC hdc;
  5570   xpm_XImage * xpm_image = NULL, * xpm_mask = NULL;
  5571 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  5572 
  5573   /* Configure the XPM lib.  Use the visual of frame F.  Allocate
  5574      close colors.  Return colors allocated.  */
  5575   memset (&attrs, 0, sizeof attrs);
  5576 
  5577 #ifndef HAVE_NTGUI
  5578   attrs.visual = FRAME_X_VISUAL (f);
  5579   attrs.colormap = FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f);
  5580   attrs.depth = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->n_planes;
  5581   attrs.valuemask |= XpmVisual;
  5582   attrs.valuemask |= XpmColormap;
  5583   attrs.valuemask |= XpmDepth;
  5584 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  5585 
  5586 #ifdef ALLOC_XPM_COLORS
  5587   /* Allocate colors with our own functions which handle
  5588      failing color allocation more gracefully.  */
  5589   attrs.color_closure = f;
  5590   attrs.alloc_color = xpm_alloc_color;
  5591   attrs.free_colors = xpm_free_colors;
  5592   attrs.valuemask |= XpmAllocColor | XpmFreeColors | XpmColorClosure;
  5593 #else /* not ALLOC_XPM_COLORS */
  5594   /* Let the XPM lib allocate colors.  */
  5595   attrs.valuemask |= XpmReturnAllocPixels;
  5596 #ifdef XpmAllocCloseColors
  5597   attrs.alloc_close_colors = 1;
  5598   attrs.valuemask |= XpmAllocCloseColors;
  5599 #else /* not XpmAllocCloseColors */
  5600   attrs.closeness = 600;
  5601   attrs.valuemask |= XpmCloseness;
  5602 #endif /* not XpmAllocCloseColors */
  5603 #endif /* ALLOC_XPM_COLORS */
  5604 
  5605   /* If image specification contains symbolic color definitions, add
  5606      these to `attrs'.  */
  5607   color_symbols = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCcolor_symbols, NULL);
  5608   if (CONSP (color_symbols))
  5609     {
  5610       Lisp_Object tail;
  5611       XpmColorSymbol *xpm_syms;
  5612       ptrdiff_t i, size;
  5613 
  5614       attrs.valuemask |= XpmColorSymbols;
  5615 
  5616       /* Count number of symbols.  */
  5617       attrs.numsymbols = 0;
  5618       for (tail = color_symbols; CONSP (tail); tail = XCDR (tail))
  5619         ++attrs.numsymbols;
  5620 
  5621       /* Allocate an XpmColorSymbol array.  */
  5622       SAFE_NALLOCA (xpm_syms, 1, attrs.numsymbols);
  5623       size = attrs.numsymbols * sizeof *xpm_syms;
  5624       memset (xpm_syms, 0, size);
  5625       attrs.colorsymbols = xpm_syms;
  5626 
  5627       /* Fill the color symbol array.  */
  5628       for (tail = color_symbols, i = 0;
  5629            CONSP (tail);
  5630            ++i, tail = XCDR (tail))
  5631         {
  5632           Lisp_Object name;
  5633           Lisp_Object color;
  5634           char *empty_string = (char *) "";
  5635 
  5636           if (!CONSP (XCAR (tail)))
  5637             {
  5638               xpm_syms[i].name = empty_string;
  5639               xpm_syms[i].value = empty_string;
  5640               continue;
  5641             }
  5642           name = XCAR (XCAR (tail));
  5643           color = XCDR (XCAR (tail));
  5644           if (STRINGP (name))
  5645             SAFE_ALLOCA_STRING (xpm_syms[i].name, name);
  5646           else
  5647             xpm_syms[i].name = empty_string;
  5648           if (STRINGP (color))
  5649             SAFE_ALLOCA_STRING (xpm_syms[i].value, color);
  5650           else
  5651             xpm_syms[i].value = empty_string;
  5652         }
  5653     }
  5654 
  5655   /* Create a pixmap for the image, either from a file, or from a
  5656      string buffer containing data in the same format as an XPM file.  */
  5657 #ifdef ALLOC_XPM_COLORS
  5658   xpm_init_color_cache (f, &attrs);
  5659 #endif
  5660 
  5661   specified_file = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCfile, NULL);
  5662 
  5663 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  5664   {
  5665     HDC frame_dc = get_frame_dc (f);
  5666     hdc = CreateCompatibleDC (frame_dc);
  5667     release_frame_dc (f, frame_dc);
  5668   }
  5669 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  5670 
  5671   if (STRINGP (specified_file))
  5672     {
  5673       Lisp_Object file = image_find_image_file (specified_file);
  5674       if (!STRINGP (file))
  5675         {
  5676           image_error ("Cannot find image file `%s'", specified_file);
  5677 #ifdef ALLOC_XPM_COLORS
  5678           xpm_free_color_cache ();
  5679 #endif
  5680           SAFE_FREE ();
  5681           return 0;
  5682         }
  5683 
  5684       file = ENCODE_FILE (file);
  5685 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  5686 #ifdef WINDOWSNT
  5687       /* FILE is encoded in UTF-8, but image libraries on Windows
  5688          support neither UTF-8 nor UTF-16 encoded file names.  So we
  5689          need to re-encode it in ANSI.  */
  5690       file = ansi_encode_filename (file);
  5691 #endif
  5692       /* XpmReadFileToPixmap is not available in the Windows port of
  5693          libxpm.  But XpmReadFileToImage almost does what we want.  */
  5694       rc = XpmReadFileToImage (&hdc, SSDATA (file),
  5695                                &xpm_image, &xpm_mask,
  5696                                &attrs);
  5697 #else
  5698       rc = XpmReadFileToImage (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), SSDATA (file),
  5699                                &img->ximg, &img->mask_img,
  5700                                &attrs);
  5701 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  5702     }
  5703   else
  5704     {
  5705       Lisp_Object buffer = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL);
  5706       if (!STRINGP (buffer))
  5707         {
  5708           image_error ("Invalid image data `%s'", buffer);
  5709 #ifdef ALLOC_XPM_COLORS
  5710           xpm_free_color_cache ();
  5711 #endif
  5712           SAFE_FREE ();
  5713           return 0;
  5714         }
  5715 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  5716       /* XpmCreatePixmapFromBuffer is not available in the Windows port
  5717          of libxpm.  But XpmCreateImageFromBuffer almost does what we want.  */
  5718       rc = XpmCreateImageFromBuffer (&hdc, SSDATA (buffer),
  5719                                      &xpm_image, &xpm_mask,
  5720                                      &attrs);
  5721 #else
  5722       rc = XpmCreateImageFromBuffer (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), SSDATA (buffer),
  5723                                      &img->ximg, &img->mask_img,
  5724                                      &attrs);
  5725 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  5726     }
  5727 
  5728 #ifdef HAVE_X_WINDOWS
  5729   if (rc == XpmSuccess)
  5730     {
  5731       img->pixmap = XCreatePixmap (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
  5732                                    img->ximg->width, img->ximg->height,
  5733                                    img->ximg->depth);
  5734       if (img->pixmap == NO_PIXMAP)
  5735         {
  5736           image_clear_image (f, img);
  5737           rc = XpmNoMemory;
  5738         }
  5739       else
  5740         {
  5741 # if !defined USE_CAIRO && defined HAVE_XRENDER
  5742           img->picture = x_create_xrender_picture (f, img->pixmap,
  5743                                                    img->ximg->depth);
  5744 # endif
  5745           if (img->mask_img)
  5746             {
  5747               img->mask = XCreatePixmap (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
  5748                                          img->mask_img->width,
  5749                                          img->mask_img->height,
  5750                                          img->mask_img->depth);
  5751               if (img->mask == NO_PIXMAP)
  5752                 {
  5753                   image_clear_image (f, img);
  5754                   rc = XpmNoMemory;
  5755                 }
  5756 # if !defined USE_CAIRO && defined HAVE_XRENDER
  5757               else
  5758                 img->mask_picture = x_create_xrender_picture
  5759                   (f, img->mask, img->mask_img->depth);
  5760 # endif
  5761             }
  5762         }
  5763     }
  5764 #endif
  5765 
  5766   if (rc == XpmSuccess)
  5767     {
  5768 #if defined (COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT) && defined (ALLOC_XPM_COLORS)
  5769       img->colors = colors_in_color_table (&img->ncolors);
  5770 #else /* not ALLOC_XPM_COLORS */
  5771       int i;
  5772 
  5773 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  5774       /* W32 XPM uses XImage to wrap what W32 Emacs calls a Pixmap,
  5775          plus some duplicate attributes.  */
  5776       if (xpm_image && xpm_image->bitmap)
  5777         {
  5778           img->pixmap = xpm_image->bitmap;
  5779           /* XImageFree in libXpm frees XImage struct without destroying
  5780              the bitmap, which is what we want.  */
  5781           XImageFree (xpm_image);
  5782         }
  5783       if (xpm_mask && xpm_mask->bitmap)
  5784         {
  5785           /* The mask appears to be inverted compared with what we expect.
  5786              TODO: invert our expectations.  See other places where we
  5787              have to invert bits because our idea of masks is backwards.  */
  5788           HGDIOBJ old_obj;
  5789           old_obj = SelectObject (hdc, xpm_mask->bitmap);
  5790 
  5791           PatBlt (hdc, 0, 0, xpm_mask->width, xpm_mask->height, DSTINVERT);
  5792           SelectObject (hdc, old_obj);
  5793 
  5794           img->mask = xpm_mask->bitmap;
  5795           XImageFree (xpm_mask);
  5796           DeleteDC (hdc);
  5797         }
  5798 
  5799       DeleteDC (hdc);
  5800 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  5801 
  5802       /* Remember allocated colors.  */
  5803       img->colors = xnmalloc (attrs.nalloc_pixels, sizeof *img->colors);
  5804       img->ncolors = attrs.nalloc_pixels;
  5805       for (i = 0; i < attrs.nalloc_pixels; ++i)
  5806         {
  5807           img->colors[i] = attrs.alloc_pixels[i];
  5808 #ifdef DEBUG_X_COLORS
  5809           register_color (img->colors[i]);
  5810 #endif
  5811         }
  5812 #endif /* not ALLOC_XPM_COLORS */
  5813 
  5814       img->width = attrs.width;
  5815       img->height = attrs.height;
  5816       eassert (img->width > 0 && img->height > 0);
  5817 
  5818       /* The call to XpmFreeAttributes below frees attrs.alloc_pixels.  */
  5819       XpmFreeAttributes (&attrs);
  5820 
  5821 #ifdef HAVE_X_WINDOWS
  5822       /* Maybe fill in the background field while we have ximg handy.  */
  5823       IMAGE_BACKGROUND (img, f, img->ximg);
  5824       if (img->mask_img)
  5825         /* Fill in the background_transparent field while we have the
  5826            mask handy.  */
  5827         image_background_transparent (img, f, img->mask_img);
  5828 #endif
  5829     }
  5830   else
  5831     {
  5832 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  5833       DeleteDC (hdc);
  5834 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  5835 
  5836       switch (rc)
  5837         {
  5838         case XpmOpenFailed:
  5839           image_error ("Error opening XPM file (%s)", img->spec);
  5840           break;
  5841 
  5842         case XpmFileInvalid:
  5843           image_error ("Invalid XPM file (%s)", img->spec);
  5844           break;
  5845 
  5846         case XpmNoMemory:
  5847           image_error ("Out of memory (%s)", img->spec);
  5848           break;
  5849 
  5850         case XpmColorFailed:
  5851           image_error ("Color allocation error (%s)", img->spec);
  5852           break;
  5853 
  5854         default:
  5855           image_error ("Unknown error (%s)", img->spec);
  5856           break;
  5857         }
  5858     }
  5859 
  5860 #ifdef ALLOC_XPM_COLORS
  5861   xpm_free_color_cache ();
  5862 #endif
  5863   SAFE_FREE ();
  5864   return rc == XpmSuccess;
  5865 }
  5866 
  5867 #endif /* HAVE_XPM && !USE_CAIRO */
  5868 
  5869 #if (defined USE_CAIRO && defined HAVE_XPM)     \
  5870   || (defined HAVE_NS && !defined HAVE_XPM)     \
  5871   || (defined HAVE_HAIKU && !defined HAVE_XPM)  \
  5872   || (defined HAVE_PGTK && !defined HAVE_XPM)   \
  5873   || (defined HAVE_ANDROID && !defined HAVE_XPM)
  5874 
  5875 /* XPM support functions for NS, Haiku and Android where libxpm is not
  5876    available, and for Cairo.  Only XPM version 3 (without any
  5877    extensions) is supported.  */
  5878 
  5879 static void xpm_put_color_table_v (Lisp_Object, const char *,
  5880                                    int, Lisp_Object);
  5881 static Lisp_Object xpm_get_color_table_v (Lisp_Object, const char *, int);
  5882 static void xpm_put_color_table_h (Lisp_Object, const char *,
  5883                                    int, Lisp_Object);
  5884 static Lisp_Object xpm_get_color_table_h (Lisp_Object, const char *, int);
  5885 
  5886 /* Tokens returned from xpm_scan.  */
  5887 
  5888 enum xpm_token
  5889 {
  5890   XPM_TK_IDENT = 256,
  5891   XPM_TK_STRING,
  5892   XPM_TK_EOF
  5893 };
  5894 
  5895 /* Scan an XPM data and return a character (< 256) or a token defined
  5896    by enum xpm_token above.  *S and END are the start (inclusive) and
  5897    the end (exclusive) addresses of the data, respectively.  Advance
  5898    *S while scanning.  If token is either XPM_TK_IDENT or
  5899    XPM_TK_STRING, *BEG and *LEN are set to the start address and the
  5900    length of the corresponding token, respectively.  */
  5901 
  5902 static int
  5903 xpm_scan (const char **s, const char *end, const char **beg, ptrdiff_t *len)
  5904 {
  5905   unsigned char c;
  5906 
  5907   while (*s < end)
  5908     {
  5909       /* Skip white-space.  */
  5910       do
  5911         c = *(*s)++;
  5912       while (c_isspace (c) && *s < end);
  5913 
  5914       /* gnus-pointer.xpm uses '-' in its identifier.
  5915          sb-dir-plus.xpm uses '+' in its identifier.  */
  5916       if (c_isalpha (c) || c == '_' || c == '-' || c == '+')
  5917         {
  5918           *beg = *s - 1;
  5919           while (*s < end
  5920                  && (c = **s, c_isalnum (c)
  5921                      || c == '_' || c == '-' || c == '+'))
  5922               ++*s;
  5923           *len = *s - *beg;
  5924           return XPM_TK_IDENT;
  5925         }
  5926       else if (c == '"')
  5927         {
  5928           *beg = *s;
  5929           while (*s < end && **s != '"')
  5930             ++*s;
  5931           *len = *s - *beg;
  5932           if (*s < end)
  5933             ++*s;
  5934           return XPM_TK_STRING;
  5935         }
  5936       else if (c == '/')
  5937         {
  5938           if (*s < end && **s == '*')
  5939             {
  5940               /* C-style comment.  */
  5941               ++*s;
  5942               do
  5943                 {
  5944                   while (*s < end && *(*s)++ != '*')
  5945                     ;
  5946                 }
  5947               while (*s < end && **s != '/');
  5948               if (*s < end)
  5949                 ++*s;
  5950             }
  5951           else
  5952             return c;
  5953         }
  5954       else
  5955         return c;
  5956     }
  5957 
  5958   return XPM_TK_EOF;
  5959 }
  5960 
  5961 /* Functions for color table lookup in XPM data.  A key is a string
  5962    specifying the color of each pixel in XPM data.  A value is either
  5963    an integer that specifies a pixel color, Qt that specifies
  5964    transparency, or Qnil for the unspecified color.  If the length of
  5965    the key string is one, a vector is used as a table.  Otherwise, a
  5966    hash table is used.  */
  5967 
  5968 static Lisp_Object
  5969 xpm_make_color_table_v (void (**put_func) (Lisp_Object, const char *, int,
  5970                                            Lisp_Object),
  5971                         Lisp_Object (**get_func) (Lisp_Object, const char *,
  5972                                                   int))
  5973 {
  5974   *put_func = xpm_put_color_table_v;
  5975   *get_func = xpm_get_color_table_v;
  5976   return make_nil_vector (256);
  5977 }
  5978 
  5979 static void
  5980 xpm_put_color_table_v (Lisp_Object color_table,
  5981                        const char *chars_start,
  5982                        int chars_len,
  5983                        Lisp_Object color)
  5984 {
  5985   unsigned char uc = *chars_start;
  5986   ASET (color_table, uc, color);
  5987 }
  5988 
  5989 static Lisp_Object
  5990 xpm_get_color_table_v (Lisp_Object color_table,
  5991                        const char *chars_start,
  5992                        int chars_len)
  5993 {
  5994   unsigned char uc = *chars_start;
  5995   return AREF (color_table, uc);
  5996 }
  5997 
  5998 static Lisp_Object
  5999 xpm_make_color_table_h (void (**put_func) (Lisp_Object, const char *, int,
  6000                                            Lisp_Object),
  6001                         Lisp_Object (**get_func) (Lisp_Object, const char *,
  6002                                                   int))
  6003 {
  6004   *put_func = xpm_put_color_table_h;
  6005   *get_func = xpm_get_color_table_h;
  6006   return make_hash_table (hashtest_equal, DEFAULT_HASH_SIZE,
  6007                           DEFAULT_REHASH_SIZE, DEFAULT_REHASH_THRESHOLD,
  6008                           Qnil, false);
  6009 }
  6010 
  6011 static void
  6012 xpm_put_color_table_h (Lisp_Object color_table,
  6013                        const char *chars_start,
  6014                        int chars_len,
  6015                        Lisp_Object color)
  6016 {
  6017   struct Lisp_Hash_Table *table = XHASH_TABLE (color_table);
  6018   Lisp_Object chars = make_unibyte_string (chars_start, chars_len), hash_code;
  6019 
  6020   hash_lookup (table, chars, &hash_code);
  6021   hash_put (table, chars, color, hash_code);
  6022 }
  6023 
  6024 static Lisp_Object
  6025 xpm_get_color_table_h (Lisp_Object color_table,
  6026                        const char *chars_start,
  6027                        int chars_len)
  6028 {
  6029   struct Lisp_Hash_Table *table = XHASH_TABLE (color_table);
  6030   ptrdiff_t i =
  6031     hash_lookup (table, make_unibyte_string (chars_start, chars_len), NULL);
  6032 
  6033   return i >= 0 ? HASH_VALUE (table, i) : Qnil;
  6034 }
  6035 
  6036 enum xpm_color_key {
  6037   XPM_COLOR_KEY_S,
  6038   XPM_COLOR_KEY_M,
  6039   XPM_COLOR_KEY_G4,
  6040   XPM_COLOR_KEY_G,
  6041   XPM_COLOR_KEY_C
  6042 };
  6043 
  6044 static const char xpm_color_key_strings[][4] = {"s", "m", "g4", "g", "c"};
  6045 
  6046 static int
  6047 xpm_str_to_color_key (const char *s)
  6048 {
  6049   int i;
  6050 
  6051   for (i = 0; i < ARRAYELTS (xpm_color_key_strings); i++)
  6052     if (strcmp (xpm_color_key_strings[i], s) == 0)
  6053       return i;
  6054   return -1;
  6055 }
  6056 
  6057 static bool
  6058 xpm_load_image (struct frame *f,
  6059                 struct image *img,
  6060                 const char *contents,
  6061                 const char *end)
  6062 {
  6063   const char *s = contents, *beg, *str;
  6064   char buffer[BUFSIZ];
  6065   int width, height, x, y;
  6066   int num_colors, chars_per_pixel;
  6067   ptrdiff_t len;
  6068   int LA1;
  6069   void (*put_color_table) (Lisp_Object, const char *, int, Lisp_Object);
  6070   Lisp_Object (*get_color_table) (Lisp_Object, const char *, int);
  6071   Lisp_Object frame, color_symbols, color_table;
  6072   int best_key;
  6073 #if !defined (HAVE_NS)
  6074   bool have_mask = false;
  6075 #endif
  6076   Emacs_Pix_Container ximg = NULL, mask_img = NULL;
  6077 
  6078 #define match() \
  6079      LA1 = xpm_scan (&s, end, &beg, &len)
  6080 
  6081 #define expect(TOKEN)           \
  6082   do                            \
  6083     {                           \
  6084       if (LA1 != (TOKEN))       \
  6085         goto failure;           \
  6086       match ();                 \
  6087     }                           \
  6088   while (0)
  6089 
  6090 #define expect_ident(IDENT)                                     \
  6091      if (LA1 == XPM_TK_IDENT \
  6092          && strlen ((IDENT)) == len && memcmp ((IDENT), beg, len) == 0) \
  6093        match ();                                                \
  6094      else                                                       \
  6095        goto failure
  6096 
  6097   if (!(end - s >= 9 && memcmp (s, "/* XPM */", 9) == 0))
  6098     goto failure;
  6099   s += 9;
  6100   match ();
  6101   expect_ident ("static");
  6102   expect_ident ("char");
  6103   expect ('*');
  6104   expect (XPM_TK_IDENT);
  6105   expect ('[');
  6106   expect (']');
  6107   expect ('=');
  6108   expect ('{');
  6109   expect (XPM_TK_STRING);
  6110   if (len >= BUFSIZ)
  6111     goto failure;
  6112   memcpy (buffer, beg, len);
  6113   buffer[len] = '\0';
  6114   if (sscanf (buffer, "%d %d %d %d", &width, &height,
  6115               &num_colors, &chars_per_pixel) != 4
  6116       || width <= 0 || height <= 0
  6117       || num_colors <= 0 || chars_per_pixel <= 0)
  6118     goto failure;
  6119 
  6120   if (!check_image_size (f, width, height))
  6121     {
  6122       image_size_error ();
  6123       goto failure;
  6124     }
  6125 
  6126   if (!image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, 0, &ximg, 0)
  6127 #ifndef HAVE_NS
  6128       || !image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, 1,
  6129                                            &mask_img, 1)
  6130 #endif
  6131       )
  6132     {
  6133       image_error ("Image too large");
  6134       goto failure;
  6135     }
  6136 
  6137   expect (',');
  6138 
  6139   XSETFRAME (frame, f);
  6140   if (!NILP (Fxw_display_color_p (frame)))
  6141     best_key = XPM_COLOR_KEY_C;
  6142   else if (!NILP (Fx_display_grayscale_p (frame)))
  6143     best_key = (XFIXNAT (Fx_display_planes (frame)) > 2
  6144                 ? XPM_COLOR_KEY_G : XPM_COLOR_KEY_G4);
  6145   else
  6146     best_key = XPM_COLOR_KEY_M;
  6147 
  6148   color_symbols = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCcolor_symbols, NULL);
  6149   if (chars_per_pixel == 1)
  6150     color_table = xpm_make_color_table_v (&put_color_table,
  6151                                           &get_color_table);
  6152   else
  6153     color_table = xpm_make_color_table_h (&put_color_table,
  6154                                           &get_color_table);
  6155 
  6156   while (num_colors-- > 0)
  6157     {
  6158       char *color, *max_color = NULL;
  6159       int key, next_key, max_key = 0;
  6160       Lisp_Object symbol_color = Qnil, color_val;
  6161       Emacs_Color cdef;
  6162 
  6163       expect (XPM_TK_STRING);
  6164       if (len <= chars_per_pixel || len >= BUFSIZ + chars_per_pixel)
  6165         goto failure;
  6166       memcpy (buffer, beg + chars_per_pixel, len - chars_per_pixel);
  6167       buffer[len - chars_per_pixel] = '\0';
  6168 
  6169       str = strtok (buffer, " \t");
  6170       if (str == NULL)
  6171         goto failure;
  6172       key = xpm_str_to_color_key (str);
  6173       if (key < 0)
  6174         goto failure;
  6175       do
  6176         {
  6177           color = strtok (NULL, " \t");
  6178           if (color == NULL)
  6179             goto failure;
  6180 
  6181           while ((str = strtok (NULL, " \t")) != NULL)
  6182             {
  6183               next_key = xpm_str_to_color_key (str);
  6184               if (next_key >= 0)
  6185                 break;
  6186               color[strlen (color)] = ' ';
  6187             }
  6188 
  6189           if (key == XPM_COLOR_KEY_S)
  6190             {
  6191               if (NILP (symbol_color))
  6192                 symbol_color = build_string (color);
  6193             }
  6194           else if (max_key < key && key <= best_key)
  6195             {
  6196               max_key = key;
  6197               max_color = color;
  6198             }
  6199           key = next_key;
  6200         }
  6201       while (str);
  6202 
  6203       color_val = Qnil;
  6204       if (!NILP (color_symbols) && !NILP (symbol_color))
  6205         {
  6206           Lisp_Object specified_color = Fassoc (symbol_color, color_symbols, Qnil);
  6207 
  6208           if (CONSP (specified_color) && STRINGP (XCDR (specified_color)))
  6209             {
  6210               if (xstrcasecmp (SSDATA (XCDR (specified_color)), "None") == 0)
  6211                 color_val = Qt;
  6212               else if (FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->defined_color_hook
  6213                        (f, SSDATA (XCDR (specified_color)), &cdef, false, false))
  6214                 color_val
  6215                   = make_fixnum (lookup_rgb_color (f, cdef.red, cdef.green,
  6216                                                    cdef.blue));
  6217             }
  6218         }
  6219       if (NILP (color_val) && max_color)
  6220         {
  6221           if (xstrcasecmp (max_color, "None") == 0)
  6222             color_val = Qt;
  6223           else if (FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->defined_color_hook
  6224                    (f, max_color, &cdef, false, false))
  6225             color_val = make_fixnum (lookup_rgb_color (f, cdef.red, cdef.green,
  6226                                                        cdef.blue));
  6227         }
  6228       if (!NILP (color_val))
  6229         (*put_color_table) (color_table, beg, chars_per_pixel, color_val);
  6230 
  6231       expect (',');
  6232     }
  6233 
  6234   unsigned long frame_fg = FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f);
  6235 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  6236   {
  6237     Emacs_Color color = {.pixel = frame_fg};
  6238     FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->query_colors (f, &color, 1);
  6239     frame_fg = lookup_rgb_color (f, color.red, color.green, color.blue);
  6240   }
  6241 #endif
  6242   for (y = 0; y < height; y++)
  6243     {
  6244       expect (XPM_TK_STRING);
  6245       str = beg;
  6246       if (len < width * chars_per_pixel)
  6247         goto failure;
  6248       for (x = 0; x < width; x++, str += chars_per_pixel)
  6249         {
  6250           Lisp_Object color_val =
  6251             (*get_color_table) (color_table, str, chars_per_pixel);
  6252 
  6253           PUT_PIXEL (ximg, x, y,
  6254                      FIXNUMP (color_val) ? XFIXNUM (color_val) : frame_fg);
  6255 #ifndef HAVE_NS
  6256           PUT_PIXEL (mask_img, x, y,
  6257                      (!EQ (color_val, Qt) ? PIX_MASK_DRAW
  6258                       : (have_mask = true, PIX_MASK_RETAIN)));
  6259 #else
  6260           if (EQ (color_val, Qt))
  6261             ns_set_alpha (ximg, x, y, 0);
  6262 #endif
  6263         }
  6264       if (y + 1 < height)
  6265         expect (',');
  6266     }
  6267 
  6268   img->width = width;
  6269   img->height = height;
  6270 
  6271   /* Maybe fill in the background field while we have ximg handy. */
  6272   if (NILP (image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL)))
  6273     IMAGE_BACKGROUND (img, f, ximg);
  6274 
  6275   image_put_x_image (f, img, ximg, 0);
  6276 #ifndef HAVE_NS
  6277   if (have_mask)
  6278     {
  6279       /* Fill in the background_transparent field while we have the
  6280          mask handy.  */
  6281       image_background_transparent (img, f, mask_img);
  6282 
  6283       image_put_x_image (f, img, mask_img, 1);
  6284     }
  6285   else
  6286     {
  6287       image_destroy_x_image (mask_img);
  6288       image_clear_image_1 (f, img, CLEAR_IMAGE_MASK);
  6289     }
  6290 #endif
  6291   return 1;
  6292 
  6293  failure:
  6294   image_error ("Invalid XPM3 file (%s)", img->spec);
  6295   image_destroy_x_image (ximg);
  6296   image_destroy_x_image (mask_img);
  6297   image_clear_image (f, img);
  6298   return 0;
  6299 
  6300 #undef match
  6301 #undef expect
  6302 #undef expect_ident
  6303 }
  6304 
  6305 static bool
  6306 xpm_load (struct frame *f,
  6307           struct image *img)
  6308 {
  6309   bool success_p = 0;
  6310   Lisp_Object file_name;
  6311 
  6312   /* If IMG->spec specifies a file name, create a non-file spec from it.  */
  6313   file_name = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCfile, NULL);
  6314   if (STRINGP (file_name))
  6315     {
  6316       image_fd fd;
  6317       Lisp_Object file = image_find_image_fd (file_name, &fd);
  6318       if (!STRINGP (file))
  6319         {
  6320           image_error ("Cannot find image file `%s'", file_name);
  6321           return 0;
  6322         }
  6323 
  6324       ptrdiff_t size;
  6325       char *contents = slurp_file (fd, &size);
  6326       if (contents == NULL)
  6327         {
  6328           image_error ("Error loading XPM image `%s'", file);
  6329           return 0;
  6330         }
  6331 
  6332       success_p = xpm_load_image (f, img, contents, contents + size);
  6333       xfree (contents);
  6334     }
  6335   else
  6336     {
  6337       Lisp_Object data;
  6338 
  6339       data = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL);
  6340       if (!STRINGP (data))
  6341         {
  6342           image_error ("Invalid image data `%s'", data);
  6343           return 0;
  6344         }
  6345       success_p = xpm_load_image (f, img, SSDATA (data),
  6346                                   SSDATA (data) + SBYTES (data));
  6347     }
  6348 
  6349   return success_p;
  6350 }
  6351 
  6352 #endif /* HAVE_NS && !HAVE_XPM */
  6353 
  6354 
  6355 
  6356 /***********************************************************************
  6357                              Color table
  6358  ***********************************************************************/
  6359 
  6360 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
  6361 
  6362 /* An entry in the color table mapping an RGB color to a pixel color.  */
  6363 
  6364 struct ct_color
  6365 {
  6366   int r, g, b;
  6367   unsigned long pixel;
  6368 
  6369   /* Next in color table collision list.  */
  6370   struct ct_color *next;
  6371 };
  6372 
  6373 /* The bucket vector size to use.  Must be prime.  */
  6374 
  6375 #define CT_SIZE 101
  6376 
  6377 /* Value is a hash of the RGB color given by R, G, and B.  */
  6378 
  6379 static unsigned
  6380 ct_hash_rgb (unsigned r, unsigned g, unsigned b)
  6381 {
  6382   return (r << 16) ^ (g << 8) ^ b;
  6383 }
  6384 
  6385 /* The color hash table.  */
  6386 
  6387 static struct ct_color **ct_table;
  6388 
  6389 /* Number of entries in the color table.  */
  6390 
  6391 static int ct_colors_allocated;
  6392 enum
  6393 {
  6394   ct_colors_allocated_max =
  6395     min (INT_MAX,
  6396          min (PTRDIFF_MAX, SIZE_MAX) / sizeof (unsigned long))
  6397 };
  6398 
  6399 /* Initialize the color table.  */
  6400 
  6401 static void
  6402 init_color_table (void)
  6403 {
  6404   int size = CT_SIZE * sizeof (*ct_table);
  6405   ct_table = xzalloc (size);
  6406   ct_colors_allocated = 0;
  6407 }
  6408 
  6409 
  6410 /* Free memory associated with the color table.  */
  6411 
  6412 static void
  6413 free_color_table (void)
  6414 {
  6415   int i;
  6416   struct ct_color *p, *next;
  6417 
  6418   for (i = 0; i < CT_SIZE; ++i)
  6419     for (p = ct_table[i]; p; p = next)
  6420       {
  6421         next = p->next;
  6422         xfree (p);
  6423       }
  6424 
  6425   xfree (ct_table);
  6426   ct_table = NULL;
  6427 }
  6428 
  6429 
  6430 /* Value is a pixel color for RGB color R, G, B on frame F.  If an
  6431    entry for that color already is in the color table, return the
  6432    pixel color of that entry.  Otherwise, allocate a new color for R,
  6433    G, B, and make an entry in the color table.  */
  6434 
  6435 static unsigned long
  6436 lookup_rgb_color (struct frame *f, int r, int g, int b)
  6437 {
  6438   unsigned hash = ct_hash_rgb (r, g, b);
  6439   int i = hash % CT_SIZE;
  6440   struct ct_color *p;
  6441   Display_Info *dpyinfo;
  6442 
  6443   /* Handle TrueColor visuals specially, which improves performance by
  6444      two orders of magnitude.  Freeing colors on TrueColor visuals is
  6445      a nop, and pixel colors specify RGB values directly.  See also
  6446      the Xlib spec, chapter 3.1.  */
  6447   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  6448   if (dpyinfo->red_bits > 0)
  6449     {
  6450       /* Apply gamma-correction like normal color allocation does.  */
  6451       if (f->gamma)
  6452         {
  6453           XColor color;
  6454           color.red = r, color.green = g, color.blue = b;
  6455           gamma_correct (f, &color);
  6456           r = color.red, g = color.green, b = color.blue;
  6457         }
  6458 
  6459       return x_make_truecolor_pixel (dpyinfo, r, g, b);
  6460     }
  6461 
  6462   for (p = ct_table[i]; p; p = p->next)
  6463     if (p->r == r && p->g == g && p->b == b)
  6464       break;
  6465 
  6466   if (p == NULL)
  6467     {
  6468 
  6469 #ifdef HAVE_X_WINDOWS
  6470       XColor color;
  6471       Colormap cmap;
  6472       bool rc;
  6473 #else
  6474       COLORREF color;
  6475 #endif
  6476 
  6477       if (ct_colors_allocated_max <= ct_colors_allocated)
  6478         return FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f);
  6479 
  6480 #ifdef HAVE_X_WINDOWS
  6481       color.red = r;
  6482       color.green = g;
  6483       color.blue = b;
  6484 
  6485       cmap = FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f);
  6486       rc = x_alloc_nearest_color (f, cmap, &color);
  6487       if (rc)
  6488         {
  6489           ++ct_colors_allocated;
  6490           p = xmalloc (sizeof *p);
  6491           p->r = r;
  6492           p->g = g;
  6493           p->b = b;
  6494           p->pixel = color.pixel;
  6495           p->next = ct_table[i];
  6496           ct_table[i] = p;
  6497         }
  6498       else
  6499         return FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f);
  6500 
  6501 #else
  6502 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  6503       color = PALETTERGB (r, g, b);
  6504 #else
  6505       color = RGB_TO_ULONG (r, g, b);
  6506 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  6507       ++ct_colors_allocated;
  6508       p = xmalloc (sizeof *p);
  6509       p->r = r;
  6510       p->g = g;
  6511       p->b = b;
  6512       p->pixel = color;
  6513       p->next = ct_table[i];
  6514       ct_table[i] = p;
  6515 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS */
  6516 
  6517     }
  6518 
  6519   return p->pixel;
  6520 }
  6521 
  6522 
  6523 /* Look up pixel color PIXEL which is used on frame F in the color
  6524    table.  If not already present, allocate it.  Value is PIXEL.  */
  6525 
  6526 static unsigned long
  6527 lookup_pixel_color (struct frame *f, unsigned long pixel)
  6528 {
  6529   int i = pixel % CT_SIZE;
  6530   struct ct_color *p;
  6531 
  6532   for (p = ct_table[i]; p; p = p->next)
  6533     if (p->pixel == pixel)
  6534       break;
  6535 
  6536   if (p == NULL)
  6537     {
  6538       XColor color;
  6539       Colormap cmap;
  6540       bool rc;
  6541 
  6542       if (ct_colors_allocated >= ct_colors_allocated_max)
  6543         return FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f);
  6544 
  6545 #ifdef HAVE_X_WINDOWS
  6546       cmap = FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f);
  6547       color.pixel = pixel;
  6548       x_query_colors (f, &color, 1);
  6549       rc = x_alloc_nearest_color (f, cmap, &color);
  6550 #else
  6551       block_input ();
  6552       cmap = DefaultColormapOfScreen (FRAME_X_SCREEN (f));
  6553       color.pixel = pixel;
  6554       XQueryColor (NULL, cmap, &color);
  6555       rc = x_alloc_nearest_color (f, cmap, &color);
  6556       unblock_input ();
  6557 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS */
  6558 
  6559       if (rc)
  6560         {
  6561           ++ct_colors_allocated;
  6562 
  6563           p = xmalloc (sizeof *p);
  6564           p->r = color.red;
  6565           p->g = color.green;
  6566           p->b = color.blue;
  6567           p->pixel = pixel;
  6568           p->next = ct_table[i];
  6569           ct_table[i] = p;
  6570         }
  6571       else
  6572         return FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f);
  6573     }
  6574   return p->pixel;
  6575 }
  6576 
  6577 
  6578 /* Value is a vector of all pixel colors contained in the color table,
  6579    allocated via xmalloc.  Set *N to the number of colors.  */
  6580 
  6581 static unsigned long *
  6582 colors_in_color_table (int *n)
  6583 {
  6584   int i, j;
  6585   struct ct_color *p;
  6586   unsigned long *colors;
  6587 
  6588   if (ct_colors_allocated == 0)
  6589     {
  6590       *n = 0;
  6591       colors = NULL;
  6592     }
  6593   else
  6594     {
  6595       colors = xmalloc (ct_colors_allocated * sizeof *colors);
  6596       *n = ct_colors_allocated;
  6597 
  6598       for (i = j = 0; i < CT_SIZE; ++i)
  6599         for (p = ct_table[i]; p; p = p->next)
  6600           colors[j++] = p->pixel;
  6601     }
  6602 
  6603   return colors;
  6604 }
  6605 
  6606 #else /* COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT */
  6607 
  6608 static unsigned long
  6609 lookup_rgb_color (struct frame *f, int r, int g, int b)
  6610 {
  6611 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  6612   return PALETTERGB (r >> 8, g >> 8, b >> 8);
  6613 #elif defined USE_CAIRO || defined HAVE_NS || defined HAVE_HAIKU        \
  6614   || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  6615   return RGB_TO_ULONG (r >> 8, g >> 8, b >> 8);
  6616 #else
  6617   xsignal1 (Qfile_error,
  6618             build_string ("This Emacs mishandles this image file type"));
  6619 #endif
  6620 }
  6621 
  6622 static void
  6623 init_color_table (void)
  6624 {
  6625 }
  6626 #endif /* COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT */
  6627 
  6628 
  6629 /***********************************************************************
  6630                               Algorithms
  6631  ***********************************************************************/
  6632 
  6633 /* Edge detection matrices for different edge-detection
  6634    strategies.  */
  6635 
  6636 static int emboss_matrix[9] = {
  6637    /* x - 1     x       x + 1  */
  6638         2,     -1,        0,            /* y - 1 */
  6639        -1,      0,        1,            /* y     */
  6640         0,      1,       -2             /* y + 1 */
  6641 };
  6642 
  6643 static int laplace_matrix[9] = {
  6644    /* x - 1     x       x + 1  */
  6645         1,      0,        0,            /* y - 1 */
  6646         0,      0,        0,            /* y     */
  6647         0,      0,       -1             /* y + 1 */
  6648 };
  6649 
  6650 /* Value is the intensity of the color whose red/green/blue values
  6651    are R, G, and B.  */
  6652 
  6653 #define COLOR_INTENSITY(R, G, B) ((2 * (R) + 3 * (G) + (B)) / 6)
  6654 
  6655 
  6656 /* On frame F, return an array of Emacs_Color structures describing image
  6657    IMG->pixmap.  Each Emacs_Color structure has its pixel color set.  RGB_P
  6658    means also fill the red/green/blue members of the Emacs_Color
  6659    structures.  Value is a pointer to the array of Emacs_Color structures,
  6660    allocated with xmalloc; it must be freed by the caller.  */
  6661 
  6662 static Emacs_Color *
  6663 image_to_emacs_colors (struct frame *f, struct image *img, bool rgb_p)
  6664 {
  6665   int x, y;
  6666   Emacs_Color *colors, *p;
  6667   Emacs_Pix_Context ximg;
  6668   ptrdiff_t nbytes;
  6669 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  6670   HGDIOBJ prev;
  6671 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  6672 
  6673   if (ckd_mul (&nbytes, sizeof *colors, img->width)
  6674       || ckd_mul (&nbytes, nbytes, img->height)
  6675       || SIZE_MAX < nbytes)
  6676     memory_full (SIZE_MAX);
  6677   colors = xmalloc (nbytes);
  6678 
  6679   /* Get the X image or create a memory device context for IMG. */
  6680   ximg = image_get_x_image_or_dc (f, img, 0, &prev);
  6681 
  6682   /* Fill the `pixel' members of the Emacs_Color array.  I wished there
  6683      were an easy and portable way to circumvent XGetPixel.  */
  6684   p = colors;
  6685   for (y = 0; y < img->height; ++y)
  6686     {
  6687 #if !defined USE_CAIRO && !defined HAVE_NS && !defined HAVE_HAIKU       \
  6688   && !defined HAVE_ANDROID
  6689       Emacs_Color *row = p;
  6690       for (x = 0; x < img->width; ++x, ++p)
  6691         p->pixel = GET_PIXEL (ximg, x, y);
  6692       if (rgb_p)
  6693         {
  6694           FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->query_colors (f, row, img->width);
  6695         }
  6696 #else  /* USE_CAIRO || HAVE_NS || HAVE_HAIKU || HAVE_ANDROID */
  6697       for (x = 0; x < img->width; ++x, ++p)
  6698         {
  6699           p->pixel = GET_PIXEL (ximg, x, y);
  6700           if (rgb_p)
  6701             {
  6702               p->red = RED16_FROM_ULONG (p->pixel);
  6703               p->green = GREEN16_FROM_ULONG (p->pixel);
  6704               p->blue = BLUE16_FROM_ULONG (p->pixel);
  6705             }
  6706         }
  6707 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO || HAVE_NS || HAVE_ANDROID */
  6708     }
  6709 
  6710   image_unget_x_image_or_dc (img, 0, ximg, prev);
  6711 
  6712   return colors;
  6713 }
  6714 
  6715 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  6716 
  6717 /* Put a pixel of COLOR at position X, Y in XIMG.  XIMG must have been
  6718    created with CreateDIBSection, with the pointer to the bit values
  6719    stored in ximg->data.  */
  6720 
  6721 static void
  6722 XPutPixel (XImage *ximg, int x, int y, COLORREF color)
  6723 {
  6724   int width = ximg->info.bmiHeader.biWidth;
  6725   unsigned char * pixel;
  6726 
  6727   /* True color images.  */
  6728   if (ximg->info.bmiHeader.biBitCount == 24)
  6729     {
  6730       int rowbytes = width * 3;
  6731       /* Ensure scanlines are aligned on 4 byte boundaries.  */
  6732       if (rowbytes % 4)
  6733         rowbytes += 4 - (rowbytes % 4);
  6734 
  6735       pixel = ximg->data + y * rowbytes + x * 3;
  6736       /* Windows bitmaps are in BGR order.  */
  6737       *pixel = GetBValue (color);
  6738       *(pixel + 1) = GetGValue (color);
  6739       *(pixel + 2) = GetRValue (color);
  6740     }
  6741   /* Monochrome images.  */
  6742   else if (ximg->info.bmiHeader.biBitCount == 1)
  6743     {
  6744       int rowbytes = width / 8;
  6745       /* Ensure scanlines are aligned on 4 byte boundaries.  */
  6746       if (rowbytes % 4)
  6747         rowbytes += 4 - (rowbytes % 4);
  6748       pixel = ximg->data + y * rowbytes + x / 8;
  6749       /* Filter out palette info.  */
  6750       if (color & 0x00ffffff)
  6751         *pixel = *pixel | (1 << x % 8);
  6752       else
  6753         *pixel = *pixel & ~(1 << x % 8);
  6754     }
  6755   else
  6756     image_error ("XPutPixel: palette image not supported");
  6757 }
  6758 
  6759 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  6760 
  6761 /* Create IMG->pixmap from an array COLORS of Emacs_Color structures, whose
  6762    RGB members are set.  F is the frame on which this all happens.
  6763    COLORS will be freed; an existing IMG->pixmap will be freed, too.  */
  6764 
  6765 static void
  6766 image_from_emacs_colors (struct frame *f, struct image *img, Emacs_Color *colors)
  6767 {
  6768   int x, y;
  6769   Emacs_Pix_Container ximage;
  6770   Emacs_Color *p;
  6771 
  6772 #ifndef HAVE_ANDROID
  6773   ximage = NULL;
  6774 #else
  6775   ximage = 0;
  6776 #endif
  6777 
  6778   init_color_table ();
  6779
