  6780   image_clear_image_1 (f, img, CLEAR_IMAGE_PIXMAP | CLEAR_IMAGE_COLORS);
  6781   image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, img->width, img->height, 0,
  6782                                    &ximage, 0);
  6783   p = colors;
  6784   for (y = 0; y < img->height; ++y)
  6785     for (x = 0; x < img->width; ++x, ++p)
  6786       {
  6787         unsigned long pixel;
  6788         pixel = lookup_rgb_color (f, p->red, p->green, p->blue);
  6789         PUT_PIXEL (ximage, x, y, pixel);
  6790       }
  6791 
  6792   xfree (colors);
  6793 
  6794   image_put_x_image (f, img, ximage, false);
  6795 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
  6796   img->colors = colors_in_color_table (&img->ncolors);
  6797   free_color_table ();
  6798 #endif /* COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT */
  6799 }
  6800 
  6801 
  6802 /* On frame F, perform edge-detection on image IMG.
  6803 
  6804    MATRIX is a nine-element array specifying the transformation
  6805    matrix.  See emboss_matrix for an example.
  6806 
  6807    COLOR_ADJUST is a color adjustment added to each pixel of the
  6808    outgoing image.  */
  6809 
  6810 static void
  6811 image_detect_edges (struct frame *f, struct image *img,
  6812                     int *matrix, int color_adjust)
  6813 {
  6814   Emacs_Color *colors = image_to_emacs_colors (f, img, 1);
  6815   Emacs_Color *new, *p;
  6816   int x, y, i, sum;
  6817   ptrdiff_t nbytes;
  6818 
  6819   for (i = sum = 0; i < 9; ++i)
  6820     sum += eabs (matrix[i]);
  6821 
  6822 #define COLOR(A, X, Y) ((A) + (Y) * img->width + (X))
  6823 
  6824   if (ckd_mul (&nbytes, sizeof *new, img->width)
  6825       || ckd_mul (&nbytes, nbytes, img->height))
  6826     memory_full (SIZE_MAX);
  6827   new = xmalloc (nbytes);
  6828 
  6829   for (y = 0; y < img->height; ++y)
  6830     {
  6831       p = COLOR (new, 0, y);
  6832       p->red = p->green = p->blue = 0xffff/2;
  6833       p = COLOR (new, img->width - 1, y);
  6834       p->red = p->green = p->blue = 0xffff/2;
  6835     }
  6836 
  6837   for (x = 1; x < img->width - 1; ++x)
  6838     {
  6839       p = COLOR (new, x, 0);
  6840       p->red = p->green = p->blue = 0xffff/2;
  6841       p = COLOR (new, x, img->height - 1);
  6842       p->red = p->green = p->blue = 0xffff/2;
  6843     }
  6844 
  6845   for (y = 1; y < img->height - 1; ++y)
  6846     {
  6847       p = COLOR (new, 1, y);
  6848 
  6849       for (x = 1; x < img->width - 1; ++x, ++p)
  6850         {
  6851           int r, g, b, yy, xx;
  6852 
  6853           r = g = b = i = 0;
  6854           for (yy = y - 1; yy < y + 2; ++yy)
  6855             for (xx = x - 1; xx < x + 2; ++xx, ++i)
  6856               if (matrix[i])
  6857                 {
  6858                   Emacs_Color *t = COLOR (colors, xx, yy);
  6859                   r += matrix[i] * t->red;
  6860                   g += matrix[i] * t->green;
  6861                   b += matrix[i] * t->blue;
  6862                 }
  6863 
  6864           r = (r / sum + color_adjust) & 0xffff;
  6865           g = (g / sum + color_adjust) & 0xffff;
  6866           b = (b / sum + color_adjust) & 0xffff;
  6867           p->red = p->green = p->blue = COLOR_INTENSITY (r, g, b);
  6868         }
  6869     }
  6870 
  6871   xfree (colors);
  6872   image_from_emacs_colors (f, img, new);
  6873 
  6874 #undef COLOR
  6875 }
  6876 
  6877 
  6878 /* Perform the pre-defined `emboss' edge-detection on image IMG
  6879    on frame F.  */
  6880 
  6881 static void
  6882 image_emboss (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  6883 {
  6884   image_detect_edges (f, img, emboss_matrix, 0xffff / 2);
  6885 }
  6886 
  6887 
  6888 /* Transform image IMG which is used on frame F with a Laplace
  6889    edge-detection algorithm.  The result is an image that can be used
  6890    to draw disabled buttons, for example.  */
  6891 
  6892 static void
  6893 image_laplace (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  6894 {
  6895   image_detect_edges (f, img, laplace_matrix, 45000);
  6896 }
  6897 
  6898 
  6899 /* Perform edge-detection on image IMG on frame F, with specified
  6900    transformation matrix MATRIX and color-adjustment COLOR_ADJUST.
  6901 
  6902    MATRIX must be either
  6903 
  6904    - a list of at least 9 numbers in row-major form
  6905    - a vector of at least 9 numbers
  6906 
  6907    COLOR_ADJUST nil means use a default; otherwise it must be a
  6908    number.  */
  6909 
  6910 static void
  6911 image_edge_detection (struct frame *f, struct image *img,
  6912                       Lisp_Object matrix, Lisp_Object color_adjust)
  6913 {
  6914   int i = 0;
  6915   int trans[9];
  6916 
  6917   if (CONSP (matrix))
  6918     {
  6919       for (i = 0;
  6920            i < 9 && CONSP (matrix) && NUMBERP (XCAR (matrix));
  6921            ++i, matrix = XCDR (matrix))
  6922         trans[i] = XFLOATINT (XCAR (matrix));
  6923     }
  6924   else if (VECTORP (matrix) && ASIZE (matrix) >= 9)
  6925     {
  6926       for (i = 0; i < 9 && NUMBERP (AREF (matrix, i)); ++i)
  6927         trans[i] = XFLOATINT (AREF (matrix, i));
  6928     }
  6929 
  6930   if (NILP (color_adjust))
  6931     color_adjust = make_fixnum (0xffff / 2);
  6932 
  6933   if (i == 9 && NUMBERP (color_adjust))
  6934     image_detect_edges (f, img, trans, XFLOATINT (color_adjust));
  6935 }
  6936 
  6937 
  6938 #if defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS || defined USE_CAIRO || defined HAVE_HAIKU   \
  6939   || defined HAVE_ANDROID
  6940 
  6941 static void
  6942 image_pixmap_draw_cross (struct frame *f, Emacs_Pixmap pixmap,
  6943                          int x, int y, unsigned int width, unsigned int height,
  6944                          unsigned long color)
  6945 {
  6946 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  6947   cairo_surface_t *surface
  6948     = cairo_image_surface_create_for_data ((unsigned char *) pixmap->data,
  6949                                            (pixmap->bits_per_pixel == 32
  6950                                             ? CAIRO_FORMAT_RGB24
  6951                                             : CAIRO_FORMAT_A8),
  6952                                            pixmap->width, pixmap->height,
  6953                                            pixmap->bytes_per_line);
  6954   cairo_t *cr = cairo_create (surface);
  6955   cairo_surface_destroy (surface);
  6956   cairo_set_source_rgb (cr, RED_FROM_ULONG (color) / 255.0,
  6957                         GREEN_FROM_ULONG (color) / 255.0,
  6958                         BLUE_FROM_ULONG (color) / 255.0);
  6959   cairo_move_to (cr, x + 0.5, y + 0.5);
  6960   cairo_rel_line_to (cr, width - 1, height - 1);
  6961   cairo_rel_move_to (cr, 0, - (height - 1));
  6962   cairo_rel_line_to (cr, - (width - 1), height - 1);
  6963   cairo_set_line_width (cr, 1);
  6964   cairo_stroke (cr);
  6965   cairo_destroy (cr);
  6966 #elif HAVE_X_WINDOWS
  6967   Display *dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  6968   GC gc = XCreateGC (dpy, pixmap, 0, NULL);
  6969 
  6970   XSetForeground (dpy, gc, color);
  6971   XDrawLine (dpy, pixmap, gc, x, y, x + width - 1, y + height - 1);
  6972   XDrawLine (dpy, pixmap, gc, x, y + height - 1, x + width - 1, y);
  6973   XFreeGC (dpy, gc);
  6974 #elif HAVE_HAIKU
  6975   be_draw_cross_on_pixmap (pixmap, x, y, width, height, color);
  6976 #elif HAVE_ANDROID
  6977 #ifndef ANDROID_STUBIFY
  6978   struct android_gc *gc;
  6979 
  6980   gc = android_create_gc (0, NULL);
  6981   android_set_foreground (gc, color);
  6982   android_draw_line (pixmap, gc, x, y, x + width - 1, y + height - 1);
  6983   android_draw_line (pixmap, gc, x, y + height - 1, x + width - 1, y);
  6984   android_free_gc (gc);
  6985 #else
  6986   emacs_abort ();
  6987 #endif
  6988 #endif
  6989 }
  6990 
  6991 #endif  /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS || USE_CAIRO || HAVE_HAIKU */
  6992 
  6993 /* Transform image IMG on frame F so that it looks disabled.  */
  6994 
  6995 static void
  6996 image_disable_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  6997 {
  6998   Display_Info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  6999 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  7000   int n_planes = dpyinfo->n_planes * dpyinfo->n_cbits;
  7001 #else
  7002   int n_planes = dpyinfo->n_planes;
  7003 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  7004 
  7005   if (n_planes >= 2)
  7006     {
  7007       /* Color (or grayscale).  Convert to gray, and equalize.  Just
  7008          drawing such images with a stipple can look very odd, so
  7009          we're using this method instead.  */
  7010       Emacs_Color *colors = image_to_emacs_colors (f, img, 1);
  7011       Emacs_Color *p, *end;
  7012       const int h = 15000;
  7013       const int l = 30000;
  7014 
  7015       for (p = colors, end = colors + img->width * img->height;
  7016            p < end;
  7017            ++p)
  7018         {
  7019           int i = COLOR_INTENSITY (p->red, p->green, p->blue);
  7020           int i2 = (0xffff - h - l) * i / 0xffff + l;
  7021           p->red = p->green = p->blue = i2;
  7022         }
  7023 
  7024       image_from_emacs_colors (f, img, colors);
  7025     }
  7026 
  7027   /* Draw a cross over the disabled image, if we must or if we
  7028      should.  */
  7029   if (n_planes < 2 || cross_disabled_images)
  7030     {
  7031 #ifndef HAVE_NTGUI
  7032 #ifndef HAVE_NS  /* TODO: NS support, however this not needed for toolbars */
  7033 
  7034 #if !defined USE_CAIRO && !defined HAVE_HAIKU && !defined HAVE_ANDROID
  7035 #define CrossForeground(f) BLACK_PIX_DEFAULT (f)
  7036 #define MaskForeground(f)  WHITE_PIX_DEFAULT (f)
  7037 #else  /* USE_CAIRO || HAVE_HAIKU */
  7038 #define CrossForeground(f) 0
  7039 #define MaskForeground(f)  PIX_MASK_DRAW
  7040 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO || HAVE_HAIKU */
  7041 
  7042 #if !defined USE_CAIRO && !defined HAVE_HAIKU
  7043       image_sync_to_pixmaps (f, img);
  7044 #endif  /* !USE_CAIRO && !HAVE_HAIKU */
  7045       image_pixmap_draw_cross (f, img->pixmap, 0, 0, img->width, img->height,
  7046                                CrossForeground (f));
  7047       if (img->mask)
  7048         image_pixmap_draw_cross (f, img->mask, 0, 0, img->width, img->height,
  7049                                  MaskForeground (f));
  7050 #endif /* !HAVE_NS */
  7051 #else
  7052       HDC hdc, bmpdc;
  7053       HGDIOBJ prev;
  7054 
  7055       hdc = get_frame_dc (f);
  7056       bmpdc = CreateCompatibleDC (hdc);
  7057       release_frame_dc (f, hdc);
  7058 
  7059       prev = SelectObject (bmpdc, img->pixmap);
  7060 
  7061       SetTextColor (bmpdc, BLACK_PIX_DEFAULT (f));
  7062       MoveToEx (bmpdc, 0, 0, NULL);
  7063       LineTo (bmpdc, img->width - 1, img->height - 1);
  7064       MoveToEx (bmpdc, 0, img->height - 1, NULL);
  7065       LineTo (bmpdc, img->width - 1, 0);
  7066 
  7067       if (img->mask)
  7068         {
  7069           SelectObject (bmpdc, img->mask);
  7070           SetTextColor (bmpdc, WHITE_PIX_DEFAULT (f));
  7071           MoveToEx (bmpdc, 0, 0, NULL);
  7072           LineTo (bmpdc, img->width - 1, img->height - 1);
  7073           MoveToEx (bmpdc, 0, img->height - 1, NULL);
  7074           LineTo (bmpdc, img->width - 1, 0);
  7075         }
  7076       SelectObject (bmpdc, prev);
  7077       DeleteDC (bmpdc);
  7078 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  7079     }
  7080 }
  7081 
  7082 
  7083 /* Build a mask for image IMG which is used on frame F.  FILE is the
  7084    name of an image file, for error messages.  HOW determines how to
  7085    determine the background color of IMG.  If it is a list '(R G B)',
  7086    with R, G, and B being integers >= 0, take that as the color of the
  7087    background.  Otherwise, determine the background color of IMG
  7088    heuristically.  */
  7089 
  7090 static void
  7091 image_build_heuristic_mask (struct frame *f, struct image *img,
  7092                             Lisp_Object how)
  7093 {
  7094   Emacs_Pix_Context ximg;
  7095 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  7096   HGDIOBJ prev;
  7097   char *mask_img;
  7098   int row_width;
  7099 #elif !defined HAVE_NS
  7100   Emacs_Pix_Container mask_img;
  7101 #endif
  7102   int x, y;
  7103   bool use_img_background;
  7104   unsigned long bg = 0;
  7105 
  7106   if (img->mask)
  7107     image_clear_image_1 (f, img, CLEAR_IMAGE_MASK);
  7108 
  7109 #ifndef HAVE_NTGUI
  7110 #ifndef HAVE_NS
  7111   /* Create an image and pixmap serving as mask.  */
  7112   if (! image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, img->width, img->height, 1,
  7113                                          &mask_img, 1))
  7114     return;
  7115 #endif /* !HAVE_NS */
  7116 #else
  7117   /* Create the bit array serving as mask.  */
  7118   row_width = (img->width + 7) / 8;
  7119   mask_img = xzalloc (row_width * img->height);
  7120 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  7121 
  7122   /* Get the X image or create a memory device context for IMG.  */
  7123   ximg = image_get_x_image_or_dc (f, img, 0, &prev);
  7124 
  7125   /* Determine the background color of ximg.  If HOW is `(R G B)'
  7126      take that as color.  Otherwise, use the image's background color. */
  7127   use_img_background = 1;
  7128 
  7129   if (CONSP (how))
  7130     {
  7131       int rgb[3], i;
  7132 
  7133       for (i = 0; i < 3 && CONSP (how) && FIXNATP (XCAR (how)); ++i)
  7134         {
  7135           rgb[i] = XFIXNAT (XCAR (how)) & 0xffff;
  7136           how = XCDR (how);
  7137         }
  7138 
  7139       if (i == 3 && NILP (how))
  7140         {
  7141 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
  7142           char color_name[30];
  7143           sprintf (color_name, "#%04x%04x%04x",
  7144                    rgb[0] + 0u, rgb[1] + 0u, rgb[2] + 0u);
  7145           bg = (
  7146 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  7147                 0x00ffffff & /* Filter out palette info.  */
  7148 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  7149                 image_alloc_image_color (f, img, build_string (color_name), 0));
  7150 #else  /* USE_CAIRO */
  7151           bg = lookup_rgb_color (f, rgb[0], rgb[1], rgb[2]);
  7152 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
  7153           use_img_background = 0;
  7154         }
  7155     }
  7156 
  7157   if (use_img_background)
  7158     bg = four_corners_best (ximg, img->corners, img->width, img->height);
  7159 
  7160   /* Set all bits in mask_img to 1 whose color in ximg is different
  7161      from the background color bg.  */
  7162 #ifndef HAVE_NTGUI
  7163   for (y = 0; y < img->height; ++y)
  7164     for (x = 0; x < img->width; ++x)
  7165 #ifndef HAVE_NS
  7166       PUT_PIXEL (mask_img, x, y, (GET_PIXEL (ximg, x, y) != bg
  7167                                   ? PIX_MASK_DRAW : PIX_MASK_RETAIN));
  7168 #else
  7169       if (XGetPixel (ximg, x, y) == bg)
  7170         ns_set_alpha (ximg, x, y, 0);
  7171 #endif /* HAVE_NS */
  7172 #ifndef HAVE_NS
  7173   /* Fill in the background_transparent field while we have the mask handy. */
  7174   image_background_transparent (img, f, mask_img);
  7175 
  7176   /* Put mask_img into the image.  */
  7177   image_put_x_image (f, img, mask_img, 1);
  7178 #endif /* !HAVE_NS */
  7179 #else
  7180   for (y = 0; y < img->height; ++y)
  7181     for (x = 0; x < img->width; ++x)
  7182       {
  7183         COLORREF p = GetPixel (ximg, x, y);
  7184         if (p != bg)
  7185           mask_img[y * row_width + x / 8] |= 1 << (x % 8);
  7186       }
  7187 
  7188   /* Create the mask image.  */
  7189   img->mask = w32_create_pixmap_from_bitmap_data (img->width, img->height,
  7190                                                   mask_img);
  7191   /* Fill in the background_transparent field while we have the mask handy. */
  7192   SelectObject (ximg, img->mask);
  7193   image_background_transparent (img, f, ximg);
  7194 
  7195   /* Was: image_destroy_x_image ((XImagePtr )mask_img); which seems bogus ++kfs */
  7196   xfree (mask_img);
  7197 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  7198 
  7199   image_unget_x_image_or_dc (img, 0, ximg, prev);
  7200 }
  7201 
  7202 
  7203 /***********************************************************************
  7204                        PBM (mono, gray, color)
  7205  ***********************************************************************/
  7206 
  7207 /* Indices of image specification fields in gs_format, below.  */
  7208 
  7209 enum pbm_keyword_index
  7210 {
  7211   PBM_TYPE,
  7212   PBM_FILE,
  7213   PBM_DATA,
  7214   PBM_ASCENT,
  7215   PBM_MARGIN,
  7216   PBM_RELIEF,
  7217   PBM_ALGORITHM,
  7218   PBM_HEURISTIC_MASK,
  7219   PBM_MASK,
  7220   PBM_FOREGROUND,
  7221   PBM_BACKGROUND,
  7222   PBM_LAST
  7223 };
  7224 
  7225 /* Vector of image_keyword structures describing the format
  7226    of valid user-defined image specifications.  */
  7227 
  7228 static const struct image_keyword pbm_format[PBM_LAST] =
  7229 {
  7230   {":type",             IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     1},
  7231   {":file",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  7232   {":data",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  7233   {":ascent",           IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,                     0},
  7234   {":margin",           IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR, 0},
  7235   {":relief",           IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
  7236   {":conversion",       IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  7237   {":heuristic-mask",   IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  7238   {":mask",             IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  7239   {":foreground",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0},
  7240   {":background",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0}
  7241 };
  7242 
  7243 /* Return true if OBJECT is a valid PBM image specification.  */
  7244 
  7245 static bool
  7246 pbm_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
  7247 {
  7248   struct image_keyword fmt[PBM_LAST];
  7249 
  7250   memcpy (fmt, pbm_format, sizeof fmt);
  7251 
  7252   if (!parse_image_spec (object, fmt, PBM_LAST, Qpbm))
  7253     return 0;
  7254 
  7255   /* Must specify either :data or :file.  */
  7256   return fmt[PBM_DATA].count + fmt[PBM_FILE].count == 1;
  7257 }
  7258 
  7259 
  7260 /* Get next char skipping comments in Netpbm header.  Returns -1 at
  7261    end of input.  */
  7262 
  7263 static int
  7264 pbm_next_char (char **s, char *end)
  7265 {
  7266   while (*s < end)
  7267     {
  7268       unsigned char c = *(*s)++;
  7269       if (c != '#')
  7270         return c;
  7271       while (*s < end)
  7272         {
  7273           c = *(*s)++;
  7274           if (c == '\n' || c == '\r')
  7275             break;
  7276         }
  7277     }
  7278 
  7279   return -1;
  7280 }
  7281 
  7282 
  7283 /* Scan a decimal number from *S and return it.  Advance *S while
  7284    reading the number.  END is the end of the string.  Value is -1 at
  7285    end of input.  */
  7286 
  7287 static int
  7288 pbm_scan_number (char **s, char *end)
  7289 {
  7290   int c = 0, val = -1;
  7291 
  7292   /* Skip white-space.  */
  7293   while ((c = pbm_next_char (s, end)) != -1 && c_isspace (c))
  7294     ;
  7295 
  7296   if (c_isdigit (c))
  7297     {
  7298       /* Read decimal number.  */
  7299       val = c - '0';
  7300       while ((c = pbm_next_char (s, end)) != -1 && c_isdigit (c))
  7301         val = 10 * val + c - '0';
  7302     }
  7303 
  7304   return val;
  7305 }
  7306 
  7307 /* Scan an index from *S and return it.  It is a one-byte unsigned
  7308    index if !TWO_BYTE, and a two-byte big-endian unsigned index if
  7309    TWO_BYTE.  */
  7310 
  7311 static int
  7312 pbm_scan_index (char **s, bool two_byte)
  7313 {
  7314   char *p = *s;
  7315   unsigned char c0 = *p++;
  7316   int n = c0;
  7317   if (two_byte)
  7318     {
  7319       unsigned char c1 = *p++;
  7320       n = (n << 8) + c1;
  7321     }
  7322   *s = p;
  7323   return n;
  7324 }
  7325 
  7326 
  7327 /* Load PBM image IMG for use on frame F.  */
  7328 
  7329 static bool
  7330 pbm_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  7331 {
  7332   bool raw_p;
  7333   int x, y;
  7334   int width, height, max_color_idx = 0;
  7335   Lisp_Object specified_file;
  7336   enum {PBM_MONO, PBM_GRAY, PBM_COLOR} type;
  7337   char *contents = NULL;
  7338   char *end, *p;
  7339   Emacs_Pix_Container ximg;
  7340 
  7341   specified_file = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCfile, NULL);
  7342 
  7343   if (STRINGP (specified_file))
  7344     {
  7345       image_fd fd;
  7346       Lisp_Object file = image_find_image_fd (specified_file, &fd);
  7347       if (!STRINGP (file))
  7348         {
  7349           image_error ("Cannot find image file `%s'", specified_file);
  7350           return 0;
  7351         }
  7352 
  7353       ptrdiff_t size;
  7354       contents = slurp_file (fd, &size);
  7355       if (contents == NULL)
  7356         {
  7357           image_error ("Error reading `%s'", file);
  7358           return 0;
  7359         }
  7360 
  7361       p = contents;
  7362       end = contents + size;
  7363     }
  7364   else
  7365     {
  7366       Lisp_Object data;
  7367       data = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL);
  7368       if (!STRINGP (data))
  7369         {
  7370           image_error ("Invalid image data `%s'", data);
  7371           return 0;
  7372         }
  7373       p = SSDATA (data);
  7374       end = p + SBYTES (data);
  7375     }
  7376 
  7377   /* Check magic number.  */
  7378   if (end - p < 2 || *p++ != 'P')
  7379     {
  7380       image_error ("Not a PBM image: `%s'", img->spec);
  7381     error:
  7382       xfree (contents);
  7383       img->pixmap = NO_PIXMAP;
  7384       return 0;
  7385     }
  7386 
  7387   switch (*p++)
  7388     {
  7389     case '1':
  7390       raw_p = 0, type = PBM_MONO;
  7391       break;
  7392 
  7393     case '2':
  7394       raw_p = 0, type = PBM_GRAY;
  7395       break;
  7396 
  7397     case '3':
  7398       raw_p = 0, type = PBM_COLOR;
  7399       break;
  7400 
  7401     case '4':
  7402       raw_p = 1, type = PBM_MONO;
  7403       break;
  7404 
  7405     case '5':
  7406       raw_p = 1, type = PBM_GRAY;
  7407       break;
  7408 
  7409     case '6':
  7410       raw_p = 1, type = PBM_COLOR;
  7411       break;
  7412 
  7413     default:
  7414       image_error ("Not a PBM image: `%s'", img->spec);
  7415       goto error;
  7416     }
  7417 
  7418   /* Read width, height, maximum color-component.  Characters
  7419      starting with `#' up to the end of a line are ignored.  */
  7420   width = pbm_scan_number (&p, end);
  7421   height = pbm_scan_number (&p, end);
  7422 
  7423   if (type != PBM_MONO)
  7424     {
  7425       max_color_idx = pbm_scan_number (&p, end);
  7426       if (max_color_idx > 65535 || max_color_idx < 0)
  7427         {
  7428           image_error ("Unsupported maximum PBM color value");
  7429           goto error;
  7430         }
  7431     }
  7432 
  7433   if (!check_image_size (f, width, height))
  7434     {
  7435       image_size_error ();
  7436       goto error;
  7437     }
  7438 
  7439   if (!image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, 0, &ximg, 0))
  7440     goto error;
  7441 
  7442   /* Initialize the color hash table.  */
  7443   init_color_table ();
  7444 
  7445   if (type == PBM_MONO)
  7446     {
  7447       unsigned char c = 0;
  7448       int g;
  7449       struct image_keyword fmt[PBM_LAST];
  7450       unsigned long fg = img->face_foreground;
  7451       unsigned long bg = img->face_background;
  7452       /* Parse the image specification.  */
  7453       memcpy (fmt, pbm_format, sizeof fmt);
  7454       parse_image_spec (img->spec, fmt, PBM_LAST, Qpbm);
  7455 
  7456       /* Get foreground and background colors, maybe allocate colors.  */
  7457       if (fmt[PBM_FOREGROUND].count
  7458           && STRINGP (fmt[PBM_FOREGROUND].value))
  7459         fg = image_alloc_image_color (f, img, fmt[PBM_FOREGROUND].value, fg);
  7460       if (fmt[PBM_BACKGROUND].count
  7461           && STRINGP (fmt[PBM_BACKGROUND].value))
  7462         {
  7463           bg = image_alloc_image_color (f, img, fmt[PBM_BACKGROUND].value, bg);
  7464           img->background = bg;
  7465           img->background_valid = 1;
  7466         }
  7467 
  7468 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  7469       {
  7470         Emacs_Color fgbg[] = {{.pixel = fg}, {.pixel = bg}};
  7471         FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->query_colors (f, fgbg, ARRAYELTS (fgbg));
  7472         fg = lookup_rgb_color (f, fgbg[0].red, fgbg[0].green, fgbg[0].blue);
  7473         bg = lookup_rgb_color (f, fgbg[1].red, fgbg[1].green, fgbg[1].blue);
  7474       }
  7475 #endif
  7476       for (y = 0; y < height; ++y)
  7477         for (x = 0; x < width; ++x)
  7478           {
  7479             if (raw_p)
  7480               {
  7481                 if ((x & 7) == 0)
  7482                   {
  7483                     if (p >= end)
  7484                       {
  7485                         image_destroy_x_image (ximg);
  7486                         image_clear_image (f, img);
  7487                         image_error ("Invalid image size in image `%s'",
  7488                                      img->spec);
  7489                         goto error;
  7490                       }
  7491                     c = *p++;
  7492                   }
  7493                 g = c & 0x80;
  7494                 c <<= 1;
  7495               }
  7496             else
  7497               {
  7498                 int c = 0;
  7499                 /* Skip white-space and comments.  */
  7500                 while ((c = pbm_next_char (&p, end)) != -1 && c_isspace (c))
  7501                   ;
  7502 
  7503                 if (c == '0' || c == '1')
  7504                   g = c - '0';
  7505                 else
  7506                   g = 0;
  7507               }
  7508 
  7509             PUT_PIXEL (ximg, x, y, g ? fg : bg);
  7510           }
  7511     }
  7512   else
  7513     {
  7514       int expected_size = height * width;
  7515       bool two_byte = 255 < max_color_idx;
  7516       if (two_byte)
  7517         expected_size *= 2;
  7518       if (type == PBM_COLOR)
  7519         expected_size *= 3;
  7520 
  7521       if (raw_p && p + expected_size > end)
  7522         {
  7523           image_destroy_x_image (ximg);
  7524           image_clear_image (f, img);
  7525           image_error ("Invalid image size in image `%s'", img->spec);
  7526           goto error;
  7527         }
  7528 
  7529       for (y = 0; y < height; ++y)
  7530         for (x = 0; x < width; ++x)
  7531           {
  7532             int r, g, b;
  7533 
  7534             if (type == PBM_GRAY && raw_p)
  7535               r = g = b = pbm_scan_index (&p, two_byte);
  7536             else if (type == PBM_GRAY)
  7537               r = g = b = pbm_scan_number (&p, end);
  7538             else if (raw_p)
  7539               {
  7540                 r = pbm_scan_index (&p, two_byte);
  7541                 g = pbm_scan_index (&p, two_byte);
  7542                 b = pbm_scan_index (&p, two_byte);
  7543               }
  7544             else
  7545               {
  7546                 r = pbm_scan_number (&p, end);
  7547                 g = pbm_scan_number (&p, end);
  7548                 b = pbm_scan_number (&p, end);
  7549               }
  7550 
  7551             if (r < 0 || g < 0 || b < 0)
  7552               {
  7553                 image_destroy_x_image (ximg);
  7554                 image_error ("Invalid pixel value in image `%s'", img->spec);
  7555                 goto error;
  7556               }
  7557 
  7558             /* RGB values are now in the range 0..max_color_idx.
  7559                Scale this to the range 0..0xffff supported by X.  */
  7560             r = (double) r * 65535 / max_color_idx;
  7561             g = (double) g * 65535 / max_color_idx;
  7562             b = (double) b * 65535 / max_color_idx;
  7563             PUT_PIXEL (ximg, x, y, lookup_rgb_color (f, r, g, b));
  7564           }
  7565     }
  7566 
  7567 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
  7568   /* Store in IMG->colors the colors allocated for the image, and
  7569      free the color table.  */
  7570   img->colors = colors_in_color_table (&img->ncolors);
  7571   free_color_table ();
  7572 #endif /* COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT */
  7573 
  7574   img->width = width;
  7575   img->height = height;
  7576 
  7577   /* Maybe fill in the background field while we have ximg handy.  */
  7578 
  7579   if (NILP (image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL)))
  7580     /* Casting avoids a GCC warning.  */
  7581     IMAGE_BACKGROUND (img, f, (Emacs_Pix_Context)ximg);
  7582 
  7583   /* Put ximg into the image.  */
  7584   image_put_x_image (f, img, ximg, 0);
  7585 
  7586   /* X and W32 versions did it here, MAC version above.  ++kfs
  7587      img->width = width;
  7588      img->height = height; */
  7589 
  7590   xfree (contents);
  7591   return 1;
  7592 }
  7593 
  7594 
  7595 /***********************************************************************
  7596                             NATIVE IMAGE HANDLING
  7597  ***********************************************************************/
  7598 
  7599 #if HAVE_NATIVE_IMAGE_API
  7600 static bool
  7601 image_can_use_native_api (Lisp_Object type)
  7602 {
  7603 # ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  7604   return w32_can_use_native_image_api (type);
  7605 # elif defined HAVE_NS
  7606   return ns_can_use_native_image_api (type);
  7607 # elif defined HAVE_HAIKU
  7608   return haiku_can_use_native_image_api (type);
  7609 # else
  7610   return false;
  7611 # endif
  7612 }
  7613 
  7614 /*
  7615  * These functions are actually defined in the OS-native implementation file.
  7616  * Currently, for Windows GDI+ interface, w32image.c, and nsimage.m for macOS.
  7617  */
  7618 
  7619 /* Indices of image specification fields in native format, below.  */
  7620 enum native_image_keyword_index
  7621 {
  7622   NATIVE_IMAGE_TYPE,
  7623   NATIVE_IMAGE_DATA,
  7624   NATIVE_IMAGE_FILE,
  7625   NATIVE_IMAGE_ASCENT,
  7626   NATIVE_IMAGE_MARGIN,
  7627   NATIVE_IMAGE_RELIEF,
  7628   NATIVE_IMAGE_ALGORITHM,
  7629   NATIVE_IMAGE_HEURISTIC_MASK,
  7630   NATIVE_IMAGE_MASK,
  7631   NATIVE_IMAGE_BACKGROUND,
  7632   NATIVE_IMAGE_INDEX,
  7633   NATIVE_IMAGE_LAST
  7634 };
  7635 
  7636 /* Vector of image_keyword structures describing the format
  7637    of valid user-defined image specifications.  */
  7638 static const struct image_keyword native_image_format[] =
  7639 {
  7640   {":type",             IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     1},
  7641   {":data",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  7642   {":file",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  7643   {":ascent",           IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,                     0},
  7644   {":margin",           IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR, 0},
  7645   {":relief",           IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
  7646   {":conversion",       IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  7647   {":heuristic-mask",   IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  7648   {":mask",             IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  7649   {":background",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0},
  7650   {":index",            IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,       0}
  7651 };
  7652 
  7653 /* Return true if OBJECT is a valid native API image specification.  */
  7654 
  7655 static bool
  7656 native_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
  7657 {
  7658   struct image_keyword fmt[NATIVE_IMAGE_LAST];
  7659   memcpy (fmt, native_image_format, sizeof fmt);
  7660 
  7661   if (!parse_image_spec (object, fmt, 10, Qnative_image))
  7662     return 0;
  7663 
  7664   /* Must specify either the :data or :file keyword.  */
  7665   return fmt[NATIVE_IMAGE_FILE].count + fmt[NATIVE_IMAGE_DATA].count == 1;
  7666 }
  7667 
  7668 static bool
  7669 native_image_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  7670 {
  7671   Lisp_Object image_file = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCfile, NULL);
  7672 
  7673   if (STRINGP (image_file))
  7674     image_file = image_find_image_file (image_file);
  7675 
  7676 # ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  7677   return w32_load_image (f, img, image_file,
  7678                          image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL));
  7679 # elif defined HAVE_NS
  7680   return ns_load_image (f, img, image_file,
  7681                         image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL));
  7682 # elif defined HAVE_HAIKU
  7683   return haiku_load_image (f, img, image_file,
  7684                            image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL));
  7685 # else
  7686   return 0;
  7687 # endif
  7688 }
  7689 
  7690 #endif  /* HAVE_NATIVE_IMAGE_API */
  7691 
  7692 
  7693 /***********************************************************************
  7694                                  PNG
  7695  ***********************************************************************/
  7696 
  7697 #if defined (HAVE_PNG)
  7698 
  7699 /* Indices of image specification fields in png_format, below.  */
  7700 
  7701 enum png_keyword_index
  7702 {
  7703   PNG_TYPE,
  7704   PNG_DATA,
  7705   PNG_FILE,
  7706   PNG_ASCENT,
  7707   PNG_MARGIN,
  7708   PNG_RELIEF,
  7709   PNG_ALGORITHM,
  7710   PNG_HEURISTIC_MASK,
  7711   PNG_MASK,
  7712   PNG_BACKGROUND,
  7713   PNG_LAST
  7714 };
  7715 
  7716 /* Vector of image_keyword structures describing the format
  7717    of valid user-defined image specifications.  */
  7718 
  7719 static const struct image_keyword png_format[PNG_LAST] =
  7720 {
  7721   {":type",             IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     1},
  7722   {":data",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  7723   {":file",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  7724   {":ascent",           IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,                     0},
  7725   {":margin",           IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR, 0},
  7726   {":relief",           IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
  7727   {":conversion",       IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  7728   {":heuristic-mask",   IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  7729   {":mask",             IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  7730   {":background",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0}
  7731 };
  7732 
  7733 /* Return true if OBJECT is a valid PNG image specification.  */
  7734 
  7735 static bool
  7736 png_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
  7737 {
  7738   struct image_keyword fmt[PNG_LAST];
  7739   memcpy (fmt, png_format, sizeof fmt);
  7740 
  7741   if (!parse_image_spec (object, fmt, PNG_LAST, Qpng))
  7742     return 0;
  7743 
  7744   /* Must specify either the :data or :file keyword.  */
  7745   return fmt[PNG_FILE].count + fmt[PNG_DATA].count == 1;
  7746 }
  7747 
  7748 #endif /* HAVE_PNG */
  7749 
  7750 
  7751 #ifdef HAVE_PNG
  7752 
  7753 # ifdef WINDOWSNT
  7754 /* PNG library details.  */
  7755 
  7756 DEF_DLL_FN (png_voidp, png_get_io_ptr, (png_structp));
  7757 DEF_DLL_FN (int, png_sig_cmp, (png_bytep, png_size_t, png_size_t));
  7758 DEF_DLL_FN (png_structp, png_create_read_struct,
  7759             (png_const_charp, png_voidp, png_error_ptr, png_error_ptr));
  7760 DEF_DLL_FN (png_infop, png_create_info_struct, (png_structp));
  7761 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_destroy_read_struct,
  7762             (png_structpp, png_infopp, png_infopp));
  7763 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_set_read_fn, (png_structp, png_voidp, png_rw_ptr));
  7764 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_set_sig_bytes, (png_structp, int));
  7765 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_read_info, (png_structp, png_infop));
  7766 DEF_DLL_FN (png_uint_32, png_get_IHDR,
  7767             (png_structp, png_infop, png_uint_32 *, png_uint_32 *,
  7768              int *, int *, int *, int *, int *));
  7769 #  ifdef PNG_tRNS_SUPPORTED
  7770 DEF_DLL_FN (png_uint_32, png_get_tRNS, (png_structp, png_infop, png_bytep *,
  7771                                         int *, png_color_16p *));
  7772 #  endif
  7773 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_set_strip_16, (png_structp));
  7774 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_set_expand, (png_structp));
  7775 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_set_gray_to_rgb, (png_structp));
  7776 DEF_DLL_FN (int, png_set_interlace_handling, (png_structp));
  7777 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_set_background,
  7778             (png_structp, png_color_16p, int, int, double));
  7779 DEF_DLL_FN (png_uint_32, png_get_bKGD,
  7780             (png_structp, png_infop, png_color_16p *));
  7781 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_read_update_info, (png_structp, png_infop));
  7782 DEF_DLL_FN (png_byte, png_get_channels, (png_structp, png_infop));
  7783 DEF_DLL_FN (png_size_t, png_get_rowbytes, (png_structp, png_infop));
  7784 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_read_image, (png_structp, png_bytepp));
  7785 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_read_end, (png_structp, png_infop));
  7786 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_error, (png_structp, png_const_charp));
  7787 
  7788 #  if (PNG_LIBPNG_VER >= 10500)
  7789 DEF_DLL_FN (void, png_longjmp, (png_structp, int) PNG_NORETURN);
  7790 DEF_DLL_FN (jmp_buf *, png_set_longjmp_fn,
  7791             (png_structp, png_longjmp_ptr, size_t));
  7792 #  endif /* libpng version >= 1.5 */
  7793 
  7794 static bool
  7795 init_png_functions (void)
  7796 {
  7797   HMODULE library;
  7798 
  7799   if (!(library = w32_delayed_load (Qpng)))
  7800     return 0;
  7801 
  7802   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_get_io_ptr);
  7803   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_sig_cmp);
  7804   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_create_read_struct);
  7805   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_create_info_struct);
  7806   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_destroy_read_struct);
  7807   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_set_read_fn);
  7808   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_set_sig_bytes);
  7809   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_read_info);
  7810   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_get_IHDR);
  7811 #  ifdef PNG_tRNS_SUPPORTED
  7812   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_get_tRNS);
  7813 #  endif
  7814   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_set_strip_16);
  7815   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_set_expand);
  7816   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_set_gray_to_rgb);
  7817   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_set_interlace_handling);
  7818   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_set_background);
  7819   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_get_bKGD);
  7820   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_read_update_info);
  7821   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_get_channels);
  7822   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_get_rowbytes);
  7823   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_read_image);
  7824   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_read_end);
  7825   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_error);
  7826 
  7827 #  if (PNG_LIBPNG_VER >= 10500)
  7828   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_longjmp);
  7829   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, png_set_longjmp_fn);
  7830 #  endif /* libpng version >= 1.5 */
  7831 
  7832   return 1;
  7833 }
  7834 
  7835 #  undef png_create_info_struct
  7836 #  undef png_create_read_struct
  7837 #  undef png_destroy_read_struct
  7838 #  undef png_error
  7839 #  undef png_get_bKGD
  7840 #  undef png_get_channels
  7841 #  undef png_get_IHDR
  7842 #  undef png_get_io_ptr
  7843 #  undef png_get_rowbytes
  7844 #  undef png_get_tRNS
  7845 #  undef png_longjmp
  7846 #  undef png_read_end
  7847 #  undef png_read_image
  7848 #  undef png_read_info
  7849 #  undef png_read_update_info
  7850 #  undef png_set_background
  7851 #  undef png_set_expand
  7852 #  undef png_set_gray_to_rgb
  7853 #  undef png_set_interlace_handling
  7854 #  undef png_set_longjmp_fn
  7855 #  undef png_set_read_fn
  7856 #  undef png_set_sig_bytes
  7857 #  undef png_set_strip_16
  7858 #  undef png_sig_cmp
  7859 
  7860 #  define png_create_info_struct fn_png_create_info_struct
  7861 #  define png_create_read_struct fn_png_create_read_struct
  7862 #  define png_destroy_read_struct fn_png_destroy_read_struct
  7863 #  define png_error fn_png_error
  7864 #  define png_get_bKGD fn_png_get_bKGD
  7865 #  define png_get_channels fn_png_get_channels
  7866 #  define png_get_IHDR fn_png_get_IHDR
  7867 #  define png_get_io_ptr fn_png_get_io_ptr
  7868 #  define png_get_rowbytes fn_png_get_rowbytes
  7869 #  define png_get_tRNS fn_png_get_tRNS
  7870 #  define png_longjmp fn_png_longjmp
  7871 #  define png_read_end fn_png_read_end
  7872 #  define png_read_image fn_png_read_image
  7873 #  define png_read_info fn_png_read_info
  7874 #  define png_read_update_info fn_png_read_update_info
  7875 #  define png_set_background fn_png_set_background
  7876 #  define png_set_expand fn_png_set_expand
  7877 #  define png_set_gray_to_rgb fn_png_set_gray_to_rgb
  7878 #  define png_set_interlace_handling fn_png_set_interlace_handling
  7879 #  define png_set_longjmp_fn fn_png_set_longjmp_fn
  7880 #  define png_set_read_fn fn_png_set_read_fn
  7881 #  define png_set_sig_bytes fn_png_set_sig_bytes
  7882 #  define png_set_strip_16 fn_png_set_strip_16
  7883 #  define png_sig_cmp fn_png_sig_cmp
  7884 
  7885 # endif /* WINDOWSNT */
  7886 
  7887 /* Fast implementations of setjmp and longjmp.  Although setjmp and longjmp
  7888    will do, POSIX _setjmp and _longjmp (if available) are often faster.
  7889    Do not use sys_setjmp, as PNG supports only jmp_buf.
  7890    It's OK if the longjmp substitute restores the signal mask.  */
  7891 # ifdef HAVE__SETJMP
  7892 #  define FAST_SETJMP(j) _setjmp (j)
  7893 #  define FAST_LONGJMP _longjmp
  7894 # else
  7895 #  define FAST_SETJMP(j) setjmp (j)
  7896 #  define FAST_LONGJMP longjmp
  7897 # endif
  7898 
  7899 # if PNG_LIBPNG_VER < 10500
  7900 #  define PNG_LONGJMP(ptr) FAST_LONGJMP ((ptr)->jmpbuf, 1)
  7901 #  define PNG_JMPBUF(ptr) ((ptr)->jmpbuf)
  7902 # else
  7903 /* In libpng version 1.5, the jmpbuf member is hidden. (Bug#7908)  */
  7904 #  define PNG_LONGJMP(ptr) png_longjmp (ptr, 1)
  7905 #  define PNG_JMPBUF(ptr) \
  7906      (*png_set_longjmp_fn (ptr, FAST_LONGJMP, sizeof (jmp_buf)))
  7907 # endif
  7908 
  7909 /* Error and warning handlers installed when the PNG library
  7910    is initialized.  */
  7911 
  7912 static AVOID
  7913 my_png_error (png_struct *png_ptr, const char *msg)
  7914 {
  7915   eassert (png_ptr != NULL);
  7916   /* Avoid compiler warning about deprecated direct access to
  7917      png_ptr's fields in libpng versions 1.4.x.  */
  7918   image_error ("PNG error: %s", build_string (msg));
  7919   PNG_LONGJMP (png_ptr);
  7920 }
  7921 
  7922 
  7923 static void
  7924 my_png_warning (png_struct *png_ptr, const char *msg)
  7925 {
  7926   eassert (png_ptr != NULL);
  7927   image_error ("PNG warning: %s", build_string (msg));
  7928 }
  7929 
  7930 /* Memory source for PNG decoding.  */
  7931 
  7932 struct png_memory_storage
  7933 {
  7934   unsigned char *bytes;         /* The data       */
  7935   ptrdiff_t len;                /* How big is it? */
  7936   ptrdiff_t index;              /* Where are we?  */
  7937 };
  7938 
  7939 
  7940 /* Function set as reader function when reading PNG image from memory.
  7941    PNG_PTR is a pointer to the PNG control structure.  Copy LENGTH
  7942    bytes from the input to DATA.  */
  7943 
  7944 static void
  7945 png_read_from_memory (png_structp png_ptr, png_bytep data, png_size_t length)
  7946 {
  7947   struct png_memory_storage *tbr = png_get_io_ptr (png_ptr);
  7948 
  7949   if (length > tbr->len - tbr->index)
  7950     png_error (png_ptr, "Read error");
  7951 
  7952   memcpy (data, tbr->bytes + tbr->index, length);
  7953   tbr->index = tbr->index + length;
  7954 }
  7955 
  7956 
  7957 /* Function set as reader function when reading PNG image from a file.
  7958    PNG_PTR is a pointer to the PNG control structure.  Copy LENGTH
  7959    bytes from the input to DATA.  */
  7960 
  7961 static void
  7962 png_read_from_file (png_structp png_ptr, png_bytep data, png_size_t length)
  7963 {
  7964   FILE *fp = png_get_io_ptr (png_ptr);
  7965 
  7966   if (fread (data, 1, length, fp) < length)
  7967     png_error (png_ptr, "Read error");
  7968 }
  7969 
  7970 
  7971 /* Load PNG image IMG for use on frame F.  Value is true if
  7972    successful.  */
  7973 
  7974 struct png_load_context
  7975 {
  7976   /* These are members so that longjmp doesn't munge local variables.  */
  7977   png_struct *png_ptr;
  7978   png_info *info_ptr;
  7979   png_info *end_info;
  7980   FILE *fp;
  7981   png_byte *pixels;
  7982   png_byte **rows;
  7983 };
  7984 
  7985 static bool
  7986 png_load_body (struct frame *f, struct image *img, struct png_load_context *c)
  7987 {
  7988   Lisp_Object specified_file, specified_data;
  7989   FILE *fp = NULL;
  7990   int x, y;
  7991   ptrdiff_t i;
  7992   png_struct *png_ptr;
  7993   png_info *info_ptr = NULL, *end_info = NULL;
  7994   png_byte sig[8];
  7995   png_byte *pixels = NULL;
  7996   png_byte **rows = NULL;
  7997   png_uint_32 width, height;
  7998   int bit_depth, color_type, interlace_type;
  7999   png_byte channels;
  8000   png_uint_32 row_bytes;
  8001   bool transparent_p;
  8002   struct png_memory_storage tbr;  /* Data to be read */
  8003   ptrdiff_t nbytes;
  8004   Emacs_Pix_Container ximg, mask_img = NULL;
  8005 
  8006   /* Find out what file to load.  */
  8007   specified_file = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCfile, NULL);
  8008   specified_data = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL);
  8009 
  8010   if (NILP (specified_data))
  8011     {
  8012       int fd;
  8013       Lisp_Object file = image_find_image_file (specified_file);
  8014 
  8015       if (!STRINGP (file)
  8016           || (fd = emacs_open (SSDATA (ENCODE_FILE (file)),
  8017                                O_RDONLY, 0)) < 0)
  8018         {
  8019           image_error ("Cannot find image file `%s'", specified_file);
  8020           return 0;
  8021         }
  8022 
  8023       /* Open the image file.  */
  8024       fp = fdopen (fd, "rb");
  8025       if (!fp)
  8026         {
  8027           image_error ("Cannot open image file `%s'", file);
  8028           return 0;
  8029         }
  8030 
  8031       /* Check PNG signature.  */
  8032       if (fread (sig, 1, sizeof sig, fp) != sizeof sig
  8033           || png_sig_cmp (sig, 0, sizeof sig))
  8034         {
  8035           emacs_fclose (fp);
  8036           image_error ("Not a PNG file: `%s'", file);
  8037           return 0;
  8038         }
  8039     }
  8040   else
  8041     {
  8042       if (!STRINGP (specified_data))
  8043         {
  8044           image_error ("Invalid image data `%s'", specified_data);
  8045           return 0;
  8046         }
  8047 
  8048       /* Read from memory.  */
  8049       tbr.bytes = SDATA (specified_data);
  8050       tbr.len = SBYTES (specified_data);
  8051       tbr.index = 0;
  8052 
  8053       /* Check PNG signature.  */
  8054       if (tbr.len < sizeof sig
  8055           || png_sig_cmp (tbr.bytes, 0, sizeof sig))
  8056         {
  8057           image_error ("Not a PNG image: `%s'", img->spec);
  8058           return 0;
  8059         }
  8060 
  8061       /* Need to skip past the signature.  */
  8062       tbr.bytes += sizeof (sig);
  8063     }
  8064 
  8065   /* Initialize read and info structs for PNG lib.  */
  8066   png_ptr = png_create_read_struct (PNG_LIBPNG_VER_STRING,
  8067                                        NULL, my_png_error,
  8068                                        my_png_warning);
  8069   if (png_ptr)
  8070     {
  8071       info_ptr = png_create_info_struct (png_ptr);
  8072       end_info = png_create_info_struct (png_ptr);
  8073     }
  8074 
  8075   c->png_ptr = png_ptr;
  8076   c->info_ptr = info_ptr;
  8077   c->end_info = end_info;
  8078   c->fp = fp;
  8079   c->pixels = pixels;
  8080   c->rows = rows;
  8081 
  8082   if (! (info_ptr && end_info))
  8083     {
  8084       png_destroy_read_struct (&c->png_ptr, &c->info_ptr, &c->end_info);
  8085       png_ptr = 0;
  8086     }
  8087   if (! png_ptr)
  8088     {
  8089       if (fp) emacs_fclose (fp);
  8090       return 0;
  8091     }
  8092 
  8093   /* Set error jump-back.  We come back here when the PNG library
  8094      detects an error.  */
  8095   if (FAST_SETJMP (PNG_JMPBUF (png_ptr)))
  8096     {
  8097     error:
  8098       if (c->png_ptr)
  8099         png_destroy_read_struct (&c->png_ptr, &c->info_ptr, &c->end_info);
  8100       xfree (c->pixels);
  8101       xfree (c->rows);
  8102       if (c->fp)
  8103         emacs_fclose (c->fp);
  8104       return 0;
  8105     }
  8106 
  8107   /* Read image info.  */
  8108   if (!NILP (specified_data))
  8109     png_set_read_fn (png_ptr, &tbr, png_read_from_memory);
  8110   else
  8111     png_set_read_fn (png_ptr, fp, png_read_from_file);
  8112 
  8113   png_set_sig_bytes (png_ptr, sizeof sig);
  8114   png_read_info (png_ptr, info_ptr);
  8115   png_get_IHDR (png_ptr, info_ptr, &width, &height, &bit_depth, &color_type,
  8116                 &interlace_type, NULL, NULL);
  8117 
  8118   if (! (width <= INT_MAX && height <= INT_MAX
  8119          && check_image_size (f, width, height)))
  8120     {
  8121       image_size_error ();
  8122       goto error;
  8123     }
  8124 
  8125   /* Create the X image and pixmap now, so that the work below can be
  8126      omitted if the image is too large for X.  */
  8127   if (!image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, 0, &ximg, 0))
  8128     goto error;
  8129 
  8130   /* If image contains simply transparency data, we prefer to
  8131      construct a clipping mask.  */
  8132   transparent_p = false;
  8133 # ifdef PNG_tRNS_SUPPORTED
  8134   png_bytep trans_alpha;
  8135   int num_trans;
  8136   if (png_get_tRNS (png_ptr, info_ptr, &trans_alpha, &num_trans, NULL))
  8137     {
  8138       transparent_p = true;
  8139       if (trans_alpha)
  8140         for (int i = 0; i < num_trans; i++)
  8141           if (0 < trans_alpha[i] && trans_alpha[i] < 255)
  8142             {
  8143               transparent_p = false;
  8144               break;
  8145             }
  8146     }
  8147 # endif
  8148 
  8149   /* This function is easier to write if we only have to handle
  8150      one data format: RGB or RGBA with 8 bits per channel.  Let's
  8151      transform other formats into that format.  */
  8152 
  8153   /* Strip more than 8 bits per channel.  */
  8154   if (bit_depth == 16)
  8155     png_set_strip_16 (png_ptr);
  8156 
  8157   /* Expand data to 24 bit RGB, or 8 bit grayscale, with alpha channel
  8158      if available.  */
  8159   png_set_expand (png_ptr);
  8160 
  8161   /* Convert grayscale images to RGB.  */
  8162   if (color_type == PNG_COLOR_TYPE_GRAY
  8163       || color_type == PNG_COLOR_TYPE_GRAY_ALPHA)
  8164     png_set_gray_to_rgb (png_ptr);
  8165 
  8166   /* Handle alpha channel by combining the image with a background
  8167      color.  Do this only if a real alpha channel is supplied.  For
  8168      simple transparency, we prefer a clipping mask.  */
  8169   if (!transparent_p)
  8170     {
  8171       /* png_color_16 *image_bg; */
  8172       Lisp_Object specified_bg
  8173         = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL);
  8174       Emacs_Color color;
  8175 
  8176       /* If the user specified a color, try to use it; if not, use the
  8177          current frame background, ignoring any default background
  8178          color set by the image.  */
  8179       if (STRINGP (specified_bg)
  8180           ? FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->defined_color_hook (f,
  8181                                                     SSDATA (specified_bg),
  8182                                                     &color,
  8183                                                     false,
  8184                                                     false)
  8185           : (FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->query_frame_background_color (f, &color),
  8186              true))
  8187         /* The user specified `:background', use that.  */
  8188         {
  8189           int shift = bit_depth == 16 ? 0 : 8;
  8190           png_color_16 bg = { 0 };
  8191           bg.red = color.red >> shift;
  8192           bg.green = color.green >> shift;
  8193           bg.blue = color.blue >> shift;
  8194 
  8195           png_set_background (png_ptr, &bg,
  8196                               PNG_BACKGROUND_GAMMA_SCREEN, 0, 1.0);
  8197         }
  8198     }
  8199 
  8200   png_set_interlace_handling (png_ptr);
  8201   png_read_update_info (png_ptr, info_ptr);
  8202 
  8203   /* Get number of channels.  Valid values are 1 for grayscale images
  8204      and images with a palette, 2 for grayscale images with transparency
  8205      information (alpha channel), 3 for RGB images, and 4 for RGB
  8206      images with alpha channel, i.e. RGBA.  If conversions above were
  8207      sufficient we should only have 3 or 4 channels here.  */
  8208   channels = png_get_channels (png_ptr, info_ptr);
  8209   eassert (channels == 3 || channels == 4);
  8210 
  8211   /* Number of bytes needed for one row of the image.  */
  8212   row_bytes = png_get_rowbytes (png_ptr, info_ptr);
  8213 
  8214   /* Allocate memory for the image.  */
  8215   if (ckd_mul (&nbytes, row_bytes, sizeof *pixels)
  8216       || ckd_mul (&nbytes, nbytes, height))
  8217     memory_full (SIZE_MAX);
  8218   c->pixels = pixels = xmalloc (nbytes);
  8219   c->rows = rows = xmalloc (height * sizeof *rows);
  8220   for (i = 0; i < height; ++i)
  8221     rows[i] = pixels + i * row_bytes;
  8222 
  8223   /* Read the entire image.  */
  8224   png_read_image (png_ptr, rows);
  8225   png_read_end (png_ptr, info_ptr);
  8226   if (fp)
  8227     {
  8228       emacs_fclose (fp);
  8229       c->fp = NULL;
  8230     }
  8231 
  8232   /* Create an image and pixmap serving as mask if the PNG image
  8233      contains an alpha channel.  */
  8234   if (channels == 4
  8235       && transparent_p
  8236       && !image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, 1,
  8237                                            &mask_img, 1))
  8238     {
  8239       image_destroy_x_image (ximg);
  8240       image_clear_image_1 (f, img, CLEAR_IMAGE_PIXMAP);
  8241       goto error;
  8242     }
  8243 
  8244   /* Fill the X image and mask from PNG data.  */
  8245   init_color_table ();
  8246 
  8247   for (y = 0; y < height; ++y)
  8248     {
  8249       png_byte *p = rows[y];
  8250 
  8251       for (x = 0; x < width; ++x)
  8252         {
  8253           int r, g, b;
  8254 
  8255           r = *p++ << 8;
  8256           g = *p++ << 8;
  8257           b = *p++ << 8;
  8258           PUT_PIXEL (ximg, x, y, lookup_rgb_color (f, r, g, b));
  8259           /* An alpha channel, aka mask channel, associates variable
  8260              transparency with an image.  Where other image formats
  8261              support binary transparency---fully transparent or fully
  8262              opaque---PNG allows up to 254 levels of partial transparency.
  8263              The PNG library implements partial transparency by combining
  8264              the image with a specified background color.
  8265 
  8266              I'm not sure how to handle this here nicely: because the
  8267              background on which the image is displayed may change, for
  8268              real alpha channel support, it would be necessary to create
  8269              a new image for each possible background.
  8270 
  8271              What I'm doing now is that a mask is created if we have
  8272              boolean transparency information.  Otherwise I'm using
  8273              the frame's background color to combine the image with.  */
  8274 
  8275           if (channels == 4)
  8276             {
  8277               if (mask_img)
  8278                 PUT_PIXEL (mask_img, x, y, *p > 0 ? PIX_MASK_DRAW : PIX_MASK_RETAIN);
  8279               ++p;
  8280             }
  8281         }
  8282     }
  8283 
  8284   if (NILP (image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL)))
  8285     /* Set IMG's background color from the PNG image, unless the user
  8286        overrode it.  */
  8287     {
  8288       png_color_16 *bg;
  8289       if (png_get_bKGD (png_ptr, info_ptr, &bg))
  8290         {
  8291 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
  8292           img->background = lookup_rgb_color (f, bg->red, bg->green, bg->blue);
  8293 #else  /* USE_CAIRO */
  8294           char color_name[30];
  8295           sprintf (color_name, "#%04x%04x%04x", bg->red, bg->green, bg->blue);
  8296           img->background
  8297             = image_alloc_image_color (f, img, build_string (color_name), 0);
  8298 #endif /* USE_CAIRO */
  8299           img->background_valid = 1;
  8300         }
  8301     }
  8302 
  8303 # ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
  8304   /* Remember colors allocated for this image.  */
  8305   img->colors = colors_in_color_table (&img->ncolors);
  8306   free_color_table ();
  8307 # endif /* COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT */
  8308 
  8309   /* Clean up.  */
  8310   png_destroy_read_struct (&c->png_ptr, &c->info_ptr, &c->end_info);
  8311   xfree (rows);
  8312   xfree (pixels);
  8313 
  8314   img->width = width;
  8315   img->height = height;
  8316 
  8317   /* Maybe fill in the background field while we have ximg handy.
  8318      Casting avoids a GCC warning.  */
  8319   IMAGE_BACKGROUND (img, f, (Emacs_Pix_Context)ximg);
  8320 
  8321   /* Put ximg into the image.  */
  8322   image_put_x_image (f, img, ximg, 0);
  8323 
  8324   /* Same for the mask.  */
  8325   if (mask_img)
  8326     {
  8327       /* Fill in the background_transparent field while we have the
  8328          mask handy.  Casting avoids a GCC warning.  */
  8329       image_background_transparent (img, f, (Emacs_Pix_Context)mask_img);
  8330 
  8331       image_put_x_image (f, img, mask_img, 1);
  8332     }
  8333 
  8334   return 1;
  8335 }
  8336 
  8337 static bool
  8338 png_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  8339 {
  8340   struct png_load_context c;
  8341   return png_load_body (f, img, &c);
  8342 }
  8343 
  8344 #endif /* HAVE_PNG */
  8345 
  8346 
  8347 
  8348 /***********************************************************************
  8349                                  JPEG
  8350  ***********************************************************************/
  8351 
  8352 #if defined (HAVE_JPEG)
  8353 
  8354 /* Indices of image specification fields in gs_format, below.  */
  8355 
  8356 enum jpeg_keyword_index
  8357 {
  8358   JPEG_TYPE,
  8359   JPEG_DATA,
  8360   JPEG_FILE,
  8361   JPEG_ASCENT,
  8362   JPEG_MARGIN,
  8363   JPEG_RELIEF,
  8364   JPEG_ALGORITHM,
  8365   JPEG_HEURISTIC_MASK,
  8366   JPEG_MASK,
  8367   JPEG_BACKGROUND,
  8368   JPEG_LAST
  8369 };
  8370 
  8371 /* Vector of image_keyword structures describing the format
  8372    of valid user-defined image specifications.  */
  8373 
  8374 static const struct image_keyword jpeg_format[JPEG_LAST] =
  8375 {
  8376   {":type",             IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     1},
  8377   {":data",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  8378   {":file",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  8379   {":ascent",           IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,                     0},
  8380   {":margin",           IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR, 0},
  8381   {":relief",           IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
  8382   {":conversions",      IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  8383   {":heuristic-mask",   IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  8384   {":mask",             IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  8385   {":background",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0}
  8386 };
  8387 
  8388 /* Return true if OBJECT is a valid JPEG image specification.  */
  8389 
  8390 static bool
  8391 jpeg_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
  8392 {
  8393   struct image_keyword fmt[JPEG_LAST];
  8394 
  8395   memcpy (fmt, jpeg_format, sizeof fmt);
  8396 
  8397   if (!parse_image_spec (object, fmt, JPEG_LAST, Qjpeg))
  8398     return 0;
  8399 
  8400   /* Must specify either the :data or :file keyword.  */
  8401   return fmt[JPEG_FILE].count + fmt[JPEG_DATA].count == 1;
  8402 }
  8403 
  8404 #endif /* HAVE_JPEG */
  8405 
  8406 #ifdef HAVE_JPEG
  8407 
  8408 /* Work around a warning about HAVE_STDLIB_H being redefined in
  8409    jconfig.h.  */
  8410 # ifdef HAVE_STDLIB_H
  8411 #  undef HAVE_STDLIB_H
  8412 # endif
  8413 
  8414 # if defined (HAVE_NTGUI) && !defined (__WIN32__)
  8415 /* In older releases of the jpeg library, jpeglib.h will define boolean
  8416    differently depending on __WIN32__, so make sure it is defined.  */
  8417 #  define __WIN32__ 1
  8418 # endif
  8419 
  8420 /* rpcndr.h (via windows.h) and jpeglib.h both define boolean types.
  8421    Some versions of jpeglib try to detect whether rpcndr.h is loaded,
  8422    using the Windows boolean type instead of the jpeglib boolean type
  8423    if so.  Cygwin jpeglib, however, doesn't try to detect whether its
  8424    headers are included along with windows.h, so under Cygwin, jpeglib
  8425    attempts to define a conflicting boolean type.  Worse, forcing
  8426    Cygwin jpeglib headers to use the Windows boolean type doesn't work
  8427    because it created an ABI incompatibility between the
  8428    already-compiled jpeg library and the header interface definition.
  8429 
  8430    The best we can do is to define jpeglib's boolean type to a
  8431    different name.  This name, jpeg_boolean, remains in effect through
  8432    the rest of image.c.
  8433 */
  8434 # if defined CYGWIN && defined HAVE_NTGUI
  8435 #  define boolean jpeg_boolean
  8436 # endif
  8437 # include <jpeglib.h>
  8438 # include <jerror.h>
  8439 
  8440 # ifdef WINDOWSNT
  8441 
  8442 /* JPEG library details.  */
  8443 DEF_DLL_FN (void, jpeg_CreateDecompress, (j_decompress_ptr, int, size_t));
  8444 DEF_DLL_FN (boolean, jpeg_start_decompress, (j_decompress_ptr));
  8445 DEF_DLL_FN (boolean, jpeg_finish_decompress, (j_decompress_ptr));
  8446 DEF_DLL_FN (void, jpeg_destroy_decompress, (j_decompress_ptr));
  8447 DEF_DLL_FN (int, jpeg_read_header, (j_decompress_ptr, boolean));
  8448 DEF_DLL_FN (JDIMENSION, jpeg_read_scanlines,
  8449             (j_decompress_ptr, JSAMPARRAY, JDIMENSION));
  8450 DEF_DLL_FN (struct jpeg_error_mgr *, jpeg_std_error,
  8451             (struct jpeg_error_mgr *));
  8452 DEF_DLL_FN (boolean, jpeg_resync_to_restart, (j_decompress_ptr, int));
  8453 
  8454 static bool
  8455 init_jpeg_functions (void)
  8456 {
  8457   HMODULE library;
  8458 
  8459   if (!(library = w32_delayed_load (Qjpeg)))
  8460     return 0;
  8461 
  8462   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, jpeg_finish_decompress);
  8463   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, jpeg_read_scanlines);
  8464   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, jpeg_start_decompress);
  8465   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, jpeg_read_header);
  8466   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, jpeg_CreateDecompress);
  8467   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, jpeg_destroy_decompress);
  8468   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, jpeg_std_error);
  8469   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, jpeg_resync_to_restart);
  8470   return 1;
  8471 }
  8472 
  8473 #  undef jpeg_CreateDecompress
  8474 #  undef jpeg_destroy_decompress
  8475 #  undef jpeg_finish_decompress
  8476 #  undef jpeg_read_header
  8477 #  undef jpeg_read_scanlines
  8478 #  undef jpeg_resync_to_restart
  8479 #  undef jpeg_start_decompress
  8480 #  undef jpeg_std_error
  8481 
  8482 #  define jpeg_CreateDecompress fn_jpeg_CreateDecompress
  8483 #  define jpeg_destroy_decompress fn_jpeg_destroy_decompress
  8484 #  define jpeg_finish_decompress fn_jpeg_finish_decompress
  8485 #  define jpeg_read_header fn_jpeg_read_header
  8486 #  define jpeg_read_scanlines fn_jpeg_read_scanlines
  8487 #  define jpeg_resync_to_restart fn_jpeg_resync_to_restart
  8488 #  define jpeg_start_decompress fn_jpeg_start_decompress
  8489 #  define jpeg_std_error fn_jpeg_std_error
  8490 
  8491 /* Wrapper since we can't directly assign the function pointer
  8492    to another function pointer that was declared more completely easily.  */
  8493 static boolean
  8494 jpeg_resync_to_restart_wrapper (j_decompress_ptr cinfo, int desired)
  8495 {
  8496   return jpeg_resync_to_restart (cinfo, desired);
  8497 }
  8498 #  undef jpeg_resync_to_restart
  8499 #  define jpeg_resync_to_restart jpeg_resync_to_restart_wrapper
  8500 
  8501 # endif /* WINDOWSNT */
  8502 
  8503 struct my_jpeg_error_mgr
  8504 {
  8505   struct jpeg_error_mgr pub;
  8506   sys_jmp_buf setjmp_buffer;
  8507 
  8508   /* The remaining members are so that longjmp doesn't munge local
  8509      variables.  */
  8510   struct jpeg_decompress_struct cinfo;
  8511   enum
  8512     {
  8513       MY_JPEG_ERROR_EXIT,
  8514       MY_JPEG_INVALID_IMAGE_SIZE,
  8515       MY_JPEG_CANNOT_CREATE_X
  8516     } failure_code;
  8517 };
  8518 
  8519 
  8520 static AVOID
  8521 my_error_exit (j_common_ptr cinfo)
  8522 {
  8523   struct my_jpeg_error_mgr *mgr = (struct my_jpeg_error_mgr *) cinfo->err;
  8524   mgr->failure_code = MY_JPEG_ERROR_EXIT;
  8525   sys_longjmp (mgr->setjmp_buffer, 1);
  8526 }
  8527 
  8528 
  8529 /* Init source method for JPEG data source manager.  Called by
  8530    jpeg_read_header before any data is actually read.  See
  8531    libjpeg.doc from the JPEG lib distribution.  */
  8532 
  8533 static void
  8534 our_common_init_source (j_decompress_ptr cinfo)
  8535 {
  8536 }
  8537 
  8538 
  8539 /* Method to terminate data source.  Called by
  8540    jpeg_finish_decompress after all data has been processed.  */
  8541 
  8542 static void
  8543 our_common_term_source (j_decompress_ptr cinfo)
  8544 {
  8545 }
  8546 
  8547 
  8548 /* Fill input buffer method for JPEG data source manager.  Called
  8549    whenever more data is needed.  We read the whole image in one step,
  8550    so this only adds a fake end of input marker at the end.  */
  8551 
  8552 static JOCTET our_memory_buffer[2];
  8553 
  8554 static boolean
  8555 our_memory_fill_input_buffer (j_decompress_ptr cinfo)
  8556 {
  8557   /* Insert a fake EOI marker.  */
  8558   struct jpeg_source_mgr *src = cinfo->src;
  8559 
  8560   our_memory_buffer[0] = (JOCTET) 0xFF;
  8561   our_memory_buffer[1] = (JOCTET) JPEG_EOI;
  8562 
  8563   src->next_input_byte = our_memory_buffer;
  8564   src->bytes_in_buffer = 2;
  8565   return 1;
  8566 }
  8567 
  8568 
  8569 /* Method to skip over NUM_BYTES bytes in the image data.  CINFO->src
  8570    is the JPEG data source manager.  */
  8571 
  8572 static void
  8573 our_memory_skip_input_data (j_decompress_ptr cinfo, long int num_bytes)
  8574 {
  8575   struct jpeg_source_mgr *src = cinfo->src;
  8576 
  8577   if (src)
  8578     {
  8579       if (num_bytes > src->bytes_in_buffer)
  8580         ERREXIT (cinfo, JERR_INPUT_EOF);
  8581 
  8582       src->bytes_in_buffer -= num_bytes;
  8583       src->next_input_byte += num_bytes;
  8584     }
  8585 }
  8586 
  8587 
  8588 /* Set up the JPEG lib for reading an image from DATA which contains
  8589    LEN bytes.  CINFO is the decompression info structure created for
  8590    reading the image.  */
  8591 
  8592 static void
  8593 jpeg_memory_src (j_decompress_ptr cinfo, JOCTET *data, ptrdiff_t len)
  8594 {
  8595   struct jpeg_source_mgr *src = cinfo->src;
  8596 
  8597   if (! src)
  8598     {
  8599       /* First time for this JPEG object?  */
  8600       src = cinfo->mem->alloc_small ((j_common_ptr) cinfo,
  8601                                      JPOOL_PERMANENT, sizeof *src);
  8602       cinfo->src = src;
  8603       src->next_input_byte = data;
  8604     }
  8605 
  8606   src->init_source = our_common_init_source;
  8607   src->fill_input_buffer = our_memory_fill_input_buffer;
  8608   src->skip_input_data = our_memory_skip_input_data;
  8609   src->resync_to_restart = jpeg_resync_to_restart; /* Use default method.  */
  8610   src->term_source = our_common_term_source;
  8611   src->bytes_in_buffer = len;
  8612   src->next_input_byte = data;
  8613 }
  8614 
  8615 
  8616 struct jpeg_stdio_mgr
  8617 {
  8618   struct jpeg_source_mgr mgr;
  8619   boolean finished;
  8620   FILE *file;
  8621   JOCTET *buffer;
  8622 };
  8623 
  8624 
  8625 /* Size of buffer to read JPEG from file.
  8626    Not too big, as we want to use alloc_small.  */
  8627 #define JPEG_STDIO_BUFFER_SIZE 8192
  8628 
  8629 
  8630 /* Fill input buffer method for JPEG data source manager.  Called
  8631    whenever more data is needed.  The data is read from a FILE *.  */
  8632 
  8633 static boolean
  8634 our_stdio_fill_input_buffer (j_decompress_ptr cinfo)
  8635 {
  8636   struct jpeg_stdio_mgr *src;
  8637 
  8638   src = (struct jpeg_stdio_mgr *) cinfo->src;
  8639   if (!src->finished)
  8640     {
  8641       ptrdiff_t bytes;
  8642 
  8643       bytes = fread (src->buffer, 1, JPEG_STDIO_BUFFER_SIZE, src->file);
  8644       if (bytes > 0)
  8645         src->mgr.bytes_in_buffer = bytes;
  8646       else
  8647         {
  8648           WARNMS (cinfo, JWRN_JPEG_EOF);
  8649           src->finished = 1;
  8650           src->buffer[0] = (JOCTET) 0xFF;
  8651           src->buffer[1] = (JOCTET) JPEG_EOI;
  8652           src->mgr.bytes_in_buffer = 2;
  8653         }
  8654       src->mgr.next_input_byte = src->buffer;
  8655     }
  8656 
  8657   return 1;
  8658 }
  8659 
  8660 
  8661 /* Method to skip over NUM_BYTES bytes in the image data.  CINFO->src
  8662    is the JPEG data source manager.  */
  8663 
  8664 static void
  8665 our_stdio_skip_input_data (j_decompress_ptr cinfo, long int num_bytes)
  8666 {
  8667   struct jpeg_stdio_mgr *src;
  8668   src = (struct jpeg_stdio_mgr *) cinfo->src;
  8669 
  8670   while (num_bytes > 0 && !src->finished)
  8671     {
  8672       if (num_bytes <= src->mgr.bytes_in_buffer)
  8673         {
  8674           src->mgr.bytes_in_buffer -= num_bytes;
  8675           src->mgr.next_input_byte += num_bytes;
  8676           break;
  8677         }
  8678       else
  8679         {
  8680           num_bytes -= src->mgr.bytes_in_buffer;
  8681           src->mgr.bytes_in_buffer = 0;
  8682           src->mgr.next_input_byte = NULL;
  8683 
  8684           our_stdio_fill_input_buffer (cinfo);
  8685         }
  8686     }
  8687 }
  8688 
  8689 
  8690 /* Set up the JPEG lib for reading an image from a FILE *.
  8691    CINFO is the decompression info structure created for
  8692    reading the image.  */
  8693 
  8694 static void
  8695 jpeg_file_src (j_decompress_ptr cinfo, FILE *fp)
  8696 {
  8697   struct jpeg_stdio_mgr *src = (struct jpeg_stdio_mgr *) cinfo->src;
  8698 
  8699   if (! src)
  8700     {
  8701       /* First time for this JPEG object?  */
  8702       src = cinfo->mem->alloc_small ((j_common_ptr) cinfo,
  8703                                      JPOOL_PERMANENT, sizeof *src);
  8704       cinfo->src = (struct jpeg_source_mgr *) src;
  8705       src->buffer = cinfo->mem->alloc_small ((j_common_ptr) cinfo,
  8706                                              JPOOL_PERMANENT,
  8707                                              JPEG_STDIO_BUFFER_SIZE);
  8708     }
  8709 
  8710   src->file = fp;
  8711   src->finished = 0;
  8712   src->mgr.init_source = our_common_init_source;
  8713   src->mgr.fill_input_buffer = our_stdio_fill_input_buffer;
  8714   src->mgr.skip_input_data = our_stdio_skip_input_data;
  8715   src->mgr.resync_to_restart = jpeg_resync_to_restart; /* Use default.  */
  8716   src->mgr.term_source = our_common_term_source;
  8717   src->mgr.bytes_in_buffer = 0;
  8718   src->mgr.next_input_byte = NULL;
  8719 }
  8720 
  8721 /* Load image IMG for use on frame F.  Patterned after example.c
  8722    from the JPEG lib.  */
  8723 
  8724 static bool
  8725 jpeg_load_body (struct frame *f, struct image *img,
  8726                 struct my_jpeg_error_mgr *mgr)
  8727 {
  8728   Lisp_Object specified_file, specified_data;
  8729   FILE *volatile fp = NULL;
  8730   JSAMPARRAY buffer;
  8731   int row_stride, x, y;
  8732   int width, height;
  8733   int i, ir, ig, ib;
  8734   unsigned long *colors;
  8735   Emacs_Pix_Container ximg = NULL;
  8736 
  8737   /* Open the JPEG file.  */
  8738   specified_file = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCfile, NULL);
  8739   specified_data = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL);
  8740 
  8741   if (NILP (specified_data))
  8742     {
  8743       int fd;
  8744       Lisp_Object file = image_find_image_file (specified_file);
  8745       if (!STRINGP (file)
  8746           || (fd = emacs_open (SSDATA (ENCODE_FILE (file)),
  8747                                O_RDONLY, 0)) < 0)
  8748         {
  8749           image_error ("Cannot find image file `%s'", specified_file);
  8750           return 0;
  8751         }
  8752 
  8753       fp = fdopen (fd, "rb");
  8754       if (fp == NULL)
  8755         {
  8756           image_error ("Cannot open `%s'", file);
  8757           return 0;
  8758         }
  8759     }
  8760   else if (!STRINGP (specified_data))
  8761     {
  8762       image_error ("Invalid image data `%s'", specified_data);
  8763       return 0;
  8764     }
  8765 
  8766   /* Customize libjpeg's error handling to call my_error_exit when an
  8767      error is detected.  This function will perform a longjmp.  */
  8768   mgr->cinfo.err = jpeg_std_error (&mgr->pub);
  8769   mgr->pub.error_exit = my_error_exit;
  8770   if (sys_setjmp (mgr->setjmp_buffer))
  8771     {
  8772       switch (mgr->failure_code)
  8773         {
  8774         case MY_JPEG_ERROR_EXIT:
  8775           {
  8776             char buf[JMSG_LENGTH_MAX];
  8777             mgr->cinfo.err->format_message ((j_common_ptr) &mgr->cinfo, buf);
  8778             image_error ("Error reading JPEG image `%s': %s",
  8779                          img->spec, build_string (buf));
  8780             break;
  8781           }
  8782 
  8783         case MY_JPEG_INVALID_IMAGE_SIZE:
  8784           image_size_error ();
  8785           break;
  8786 
  8787         case MY_JPEG_CANNOT_CREATE_X:
  8788           break;
  8789         }
  8790 
  8791       /* Close the input file and destroy the JPEG object.  */
  8792       if (fp)
  8793         emacs_fclose (fp);
  8794       jpeg_destroy_decompress (&mgr->cinfo);
  8795 
  8796       /* If we already have an XImage, free that.  */
  8797       image_destroy_x_image (ximg);
  8798       /* Free pixmap and colors.  */
  8799       image_clear_image (f, img);
  8800       return 0;
  8801     }
  8802 
  8803   /* Create the JPEG decompression object.  Let it read from fp.
  8804          Read the JPEG image header.  */
  8805   jpeg_CreateDecompress (&mgr->cinfo, JPEG_LIB_VERSION, sizeof *&mgr->cinfo);
  8806 
  8807   if (NILP (specified_data))
  8808     jpeg_file_src (&mgr->cinfo, fp);
  8809   else
  8810     jpeg_memory_src (&mgr->cinfo, SDATA (specified_data),
  8811                      SBYTES (specified_data));
  8812 
  8813   jpeg_read_header (&mgr->cinfo, 1);
  8814 
  8815   /* Customize decompression so that color quantization will be used.
  8816          Start decompression.  */
  8817   mgr->cinfo.quantize_colors = 1;
  8818   jpeg_start_decompress (&mgr->cinfo);
  8819   width = img->width = mgr->cinfo.output_width;
  8820   height = img->height = mgr->cinfo.output_height;
  8821 
  8822   if (!check_image_size (f, width, height))
  8823     {
  8824       mgr->failure_code = MY_JPEG_INVALID_IMAGE_SIZE;
  8825       sys_longjmp (mgr->setjmp_buffer, 1);
  8826     }
  8827 
  8828   /* Create X image and pixmap.  */
  8829   if (!image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, 0, &ximg, 0))
  8830     {
  8831       mgr->failure_code = MY_JPEG_CANNOT_CREATE_X;
  8832       sys_longjmp (mgr->setjmp_buffer, 1);
  8833     }
  8834 
  8835   /* Allocate colors.  When color quantization is used,
  8836      mgr->cinfo.actual_number_of_colors has been set with the number of
  8837      colors generated, and mgr->cinfo.colormap is a two-dimensional array
  8838      of color indices in the range 0..mgr->cinfo.actual_number_of_colors.
  8839      No more than 255 colors will be generated.  */
  8840   USE_SAFE_ALLOCA;
  8841   {
  8842     if (mgr->cinfo.out_color_components > 2)
  8843       ir = 0, ig = 1, ib = 2;
  8844     else if (mgr->cinfo.out_color_components > 1)
  8845       ir = 0, ig = 1, ib = 0;
  8846     else
  8847       ir = 0, ig = 0, ib = 0;
  8848 
  8849     /* Use the color table mechanism because it handles colors that
  8850        cannot be allocated nicely.  Such colors will be replaced with
  8851        a default color, and we don't have to care about which colors
  8852        can be freed safely, and which can't.  */
  8853     init_color_table ();
  8854     SAFE_NALLOCA (colors, 1, mgr->cinfo.actual_number_of_colors);
  8855 
  8856     for (i = 0; i < mgr->cinfo.actual_number_of_colors; ++i)
  8857       {
  8858         /* Multiply RGB values with 255 because X expects RGB values
  8859            in the range 0..0xffff.  */
  8860         int r = mgr->cinfo.colormap[ir][i] << 8;
  8861         int g = mgr->cinfo.colormap[ig][i] << 8;
  8862         int b = mgr->cinfo.colormap[ib][i] << 8;
  8863         colors[i] = lookup_rgb_color (f, r, g, b);
  8864       }
  8865 
  8866 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
  8867     /* Remember those colors actually allocated.  */
  8868     img->colors = colors_in_color_table (&img->ncolors);
  8869     free_color_table ();
  8870 #endif /* COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT */
  8871   }
  8872 
  8873   /* Read pixels.  */
  8874   row_stride = width * mgr->cinfo.output_components;
  8875   buffer = mgr->cinfo.mem->alloc_sarray ((j_common_ptr) &mgr->cinfo,
  8876                                          JPOOL_IMAGE, row_stride, 1);
  8877   for (y = 0; y < height; ++y)
  8878     {
  8879       jpeg_read_scanlines (&mgr->cinfo, buffer, 1);
  8880       for (x = 0; x < mgr->cinfo.output_width; ++x)
  8881         PUT_PIXEL (ximg, x, y, colors[buffer[0][x]]);
  8882     }
  8883 
  8884   /* Clean up.  */
  8885   jpeg_finish_decompress (&mgr->cinfo);
  8886   jpeg_destroy_decompress (&mgr->cinfo);
  8887   if (fp)
  8888     emacs_fclose (fp);
  8889 
  8890   /* Maybe fill in the background field while we have ximg handy. */
  8891   if (NILP (image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL)))
  8892     /* Casting avoids a GCC warning.  */
  8893     IMAGE_BACKGROUND (img, f, (Emacs_Pix_Context)ximg);
  8894 
  8895   /* Put ximg into the image.  */
  8896   image_put_x_image (f, img, ximg, 0);
  8897   SAFE_FREE ();
  8898   return 1;
  8899 }
  8900 
  8901 static bool
  8902 jpeg_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  8903 {
  8904   struct my_jpeg_error_mgr mgr;
  8905   return jpeg_load_body (f, img, &mgr);
  8906 }
  8907 
  8908 #endif /* !HAVE_JPEG */
  8909 
  8910 
  8911 
  8912 /***********************************************************************
  8913                                  TIFF
  8914  ***********************************************************************/
  8915 
  8916 #if defined (HAVE_TIFF)
  8917 
  8918 /* Indices of image specification fields in tiff_format, below.  */
  8919 
  8920 enum tiff_keyword_index
  8921 {
  8922   TIFF_TYPE,
  8923   TIFF_DATA,
  8924   TIFF_FILE,
  8925   TIFF_ASCENT,
  8926   TIFF_MARGIN,
  8927   TIFF_RELIEF,
  8928   TIFF_ALGORITHM,
  8929   TIFF_HEURISTIC_MASK,
  8930   TIFF_MASK,
  8931   TIFF_BACKGROUND,
  8932   TIFF_INDEX,
  8933   TIFF_LAST
  8934 };
  8935 
  8936 /* Vector of image_keyword structures describing the format
  8937    of valid user-defined image specifications.  */
  8938 
  8939 static const struct image_keyword tiff_format[TIFF_LAST] =
  8940 {
  8941   {":type",             IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     1},
