  8942   {":data",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  8943   {":file",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  8944   {":ascent",           IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,                     0},
  8945   {":margin",           IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR, 0},
  8946   {":relief",           IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
  8947   {":conversions",      IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  8948   {":heuristic-mask",   IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  8949   {":mask",             IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  8950   {":background",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0},
  8951   {":index",            IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,       0}
  8952 };
  8953 
  8954 /* Return true if OBJECT is a valid TIFF image specification.  */
  8955 
  8956 static bool
  8957 tiff_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
  8958 {
  8959   struct image_keyword fmt[TIFF_LAST];
  8960   memcpy (fmt, tiff_format, sizeof fmt);
  8961 
  8962   if (!parse_image_spec (object, fmt, TIFF_LAST, Qtiff))
  8963     return 0;
  8964 
  8965   /* Must specify either the :data or :file keyword.  */
  8966   return fmt[TIFF_FILE].count + fmt[TIFF_DATA].count == 1;
  8967 }
  8968 
  8969 #endif /* HAVE_TIFF */
  8970 
  8971 #ifdef HAVE_TIFF
  8972 
  8973 # include <tiffio.h>
  8974 
  8975 /* libtiff version 4.3.0 deprecated uint32 typedef.  */
  8976 #if TIFFLIB_VERSION >= 20210416
  8977 # define UINT32 uint32_t
  8978 #else
  8979 # define UINT32 uint32
  8980 #endif
  8981 
  8982 # ifdef WINDOWSNT
  8983 
  8984 /* TIFF library details.  */
  8985 DEF_DLL_FN (TIFFErrorHandler, TIFFSetErrorHandler, (TIFFErrorHandler));
  8986 DEF_DLL_FN (TIFFErrorHandler, TIFFSetWarningHandler, (TIFFErrorHandler));
  8987 DEF_DLL_FN (TIFF *, TIFFOpen, (const char *, const char *));
  8988 DEF_DLL_FN (TIFF *, TIFFClientOpen,
  8989             (const char *, const char *, thandle_t, TIFFReadWriteProc,
  8990              TIFFReadWriteProc, TIFFSeekProc, TIFFCloseProc, TIFFSizeProc,
  8991              TIFFMapFileProc, TIFFUnmapFileProc));
  8992 DEF_DLL_FN (int, TIFFGetField, (TIFF *, ttag_t, ...));
  8993 DEF_DLL_FN (int, TIFFReadRGBAImage, (TIFF *, UINT32, UINT32, UINT32 *, int));
  8994 DEF_DLL_FN (void, TIFFClose, (TIFF *));
  8995 DEF_DLL_FN (int, TIFFSetDirectory, (TIFF *, tdir_t));
  8996 
  8997 static bool
  8998 init_tiff_functions (void)
  8999 {
  9000   HMODULE library;
  9001 
  9002   if (!(library = w32_delayed_load (Qtiff)))
  9003     return 0;
  9004 
  9005   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, TIFFSetErrorHandler);
  9006   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, TIFFSetWarningHandler);
  9007   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, TIFFOpen);
  9008   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, TIFFClientOpen);
  9009   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, TIFFGetField);
  9010   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, TIFFReadRGBAImage);
  9011   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, TIFFClose);
  9012   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, TIFFSetDirectory);
  9013   return 1;
  9014 }
  9015 
  9016 #  undef TIFFClientOpen
  9017 #  undef TIFFClose
  9018 #  undef TIFFGetField
  9019 #  undef TIFFOpen
  9020 #  undef TIFFReadRGBAImage
  9021 #  undef TIFFSetDirectory
  9022 #  undef TIFFSetErrorHandler
  9023 #  undef TIFFSetWarningHandler
  9024 
  9025 #  define TIFFClientOpen fn_TIFFClientOpen
  9026 #  define TIFFClose fn_TIFFClose
  9027 #  define TIFFGetField fn_TIFFGetField
  9028 #  define TIFFOpen fn_TIFFOpen
  9029 #  define TIFFReadRGBAImage fn_TIFFReadRGBAImage
  9030 #  define TIFFSetDirectory fn_TIFFSetDirectory
  9031 #  define TIFFSetErrorHandler fn_TIFFSetErrorHandler
  9032 #  define TIFFSetWarningHandler fn_TIFFSetWarningHandler
  9033 
  9034 # endif /* WINDOWSNT */
  9035 
  9036 
  9037 /* Reading from a memory buffer for TIFF images Based on the PNG
  9038    memory source, but we have to provide a lot of extra functions.
  9039    Blah.
  9040 
  9041    We really only need to implement read and seek, but I am not
  9042    convinced that the TIFF library is smart enough not to destroy
  9043    itself if we only hand it the function pointers we need to
  9044    override.  */
  9045 
  9046 typedef struct
  9047 {
  9048   unsigned char *bytes;
  9049   ptrdiff_t len;
  9050   ptrdiff_t index;
  9051 }
  9052 tiff_memory_source;
  9053 
  9054 static tsize_t
  9055 tiff_read_from_memory (thandle_t data, tdata_t buf, tsize_t size)
  9056 {
  9057   tiff_memory_source *src = (tiff_memory_source *) data;
  9058 
  9059   size = min (size, src->len - src->index);
  9060   memcpy (buf, src->bytes + src->index, size);
  9061   src->index += size;
  9062   return size;
  9063 }
  9064 
  9065 static tsize_t
  9066 tiff_write_from_memory (thandle_t data, tdata_t buf, tsize_t size)
  9067 {
  9068   return -1;
  9069 }
  9070 
  9071 static toff_t
  9072 tiff_seek_in_memory (thandle_t data, toff_t off, int whence)
  9073 {
  9074   tiff_memory_source *src = (tiff_memory_source *) data;
  9075   ptrdiff_t idx;
  9076 
  9077   switch (whence)
  9078     {
  9079     case SEEK_SET:              /* Go from beginning of source.  */
  9080       idx = off;
  9081       break;
  9082 
  9083     case SEEK_END:              /* Go from end of source.  */
  9084       idx = src->len + off;
  9085       break;
  9086 
  9087     case SEEK_CUR:              /* Go from current position.  */
  9088       idx = src->index + off;
  9089       break;
  9090 
  9091     default:                    /* Invalid `whence'.   */
  9092       return -1;
  9093     }
  9094 
  9095   if (idx > src->len || idx < 0)
  9096     return -1;
  9097 
  9098   src->index = idx;
  9099   return src->index;
  9100 }
  9101 
  9102 static int
  9103 tiff_close_memory (thandle_t data)
  9104 {
  9105   /* NOOP */
  9106   return 0;
  9107 }
  9108 
  9109 static int
  9110 tiff_mmap_memory (thandle_t data, tdata_t *pbase, toff_t *psize)
  9111 {
  9112   /* It is already _IN_ memory. */
  9113   return 0;
  9114 }
  9115 
  9116 static void
  9117 tiff_unmap_memory (thandle_t data, tdata_t base, toff_t size)
  9118 {
  9119   /* We don't need to do this. */
  9120 }
  9121 
  9122 static toff_t
  9123 tiff_size_of_memory (thandle_t data)
  9124 {
  9125   return ((tiff_memory_source *) data)->len;
  9126 }
  9127 
  9128 /* GCC 3.x on x86 Windows targets has a bug that triggers an internal
  9129    compiler error compiling tiff_handler, see Bugzilla bug #17406
  9130    (https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=17406).  Declaring
  9131    this function as external works around that problem.  */
  9132 # if defined (__MINGW32__) && __GNUC__ == 3
  9133 #  define MINGW_STATIC
  9134 # else
  9135 #  define MINGW_STATIC static
  9136 # endif
  9137 
  9138 MINGW_STATIC void
  9139 tiff_handler (const char *, const char *, const char *, va_list)
  9140   ATTRIBUTE_FORMAT_PRINTF (3, 0);
  9141 MINGW_STATIC void
  9142 tiff_handler (const char *log_format, const char *title,
  9143               const char *format, va_list ap)
  9144 {
  9145   /* doprnt is not suitable here, as TIFF handlers are called from
  9146      libtiff and are passed arbitrary printf directives.  Instead, use
  9147      vsnprintf, taking care to be portable to nonstandard environments
  9148      where vsnprintf returns -1 on buffer overflow.  Since it's just a
  9149      log entry, it's OK to truncate it.  */
  9150   char buf[4000];
  9151   int len = vsnprintf (buf, sizeof buf, format, ap);
  9152   add_to_log (log_format, build_string (title),
  9153               make_string (buf, max (0, min (len, sizeof buf - 1))));
  9154 }
  9155 # undef MINGW_STATIC
  9156 
  9157 static void tiff_error_handler (const char *, const char *, va_list)
  9158   ATTRIBUTE_FORMAT_PRINTF (2, 0);
  9159 static void
  9160 tiff_error_handler (const char *title, const char *format, va_list ap)
  9161 {
  9162   tiff_handler ("TIFF error: %s %s", title, format, ap);
  9163 }
  9164 
  9165 
  9166 static void tiff_warning_handler (const char *, const char *, va_list)
  9167   ATTRIBUTE_FORMAT_PRINTF (2, 0);
  9168 static void
  9169 tiff_warning_handler (const char *title, const char *format, va_list ap)
  9170 {
  9171   tiff_handler ("TIFF warning: %s %s", title, format, ap);
  9172 }
  9173 
  9174 
  9175 /* Load TIFF image IMG for use on frame F.  Value is true if
  9176    successful.  */
  9177 
  9178 static bool
  9179 tiff_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  9180 {
  9181   Lisp_Object specified_file;
  9182   Lisp_Object specified_data;
  9183   TIFF *tiff;
  9184   int width, height, x, y, count;
  9185   UINT32 *buf;
  9186   int rc;
  9187   Emacs_Pix_Container ximg;
  9188   tiff_memory_source memsrc;
  9189   Lisp_Object image;
  9190 
  9191   specified_file = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCfile, NULL);
  9192   specified_data = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL);
  9193 
  9194   TIFFSetErrorHandler ((TIFFErrorHandler) tiff_error_handler);
  9195   TIFFSetWarningHandler ((TIFFErrorHandler) tiff_warning_handler);
  9196 
  9197   if (NILP (specified_data))
  9198     {
  9199       /* Read from a file */
  9200       Lisp_Object file = image_find_image_file (specified_file);
  9201       if (!STRINGP (file))
  9202         {
  9203           image_error ("Cannot find image file `%s'", specified_file);
  9204           return 0;
  9205         }
  9206 
  9207       Lisp_Object encoded_file = ENCODE_FILE (file);
  9208 # ifdef WINDOWSNT
  9209       encoded_file = ansi_encode_filename (encoded_file);
  9210 # endif
  9211 
  9212       /* Try to open the image file.  */
  9213       tiff = TIFFOpen (SSDATA (encoded_file), "r");
  9214       if (tiff == NULL)
  9215         {
  9216           image_error ("Cannot open `%s'", file);
  9217           return 0;
  9218         }
  9219     }
  9220   else
  9221     {
  9222       if (!STRINGP (specified_data))
  9223         {
  9224           image_error ("Invalid image data `%s'", specified_data);
  9225           return 0;
  9226         }
  9227 
  9228       /* Memory source! */
  9229       memsrc.bytes = SDATA (specified_data);
  9230       memsrc.len = SBYTES (specified_data);
  9231       memsrc.index = 0;
  9232 
  9233       tiff = TIFFClientOpen ("memory_source", "r", (thandle_t)&memsrc,
  9234                              tiff_read_from_memory,
  9235                              tiff_write_from_memory,
  9236                              tiff_seek_in_memory,
  9237                              tiff_close_memory,
  9238                              tiff_size_of_memory,
  9239                              tiff_mmap_memory,
  9240                              tiff_unmap_memory);
  9241 
  9242       if (!tiff)
  9243         {
  9244           image_error ("Cannot open memory source for `%s'", img->spec);
  9245           return 0;
  9246         }
  9247     }
  9248 
  9249   image = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCindex, NULL);
  9250   if (FIXNUMP (image))
  9251     {
  9252       EMACS_INT ino = XFIXNAT (image);
  9253       if (! (TYPE_MINIMUM (tdir_t) <= ino && ino <= TYPE_MAXIMUM (tdir_t)
  9254              && TIFFSetDirectory (tiff, ino)))
  9255         {
  9256           image_error ("Invalid image number `%s' in image `%s'",
  9257                        image, img->spec);
  9258           TIFFClose (tiff);
  9259           return 0;
  9260         }
  9261     }
  9262 
  9263   /* Get width and height of the image, and allocate a raster buffer
  9264      of width x height 32-bit values.  */
  9265   TIFFGetField (tiff, TIFFTAG_IMAGEWIDTH, &width);
  9266   TIFFGetField (tiff, TIFFTAG_IMAGELENGTH, &height);
  9267 
  9268   if (!check_image_size (f, width, height))
  9269     {
  9270       image_size_error ();
  9271       TIFFClose (tiff);
  9272       return 0;
  9273     }
  9274 
  9275   /* Create the X image and pixmap.  */
  9276   if (! (height <= min (PTRDIFF_MAX, SIZE_MAX) / sizeof *buf / width
  9277          && image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, 0,
  9278                                              &ximg, 0)))
  9279     {
  9280       TIFFClose (tiff);
  9281       return 0;
  9282     }
  9283 
  9284   buf = xmalloc (sizeof *buf * width * height);
  9285 
  9286   rc = TIFFReadRGBAImage (tiff, width, height, buf, 0);
  9287 
  9288   /* Count the number of images in the file.  */
  9289   for (count = 1; TIFFSetDirectory (tiff, count); count++)
  9290     continue;
  9291 
  9292   if (count > 1)
  9293     img->lisp_data = Fcons (Qcount,
  9294                             Fcons (make_fixnum (count),
  9295                                    img->lisp_data));
  9296 
  9297   TIFFClose (tiff);
  9298   if (!rc)
  9299     {
  9300       image_error ("Error reading TIFF image `%s'", img->spec);
  9301       xfree (buf);
  9302       return 0;
  9303     }
  9304 
  9305   /* Initialize the color table.  */
  9306   init_color_table ();
  9307 
  9308   /* Process the pixel raster.  Origin is in the lower-left corner.  */
  9309   for (y = 0; y < height; ++y)
  9310     {
  9311       UINT32 *row = buf + y * width;
  9312 
  9313       for (x = 0; x < width; ++x)
  9314         {
  9315           UINT32 abgr = row[x];
  9316           int r = TIFFGetR (abgr) << 8;
  9317           int g = TIFFGetG (abgr) << 8;
  9318           int b = TIFFGetB (abgr) << 8;
  9319           PUT_PIXEL (ximg, x, height - 1 - y, lookup_rgb_color (f, r, g, b));
  9320         }
  9321     }
  9322 
  9323 # ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
  9324   /* Remember the colors allocated for the image.  Free the color table.  */
  9325   img->colors = colors_in_color_table (&img->ncolors);
  9326   free_color_table ();
  9327 # endif /* COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT */
  9328 
  9329   img->width = width;
  9330   img->height = height;
  9331 
  9332   /* Maybe fill in the background field while we have ximg handy. */
  9333   if (NILP (image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL)))
  9334     /* Casting avoids a GCC warning on W32.  */
  9335     IMAGE_BACKGROUND (img, f, (Emacs_Pix_Context)ximg);
  9336 
  9337   /* Put ximg into the image.  */
  9338   image_put_x_image (f, img, ximg, 0);
  9339 
  9340   xfree (buf);
  9341   return 1;
  9342 }
  9343 
  9344 #endif
  9345 
  9346 
  9347 
  9348 /***********************************************************************
  9349                                  GIF
  9350  ***********************************************************************/
  9351 
  9352 #if defined (HAVE_GIF)
  9353 
  9354 /* Indices of image specification fields in gif_format, below.  */
  9355 
  9356 enum gif_keyword_index
  9357 {
  9358   GIF_TYPE,
  9359   GIF_DATA,
  9360   GIF_FILE,
  9361   GIF_ASCENT,
  9362   GIF_MARGIN,
  9363   GIF_RELIEF,
  9364   GIF_ALGORITHM,
  9365   GIF_HEURISTIC_MASK,
  9366   GIF_MASK,
  9367   GIF_IMAGE,
  9368   GIF_BACKGROUND,
  9369   GIF_LAST
  9370 };
  9371 
  9372 /* Vector of image_keyword structures describing the format
  9373    of valid user-defined image specifications.  */
  9374 
  9375 static const struct image_keyword gif_format[GIF_LAST] =
  9376 {
  9377   {":type",             IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     1},
  9378   {":data",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  9379   {":file",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
  9380   {":ascent",           IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,                     0},
  9381   {":margin",           IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR, 0},
  9382   {":relief",           IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
  9383   {":conversion",       IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  9384   {":heuristic-mask",   IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  9385   {":mask",             IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
  9386   {":index",            IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,       0},
  9387   {":background",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0}
  9388 };
  9389 
  9390 /* Free X resources of GIF image IMG which is used on frame F.  */
  9391 
  9392 static void
  9393 gif_clear_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  9394 {
  9395   img->lisp_data = Qnil;
  9396   image_clear_image (f, img);
  9397 }
  9398 
  9399 /* Return true if OBJECT is a valid GIF image specification.  */
  9400 
  9401 static bool
  9402 gif_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
  9403 {
  9404   struct image_keyword fmt[GIF_LAST];
  9405   memcpy (fmt, gif_format, sizeof fmt);
  9406 
  9407   if (!parse_image_spec (object, fmt, GIF_LAST, Qgif))
  9408     return 0;
  9409 
  9410   /* Must specify either the :data or :file keyword.  */
  9411   return fmt[GIF_FILE].count + fmt[GIF_DATA].count == 1;
  9412 }
  9413 
  9414 #endif /* HAVE_GIF */
  9415 
  9416 #ifdef HAVE_GIF
  9417 
  9418 # ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
  9419 
  9420 /* winuser.h might define DrawText to DrawTextA or DrawTextW.
  9421    Undefine before redefining to avoid a preprocessor warning.  */
  9422 #  ifdef DrawText
  9423 #   undef DrawText
  9424 #  endif
  9425 /* avoid conflict with QuickdrawText.h */
  9426 #  define DrawText gif_DrawText
  9427 #  include <gif_lib.h>
  9428 /* The bogus ifdef below, which is always true, is to avoid a compiler
  9429    warning about DrawText being unused.  */
  9430 #  ifdef DrawText
  9431 #   undef DrawText
  9432 #  endif
  9433 
  9434 # else /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  9435 
  9436 #  include <gif_lib.h>
  9437 
  9438 # endif /* HAVE_NTGUI */
  9439 
  9440 /* Giflib before 4.1.6 didn't define these macros.  */
  9441 # ifndef GIFLIB_MAJOR
  9442 #  define GIFLIB_MAJOR 4
  9443 # endif
  9444 # ifndef GIFLIB_MINOR
  9445 #  define GIFLIB_MINOR 0
  9446 # endif
  9447 # ifndef GIFLIB_RELEASE
  9448 #  define GIFLIB_RELEASE 0
  9449 # endif
  9450 /* Giflib before 5.0 didn't define these macros.  */
  9451 # if GIFLIB_MAJOR < 5
  9452 #  define DISPOSAL_UNSPECIFIED    0    /* No disposal specified.  */
  9453 #  define DISPOSE_DO_NOT          1    /* Leave image in place.  */
  9454 #  define DISPOSE_BACKGROUND      2    /* Set area too background color.  */
  9455 #  define DISPOSE_PREVIOUS        3    /* Restore to previous content.  */
  9456 #  define NO_TRANSPARENT_COLOR    -1
  9457 # endif
  9458 
  9459 /* GifErrorString is declared to return char const * when GIFLIB_MAJOR
  9460    and GIFLIB_MINOR indicate 5.1 or later.  Do not bother using it in
  9461    earlier releases, where either it returns char * or GIFLIB_MINOR
  9462    may be incorrect.  */
  9463 # define HAVE_GIFERRORSTRING (5 < GIFLIB_MAJOR + (1 <= GIFLIB_MINOR))
  9464 
  9465 # ifdef WINDOWSNT
  9466 
  9467 /* GIF library details.  */
  9468 #  if GIFLIB_MAJOR + (GIFLIB_MINOR >= 1) > 5
  9469 DEF_DLL_FN (int, DGifCloseFile, (GifFileType *, int *));
  9470 #   else
  9471 DEF_DLL_FN (int, DGifCloseFile, (GifFileType *));
  9472 #  endif
  9473 DEF_DLL_FN (int, DGifSlurp, (GifFileType *));
  9474 #  if GIFLIB_MAJOR < 5
  9475 DEF_DLL_FN (GifFileType *, DGifOpen, (void *, InputFunc));
  9476 DEF_DLL_FN (GifFileType *, DGifOpenFileName, (const char *));
  9477 #  else
  9478 DEF_DLL_FN (GifFileType *, DGifOpen, (void *, InputFunc, int *));
  9479 DEF_DLL_FN (GifFileType *, DGifOpenFileName, (const char *, int *));
  9480 DEF_DLL_FN (int, DGifSavedExtensionToGCB,
  9481             (GifFileType *, int, GraphicsControlBlock *));
  9482 #  endif
  9483 #  if HAVE_GIFERRORSTRING
  9484 DEF_DLL_FN (char const *, GifErrorString, (int));
  9485 #  endif
  9486 
  9487 static bool
  9488 init_gif_functions (void)
  9489 {
  9490   HMODULE library;
  9491 
  9492   if (!(library = w32_delayed_load (Qgif)))
  9493     return 0;
  9494 
  9495   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, DGifCloseFile);
  9496   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, DGifSlurp);
  9497   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, DGifOpen);
  9498   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, DGifOpenFileName);
  9499 #  if GIFLIB_MAJOR >= 5
  9500   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, DGifSavedExtensionToGCB);
  9501 #  endif
  9502 #  if HAVE_GIFERRORSTRING
  9503   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, GifErrorString);
  9504 #  endif
  9505   return 1;
  9506 }
  9507 
  9508 #  undef DGifCloseFile
  9509 #  undef DGifOpen
  9510 #  undef DGifOpenFileName
  9511 #  undef DGifSlurp
  9512 #  if GIFLIB_MAJOR >= 5
  9513 #   undef DGifSavedExtensionToGCB
  9514 #  endif
  9515 #  undef GifErrorString
  9516 
  9517 #  define DGifCloseFile fn_DGifCloseFile
  9518 #  define DGifOpen fn_DGifOpen
  9519 #  define DGifOpenFileName fn_DGifOpenFileName
  9520 #  define DGifSlurp fn_DGifSlurp
  9521 #  if GIFLIB_MAJOR >= 5
  9522 #   define DGifSavedExtensionToGCB fn_DGifSavedExtensionToGCB
  9523 #  endif
  9524 #  define GifErrorString fn_GifErrorString
  9525 
  9526 # endif /* WINDOWSNT */
  9527 
  9528 /* Reading a GIF image from memory
  9529    Based on the PNG memory stuff to a certain extent. */
  9530 
  9531 typedef struct
  9532 {
  9533   unsigned char *bytes;
  9534   ptrdiff_t len;
  9535   ptrdiff_t index;
  9536 }
  9537 gif_memory_source;
  9538 
  9539 /* Make the current memory source available to gif_read_from_memory.
  9540    It's done this way because not all versions of libungif support
  9541    a UserData field in the GifFileType structure.  */
  9542 static gif_memory_source *current_gif_memory_src;
  9543 
  9544 static int
  9545 gif_read_from_memory (GifFileType *file, GifByteType *buf, int len)
  9546 {
  9547   gif_memory_source *src = current_gif_memory_src;
  9548 
  9549   if (len > src->len - src->index)
  9550     return -1;
  9551 
  9552   memcpy (buf, src->bytes + src->index, len);
  9553   src->index += len;
  9554   return len;
  9555 }
  9556 
  9557 static int
  9558 gif_close (GifFileType *gif, int *err)
  9559 {
  9560   int retval;
  9561 
  9562 #if GIFLIB_MAJOR + (GIFLIB_MINOR >= 1) > 5
  9563   retval = DGifCloseFile (gif, err);
  9564 #else
  9565   retval = DGifCloseFile (gif);
  9566 #if GIFLIB_MAJOR >= 5
  9567   if (err)
  9568     *err = gif->Error;
  9569 #endif
  9570 #endif
  9571   return retval;
  9572 }
  9573 
  9574 /* Load GIF image IMG for use on frame F.  Value is true if
  9575    successful.  */
  9576 
  9577 static const int interlace_start[] = {0, 4, 2, 1};
  9578 static const int interlace_increment[] = {8, 8, 4, 2};
  9579 
  9580 #define GIF_LOCAL_DESCRIPTOR_EXTENSION 249
  9581 
  9582 static void
  9583 gif_destroy (struct anim_cache* cache)
  9584 {
  9585   int gif_err;
  9586   gif_close (cache->handle, &gif_err);
  9587 }
  9588 
  9589 static bool
  9590 gif_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
  9591 {
  9592   int rc, width, height, x, y, i, j;
  9593   ColorMapObject *gif_color_map;
  9594   GifFileType *gif = NULL;
  9595   gif_memory_source memsrc;
  9596   Lisp_Object specified_bg = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL);
  9597   Lisp_Object specified_file = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCfile, NULL);
  9598   Lisp_Object specified_data = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL);
  9599   unsigned long *pixmap = NULL;
  9600   EMACS_INT idx = -1;
  9601   int gif_err;
  9602   struct anim_cache* cache = NULL;
  9603   /* Which sub-image are we to display?  */
  9604   Lisp_Object image_number = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCindex, NULL);
  9605   int byte_size = 0;
  9606 
  9607   idx = FIXNUMP (image_number) ? XFIXNAT (image_number) : 0;
  9608 
  9609   if (!NILP (image_number))
  9610     {
  9611       /* If this is an animated image, create a cache for it.  */
  9612       cache = anim_get_animation_cache (XCDR (img->spec));
  9613       /* We have an old cache entry, so use it.  */
  9614       if (cache->handle)
  9615         {
  9616           gif = cache->handle;
  9617           pixmap = cache->temp;
  9618           /* We're out of sync, so start from the beginning.  */
  9619           if (cache->index != idx - 1)
  9620             cache->index = -1;
  9621         }
  9622     }
  9623 
  9624   /* If we don't have a cached entry, read the image.  */
  9625   if (! gif)
  9626     {
  9627       if (NILP (specified_data))
  9628         {
  9629           Lisp_Object file = image_find_image_file (specified_file);
  9630           if (!STRINGP (file))
  9631             {
  9632               image_error ("Cannot find image file `%s'", specified_file);
  9633               return false;
  9634             }
  9635 
  9636           Lisp_Object encoded_file = ENCODE_FILE (file);
  9637 #ifdef WINDOWSNT
  9638           encoded_file = ansi_encode_filename (encoded_file);
  9639 #endif
  9640 
  9641           /* Open the GIF file.  */
  9642 #if GIFLIB_MAJOR < 5
  9643           gif = DGifOpenFileName (SSDATA (encoded_file));
  9644 #else
  9645           gif = DGifOpenFileName (SSDATA (encoded_file), &gif_err);
  9646 #endif
  9647           if (gif == NULL)
  9648             {
  9649 #if HAVE_GIFERRORSTRING
  9650               const char *errstr = GifErrorString (gif_err);
  9651               if (errstr)
  9652                 image_error ("Cannot open `%s': %s", file,
  9653                              build_string (errstr));
  9654               else
  9655 #endif
  9656                 image_error ("Cannot open `%s'", file);
  9657               return false;
  9658             }
  9659 
  9660           /* Get the file size so that we can report it in
  9661              `image-cache-size'.  */
  9662           {
  9663             struct stat st;
  9664             int fd;
  9665 
  9666             fd = emacs_open (SSDATA (encoded_file), O_RDONLY,
  9667                              0);
  9668             if (!sys_fstat (fd, &st))
  9669               byte_size = st.st_size;
  9670             emacs_close (fd);
  9671           }
  9672         }
  9673       else
  9674         {
  9675           if (!STRINGP (specified_data))
  9676             {
  9677               image_error ("Invalid image data `%s'", specified_data);
  9678               return false;
  9679             }
  9680 
  9681           /* Read from memory! */
  9682           current_gif_memory_src = &memsrc;
  9683           memsrc.bytes = SDATA (specified_data);
  9684           memsrc.len = SBYTES (specified_data);
  9685           memsrc.index = 0;
  9686           byte_size = memsrc.len;
  9687 
  9688 #if GIFLIB_MAJOR < 5
  9689           gif = DGifOpen (&memsrc, gif_read_from_memory);
  9690 #else
  9691           gif = DGifOpen (&memsrc, gif_read_from_memory, &gif_err);
  9692 #endif
  9693           if (!gif)
  9694             {
  9695 #if HAVE_GIFERRORSTRING
  9696               const char *errstr = GifErrorString (gif_err);
  9697               if (errstr)
  9698                 image_error ("Cannot open memory source `%s': %s",
  9699                              img->spec, build_string (errstr));
  9700               else
  9701 #endif
  9702                 image_error ("Cannot open memory source `%s'", img->spec);
  9703               return false;
  9704             }
  9705         }
  9706 
  9707       /* Before reading entire contents, check the declared image size. */
  9708       if (!check_image_size (f, gif->SWidth, gif->SHeight))
  9709         {
  9710           image_size_error ();
  9711           goto gif_error;
  9712         }
  9713 
  9714       /* Read entire contents.  */
  9715       rc = DGifSlurp (gif);
  9716       if (rc == GIF_ERROR || gif->ImageCount <= 0)
  9717         {
  9718 #if HAVE_GIFERRORSTRING
  9719           const char *errstr = GifErrorString (gif->Error);
  9720           if (errstr)
  9721             if (NILP (specified_data))
  9722               image_error ("Error reading `%s' (%s)", img->spec,
  9723                            build_string (errstr));
  9724             else
  9725               image_error ("Error reading GIF data: %s",
  9726                            build_string (errstr));
  9727           else
  9728 #endif
  9729             if (NILP (specified_data))
  9730               image_error ("Error reading `%s'", img->spec);
  9731             else
  9732               image_error ("Error reading GIF data");
  9733           goto gif_error;
  9734         }
  9735 
  9736       width = img->width = gif->SWidth;
  9737       height = img->height = gif->SHeight;
  9738 
  9739       /* Check that the selected subimages fit.  It's not clear whether
  9740          the GIF spec requires this, but Emacs can crash if they don't fit.  */
  9741       for (j = 0; j < gif->ImageCount; ++j)
  9742         {
  9743           struct SavedImage *subimage = gif->SavedImages + j;
  9744           int subimg_width = subimage->ImageDesc.Width;
  9745           int subimg_height = subimage->ImageDesc.Height;
  9746           int subimg_top = subimage->ImageDesc.Top;
  9747           int subimg_left = subimage->ImageDesc.Left;
  9748           if (subimg_width < 0
  9749               || subimg_height < 0
  9750               || subimg_top < 0
  9751               || subimg_left < 0
  9752               || subimg_top + subimg_height > height
  9753               || subimg_left + subimg_width > width)
  9754             {
  9755               image_error ("Subimage does not fit in image");
  9756               goto gif_error;
  9757             }
  9758         }
  9759     }
  9760   else
  9761     {
  9762       /* Cached image; set data.  */
  9763       width = img->width = gif->SWidth;
  9764       height = img->height = gif->SHeight;
  9765     }
  9766 
  9767   if (idx < 0 || idx >= gif->ImageCount)
  9768     {
  9769       image_error ("Invalid image number `%s' in image `%s'",
  9770                    make_fixnum (idx), img->spec);
  9771       goto gif_error;
  9772     }
  9773 
  9774   /* It's an animated image, so initialize the cache.  */
  9775   if (cache && !cache->handle)
  9776     {
  9777       cache->handle = gif;
  9778       cache->destructor = (void (*)(void *)) &gif_destroy;
  9779       cache->width = width;
  9780       cache->height = height;
  9781       cache->byte_size = byte_size;
  9782     }
  9783 
  9784   img->corners[TOP_CORNER] = gif->SavedImages[0].ImageDesc.Top;
  9785   img->corners[LEFT_CORNER] = gif->SavedImages[0].ImageDesc.Left;
  9786   img->corners[BOT_CORNER]
  9787     = img->corners[TOP_CORNER] + gif->SavedImages[0].ImageDesc.Height;
  9788   img->corners[RIGHT_CORNER]
  9789     = img->corners[LEFT_CORNER] + gif->SavedImages[0].ImageDesc.Width;
  9790 
  9791   if (!check_image_size (f, width, height))
  9792     {
  9793       image_size_error ();
  9794       goto gif_error;
  9795     }
  9796 
  9797   /* Create the X image and pixmap.  */
  9798   Emacs_Pix_Container ximg;
  9799   if (!image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, 0, &ximg, 0))
  9800     goto gif_error;
  9801 
  9802   /* We construct the (possibly composited animated) image in this
  9803      buffer.  */
  9804   if (!pixmap)
  9805     {
  9806       pixmap = xmalloc (width * height * sizeof (unsigned long));
  9807       if (cache)
  9808         cache->temp = pixmap;
  9809     }
  9810 
  9811   /* Clear the part of the screen image not covered by the image.
  9812      Full animated GIF support requires more here (see the gif89 spec,
  9813      disposal methods).  Let's simply assume that the part not covered
  9814      by a sub-image is in the frame's background color.  */
  9815   unsigned long frame_bg;
  9816 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
  9817   frame_bg = FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f);
  9818 #else  /* USE_CAIRO */
  9819   {
  9820     Emacs_Color color;
  9821     FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->query_frame_background_color (f, &color);
  9822     frame_bg = lookup_rgb_color (f, color.red, color.green, color.blue);
  9823   }
  9824 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
  9825 
  9826   for (y = 0; y < img->corners[TOP_CORNER]; ++y)
  9827     for (x = 0; x < width; ++x)
  9828       *(pixmap + x + y * width) = frame_bg;
  9829 
  9830   for (y = img->corners[BOT_CORNER]; y < height; ++y)
  9831     for (x = 0; x < width; ++x)
  9832       *(pixmap + x + y * width) = frame_bg;
  9833 
  9834   for (y = img->corners[TOP_CORNER]; y < img->corners[BOT_CORNER]; ++y)
  9835     {
  9836       for (x = 0; x < img->corners[LEFT_CORNER]; ++x)
  9837         *(pixmap + x + y * width) = frame_bg;
  9838       for (x = img->corners[RIGHT_CORNER]; x < width; ++x)
  9839         *(pixmap + x + y * width) = frame_bg;
  9840     }
  9841 
  9842   /* Read the GIF image into the X image.   */
  9843 
  9844   init_color_table ();
  9845 
  9846   unsigned long bgcolor UNINIT;
  9847   if (STRINGP (specified_bg))
  9848     {
  9849       bgcolor = image_alloc_image_color (f, img, specified_bg,
  9850                                          FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f));
  9851 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  9852       Emacs_Color color = {.pixel = bgcolor};
  9853       FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->query_colors (f, &color, 1);
  9854       bgcolor = lookup_rgb_color (f, color.red, color.green, color.blue);
  9855 #endif
  9856     }
  9857 
  9858   int start_frame = 0;
  9859 
  9860   /* We have animation data in the cache.  */
  9861   if (cache && cache->temp)
  9862     {
  9863       start_frame = cache->index + 1;
  9864       if (start_frame > idx)
  9865         start_frame = 0;
  9866       cache->index = idx;
  9867     }
  9868 
  9869   for (j = start_frame; j <= idx; ++j)
  9870     {
  9871       /* We use a local variable `raster' here because RasterBits is a
  9872          char *, which invites problems with bytes >= 0x80.  */
  9873       struct SavedImage *subimage = gif->SavedImages + j;
  9874       unsigned char *raster = (unsigned char *) subimage->RasterBits;
  9875       int subimg_width = subimage->ImageDesc.Width;
  9876       int subimg_height = subimage->ImageDesc.Height;
  9877       int subimg_top = subimage->ImageDesc.Top;
  9878       int subimg_left = subimage->ImageDesc.Left;
  9879 
  9880       /* From gif89a spec: 1 = "keep in place", 2 = "restore
  9881          to background".  Treat any other value like 2.  */
  9882       int disposal = DISPOSAL_UNSPECIFIED;
  9883       int transparency_color_index = NO_TRANSPARENT_COLOR;
  9884 
  9885 #if GIFLIB_MAJOR < 5
  9886       /* Find the Graphic Control Extension block for this sub-image.
  9887          Extract the disposal method and transparency color.  */
  9888       for (i = 0; i < subimage->ExtensionBlockCount; i++)
  9889         {
  9890           ExtensionBlock *extblock = subimage->ExtensionBlocks + i;
  9891 
  9892           if ((extblock->Function == GIF_LOCAL_DESCRIPTOR_EXTENSION)
  9893               && extblock->ByteCount == 4
  9894               && extblock->Bytes[0] & 1)
  9895             {
  9896               disposal = (extblock->Bytes[0] >> 2) & 7;
  9897               transparency_color_index = (unsigned char) extblock->Bytes[3];
  9898               break;
  9899             }
  9900         }
  9901 #else
  9902       GraphicsControlBlock gcb;
  9903       DGifSavedExtensionToGCB (gif, j, &gcb);
  9904       disposal = gcb.DisposalMode;
  9905       transparency_color_index = gcb.TransparentColor;
  9906 #endif
  9907 
  9908       /* We can't "keep in place" the first subimage.  */
  9909       if (j == 0)
  9910         disposal = DISPOSE_BACKGROUND;
  9911 
  9912       /* For disposal == 0 (DISPOSAL_UNSPECIFIED), the spec says
  9913          "No disposal specified.  The decoder is not required to take
  9914          any action."  In practice, it seems we need to treat this
  9915          like "keep in place" (DISPOSE_DO_NOT), see e.g.
  9916          https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/3/37/Clock.gif */
  9917       if (disposal == DISPOSAL_UNSPECIFIED)
  9918         disposal = DISPOSE_DO_NOT;
  9919 
  9920       /* This is not quite correct -- the specification is unclear,
  9921          but I think we're supposed to restore to the frame before the
  9922          previous frame?  And we don't have that data at this point.
  9923          But DISPOSE_DO_NOT is less wrong than substituting the
  9924          background, so do that for now.  */
  9925       if (disposal == DISPOSE_PREVIOUS)
  9926         disposal = DISPOSE_DO_NOT;
  9927 
  9928       gif_color_map = subimage->ImageDesc.ColorMap;
  9929       if (!gif_color_map)
  9930         gif_color_map = gif->SColorMap;
  9931 
  9932       /* Allocate subimage colors.  */
  9933       unsigned long pixel_colors[256] = { 0, };
  9934 
  9935       if (gif_color_map)
  9936         for (i = 0; i < gif_color_map->ColorCount; ++i)
  9937           {
  9938             if (transparency_color_index == i)
  9939               pixel_colors[i] = STRINGP (specified_bg)
  9940                 ? bgcolor : frame_bg;
  9941             else
  9942               {
  9943                 int r = gif_color_map->Colors[i].Red << 8;
  9944                 int g = gif_color_map->Colors[i].Green << 8;
  9945                 int b = gif_color_map->Colors[i].Blue << 8;
  9946                 pixel_colors[i] = lookup_rgb_color (f, r, g, b);
  9947               }
  9948           }
  9949 
  9950       /* Apply the pixel values.  */
  9951       if (GIFLIB_MAJOR < 5 && gif->SavedImages[j].ImageDesc.Interlace)
  9952         {
  9953           int row, pass;
  9954 
  9955           for (y = 0, row = interlace_start[0], pass = 0;
  9956                y < subimg_height;
  9957                y++, row += interlace_increment[pass])
  9958             {
  9959               while (subimg_height <= row)
  9960                 row = interlace_start[++pass];
  9961 
  9962               for (x = 0; x < subimg_width; x++)
  9963                 {
  9964                   int c = raster[y * subimg_width + x];
  9965                   if (transparency_color_index != c || disposal != DISPOSE_DO_NOT)
  9966                     {
  9967                       *(pixmap + x + subimg_left + (y + subimg_top) * width) =
  9968                         pixel_colors[c];
  9969                     }
  9970                 }
  9971             }
  9972         }
  9973       else
  9974         {
  9975           for (y = 0; y < subimg_height; ++y)
  9976             for (x = 0; x < subimg_width; ++x)
  9977               {
  9978                 int c = raster[y * subimg_width + x];
  9979                 if (transparency_color_index != c || disposal != DISPOSE_DO_NOT)
  9980                   {
  9981                     *(pixmap + x + subimg_left + (y + subimg_top) * width) =
  9982                       pixel_colors[c];
  9983                   }
  9984               }
  9985         }
  9986     }
  9987 
  9988   /* We now have the complete image (possibly composed from a series
  9989      of animated frames) in pixmap.  Put it into ximg.  */
  9990   for (y = 0; y < height; ++y)
  9991     for (x = 0; x < width; ++x)
  9992       PUT_PIXEL (ximg, x, y, *(pixmap + x + y * width));
  9993 
  9994 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
  9995   img->colors = colors_in_color_table (&img->ncolors);
  9996   free_color_table ();
  9997 #endif /* COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT */
  9998 
  9999   /* Save GIF image extension data for `image-metadata'.
 10000      Format is (count IMAGES extension-data (FUNCTION "BYTES" ...)).  */
 10001   img->lisp_data = Qnil;
 10002   if (gif->SavedImages[idx].ExtensionBlockCount > 0)
 10003     {
 10004       int delay = 0;
 10005       ExtensionBlock *ext = gif->SavedImages[idx].ExtensionBlocks;
 10006       for (i = 0; i < gif->SavedImages[idx].ExtensionBlockCount; i++, ext++)
 10007         /* Append (... FUNCTION "BYTES") */
 10008         {
 10009           img->lisp_data
 10010             = Fcons (make_fixnum (ext->Function),
 10011                      Fcons (make_unibyte_string ((char *) ext->Bytes,
 10012                                                  ext->ByteCount),
 10013                             img->lisp_data));
 10014           if (ext->Function == GIF_LOCAL_DESCRIPTOR_EXTENSION
 10015               && ext->ByteCount == 4)
 10016             {
 10017               delay = ext->Bytes[2] << CHAR_BIT;
 10018               delay |= ext->Bytes[1];
 10019             }
 10020         }
 10021       img->lisp_data = list2 (Qextension_data, img->lisp_data);
 10022       img->lisp_data
 10023         = Fcons (Qdelay,
 10024                  /* Default GIF delay is 1/15th of a second.  */
 10025                  Fcons (make_float (delay? delay / 100.0: 1.0 / 15),
 10026                         img->lisp_data));
 10027     }
 10028 
 10029   if (gif->ImageCount > 1)
 10030     img->lisp_data = Fcons (Qcount,
 10031                             Fcons (make_fixnum (gif->ImageCount),
 10032                                    img->lisp_data));
 10033 
 10034   if (!cache)
 10035     {
 10036       if (pixmap)
 10037         xfree (pixmap);
 10038       if (gif_close (gif, &gif_err) == GIF_ERROR)
 10039         {
 10040 #if HAVE_GIFERRORSTRING
 10041           char const *error_text = GifErrorString (gif_err);
 10042 
 10043           if (error_text)
 10044             image_error ("Error closing `%s': %s",
 10045                          img->spec, build_string (error_text));
 10046           else
 10047 #endif
 10048             image_error ("Error closing `%s'", img->spec);
 10049         }
 10050     }
 10051 
 10052   /* Maybe fill in the background field while we have ximg handy. */
 10053   if (NILP (image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL)))
 10054     /* Casting avoids a GCC warning.  */
 10055     IMAGE_BACKGROUND (img, f, (Emacs_Pix_Context)ximg);
 10056 
 10057   /* Put ximg into the image.  */
 10058   image_put_x_image (f, img, ximg, 0);
 10059 
 10060   return true;
 10061 
 10062  gif_error:
 10063   if (pixmap)
 10064     xfree (pixmap);
 10065   gif_close (gif, NULL);
 10066   if (cache)
 10067     {
 10068       cache->handle = NULL;
 10069       cache->temp = NULL;
 10070     }
 10071   return false;
 10072 }
 10073 
 10074 #endif /* HAVE_GIF */
 10075 
 10076 
 10077 #ifdef HAVE_WEBP
 10078 
 10079 
 10080 /***********************************************************************
 10081                                  WebP
 10082  ***********************************************************************/
 10083 
 10084 #include "webp/decode.h"
 10085 #include "webp/demux.h"
 10086 
 10087 /* Indices of image specification fields in webp_format, below.  */
 10088 
 10089 enum webp_keyword_index
 10090 {
 10091   WEBP_TYPE,
 10092   WEBP_DATA,
 10093   WEBP_FILE,
 10094   WEBP_ASCENT,
 10095   WEBP_MARGIN,
 10096   WEBP_RELIEF,
 10097   WEBP_ALGORITHM,
 10098   WEBP_HEURISTIC_MASK,
 10099   WEBP_MASK,
 10100   WEBP_INDEX,
 10101   WEBP_BACKGROUND,
 10102   WEBP_LAST
 10103 };
 10104 
 10105 /* Vector of image_keyword structures describing the format
 10106    of valid user-defined image specifications.  */
 10107 
 10108 static const struct image_keyword webp_format[WEBP_LAST] =
 10109 {
 10110   {":type",             IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     1},
 10111   {":data",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
 10112   {":file",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
 10113   {":ascent",           IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,                     0},
 10114   {":margin",           IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR, 0},
 10115   {":relief",           IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
 10116   {":conversion",       IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
 10117   {":heuristic-mask",   IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
 10118   {":mask",             IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
 10119   {":index",            IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,       0},
 10120   {":background",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0}
 10121 };
 10122 
 10123 /* Return true if OBJECT is a valid WebP image specification.  */
 10124 
 10125 static bool
 10126 webp_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
 10127 {
 10128   struct image_keyword fmt[WEBP_LAST];
 10129   memcpy (fmt, webp_format, sizeof fmt);
 10130 
 10131   if (!parse_image_spec (object, fmt, WEBP_LAST, Qwebp))
 10132     return false;
 10133 
 10134   /* Must specify either the :data or :file keyword.  */
 10135   return fmt[WEBP_FILE].count + fmt[WEBP_DATA].count == 1;
 10136 }
 10137 
 10138 #ifdef WINDOWSNT
 10139 
 10140 /* WebP library details.  */
 10141 
 10142 DEF_DLL_FN (int, WebPGetInfo, (const uint8_t *, size_t, int *, int *));
 10143 /* WebPGetFeatures is a static inline function defined in WebP's
 10144    decode.h.  Since we cannot use that with dynamically-loaded libwebp
 10145    DLL, we instead load the internal function it calls and redirect to
 10146    that through a macro.  */
 10147 DEF_DLL_FN (VP8StatusCode, WebPGetFeaturesInternal,
 10148             (const uint8_t *, size_t, WebPBitstreamFeatures *, int));
 10149 DEF_DLL_FN (uint8_t *, WebPDecodeRGBA, (const uint8_t *, size_t, int *, int *));
 10150 DEF_DLL_FN (uint8_t *, WebPDecodeRGB, (const uint8_t *, size_t, int *, int *));
 10151 DEF_DLL_FN (void, WebPFree, (void *));
 10152 DEF_DLL_FN (uint32_t, WebPDemuxGetI, (const WebPDemuxer *, WebPFormatFeature));
 10153 DEF_DLL_FN (WebPDemuxer *, WebPDemuxInternal,
 10154             (const WebPData *, int, WebPDemuxState *, int));
 10155 DEF_DLL_FN (void, WebPDemuxDelete, (WebPDemuxer *));
 10156 DEF_DLL_FN (int, WebPAnimDecoderGetNext,
 10157             (WebPAnimDecoder *, uint8_t **, int *));
 10158 DEF_DLL_FN (WebPAnimDecoder *, WebPAnimDecoderNewInternal,
 10159             (const WebPData *, const WebPAnimDecoderOptions *, int));
 10160 DEF_DLL_FN (int, WebPAnimDecoderOptionsInitInternal,
 10161             (WebPAnimDecoderOptions *, int));
 10162 DEF_DLL_FN (int, WebPAnimDecoderHasMoreFrames, (const WebPAnimDecoder *));
 10163 DEF_DLL_FN (void, WebPAnimDecoderDelete, (WebPAnimDecoder *));
 10164 
 10165 static bool
 10166 init_webp_functions (void)
 10167 {
 10168   HMODULE library1, library2;
 10169 
 10170   if (!((library1 = w32_delayed_load (Qwebp))
 10171         && (library2 = w32_delayed_load (Qwebpdemux))))
 10172     return false;
 10173 
 10174   LOAD_DLL_FN (library1, WebPGetInfo);
 10175   LOAD_DLL_FN (library1, WebPGetFeaturesInternal);
 10176   LOAD_DLL_FN (library1, WebPDecodeRGBA);
 10177   LOAD_DLL_FN (library1, WebPDecodeRGB);
 10178   LOAD_DLL_FN (library1, WebPFree);
 10179   LOAD_DLL_FN (library2, WebPDemuxGetI);
 10180   LOAD_DLL_FN (library2, WebPDemuxInternal);
 10181   LOAD_DLL_FN (library2, WebPDemuxDelete);
 10182   LOAD_DLL_FN (library2, WebPAnimDecoderGetNext);
 10183   LOAD_DLL_FN (library2, WebPAnimDecoderNewInternal);
 10184   LOAD_DLL_FN (library2, WebPAnimDecoderOptionsInitInternal);
 10185   LOAD_DLL_FN (library2, WebPAnimDecoderHasMoreFrames);
 10186   LOAD_DLL_FN (library2, WebPAnimDecoderDelete);
 10187   return true;
 10188 }
 10189 
 10190 #undef WebPGetInfo
 10191 #undef WebPGetFeatures
 10192 #undef WebPDecodeRGBA
 10193 #undef WebPDecodeRGB
 10194 #undef WebPFree
 10195 #undef WebPDemuxGetI
 10196 #undef WebPDemux
 10197 #undef WebPDemuxDelete
 10198 #undef WebPAnimDecoderGetNext
 10199 #undef WebPAnimDecoderNew
 10200 #undef WebPAnimDecoderOptionsInit
 10201 #undef WebPAnimDecoderHasMoreFrames
 10202 #undef WebPAnimDecoderDelete
 10203 
 10204 #define WebPGetInfo fn_WebPGetInfo
 10205 #define WebPGetFeatures(d,s,f)                                  \
 10206   fn_WebPGetFeaturesInternal(d,s,f,WEBP_DECODER_ABI_VERSION)
 10207 #define WebPDecodeRGBA fn_WebPDecodeRGBA
 10208 #define WebPDecodeRGB fn_WebPDecodeRGB
 10209 #define WebPFree fn_WebPFree
 10210 #define WebPDemuxGetI fn_WebPDemuxGetI
 10211 #define WebPDemux(d)                                            \
 10212   fn_WebPDemuxInternal(d,0,NULL,WEBP_DEMUX_ABI_VERSION)
 10213 #define WebPDemuxDelete fn_WebPDemuxDelete
 10214 #define WebPAnimDecoderGetNext fn_WebPAnimDecoderGetNext
 10215 #define WebPAnimDecoderNew(d,o)                                 \
 10216   fn_WebPAnimDecoderNewInternal(d,o,WEBP_DEMUX_ABI_VERSION)
 10217 #define WebPAnimDecoderOptionsInit(o)                           \
 10218   fn_WebPAnimDecoderOptionsInitInternal(o,WEBP_DEMUX_ABI_VERSION)
 10219 #define WebPAnimDecoderHasMoreFrames fn_WebPAnimDecoderHasMoreFrames
 10220 #define WebPAnimDecoderDelete fn_WebPAnimDecoderDelete
 10221 
 10222 #endif /* WINDOWSNT */
 10223 
 10224 static void
 10225 webp_destroy (struct anim_cache* cache)
 10226 {
 10227   WebPAnimDecoderDelete (cache->handle);
 10228 }
 10229 
 10230 /* Load WebP image IMG for use on frame F.  Value is true if
 10231    successful.  */
 10232 
 10233 static bool
 10234 webp_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
 10235 {
 10236   ptrdiff_t size = 0;
 10237   uint8_t *contents;
 10238   Lisp_Object file = Qnil;
 10239   int frames = 0;
 10240   double delay = 0;
 10241   WebPAnimDecoder* anim = NULL;
 10242 
 10243   /* Open the WebP file.  */
 10244   Lisp_Object specified_file = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCfile, NULL);
 10245   Lisp_Object specified_data = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL);
 10246 
 10247   if (NILP (specified_data))
 10248     {
 10249       image_fd fd;
 10250       file = image_find_image_fd (specified_file, &fd);
 10251       if (!STRINGP (file))
 10252         {
 10253           image_error ("Cannot find image file `%s'", specified_file);
 10254           return false;
 10255         }
 10256 
 10257       contents = (uint8_t *) slurp_file (fd, &size);
 10258       if (contents == NULL)
 10259         {
 10260           image_error ("Error loading WebP image `%s'", file);
 10261           return false;
 10262         }
 10263     }
 10264   else
 10265     {
 10266       if (!STRINGP (specified_data))
 10267         {
 10268           image_error ("Invalid image data `%s'", specified_data);
 10269           return false;
 10270         }
 10271       contents = SDATA (specified_data);
 10272       size = SBYTES (specified_data);
 10273     }
 10274 
 10275   /* Validate the WebP image header.  */
 10276   if (!WebPGetInfo (contents, size, NULL, NULL))
 10277     {
 10278       if (!NILP (file))
 10279         image_error ("Not a WebP file: `%s'", file);
 10280       else
 10281         image_error ("Invalid header in WebP image data");
 10282       goto webp_error1;
 10283     }
 10284 
 10285   Lisp_Object image_number = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCindex, NULL);
 10286   ptrdiff_t idx = FIXNUMP (image_number) ? XFIXNAT (image_number) : 0;
 10287 
 10288   /* Get WebP features.  */
 10289   WebPBitstreamFeatures features;
 10290   VP8StatusCode result = WebPGetFeatures (contents, size, &features);
 10291   switch (result)
 10292     {
 10293     case VP8_STATUS_OK:
 10294       break;
 10295     case VP8_STATUS_NOT_ENOUGH_DATA:
 10296     case VP8_STATUS_OUT_OF_MEMORY:
 10297     case VP8_STATUS_INVALID_PARAM:
 10298     case VP8_STATUS_BITSTREAM_ERROR:
 10299     case VP8_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE:
 10300     case VP8_STATUS_SUSPENDED:
 10301     case VP8_STATUS_USER_ABORT:
 10302     default:
 10303       /* Error out in all other cases.  */
 10304       if (!NILP (file))
 10305         image_error ("Error when interpreting WebP image data: `%s'", file);
 10306       else
 10307         image_error ("Error when interpreting WebP image data");
 10308       goto webp_error1;
 10309     }
 10310 
 10311   uint8_t *decoded = NULL;
 10312   int width, height;
 10313 
 10314   if (features.has_animation)
 10315     {
 10316       /* Animated image.  */
 10317       int timestamp;
 10318 
 10319       struct anim_cache* cache = anim_get_animation_cache (XCDR (img->spec));
 10320       /* Get the next frame from the animation cache.  */
 10321       if (cache->handle && cache->index == idx - 1)
 10322         {
 10323           WebPAnimDecoderGetNext (cache->handle, &decoded, &timestamp);
 10324           delay = timestamp;
 10325           cache->index++;
 10326           anim = cache->handle;
 10327           width = cache->width;
 10328           height = cache->height;
 10329           frames = cache->frames;
 10330         }
 10331       else
 10332         {
 10333           /* Start a new cache entry.  */
 10334           if (cache->handle)
 10335             WebPAnimDecoderDelete (cache->handle);
 10336 
 10337           WebPData webp_data;
 10338           if (NILP (specified_data))
 10339             /* If we got the data from a file, then we don't need to
 10340                copy the data. */
 10341             webp_data.bytes = cache->temp = contents;
 10342           else
 10343             /* We got the data from a string, so copy it over so that
 10344                it doesn't get garbage-collected.  */
 10345             {
 10346               webp_data.bytes = xmalloc (size);
 10347               memcpy ((void*) webp_data.bytes, contents, size);
 10348             }
 10349           /* In any case, we release the allocated memory when we
 10350              purge the anim cache.  */
 10351           webp_data.size = size;
 10352 
 10353           /* This is used just for reporting by `image-cache-size'.  */
 10354           cache->byte_size = size;
 10355 
 10356           /* Get the width/height of the total image.  */
 10357           WebPDemuxer* demux = WebPDemux (&webp_data);
 10358           cache->width = width = WebPDemuxGetI (demux, WEBP_FF_CANVAS_WIDTH);
 10359           cache->height = height = WebPDemuxGetI (demux,
 10360                                                   WEBP_FF_CANVAS_HEIGHT);
 10361           cache->frames = frames = WebPDemuxGetI (demux, WEBP_FF_FRAME_COUNT);
 10362           cache->destructor = (void (*)(void *)) webp_destroy;
 10363           WebPDemuxDelete (demux);
 10364 
 10365           WebPAnimDecoderOptions dec_options;
 10366           WebPAnimDecoderOptionsInit (&dec_options);
 10367           anim = WebPAnimDecoderNew (&webp_data, &dec_options);
 10368 
 10369           cache->handle = anim;
 10370           cache->index = idx;
 10371 
 10372           while (WebPAnimDecoderHasMoreFrames (anim)) {
 10373             WebPAnimDecoderGetNext (anim, &decoded, &timestamp);
 10374             /* Each frame has its own delay, but we don't really support
 10375                that.  So just use the delay from the first frame.  */
 10376             if (delay == 0)
 10377               delay = timestamp;
 10378             /* Stop when we get to the desired index.  */
 10379             if (idx-- == 0)
 10380               break;
 10381           }
 10382         }
 10383     }
 10384   else
 10385     {
 10386       /* Non-animated image.  */
 10387       if (features.has_alpha)
 10388         /* Linear [r0, g0, b0, a0, r1, g1, b1, a1, ...] order.  */
 10389         decoded = WebPDecodeRGBA (contents, size, &width, &height);
 10390       else
 10391         /* Linear [r0, g0, b0, r1, g1, b1, ...] order.  */
 10392         decoded = WebPDecodeRGB (contents, size, &width, &height);
 10393     }
 10394 
 10395   if (!decoded)
 10396     {
 10397       image_error ("Error when decoding WebP image data");
 10398       goto webp_error1;
 10399     }
 10400 
 10401   if (!(width <= INT_MAX && height <= INT_MAX
 10402         && check_image_size (f, width, height)))
 10403     {
 10404       image_size_error ();
 10405       goto webp_error2;
 10406     }
 10407 
 10408   /* Create the x image and pixmap.  */
 10409   Emacs_Pix_Container ximg, mask_img = NULL;
 10410   if (!image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, 0, &ximg, false))
 10411     goto webp_error2;
 10412 
 10413   /* Create an image and pixmap serving as mask if the WebP image
 10414      contains an alpha channel.  */
 10415   if (features.has_alpha
 10416       && !image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, 1,
 10417                                            &mask_img, true))
 10418     {
 10419       image_destroy_x_image (ximg);
 10420       image_clear_image_1 (f, img, CLEAR_IMAGE_PIXMAP);
 10421       goto webp_error2;
 10422     }
 10423 
 10424   /* Fill the X image and mask from WebP data.  */
 10425   init_color_table ();
 10426 
 10427   img->corners[TOP_CORNER] = 0;
 10428   img->corners[LEFT_CORNER] = 0;
 10429   img->corners[BOT_CORNER]
 10430     = img->corners[TOP_CORNER] + height;
 10431   img->corners[RIGHT_CORNER]
 10432     = img->corners[LEFT_CORNER] + width;
 10433 
 10434   uint8_t *p = decoded;
 10435   for (int y = 0; y < height; ++y)
 10436     {
 10437       for (int x = 0; x < width; ++x)
 10438         {
 10439           int r = *p++ << 8;
 10440           int g = *p++ << 8;
 10441           int b = *p++ << 8;
 10442           PUT_PIXEL (ximg, x, y, lookup_rgb_color (f, r, g, b));
 10443 
 10444           /* An alpha channel associates variable transparency with an
 10445              image.  WebP allows up to 256 levels of partial transparency.
 10446              We handle this like with PNG (which see), using the frame's
 10447              background color to combine the image with.  */
 10448           if (features.has_alpha || anim)
 10449             {
 10450               if (mask_img)
 10451                 PUT_PIXEL (mask_img, x, y, *p > 0 ? PIX_MASK_DRAW : PIX_MASK_RETAIN);
 10452               ++p;
 10453             }
 10454         }
 10455     }
 10456 
 10457 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
 10458   /* Remember colors allocated for this image.  */
 10459   img->colors = colors_in_color_table (&img->ncolors);
 10460   free_color_table ();
 10461 #endif /* COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT */
 10462 
 10463   /* Put ximg into the image.  */
 10464   image_put_x_image (f, img, ximg, 0);
 10465 
 10466   /* Same for the mask.  */
 10467   if (mask_img)
 10468     {
 10469       /* Fill in the background_transparent field while we have the
 10470          mask handy.  Casting avoids a GCC warning.  */
 10471       image_background_transparent (img, f, (Emacs_Pix_Context)mask_img);
 10472 
 10473       image_put_x_image (f, img, mask_img, 1);
 10474     }
 10475 
 10476   img->width = width;
 10477   img->height = height;
 10478 
 10479   /* Return animation data.  */
 10480   img->lisp_data = Fcons (Qcount,
 10481                           Fcons (make_fixnum (frames),
 10482                                  img->lisp_data));
 10483   img->lisp_data = Fcons (Qdelay,
 10484                           Fcons (make_float (delay / 1000),
 10485                                  img->lisp_data));
 10486 
 10487   /* Clean up.  */
 10488   if (!anim)
 10489     WebPFree (decoded);
 10490   if (NILP (specified_data) && !anim)
 10491     xfree (contents);
 10492   return true;
 10493 
 10494  webp_error2:
 10495   if (!anim)
 10496     WebPFree (decoded);
 10497 
 10498  webp_error1:
 10499   if (NILP (specified_data))
 10500     xfree (contents);
 10501   return false;
 10502 }
 10503 
 10504 #endif /* HAVE_WEBP */
 10505 
 10506 
 10507 #ifdef HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK
 10508 
 10509 
 10510 /***********************************************************************
 10511                                  ImageMagick
 10512 ***********************************************************************/
 10513 
 10514 /* Indices of image specification fields in imagemagick_format.  */
 10515 
 10516 enum imagemagick_keyword_index
 10517   {
 10518     IMAGEMAGICK_TYPE,
 10519     IMAGEMAGICK_DATA,
 10520     IMAGEMAGICK_FILE,
 10521     IMAGEMAGICK_ASCENT,
 10522     IMAGEMAGICK_MARGIN,
 10523     IMAGEMAGICK_RELIEF,
 10524     IMAGEMAGICK_ALGORITHM,
 10525     IMAGEMAGICK_HEURISTIC_MASK,
 10526     IMAGEMAGICK_MASK,
 10527     IMAGEMAGICK_BACKGROUND,
 10528     IMAGEMAGICK_HEIGHT,
 10529     IMAGEMAGICK_WIDTH,
 10530     IMAGEMAGICK_MAX_HEIGHT,
 10531     IMAGEMAGICK_MAX_WIDTH,
 10532     IMAGEMAGICK_FORMAT,
 10533     IMAGEMAGICK_ROTATION,
 10534     IMAGEMAGICK_CROP,
 10535     IMAGEMAGICK_LAST
 10536   };
 10537 
 10538 /* Vector of image_keyword structures describing the format
 10539    of valid user-defined image specifications.  */
 10540 
 10541 static struct image_keyword imagemagick_format[IMAGEMAGICK_LAST] =
 10542   {
 10543     {":type",           IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     1},
 10544     {":data",           IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
 10545     {":file",           IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
 10546     {":ascent",         IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,                     0},
 10547     {":margin",         IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR, 0},
 10548     {":relief",         IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
 10549     {":conversion",     IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
 10550     {":heuristic-mask", IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
 10551     {":mask",           IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
 10552     {":background",     IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0},
 10553     {":height",         IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
 10554     {":width",          IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
 10555     {":max-height",     IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
 10556     {":max-width",      IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
 10557     {":format",         IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     0},
 10558     {":rotation",       IMAGE_NUMBER_VALUE,                     0},
 10559     {":crop",           IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0}
 10560   };
 10561 
 10562 /* Free X resources of imagemagick image IMG which is used on frame F.  */
 10563 
 10564 static void
 10565 imagemagick_clear_image (struct frame *f,
 10566                          struct image *img)
 10567 {
 10568   image_clear_image (f, img);
 10569 }
 10570 
 10571 /* Return true if OBJECT is a valid IMAGEMAGICK image specification.  Do
 10572    this by calling parse_image_spec and supplying the keywords that
 10573    identify the IMAGEMAGICK format.   */
 10574 
 10575 static bool
 10576 imagemagick_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
 10577 {
 10578   struct image_keyword fmt[IMAGEMAGICK_LAST];
 10579   memcpy (fmt, imagemagick_format, sizeof fmt);
 10580 
 10581   if (!parse_image_spec (object, fmt, IMAGEMAGICK_LAST, Qimagemagick))
 10582     return 0;
 10583 
 10584   /* Must specify either the :data or :file keyword.  */
 10585   return fmt[IMAGEMAGICK_FILE].count + fmt[IMAGEMAGICK_DATA].count == 1;
 10586 }
 10587 
 10588 /* The GIF library also defines DrawRectangle, but its never used in Emacs.
 10589    Therefore rename the function so it doesn't collide with ImageMagick.  */
 10590 #define DrawRectangle DrawRectangleGif
 10591 
 10592 #ifdef HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK7
 10593 # include <MagickWand/MagickWand.h>
 10594 # include <MagickCore/version.h>
 10595 /* ImageMagick 7 compatibility definitions.  */
 10596 # define PixelSetMagickColor PixelSetPixelColor
 10597 typedef PixelInfo MagickPixelPacket;
 10598 #else
 10599 # include <wand/MagickWand.h>
 10600 # include <magick/version.h>
 10601 #endif
 10602 
 10603 /* ImageMagick 6.5.3 through 6.6.5 hid PixelGetMagickColor for some reason.
 10604    Emacs seems to work fine with the hidden version, so unhide it.  */
 10605 #if 0x653 <= MagickLibVersion && MagickLibVersion <= 0x665
 10606 extern WandExport void PixelGetMagickColor (const PixelWand *,
 10607                                             MagickPixelPacket *);
 10608 #endif
 10609 
 10610 static void
 10611 imagemagick_initialize (void)
 10612 {
 10613   static bool imagemagick_initialized;
 10614   if (!imagemagick_initialized)
 10615     {
 10616       imagemagick_initialized = true;
 10617       MagickWandGenesis ();
 10618     }
 10619 }
 10620 
 10621 /* Log ImageMagick error message.
 10622    Useful when an ImageMagick function returns the status `MagickFalse'.  */
 10623 
 10624 static void
 10625 imagemagick_error (MagickWand *wand)
 10626 {
 10627   char *description;
 10628   ExceptionType severity;
 10629 
 10630   description = MagickGetException (wand, &severity);
 10631   image_error ("ImageMagick error: %s", build_string (description));
 10632   MagickRelinquishMemory (description);
 10633 }
 10634 
 10635 /* Possibly give ImageMagick some extra help to determine the image
 10636    type by supplying a "dummy" filename based on the Content-Type.  */
 10637 
 10638 static char *
 10639 imagemagick_filename_hint (Lisp_Object spec, char hint_buffer[MaxTextExtent])
 10640 {
 10641   Lisp_Object symbol = intern ("image-format-suffixes");
 10642   Lisp_Object val = find_symbol_value (symbol);
 10643   Lisp_Object format;
 10644 
 10645   if (! CONSP (val))
 10646     return NULL;
 10647 
 10648   format = image_spec_value (spec, intern (":format"), NULL);
 10649   val = Fcar_safe (Fcdr_safe (Fassq (format, val)));
 10650   if (! STRINGP (val))
 10651     return NULL;
 10652 
 10653   /* It's OK to truncate the hint if it has MaxTextExtent or more bytes,
 10654      as ImageMagick would ignore the extra bytes anyway.  */
 10655   snprintf (hint_buffer, MaxTextExtent, "/tmp/foo.%s", SSDATA (val));
 10656   return hint_buffer;
 10657 }
 10658 
 10659 /* Animated images (e.g., GIF89a) are composed from one "master image"
 10660    (which is the first one, and then there's a number of images that
 10661    follow.  If following images have non-transparent colors, these are
 10662    composed "on top" of the master image.  So, in general, one has to
 10663    compute all the preceding images to be able to display a particular
 10664    sub-image.
 10665 
 10666    Computing all the preceding images is too slow, so we maintain a
 10667    cache of previously computed images.  We have to maintain a cache
 10668    separate from the image cache, because the images may be scaled
 10669    before display. */
 10670 
 10671 struct animation_cache
 10672 {
 10673   MagickWand *wand;
 10674   int index;
 10675   struct timespec update_time;
 10676   struct animation_cache *next;
 10677   char signature[FLEXIBLE_ARRAY_MEMBER];
 10678 };
 10679 
 10680 static struct animation_cache *animation_cache = NULL;
 10681 
 10682 static struct animation_cache *
 10683 imagemagick_create_cache (char *signature)
 10684 {
 10685   struct animation_cache *cache
 10686     = xmalloc (FLEXSIZEOF (struct animation_cache, signature,
 10687                            strlen (signature) + 1));
 10688   cache->wand = 0;
 10689   cache->index = 0;
 10690   cache->next = 0;
 10691   strcpy (cache->signature, signature);
 10692   return cache;
 10693 }
 10694 
 10695 /* Discard cached images that haven't been used for a minute.  If
 10696    CLEAR, discard all cached animated images.  */
 10697 static void
 10698 imagemagick_prune_animation_cache (bool clear)
 10699 {
 10700   struct animation_cache **pcache = &animation_cache;
 10701   struct timespec old = timespec_sub (current_timespec (),
 10702                                       make_timespec (60, 0));
 10703 
 10704   while (*pcache)
 10705     {
 10706       struct animation_cache *cache = *pcache;
 10707       if (clear || timespec_cmp (old, cache->update_time) > 0)
 10708         {
 10709           if (cache->wand)
 10710             DestroyMagickWand (cache->wand);
 10711           *pcache = cache->next;
 10712           xfree (cache);
 10713         }
 10714       else
 10715         pcache = &cache->next;
 10716     }
 10717 }
 10718 
 10719 static struct animation_cache *
 10720 imagemagick_get_animation_cache (MagickWand *wand)
 10721 {
 10722   char *signature = MagickGetImageSignature (wand);
 10723   struct animation_cache *cache;
 10724   struct animation_cache **pcache = &animation_cache;
 10725 
 10726   imagemagick_prune_animation_cache (false);
 10727 
 10728   while (1)
 10729     {
 10730       cache = *pcache;
 10731       if (! cache)
 10732         {
 10733           *pcache = cache = imagemagick_create_cache (signature);
 10734           break;
 10735         }
 10736       if (strcmp (signature, cache->signature) == 0)
 10737         break;
 10738       pcache = &cache->next;
 10739     }
 10740 
 10741   DestroyString (signature);
 10742   cache->update_time = current_timespec ();
 10743   return cache;
 10744 }
 10745 
 10746 static MagickWand *
 10747 imagemagick_compute_animated_image (MagickWand *super_wand, int ino)
 10748 {
 10749   int i;
 10750   MagickWand *composite_wand;
 10751   size_t dest_width, dest_height;
 10752   struct animation_cache *cache = imagemagick_get_animation_cache (super_wand);
 10753 
 10754   MagickSetIteratorIndex (super_wand, 0);
 10755 
 10756   if (ino == 0 || cache->wand == NULL || cache->index > ino)
 10757     {
 10758       composite_wand = MagickGetImage (super_wand);
 10759       if (cache->wand)
 10760         DestroyMagickWand (cache->wand);
 10761     }
 10762   else
 10763     composite_wand = cache->wand;
 10764 
 10765   dest_height = MagickGetImageHeight (composite_wand);
 10766 
 10767   for (i = max (1, cache->index + 1); i <= ino; i++)
 10768     {
 10769       MagickWand *sub_wand;
 10770       PixelIterator *source_iterator, *dest_iterator;
 10771       PixelWand **source, **dest;
 10772       size_t source_width, source_height;
 10773       ssize_t source_left, source_top;
 10774       MagickPixelPacket pixel;
 10775       DisposeType dispose;
 10776       ptrdiff_t lines = 0;
 10777 
 10778       MagickSetIteratorIndex (super_wand, i);
 10779       sub_wand = MagickGetImage (super_wand);
 10780 
 10781       MagickGetImagePage (sub_wand, &source_width, &source_height,
 10782                           &source_left, &source_top);
 10783 
 10784       /* This flag says how to handle transparent pixels.  */
 10785       dispose = MagickGetImageDispose (sub_wand);
 10786 
 10787       source_iterator = NewPixelIterator (sub_wand);
 10788       if (! source_iterator)
 10789         {
 10790           DestroyMagickWand (composite_wand);
 10791           DestroyMagickWand (sub_wand);
 10792           cache->wand = NULL;
 10793           image_error ("Imagemagick pixel iterator creation failed");
 10794           return NULL;
 10795         }
 10796 
 10797       dest_iterator = NewPixelIterator (composite_wand);
 10798       if (! dest_iterator)
 10799         {
 10800           DestroyMagickWand (composite_wand);
 10801           DestroyMagickWand (sub_wand);
 10802           DestroyPixelIterator (source_iterator);
 10803           cache->wand = NULL;
 10804           image_error ("Imagemagick pixel iterator creation failed");
 10805           return NULL;
 10806         }
 10807 
 10808       /* The sub-image may not start at origin, so move the destination
 10809          iterator to where the sub-image should start. */
 10810       if (source_top > 0)
 10811         {
 10812           PixelSetIteratorRow (dest_iterator, source_top);
 10813           lines = source_top;
 10814         }
 10815 
 10816       while ((source = PixelGetNextIteratorRow (source_iterator, &source_width))
 10817              != NULL)
 10818         {
 10819           ptrdiff_t x;
 10820 
 10821           /* Sanity check.  This shouldn't happen, but apparently
 10822              does in some pictures.  */
 10823           if (++lines >= dest_height)
 10824             break;
 10825 
 10826           dest = PixelGetNextIteratorRow (dest_iterator, &dest_width);
 10827           for (x = 0; x < source_width; x++)
 10828             {
 10829               /* Sanity check.  This shouldn't happen, but apparently
 10830                  also does in some pictures.  */
 10831               if (x + source_left >= dest_width)
 10832                 break;
 10833               /* Normally we only copy over non-transparent pixels,
 10834                  but if the disposal method is "Background", then we
 10835                  copy over all pixels.  */
 10836               if (dispose == BackgroundDispose || PixelGetAlpha (source[x]))
 10837                 {
 10838                   PixelGetMagickColor (source[x], &pixel);
 10839                   PixelSetMagickColor (dest[x + source_left], &pixel);
 10840                 }
 10841             }
 10842           PixelSyncIterator (dest_iterator);
 10843         }
 10844 
 10845       DestroyPixelIterator (source_iterator);
 10846       DestroyPixelIterator (dest_iterator);
 10847       DestroyMagickWand (sub_wand);
 10848     }
 10849 
 10850   /* Cache a copy for the next iteration.  The current wand will be
 10851      destroyed by the caller. */
 10852   cache->wand = CloneMagickWand (composite_wand);
 10853   cache->index = ino;
 10854 
 10855   return composite_wand;
 10856 }
 10857 
 10858 
 10859 /* Helper function for imagemagick_load, which does the actual loading
 10860    given contents and size, apart from frame and image structures,
 10861    passed from imagemagick_load.  Uses librimagemagick to do most of
 10862    the image processing.
 10863 
 10864    F is a pointer to the Emacs frame; IMG to the image structure to
 10865    prepare; CONTENTS is the string containing the IMAGEMAGICK data to
 10866    be parsed; SIZE is the number of bytes of data; and FILENAME is
 10867    either the file name or the image data.
 10868 
 10869    Return true if successful.  */
 10870 
 10871 static bool
 10872 imagemagick_load_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img,
 10873                         unsigned char *contents, unsigned int size,
 10874                         char *filename)
 10875 {
 10876   int width, height;
 10877   size_t image_width, image_height;
 10878   MagickBooleanType status;
 10879   Emacs_Pix_Container ximg;
 10880   int x, y;
 10881   MagickWand *image_wand;
 10882   PixelIterator *iterator;
 10883   PixelWand **pixels, *bg_wand = NULL;
 10884   MagickPixelPacket  pixel;
 10885   Lisp_Object image;
 10886 #ifndef DONT_CREATE_TRANSFORMED_IMAGEMAGICK_IMAGE
 10887   Lisp_Object value;
 10888 #endif
 10889   Lisp_Object crop;
 10890   EMACS_INT ino;
 10891   int desired_width, desired_height;
 10892 #ifndef DONT_CREATE_TRANSFORMED_IMAGEMAGICK_IMAGE
 10893   double rotation;
 10894 #endif
 10895   char hint_buffer[MaxTextExtent];
 10896   char *filename_hint = NULL;
 10897   imagemagick_initialize ();
 10898 
 10899   /* Handle image index for image types who can contain more than one image.
 10900      Interface :index is same as for GIF.  First we "ping" the image to see how
 10901      many sub-images it contains.  Pinging is faster than loading the image to
 10902      find out things about it.  */
 10903 
 10904   image = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCindex, NULL);
 10905   ino = FIXNUMP (image) ? XFIXNAT (image) : 0;
 10906   image_wand = NewMagickWand ();
 10907 
 10908   if (filename)
 10909     status = MagickReadImage (image_wand, filename);
 10910   else
 10911     {
 10912       Lisp_Object lwidth = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCwidth, NULL);
 10913       Lisp_Object lheight = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCheight, NULL);
 10914 
 10915       if (FIXNATP (lwidth) && FIXNATP (lheight))
 10916         {
 10917           MagickSetSize (image_wand, XFIXNAT (lwidth), XFIXNAT (lheight));
 10918           MagickSetDepth (image_wand, 8);
 10919         }
 10920       filename_hint = imagemagick_filename_hint (img->spec, hint_buffer);
 10921       MagickSetFilename (image_wand, filename_hint);
 10922       status = MagickReadImageBlob (image_wand, contents, size);
 10923     }
 10924 
 10925   if (status == MagickFalse)
 10926     {
 10927       imagemagick_error (image_wand);
 10928       DestroyMagickWand (image_wand);
 10929       return 0;
 10930     }
 10931 
 10932 #if defined HAVE_MAGICKAUTOORIENTIMAGE          \
 10933   || HAVE_DECL_MAGICKAUTOORIENTIMAGE
 10934   /* If no :rotation is explicitly specified, apply the automatic
 10935      rotation from EXIF. */
 10936   if (NILP (image_spec_value (img->spec, QCrotation, NULL)))
 10937     if (MagickAutoOrientImage (image_wand) == MagickFalse)
 10938       {
 10939         image_error ("Error applying automatic orientation in image `%s'", img->spec);
 10940         DestroyMagickWand (image_wand);
 10941         return 0;
 10942       }
 10943 #endif
 10944 
 10945   if (ino < 0 || ino >= MagickGetNumberImages (image_wand))
 10946     {
 10947       image_error ("Invalid image number `%s' in image `%s'", image, img->spec);
 10948       DestroyMagickWand (image_wand);
 10949       return 0;
 10950     }
 10951 
 10952   if (MagickGetImageDelay (image_wand) > 0)
 10953     img->lisp_data =
 10954       Fcons (Qdelay,
 10955              Fcons (make_float (MagickGetImageDelay (image_wand) / 100.0),
 10956                     img->lisp_data));
 10957 
 10958   if (MagickGetNumberImages (image_wand) > 1)
 10959     img->lisp_data =
 10960       Fcons (Qcount,
 10961              Fcons (make_fixnum (MagickGetNumberImages (image_wand)),
 10962                     img->lisp_data));
 10963 
 10964   /* If we have an animated image, get the new wand based on the
 10965      "super-wand". */
 10966   if (MagickGetNumberImages (image_wand) > 1)
 10967     {
 10968       /* This is an animated image (it has a delay), so compute the
 10969          composite image etc. */
 10970       if (MagickGetImageDelay (image_wand) > 0)
 10971         {
 10972           MagickWand *super_wand = image_wand;
 10973           image_wand = imagemagick_compute_animated_image (super_wand, ino);
 10974           if (! image_wand)
 10975             image_wand = super_wand;
 10976           else
 10977             DestroyMagickWand (super_wand);
 10978         }
 10979       else
 10980         /* This is not an animated image: It's just a multi-image file
 10981            (like an .ico file).  Just return the correct
 10982            sub-image.  */
 10983         {
 10984           MagickWand *super_wand = image_wand;
 10985 
 10986           MagickSetIteratorIndex (super_wand, ino);
 10987           image_wand = MagickGetImage (super_wand);
 10988           DestroyMagickWand (super_wand);
 10989         }
 10990     }
 10991 
 10992   /* Retrieve the frame's background color, for use later.  */
 10993   {
 10994     Emacs_Color bgcolor;
 10995     Lisp_Object specified_bg;
 10996 
 10997     specified_bg = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL);
 10998     if (!STRINGP (specified_bg)
 10999         || !FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->defined_color_hook (f,
 11000                                                     SSDATA (specified_bg),
 11001                                                     &bgcolor,
 11002                                                     false,
 11003                                                     false))
 11004       FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->query_frame_background_color (f, &bgcolor);
 11005 
 11006     bg_wand = NewPixelWand ();
 11007     PixelSetRed   (bg_wand, (double) bgcolor.red   / 65535);
 11008     PixelSetGreen (bg_wand, (double) bgcolor.green / 65535);
 11009     PixelSetBlue  (bg_wand, (double) bgcolor.blue  / 65535);
 11010   }
 11011 
 11012 #ifndef DONT_CREATE_TRANSFORMED_IMAGEMAGICK_IMAGE
 11013   compute_image_size (MagickGetImageWidth (image_wand),
 11014                       MagickGetImageHeight (image_wand),
 11015                       img, &desired_width, &desired_height);
 11016 #else
 11017   desired_width = desired_height = -1;
 11018 #endif
 11019 
 11020   if (desired_width != -1 && desired_height != -1)
 11021     {
 11022       status = MagickScaleImage (image_wand, desired_width, desired_height);
 11023       if (status == MagickFalse)
 11024         {
 11025           image_error ("Imagemagick scale failed");
 11026           imagemagick_error (image_wand);
 11027           goto imagemagick_error;
 11028         }
 11029     }
 11030 
 11031   /* crop behaves similar to image slicing in Emacs but is more memory
 11032      efficient.  */
 11033   crop = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCcrop, NULL);
 11034 
 11035   if (CONSP (crop) && TYPE_RANGED_FIXNUMP (size_t, XCAR (crop)))
 11036     {
 11037       /* After some testing, it seems MagickCropImage is the fastest crop
 11038          function in ImageMagick.  This crop function seems to do less copying
 11039          than the alternatives, but it still reads the entire image into memory
