 11040          before cropping, which is apparently difficult to avoid when using
 11041          imagemagick.  */
 11042       size_t crop_width = XFIXNUM (XCAR (crop));
 11043       crop = XCDR (crop);
 11044       if (CONSP (crop) && TYPE_RANGED_FIXNUMP (size_t, XCAR (crop)))
 11045         {
 11046           size_t crop_height = XFIXNUM (XCAR (crop));
 11047           crop = XCDR (crop);
 11048           if (CONSP (crop) && TYPE_RANGED_FIXNUMP (ssize_t, XCAR (crop)))
 11049             {
 11050               ssize_t crop_x = XFIXNUM (XCAR (crop));
 11051               crop = XCDR (crop);
 11052               if (CONSP (crop) && TYPE_RANGED_FIXNUMP (ssize_t, XCAR (crop)))
 11053                 {
 11054                   ssize_t crop_y = XFIXNUM (XCAR (crop));
 11055                   MagickCropImage (image_wand, crop_width, crop_height,
 11056                                    crop_x, crop_y);
 11057                 }
 11058             }
 11059         }
 11060     }
 11061 
 11062 #ifndef DONT_CREATE_TRANSFORMED_IMAGEMAGICK_IMAGE
 11063   /* Furthermore :rotation. we need background color and angle for
 11064      rotation.  */
 11065   /*
 11066     TODO background handling for rotation specified_bg =
 11067     image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL); if (!STRINGP
 11068     (specified_bg).  */
 11069   value = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCrotation, NULL);
 11070   if (FLOATP (value))
 11071     {
 11072       rotation = XFLOAT_DATA (value);
 11073       status = MagickRotateImage (image_wand, bg_wand, rotation);
 11074       if (status == MagickFalse)
 11075         {
 11076           image_error ("Imagemagick image rotate failed");
 11077           imagemagick_error (image_wand);
 11078           goto imagemagick_error;
 11079         }
 11080     }
 11081 #endif
 11082 
 11083   /* Set the canvas background color to the frame or specified
 11084      background, and flatten the image.  Note: as of ImageMagick
 11085      6.6.0, SVG image transparency is not handled properly
 11086      (e.g. etc/images/splash.svg shows a white background always).  */
 11087   {
 11088     MagickWand *new_wand;
 11089     MagickSetImageBackgroundColor (image_wand, bg_wand);
 11090 #if defined HAVE_MAGICKMERGEIMAGELAYERS         \
 11091   || HAVE_DECL_MAGICKMERGEIMAGELAYERS
 11092     new_wand = MagickMergeImageLayers (image_wand, MergeLayer);
 11093 #else
 11094     new_wand = MagickFlattenImages (image_wand);
 11095 #endif
 11096     DestroyMagickWand (image_wand);
 11097     image_wand = new_wand;
 11098   }
 11099 
 11100   /* Finally we are done manipulating the image.  Figure out the
 11101      resulting width/height and transfer ownership to Emacs.  */
 11102   image_height = MagickGetImageHeight (image_wand);
 11103   image_width = MagickGetImageWidth (image_wand);
 11104 
 11105   if (! (image_width <= INT_MAX && image_height <= INT_MAX
 11106          && check_image_size (f, image_width, image_height)))
 11107     {
 11108       image_size_error ();
 11109       goto imagemagick_error;
 11110     }
 11111 
 11112   width = image_width;
 11113   height = image_height;
 11114 
 11115   /* We can now get a valid pixel buffer from the imagemagick file, if all
 11116      went ok.  */
 11117 
 11118   init_color_table ();
 11119 
 11120 #if (defined (HAVE_MAGICKEXPORTIMAGEPIXELS)          \
 11121      || HAVE_DECL_MAGICKEXPORTIMAGEPIXELS)           \
 11122   && ! defined (HAVE_NS) && ! defined (HAVE_HAIKU)
 11123   if (imagemagick_render_type != 0)
 11124     {
 11125       /* Magicexportimage is normally faster than pixelpushing.  This
 11126          method is also well tested.  Some aspects of this method are
 11127          ad-hoc and needs to be more researched. */
 11128       void *dataptr;
 11129       int imagedepth = 24; /*MagickGetImageDepth(image_wand);*/
 11130       const char *exportdepth = imagedepth <= 8 ? "I" : "BGRP"; /*"RGBP";*/
 11131       /* Try to create a x pixmap to hold the imagemagick pixmap.  */
 11132       if (!image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, imagedepth,
 11133                                             &ximg, 0))
 11134         {
 11135 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
 11136           free_color_table ();
 11137 #endif
 11138           image_error ("Imagemagick X bitmap allocation failure");
 11139           goto imagemagick_error;
 11140         }
 11141       dataptr = ximg->data;
 11142 
 11143       /* Oddly, the below code doesn't seem to work:*/
 11144       /* switch(ximg->bitmap_unit){ */
 11145       /* case 8: */
 11146       /*   pixelwidth=CharPixel; */
 11147       /*   break; */
 11148       /* case   16: */
 11149       /*   pixelwidth=ShortPixel; */
 11150       /*   break; */
 11151       /* case   32: */
 11152       /*   pixelwidth=LongPixel; */
 11153       /*   break; */
 11154       /* } */
 11155       /*
 11156         Here im just guessing the format of the bitmap.
 11157         happens to work fine for:
 11158         - bw djvu images
 11159         on rgb display.
 11160         seems about 3 times as fast as pixel pushing(not carefully measured)
 11161       */
 11162       int pixelwidth = CharPixel; /*??? TODO figure out*/
 11163       MagickExportImagePixels (image_wand, 0, 0, width, height,
 11164                                exportdepth, pixelwidth, dataptr);
 11165     }
 11166   else
 11167 #endif /* HAVE_MAGICKEXPORTIMAGEPIXELS */
 11168     {
 11169       size_t image_height;
 11170       double quantum_range = QuantumRange;
 11171       MagickRealType color_scale = 65535.0 / quantum_range;
 11172       /* Try to create a x pixmap to hold the imagemagick pixmap.  */
 11173       if (!image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, 0,
 11174                                             &ximg, 0))
 11175         {
 11176 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
 11177           free_color_table ();
 11178 #endif
 11179           image_error ("Imagemagick X bitmap allocation failure");
 11180           goto imagemagick_error;
 11181         }
 11182 
 11183       /* Copy imagemagick image to x with primitive yet robust pixel
 11184          pusher loop.  This has been tested a lot with many different
 11185          images.  */
 11186 
 11187       /* Copy pixels from the imagemagick image structure to the x image map. */
 11188       iterator = NewPixelIterator (image_wand);
 11189       if (! iterator)
 11190         {
 11191 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
 11192           free_color_table ();
 11193 #endif
 11194           image_destroy_x_image (ximg);
 11195           image_error ("Imagemagick pixel iterator creation failed");
 11196           goto imagemagick_error;
 11197         }
 11198 
 11199       image_height = MagickGetImageHeight (image_wand);
 11200       for (y = 0; y < image_height; y++)
 11201         {
 11202           size_t row_width;
 11203           pixels = PixelGetNextIteratorRow (iterator, &row_width);
 11204           if (! pixels)
 11205             break;
 11206           int xlim = min (row_width, width);
 11207           for (x = 0; x < xlim; x++)
 11208             {
 11209               PixelGetMagickColor (pixels[x], &pixel);
 11210               PUT_PIXEL (ximg, x, y,
 11211                          lookup_rgb_color (f,
 11212                                            color_scale * pixel.red,
 11213                                            color_scale * pixel.green,
 11214                                            color_scale * pixel.blue));
 11215             }
 11216         }
 11217       DestroyPixelIterator (iterator);
 11218     }
 11219 
 11220 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
 11221   /* Remember colors allocated for this image.  */
 11222   img->colors = colors_in_color_table (&img->ncolors);
 11223   free_color_table ();
 11224 #endif /* COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT */
 11225 
 11226   img->width  = width;
 11227   img->height = height;
 11228 
 11229   /* Put ximg into the image.  */
 11230   image_put_x_image (f, img, ximg, 0);
 11231 
 11232   /* Final cleanup. image_wand should be the only resource left. */
 11233   DestroyMagickWand (image_wand);
 11234   if (bg_wand) DestroyPixelWand (bg_wand);
 11235 
 11236   /* Do not call MagickWandTerminus, to work around ImageMagick bug 825.  See:
 11237      https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/issues/825
 11238      Although this bug was introduced in ImageMagick 6.9.9-14 and
 11239      fixed in 6.9.9-18, it's simpler to work around it in all versions.  */
 11240 
 11241   return 1;
 11242 
 11243  imagemagick_error:
 11244   DestroyMagickWand (image_wand);
 11245   if (bg_wand) DestroyPixelWand (bg_wand);
 11246 
 11247   /* TODO more cleanup.  */
 11248   image_error ("Error parsing IMAGEMAGICK image `%s'", img->spec);
 11249   return 0;
 11250 }
 11251 
 11252 
 11253 /* Load IMAGEMAGICK image IMG for use on frame F.  Value is true if
 11254    successful. this function will go into the imagemagick_type structure, and
 11255    the prototype thus needs to be compatible with that structure.  */
 11256 
 11257 static bool
 11258 imagemagick_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
 11259 {
 11260   bool success_p = 0;
 11261   Lisp_Object file_name;
 11262 
 11263   /* If IMG->spec specifies a file name, create a non-file spec from it.  */
 11264   file_name = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCfile, NULL);
 11265   if (STRINGP (file_name))
 11266     {
 11267       Lisp_Object file = image_find_image_file (file_name);
 11268       if (!STRINGP (file))
 11269         {
 11270           image_error ("Cannot find image file `%s'", file_name);
 11271           return 0;
 11272         }
 11273       file = ENCODE_FILE (file);
 11274 #ifdef WINDOWSNT
 11275       file = ansi_encode_filename (file);
 11276 #endif
 11277       success_p = imagemagick_load_image (f, img, 0, 0, SSDATA (file));
 11278     }
 11279   /* Else it's not a file, it's a Lisp object.  Load the image from a
 11280      Lisp object rather than a file.  */
 11281   else
 11282     {
 11283       Lisp_Object data;
 11284 
 11285       data = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL);
 11286       if (!STRINGP (data))
 11287         {
 11288           image_error ("Invalid image data `%s'", data);
 11289           return 0;
 11290         }
 11291       success_p = imagemagick_load_image (f, img, SDATA (data),
 11292                                           SBYTES (data), NULL);
 11293     }
 11294 
 11295   return success_p;
 11296 }
 11297 
 11298 DEFUN ("imagemagick-types", Fimagemagick_types, Simagemagick_types, 0, 0, 0,
 11299        doc: /* Return a list of image types supported by ImageMagick.
 11300 Each entry in this list is a symbol named after an ImageMagick format
 11301 tag.  See the ImageMagick manual for a list of ImageMagick formats and
 11302 their descriptions (https://www.imagemagick.org/script/formats.php).
 11303 You can also try the shell command: `identify -list format'.
 11304 
 11305 Note that ImageMagick recognizes many file-types that Emacs does not
 11306 recognize as images, such as C.  See `imagemagick-enabled-types'
 11307 and `imagemagick-types-inhibit'.  */)
 11308   (void)
 11309 {
 11310   Lisp_Object typelist = Qnil;
 11311   size_t numf = 0;
 11312   ExceptionInfo *ex;
 11313   char **imtypes;
 11314   size_t i;
 11315 
 11316   imagemagick_initialize ();
 11317   ex = AcquireExceptionInfo ();
 11318   imtypes = GetMagickList ("*", &numf, ex);
 11319   DestroyExceptionInfo (ex);
 11320 
 11321   for (i = 0; i < numf; i++)
 11322     {
 11323       Lisp_Object imagemagicktype = intern (imtypes[i]);
 11324       typelist = Fcons (imagemagicktype, typelist);
 11325       imtypes[i] = MagickRelinquishMemory (imtypes[i]);
 11326     }
 11327 
 11328   MagickRelinquishMemory (imtypes);
 11329   return Fnreverse (typelist);
 11330 }
 11331 
 11332 #endif  /* defined (HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK) */
 11333 
 11334 
 11335 
 11336 /***********************************************************************
 11337                                  SVG
 11338  ***********************************************************************/
 11339 
 11340 #ifdef HAVE_RSVG
 11341 
 11342 /* Function prototypes.  */
 11343 
 11344 static bool svg_load_image (struct frame *, struct image *,
 11345                             char *, ptrdiff_t, char *);
 11346 
 11347 /* Indices of image specification fields in svg_format, below.  */
 11348 
 11349 enum svg_keyword_index
 11350 {
 11351   SVG_TYPE,
 11352   SVG_DATA,
 11353   SVG_FILE,
 11354   SVG_BASE_URI,
 11355   SVG_CSS,
 11356   SVG_ASCENT,
 11357   SVG_MARGIN,
 11358   SVG_RELIEF,
 11359   SVG_ALGORITHM,
 11360   SVG_HEURISTIC_MASK,
 11361   SVG_MASK,
 11362   SVG_FOREGROUND,
 11363   SVG_BACKGROUND,
 11364   SVG_LAST
 11365 };
 11366 
 11367 /* Vector of image_keyword structures describing the format
 11368    of valid user-defined image specifications.  */
 11369 
 11370 static const struct image_keyword svg_format[SVG_LAST] =
 11371 {
 11372   {":type",             IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     1},
 11373   {":data",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
 11374   {":file",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
 11375   {":base-uri",         IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
 11376   {":css",              IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     0},
 11377   {":ascent",           IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,                     0},
 11378   {":margin",           IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR, 0},
 11379   {":relief",           IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
 11380   {":conversion",       IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
 11381   {":heuristic-mask",   IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
 11382   {":mask",             IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
 11383   {":foreground",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0},
 11384   {":background",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0}
 11385 };
 11386 
 11387 /* Return true if OBJECT is a valid SVG image specification.  Do
 11388    this by calling parse_image_spec and supplying the keywords that
 11389    identify the SVG format.   */
 11390 
 11391 static bool
 11392 svg_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
 11393 {
 11394   struct image_keyword fmt[SVG_LAST];
 11395   memcpy (fmt, svg_format, sizeof fmt);
 11396 
 11397   if (!parse_image_spec (object, fmt, SVG_LAST, Qsvg))
 11398     return 0;
 11399 
 11400   /* Must specify either the :data or :file keyword.  */
 11401   return fmt[SVG_FILE].count + fmt[SVG_DATA].count == 1;
 11402 }
 11403 
 11404 /* Some versions of glib's gatomic.h define MemoryBarrier, but MinGW
 11405    w32api 3.18 and later has its own definition.  The following gross
 11406    hack avoids the clash.  */
 11407 # ifdef WINDOWSNT
 11408 #  if (__W32API_MAJOR_VERSION + (__W32API_MINOR_VERSION >= 18)) >= 4
 11409 #   define W32_SAVE_MINGW_VERSION __MINGW_MAJOR_VERSION
 11410 #   undef __MINGW_MAJOR_VERSION
 11411 #   define __MINGW_MAJOR_VERSION 4
 11412 #  endif
 11413 # endif
 11414 
 11415 # include <librsvg/rsvg.h>
 11416 
 11417 /* librsvg is too old for us if it doesn't define this macro.  */
 11418 # ifndef LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION
 11419 #  define LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION(v, w, x) false
 11420 # endif
 11421 
 11422 # ifdef WINDOWSNT
 11423 
 11424 /* Restore the original definition of __MINGW_MAJOR_VERSION.  */
 11425 #  if defined W32_SAVE_MINGW_VERSION && defined __MINGW_MAJOR_VERSION
 11426 #   undef __MINGW_MAJOR_VERSION
 11427 #   define __MINGW_MAJOR_VERSION W32_SAVE_MINGW_VERSION
 11428 #   ifdef __MINGW_MAJOR_VERSION
 11429 #    undef W32_SAVE_MINGW_VERSION
 11430 #   endif
 11431 #  endif
 11432 
 11433 /* SVG library functions.  */
 11434 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 32, 0)
 11435 DEF_DLL_FN (GFile *, g_file_new_for_path, (char const *));
 11436 DEF_DLL_FN (GInputStream *, g_memory_input_stream_new_from_data,
 11437             (void const *, gssize, GDestroyNotify));
 11438 DEF_DLL_FN (RsvgHandle *, rsvg_handle_new_from_stream_sync,
 11439             (GInputStream *, GFile *, RsvgHandleFlags, GCancellable *,
 11440              GError **error));
 11441 #  else
 11442 DEF_DLL_FN (RsvgHandle *, rsvg_handle_new, (void));
 11443 DEF_DLL_FN (void, rsvg_handle_set_base_uri, (RsvgHandle *, const char *));
 11444 DEF_DLL_FN (gboolean, rsvg_handle_write,
 11445             (RsvgHandle *, const guchar *, gsize, GError **));
 11446 DEF_DLL_FN (gboolean, rsvg_handle_close, (RsvgHandle *, GError **));
 11447 #  endif
 11448 
 11449 DEF_DLL_FN (void, rsvg_handle_set_dpi_x_y,
 11450             (RsvgHandle * handle, double dpi_x, double dpi_y));
 11451 
 11452 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 52, 1)
 11453 DEF_DLL_FN (gboolean, rsvg_handle_get_intrinsic_size_in_pixels,
 11454             (RsvgHandle *, gdouble *, gdouble *));
 11455 #  endif
 11456 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 46, 0)
 11457 DEF_DLL_FN (void, rsvg_handle_get_intrinsic_dimensions,
 11458             (RsvgHandle *, gboolean *, RsvgLength *, gboolean *,
 11459             RsvgLength *, gboolean *, RsvgRectangle *));
 11460 DEF_DLL_FN (gboolean, rsvg_handle_get_geometry_for_layer,
 11461             (RsvgHandle *, const char *, const RsvgRectangle *,
 11462              RsvgRectangle *, RsvgRectangle *, GError **));
 11463 #  else
 11464 DEF_DLL_FN (void, rsvg_handle_get_dimensions,
 11465             (RsvgHandle *, RsvgDimensionData *));
 11466 #  endif
 11467 
 11468 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 48, 0)
 11469 DEF_DLL_FN (gboolean, rsvg_handle_set_stylesheet,
 11470             (RsvgHandle *, const guint8 *, gsize, GError **));
 11471 #  endif
 11472 DEF_DLL_FN (GdkPixbuf *, rsvg_handle_get_pixbuf, (RsvgHandle *));
 11473 DEF_DLL_FN (int, gdk_pixbuf_get_width, (const GdkPixbuf *));
 11474 DEF_DLL_FN (int, gdk_pixbuf_get_height, (const GdkPixbuf *));
 11475 DEF_DLL_FN (guchar *, gdk_pixbuf_get_pixels, (const GdkPixbuf *));
 11476 DEF_DLL_FN (int, gdk_pixbuf_get_rowstride, (const GdkPixbuf *));
 11477 DEF_DLL_FN (GdkColorspace, gdk_pixbuf_get_colorspace, (const GdkPixbuf *));
 11478 DEF_DLL_FN (int, gdk_pixbuf_get_n_channels, (const GdkPixbuf *));
 11479 DEF_DLL_FN (gboolean, gdk_pixbuf_get_has_alpha, (const GdkPixbuf *));
 11480 DEF_DLL_FN (int, gdk_pixbuf_get_bits_per_sample, (const GdkPixbuf *));
 11481 
 11482 #  if ! GLIB_CHECK_VERSION (2, 36, 0)
 11483 DEF_DLL_FN (void, g_type_init, (void));
 11484 #  endif
 11485 DEF_DLL_FN (void, g_object_unref, (gpointer));
 11486 DEF_DLL_FN (void, g_error_free, (GError *));
 11487 
 11488 static bool
 11489 init_svg_functions (void)
 11490 {
 11491   HMODULE library, gdklib = NULL, glib = NULL, gobject = NULL, giolib = NULL;
 11492 
 11493   if (!(glib = w32_delayed_load (Qglib))
 11494       || !(gobject = w32_delayed_load (Qgobject))
 11495 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 32, 0)
 11496       || !(giolib = w32_delayed_load (Qgio))
 11497 #  endif
 11498       || !(gdklib = w32_delayed_load (Qgdk_pixbuf))
 11499       || !(library = w32_delayed_load (Qsvg)))
 11500     {
 11501       if (gdklib)  FreeLibrary (gdklib);
 11502       if (giolib)  FreeLibrary (giolib);
 11503       if (gobject) FreeLibrary (gobject);
 11504       if (glib)    FreeLibrary (glib);
 11505       return 0;
 11506     }
 11507 
 11508 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 32, 0)
 11509   LOAD_DLL_FN (giolib, g_file_new_for_path);
 11510   LOAD_DLL_FN (giolib, g_memory_input_stream_new_from_data);
 11511   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, rsvg_handle_new_from_stream_sync);
 11512 #else
 11513   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, rsvg_handle_new);
 11514   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, rsvg_handle_set_base_uri);
 11515   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, rsvg_handle_write);
 11516   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, rsvg_handle_close);
 11517 #endif
 11518   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, rsvg_handle_set_dpi_x_y);
 11519 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 52, 1)
 11520   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, rsvg_handle_get_intrinsic_size_in_pixels);
 11521 #endif
 11522 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 46, 0)
 11523   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, rsvg_handle_get_intrinsic_dimensions);
 11524   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, rsvg_handle_get_geometry_for_layer);
 11525 #else
 11526   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, rsvg_handle_get_dimensions);
 11527 #endif
 11528 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 48, 0)
 11529   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, rsvg_handle_set_stylesheet);
 11530 #endif
 11531   LOAD_DLL_FN (library, rsvg_handle_get_pixbuf);
 11532 
 11533   LOAD_DLL_FN (gdklib, gdk_pixbuf_get_width);
 11534   LOAD_DLL_FN (gdklib, gdk_pixbuf_get_height);
 11535   LOAD_DLL_FN (gdklib, gdk_pixbuf_get_pixels);
 11536   LOAD_DLL_FN (gdklib, gdk_pixbuf_get_rowstride);
 11537   LOAD_DLL_FN (gdklib, gdk_pixbuf_get_colorspace);
 11538   LOAD_DLL_FN (gdklib, gdk_pixbuf_get_n_channels);
 11539   LOAD_DLL_FN (gdklib, gdk_pixbuf_get_has_alpha);
 11540   LOAD_DLL_FN (gdklib, gdk_pixbuf_get_bits_per_sample);
 11541 
 11542 #  if ! GLIB_CHECK_VERSION (2, 36, 0)
 11543   LOAD_DLL_FN (gobject, g_type_init);
 11544 #  endif
 11545   LOAD_DLL_FN (gobject, g_object_unref);
 11546   LOAD_DLL_FN (glib, g_error_free);
 11547 
 11548   return 1;
 11549 }
 11550 
 11551 /* The following aliases for library functions allow dynamic loading
 11552    to be used on some platforms.  */
 11553 
 11554 #  undef gdk_pixbuf_get_bits_per_sample
 11555 #  undef gdk_pixbuf_get_colorspace
 11556 #  undef gdk_pixbuf_get_has_alpha
 11557 #  undef gdk_pixbuf_get_height
 11558 #  undef gdk_pixbuf_get_n_channels
 11559 #  undef gdk_pixbuf_get_pixels
 11560 #  undef gdk_pixbuf_get_rowstride
 11561 #  undef gdk_pixbuf_get_width
 11562 #  undef g_error_free
 11563 #  undef g_object_unref
 11564 #  undef g_type_init
 11565 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 52, 1)
 11566 #   undef rsvg_handle_get_intrinsic_size_in_pixels
 11567 #  endif
 11568 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 46, 0)
 11569 #   undef rsvg_handle_get_intrinsic_dimensions
 11570 #   undef rsvg_handle_get_geometry_for_layer
 11571 #  else
 11572 #   undef rsvg_handle_get_dimensions
 11573 #  endif
 11574 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 48, 0)
 11575 #   undef rsvg_handle_set_stylesheet
 11576 #  endif
 11577 #  undef rsvg_handle_get_pixbuf
 11578 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 32, 0)
 11579 #   undef g_file_new_for_path
 11580 #   undef g_memory_input_stream_new_from_data
 11581 #   undef rsvg_handle_new_from_stream_sync
 11582 #  else
 11583 #   undef rsvg_handle_close
 11584 #   undef rsvg_handle_new
 11585 #   undef rsvg_handle_set_base_uri
 11586 #   undef rsvg_handle_write
 11587 #  endif
 11588 #  undef rsvg_handle_set_dpi_x_y
 11589 
 11590 #  define gdk_pixbuf_get_bits_per_sample fn_gdk_pixbuf_get_bits_per_sample
 11591 #  define gdk_pixbuf_get_colorspace fn_gdk_pixbuf_get_colorspace
 11592 #  define gdk_pixbuf_get_has_alpha fn_gdk_pixbuf_get_has_alpha
 11593 #  define gdk_pixbuf_get_height fn_gdk_pixbuf_get_height
 11594 #  define gdk_pixbuf_get_n_channels fn_gdk_pixbuf_get_n_channels
 11595 #  define gdk_pixbuf_get_pixels fn_gdk_pixbuf_get_pixels
 11596 #  define gdk_pixbuf_get_rowstride fn_gdk_pixbuf_get_rowstride
 11597 #  define gdk_pixbuf_get_width fn_gdk_pixbuf_get_width
 11598 #  define g_error_free fn_g_error_free
 11599 #  define g_object_unref fn_g_object_unref
 11600 #  if ! GLIB_CHECK_VERSION (2, 36, 0)
 11601 #   define g_type_init fn_g_type_init
 11602 #  endif
 11603 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 52, 1)
 11604 #   define rsvg_handle_get_intrinsic_size_in_pixels \
 11605         fn_rsvg_handle_get_intrinsic_size_in_pixels
 11606 #  endif
 11607 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 46, 0)
 11608 #   define rsvg_handle_get_intrinsic_dimensions \
 11609         fn_rsvg_handle_get_intrinsic_dimensions
 11610 #   define rsvg_handle_get_geometry_for_layer   \
 11611         fn_rsvg_handle_get_geometry_for_layer
 11612 #  else
 11613 #   define rsvg_handle_get_dimensions fn_rsvg_handle_get_dimensions
 11614 #  endif
 11615 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 48, 0)
 11616 #   define rsvg_handle_set_stylesheet fn_rsvg_handle_set_stylesheet
 11617 #  endif
 11618 #  define rsvg_handle_get_pixbuf fn_rsvg_handle_get_pixbuf
 11619 #  if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 32, 0)
 11620 #   define g_file_new_for_path fn_g_file_new_for_path
 11621 #   define g_memory_input_stream_new_from_data \
 11622         fn_g_memory_input_stream_new_from_data
 11623 #   define rsvg_handle_new_from_stream_sync fn_rsvg_handle_new_from_stream_sync
 11624 #  else
 11625 #   define rsvg_handle_close fn_rsvg_handle_close
 11626 #   define rsvg_handle_new fn_rsvg_handle_new
 11627 #   define rsvg_handle_set_base_uri fn_rsvg_handle_set_base_uri
 11628 #   define rsvg_handle_write fn_rsvg_handle_write
 11629 #  endif
 11630 #  define rsvg_handle_set_dpi_x_y fn_rsvg_handle_set_dpi_x_y
 11631 
 11632 # endif /* !WINDOWSNT  */
 11633 
 11634 /* Load SVG image IMG for use on frame F.  Value is true if
 11635    successful.  */
 11636 
 11637 static bool
 11638 svg_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
 11639 {
 11640   bool success_p = 0;
 11641   Lisp_Object file_name, base_uri;
 11642 
 11643   /* If IMG->spec specifies a file name, create a non-file spec from it.  */
 11644   file_name = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCfile, NULL);
 11645   base_uri = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbase_uri, NULL);
 11646   if (STRINGP (file_name))
 11647     {
 11648       image_fd fd;
 11649       Lisp_Object file = image_find_image_fd (file_name, &fd);
 11650       if (!STRINGP (file))
 11651         {
 11652           image_error ("Cannot find image file `%s'", file_name);
 11653           return 0;
 11654         }
 11655 
 11656       /* Read the entire file into memory.  */
 11657       ptrdiff_t size;
 11658       char *contents = slurp_file (fd, &size);
 11659       if (contents == NULL)
 11660         {
 11661           image_error ("Error loading SVG image `%s'", file);
 11662           return 0;
 11663         }
 11664       /* If the file was slurped into memory properly, parse it.  */
 11665       if (!STRINGP (base_uri))
 11666         base_uri = file;
 11667       success_p = svg_load_image (f, img, contents, size,
 11668                                   SSDATA (ENCODE_FILE (base_uri)));
 11669       xfree (contents);
 11670     }
 11671   /* Else it's not a file, it's a Lisp object.  Load the image from a
 11672      Lisp object rather than a file.  */
 11673   else
 11674     {
 11675       Lisp_Object data;
 11676 
 11677       data = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCdata, NULL);
 11678       if (!STRINGP (data))
 11679         {
 11680           image_error ("Invalid image data `%s'", data);
 11681           return 0;
 11682         }
 11683       if (!STRINGP (base_uri))
 11684         base_uri = BVAR (current_buffer, filename);
 11685       success_p = svg_load_image (f, img, SSDATA (data), SBYTES (data),
 11686                                   (STRINGP (base_uri) ?
 11687                                    SSDATA (ENCODE_FILE (base_uri)) : NULL));
 11688     }
 11689 
 11690   return success_p;
 11691 }
 11692 
 11693 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 46, 0)
 11694 static double
 11695 svg_css_length_to_pixels (RsvgLength length, double dpi, int font_size)
 11696 {
 11697   double value = length.length;
 11698 
 11699   switch (length.unit)
 11700     {
 11701     case RSVG_UNIT_PX:
 11702       /* Already a pixel value.  */
 11703       break;
 11704     case RSVG_UNIT_CM:
 11705       /* 2.54 cm in an inch.  */
 11706       value = dpi * value / 2.54;
 11707       break;
 11708     case RSVG_UNIT_MM:
 11709       /* 25.4 mm in an inch.  */
 11710       value = dpi * value / 25.4;
 11711       break;
 11712     case RSVG_UNIT_PT:
 11713       /* 72 points in an inch.  */
 11714       value = dpi * value / 72;
 11715       break;
 11716     case RSVG_UNIT_PC:
 11717       /* 6 picas in an inch.  */
 11718       value = dpi * value / 6;
 11719       break;
 11720     case RSVG_UNIT_IN:
 11721       value *= dpi;
 11722       break;
 11723 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 48, 0)
 11724       /* We don't know exactly what font size is used on older librsvg
 11725          versions.  */
 11726     case RSVG_UNIT_EM:
 11727       value *= font_size;
 11728       break;
 11729 #endif
 11730     default:
 11731       /* Probably ex or %.  We can't know what the pixel value is
 11732          without more information.  */
 11733       value = 0;
 11734     }
 11735 
 11736   return value;
 11737 }
 11738 #endif
 11739 
 11740 /* Load frame F and image IMG.  CONTENTS contains the SVG XML data to
 11741    be parsed, SIZE is its size, and FILENAME is the name of the SVG
 11742    file being loaded.
 11743 
 11744    Use librsvg to do most of the image processing.
 11745 
 11746    Return true when successful.  */
 11747 static bool
 11748 svg_load_image (struct frame *f, struct image *img, char *contents,
 11749                 ptrdiff_t size, char *filename)
 11750 {
 11751   RsvgHandle *rsvg_handle;
 11752   double viewbox_width, viewbox_height;
 11753   GError *err = NULL;
 11754   GdkPixbuf *pixbuf;
 11755   int width;
 11756   int height;
 11757   const guint8 *pixels;
 11758   int rowstride;
 11759   char *wrapped_contents = NULL;
 11760   ptrdiff_t wrapped_size;
 11761 
 11762   bool empty_errmsg = true;
 11763   const char *errmsg = "";
 11764   ptrdiff_t errlen = 0;
 11765 
 11766 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 48, 0)
 11767   char *css = NULL;
 11768 #endif
 11769 
 11770 #if ! GLIB_CHECK_VERSION (2, 36, 0)
 11771   /* g_type_init is a glib function that must be called prior to
 11772      using gnome type library functions (obsolete since 2.36.0).  */
 11773   g_type_init ();
 11774 #endif
 11775 
 11776   /* Parse the unmodified SVG data so we can get its initial size.  */
 11777 
 11778 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 32, 0)
 11779   GInputStream *input_stream
 11780     = g_memory_input_stream_new_from_data (contents, size, NULL);
 11781   GFile *base_file = filename ? g_file_new_for_path (filename) : NULL;
 11782   rsvg_handle = rsvg_handle_new_from_stream_sync (input_stream, base_file,
 11783                                                   RSVG_HANDLE_FLAGS_NONE,
 11784                                                   NULL, &err);
 11785 
 11786   if (base_file)
 11787     g_object_unref (base_file);
 11788   g_object_unref (input_stream);
 11789 
 11790   /* Check rsvg_handle too, to avoid librsvg 2.40.13 bug (Bug#36773#26).  */
 11791   if (!rsvg_handle || err) goto rsvg_error;
 11792 
 11793   rsvg_handle_set_dpi_x_y (rsvg_handle, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->resx,
 11794                            FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->resy);
 11795 
 11796 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 48, 0)
 11797   Lisp_Object lcss = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCcss, NULL);
 11798   if (!STRINGP (lcss))
 11799     {
 11800       /* Generate the CSS for the SVG image.  */
 11801       /* FIXME: The below calculations leave enough space for a font
 11802          size up to 9999, if it overflows we just throw an error but
 11803          should probably increase the buffer size.  */
 11804       const char *css_spec = "svg{font-family:\"%s\";font-size:%dpx}";
 11805       int css_len = strlen (css_spec) + strlen (img->face_font_family) + 1;
 11806       css = xmalloc (css_len);
 11807       if (css_len <= snprintf (css, css_len, css_spec,
 11808                                img->face_font_family, img->face_font_size))
 11809         goto rsvg_error;
 11810 
 11811       rsvg_handle_set_stylesheet (rsvg_handle, (guint8 *)css, strlen (css), NULL);
 11812     }
 11813   else
 11814     {
 11815       css = xmalloc (SBYTES (lcss) + 1);
 11816       strncpy (css, SSDATA (lcss), SBYTES (lcss));
 11817       *(css + SBYTES (lcss) + 1) = 0;
 11818     }
 11819 #endif
 11820 
 11821 #else
 11822   /* Make a handle to a new rsvg object.  */
 11823   rsvg_handle = rsvg_handle_new ();
 11824   eassume (rsvg_handle);
 11825 
 11826   rsvg_handle_set_dpi_x_y (rsvg_handle, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->resx,
 11827                            FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->resy);
 11828 
 11829   /* Set base_uri for properly handling referenced images (via 'href').
 11830      Can be explicitly specified using `:base_uri' image property.
 11831      See rsvg bug 596114 - "image refs are relative to curdir, not .svg file"
 11832      <https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/librsvg/issues/33>. */
 11833   if (filename)
 11834     rsvg_handle_set_base_uri (rsvg_handle, filename);
 11835 
 11836   /* Parse the contents argument and fill in the rsvg_handle.  */
 11837   rsvg_handle_write (rsvg_handle, (unsigned char *) contents, size, &err);
 11838   if (err) goto rsvg_error;
 11839 
 11840   /* The parsing is complete, rsvg_handle is ready to be used, close
 11841      it for further writes.  */
 11842   rsvg_handle_close (rsvg_handle, &err);
 11843   if (err) goto rsvg_error;
 11844 #endif
 11845 
 11846   /* Get the image dimensions.  */
 11847 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 46, 0)
 11848   gdouble gviewbox_width = 0, gviewbox_height = 0;
 11849   gboolean has_viewbox = FALSE;
 11850 # if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 52, 1)
 11851   has_viewbox = rsvg_handle_get_intrinsic_size_in_pixels (rsvg_handle,
 11852                                                           &gviewbox_width,
 11853                                                           &gviewbox_height);
 11854 # endif
 11855 
 11856   if (has_viewbox)
 11857     {
 11858       viewbox_width = gviewbox_width;
 11859       viewbox_height = gviewbox_height;
 11860     }
 11861   else
 11862     {
 11863       RsvgRectangle zero_rect, viewbox, out_logical_rect;
 11864 
 11865       /* Try the intrinsic dimensions first.  */
 11866       gboolean has_width, has_height;
 11867       RsvgLength iwidth, iheight;
 11868       double dpi = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->resx;
 11869 
 11870       rsvg_handle_get_intrinsic_dimensions (rsvg_handle,
 11871                                             &has_width, &iwidth,
 11872                                             &has_height, &iheight,
 11873                                             &has_viewbox, &viewbox);
 11874 
 11875       if (has_width && has_height)
 11876         {
 11877           /* Success!  We can use these values directly.  */
 11878           viewbox_width = svg_css_length_to_pixels (iwidth, dpi,
 11879                                                     img->face_font_size);
 11880           viewbox_height = svg_css_length_to_pixels (iheight, dpi,
 11881                                                      img->face_font_size);
 11882 
 11883           /* Here one dimension could be zero because in percent unit.
 11884              So calculate this dimension with the other.  */
 11885           if (! (0 < viewbox_width) && (iwidth.unit == RSVG_UNIT_PERCENT))
 11886             viewbox_width = (viewbox_height * viewbox.width / viewbox.height)
 11887               * iwidth.length;
 11888           else if (! (0 < viewbox_height) && (iheight.unit == RSVG_UNIT_PERCENT))
 11889             viewbox_height = (viewbox_width * viewbox.height / viewbox.width)
 11890               * iheight.length;
 11891         }
 11892       else if (has_width && has_viewbox)
 11893         {
 11894           viewbox_width = svg_css_length_to_pixels (iwidth, dpi,
 11895                                                     img->face_font_size);
 11896           viewbox_height = viewbox_width * viewbox.height / viewbox.width;
 11897         }
 11898       else if (has_height && has_viewbox)
 11899         {
 11900           viewbox_height = svg_css_length_to_pixels (iheight, dpi,
 11901                                                      img->face_font_size);
 11902           viewbox_width = viewbox_height * viewbox.width / viewbox.height;
 11903         }
 11904       else if (has_viewbox)
 11905         {
 11906           viewbox_width = viewbox.width;
 11907           viewbox_height = viewbox.height;
 11908         }
 11909       else
 11910         viewbox_width = viewbox_height = 0;
 11911 
 11912       if (! (0 < viewbox_width && 0 < viewbox_height))
 11913         {
 11914           /* We haven't found a usable set of sizes, so try working out
 11915              the visible area.  */
 11916           rsvg_handle_get_geometry_for_layer (rsvg_handle, NULL,
 11917                                               &zero_rect, &viewbox,
 11918                                               &out_logical_rect, NULL);
 11919           viewbox_width = viewbox.x + viewbox.width;
 11920           viewbox_height = viewbox.y + viewbox.height;
 11921         }
 11922     }
 11923 #else
 11924   /* In librsvg before 2.46.0, guess the viewbox from the image dimensions.  */
 11925   RsvgDimensionData dimension_data;
 11926   rsvg_handle_get_dimensions (rsvg_handle, &dimension_data);
 11927   viewbox_width = dimension_data.width;
 11928   viewbox_height = dimension_data.height;
 11929 #endif
 11930 
 11931 #ifdef HAVE_NATIVE_TRANSFORMS
 11932   compute_image_size (viewbox_width, viewbox_height, img,
 11933                       &width, &height);
 11934 
 11935   width = scale_image_size (width, 1, FRAME_SCALE_FACTOR (f));
 11936   height = scale_image_size (height, 1, FRAME_SCALE_FACTOR (f));
 11937 #else
 11938   width = viewbox_width;
 11939   height = viewbox_height;
 11940 #endif
 11941 
 11942   if (! check_image_size (f, width, height))
 11943     {
 11944       image_size_error ();
 11945       goto done_error;
 11946     }
 11947 
 11948   /* We are now done with the unmodified data.  */
 11949   g_object_unref (rsvg_handle);
 11950 
 11951   /* Wrap the SVG data in another SVG.  This allows us to set the
 11952      width and height, as well as modify the foreground and background
 11953      colors.  */
 11954   {
 11955     Lisp_Object value;
 11956     unsigned long foreground = img->face_foreground;
 11957     unsigned long background = img->face_background;
 11958 
 11959     Lisp_Object encoded_contents
 11960       = Fbase64_encode_string (make_unibyte_string (contents, size), Qt);
 11961 
 11962     /* The wrapper sets the foreground color, width and height, and
 11963        viewBox must contain the dimensions of the original image.  It
 11964        also draws a rectangle over the whole space, set to the
 11965        background color, before including the original image.  This
 11966        acts to set the background color, instead of leaving it
 11967        transparent.  */
 11968     const char *wrapper =
 11969       "<svg xmlns:xlink=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink\" "
 11970       "xmlns:xi=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude\" "
 11971       "style=\"color: #%06X; fill: currentColor;\" "
 11972       "width=\"%d\" height=\"%d\" preserveAspectRatio=\"none\" "
 11973       "viewBox=\"0 0 %f %f\">"
 11974       "<rect width=\"100%%\" height=\"100%%\" fill=\"#%06X\"/>"
 11975       "<xi:include href=\"data:image/svg+xml;base64,%s\"></xi:include>"
 11976       "</svg>";
 11977 
 11978     /* FIXME: I've added 64 in the hope it will cover the size of the
 11979        width and height strings and things.  */
 11980     int buffer_size = SBYTES (encoded_contents) + strlen (wrapper) + 64;
 11981 
 11982     value = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCforeground, NULL);
 11983     if (!NILP (value))
 11984       foreground = image_alloc_image_color (f, img, value, img->face_foreground);
 11985     value = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCbackground, NULL);
 11986     if (!NILP (value))
 11987       {
 11988         background = image_alloc_image_color (f, img, value, img->face_background);
 11989         img->background = background;
 11990         img->background_valid = 1;
 11991       }
 11992 
 11993     wrapped_contents = xmalloc (buffer_size);
 11994 
 11995     if (buffer_size <= snprintf (wrapped_contents, buffer_size, wrapper,
 11996                                  foreground & 0xFFFFFF, width, height,
 11997                                  viewbox_width, viewbox_height,
 11998                                  background & 0xFFFFFF,
 11999                                  SSDATA (encoded_contents)))
 12000       goto rsvg_error;
 12001 
 12002     wrapped_size = strlen (wrapped_contents);
 12003   }
 12004 
 12005   /* Now we parse the wrapped version.  */
 12006 
 12007 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 32, 0)
 12008   input_stream = g_memory_input_stream_new_from_data (wrapped_contents, wrapped_size, NULL);
 12009   base_file = filename ? g_file_new_for_path (filename) : NULL;
 12010   rsvg_handle = rsvg_handle_new_from_stream_sync (input_stream, base_file,
 12011                                                   RSVG_HANDLE_FLAGS_NONE,
 12012                                                   NULL, &err);
 12013 
 12014   if (base_file)
 12015     g_object_unref (base_file);
 12016   g_object_unref (input_stream);
 12017 
 12018   /* Check rsvg_handle too, to avoid librsvg 2.40.13 bug (Bug#36773#26).  */
 12019   if (!rsvg_handle || err) goto rsvg_error;
 12020 
 12021   rsvg_handle_set_dpi_x_y (rsvg_handle, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->resx,
 12022                            FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->resy);
 12023 
 12024 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 48, 0)
 12025   rsvg_handle_set_stylesheet (rsvg_handle, (guint8 *)css, strlen (css), NULL);
 12026 #endif
 12027 #else
 12028   /* Make a handle to a new rsvg object.  */
 12029   rsvg_handle = rsvg_handle_new ();
 12030   eassume (rsvg_handle);
 12031 
 12032   rsvg_handle_set_dpi_x_y (rsvg_handle, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->resx,
 12033                            FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->resy);
 12034 
 12035   /* Set base_uri for properly handling referenced images (via 'href').
 12036      Can be explicitly specified using `:base_uri' image property.
 12037      See rsvg bug 596114 - "image refs are relative to curdir, not .svg file"
 12038      <https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/librsvg/issues/33>. */
 12039   if (filename)
 12040     rsvg_handle_set_base_uri (rsvg_handle, filename);
 12041 
 12042   /* Parse the contents argument and fill in the rsvg_handle.  */
 12043   rsvg_handle_write (rsvg_handle, (unsigned char *) wrapped_contents, wrapped_size, &err);
 12044   if (err) goto rsvg_error;
 12045 
 12046   /* The parsing is complete, rsvg_handle is ready to used, close it
 12047      for further writes.  */
 12048   rsvg_handle_close (rsvg_handle, &err);
 12049   if (err) goto rsvg_error;
 12050 #endif
 12051 
 12052 
 12053   /* We can now get a valid pixel buffer from the svg file, if all
 12054      went ok.  */
 12055   pixbuf = rsvg_handle_get_pixbuf (rsvg_handle);
 12056   if (!pixbuf) goto rsvg_error;
 12057   g_object_unref (rsvg_handle);
 12058   xfree (wrapped_contents);
 12059 
 12060 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 48, 0)
 12061   if (!STRINGP (lcss))
 12062     xfree (css);
 12063 #endif
 12064 
 12065   /* Extract some meta data from the svg handle.  */
 12066   width     = gdk_pixbuf_get_width (pixbuf);
 12067   height    = gdk_pixbuf_get_height (pixbuf);
 12068   pixels    = gdk_pixbuf_get_pixels (pixbuf);
 12069   rowstride = gdk_pixbuf_get_rowstride (pixbuf);
 12070 
 12071   /* Validate the svg meta data.  */
 12072   eassert (gdk_pixbuf_get_colorspace (pixbuf) == GDK_COLORSPACE_RGB);
 12073   eassert (gdk_pixbuf_get_n_channels (pixbuf) == 4);
 12074   eassert (gdk_pixbuf_get_has_alpha (pixbuf));
 12075   eassert (gdk_pixbuf_get_bits_per_sample (pixbuf) == 8);
 12076 
 12077   {
 12078     /* Try to create a x pixmap to hold the svg pixmap.  */
 12079     Emacs_Pix_Container ximg;
 12080     if (!image_create_x_image_and_pixmap (f, img, width, height, 0, &ximg, 0))
 12081       {
 12082         g_object_unref (pixbuf);
 12083         return false;
 12084       }
 12085 
 12086     init_color_table ();
 12087 
 12088     /* This loop handles opacity values, since Emacs assumes
 12089        non-transparent images.  Each pixel must be "flattened" by
 12090        calculating the resulting color, given the transparency of the
 12091        pixel, and the image background color.  */
 12092     for (int y = 0; y < height; ++y)
 12093       {
 12094         for (int x = 0; x < width; ++x)
 12095           {
 12096             int red     = *pixels++;
 12097             int green   = *pixels++;
 12098             int blue    = *pixels++;
 12099 
 12100             /* Skip opacity.  */
 12101             pixels++;
 12102 
 12103             PUT_PIXEL (ximg, x, y, lookup_rgb_color (f, red << 8, green << 8, blue << 8));
 12104           }
 12105 
 12106         pixels += rowstride - 4 * width;
 12107       }
 12108 
 12109 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
 12110     /* Remember colors allocated for this image.  */
 12111     img->colors = colors_in_color_table (&img->ncolors);
 12112     free_color_table ();
 12113 #endif /* COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT */
 12114 
 12115     g_object_unref (pixbuf);
 12116 
 12117     img->width  = width;
 12118     img->height = height;
 12119 
 12120     /* Maybe fill in the background field while we have ximg handy.
 12121        Casting avoids a GCC warning.  */
 12122     IMAGE_BACKGROUND (img, f, (Emacs_Pix_Context)ximg);
 12123 
 12124     /* Put ximg into the image.  */
 12125     image_put_x_image (f, img, ximg, 0);
 12126   }
 12127 
 12128   eassume (err == NULL);
 12129   return true;
 12130 
 12131  rsvg_error:
 12132   if (err && err->message[0])
 12133     {
 12134       errmsg = err->message;
 12135       errlen = strlen (errmsg);
 12136       /* Remove trailing whitespace from the error message text.  It
 12137          has a newline at the end, and perhaps more whitespace.  */
 12138       while (errlen && c_isspace (errmsg[errlen - 1]))
 12139         errlen--;
 12140       empty_errmsg = errlen == 0;
 12141     }
 12142 
 12143   if (empty_errmsg)
 12144     image_error ("Error parsing SVG image");
 12145   else
 12146     image_error ("Error parsing SVG image: %s", make_string (errmsg, errlen));
 12147 
 12148   if (err)
 12149     g_error_free (err);
 12150 
 12151  done_error:
 12152   if (rsvg_handle)
 12153     g_object_unref (rsvg_handle);
 12154   if (wrapped_contents)
 12155     xfree (wrapped_contents);
 12156 #if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 48, 0)
 12157   if (css && !STRINGP (lcss))
 12158     xfree (css);
 12159 #endif
 12160   return false;
 12161 }
 12162 
 12163 #endif  /* defined (HAVE_RSVG) */
 12164 
 12165 
 12166 
 12167 
 12168 /***********************************************************************
 12169                                 Ghostscript
 12170  ***********************************************************************/
 12171 
 12172 #if defined HAVE_X_WINDOWS && !defined USE_CAIRO
 12173 #define HAVE_GHOSTSCRIPT 1
 12174 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS && !USE_CAIRO */
 12175 
 12176 #ifdef HAVE_GHOSTSCRIPT
 12177 
 12178 /* Indices of image specification fields in gs_format, below.  */
 12179 
 12180 enum gs_keyword_index
 12181 {
 12182   GS_TYPE,
 12183   GS_PT_WIDTH,
 12184   GS_PT_HEIGHT,
 12185   GS_FILE,
 12186   GS_LOADER,
 12187   GS_BOUNDING_BOX,
 12188   GS_ASCENT,
 12189   GS_MARGIN,
 12190   GS_RELIEF,
 12191   GS_ALGORITHM,
 12192   GS_HEURISTIC_MASK,
 12193   GS_MASK,
 12194   GS_BACKGROUND,
 12195   GS_LAST
 12196 };
 12197 
 12198 /* Vector of image_keyword structures describing the format
 12199    of valid user-defined image specifications.  */
 12200 
 12201 static const struct image_keyword gs_format[GS_LAST] =
 12202 {
 12203   {":type",             IMAGE_SYMBOL_VALUE,                     1},
 12204   {":pt-width",         IMAGE_POSITIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,           1},
 12205   {":pt-height",        IMAGE_POSITIVE_INTEGER_VALUE,           1},
 12206   {":file",             IMAGE_STRING_VALUE,                     1},
 12207   {":loader",           IMAGE_FUNCTION_VALUE,                   0},
 12208   {":bounding-box",     IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            1},
 12209   {":ascent",           IMAGE_ASCENT_VALUE,                     0},
 12210   {":margin",           IMAGE_NON_NEGATIVE_INTEGER_VALUE_OR_PAIR, 0},
 12211   {":relief",           IMAGE_INTEGER_VALUE,                    0},
 12212   {":conversion",       IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
 12213   {":heuristic-mask",   IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
 12214   {":mask",             IMAGE_DONT_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE,            0},
 12215   {":background",       IMAGE_STRING_OR_NIL_VALUE,              0}
 12216 };
 12217 
 12218 /* Return true if OBJECT is a valid Ghostscript image
 12219    specification.  */
 12220 
 12221 static bool
 12222 gs_image_p (Lisp_Object object)
 12223 {
 12224   struct image_keyword fmt[GS_LAST];
 12225   Lisp_Object tem;
 12226   int i;
 12227 
 12228   memcpy (fmt, gs_format, sizeof fmt);
 12229 
 12230   if (!parse_image_spec (object, fmt, GS_LAST, Qpostscript))
 12231     return 0;
 12232 
 12233   /* Bounding box must be a list or vector containing 4 integers.  */
 12234   tem = fmt[GS_BOUNDING_BOX].value;
 12235   if (CONSP (tem))
 12236     {
 12237       for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i, tem = XCDR (tem))
 12238         if (!CONSP (tem) || !FIXNUMP (XCAR (tem)))
 12239           return 0;
 12240       if (!NILP (tem))
 12241         return 0;
 12242     }
 12243   else if (VECTORP (tem))
 12244     {
 12245       if (ASIZE (tem) != 4)
 12246         return 0;
 12247       for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i)
 12248         if (!FIXNUMP (AREF (tem, i)))
 12249           return 0;
 12250     }
 12251   else
 12252     return 0;
 12253 
 12254   return 1;
 12255 }
 12256 
 12257 
 12258 /* Load Ghostscript image IMG for use on frame F.  Value is true
 12259    if successful.  */
 12260 
 12261 static bool
 12262 gs_load (struct frame *f, struct image *img)
 12263 {
 12264   uintmax_t printnum1, printnum2;
 12265   char buffer[sizeof " " + 2 * INT_STRLEN_BOUND (intmax_t)];
 12266   Lisp_Object window_and_pixmap_id = Qnil, loader, pt_height, pt_width;
 12267   Lisp_Object frame;
 12268   double in_width, in_height;
 12269   Lisp_Object pixel_colors = Qnil;
 12270 
 12271   /* Compute pixel size of pixmap needed from the given size in the
 12272      image specification.  Sizes in the specification are in pt.  1 pt
 12273      = 1/72 in, xdpi and ydpi are stored in the frame's X display
 12274      info.  */
 12275   pt_width = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCpt_width, NULL);
 12276   in_width = FIXNUMP (pt_width) ? XFIXNAT (pt_width) / 72.0 : 0;
 12277   in_width *= FRAME_RES_X (f);
 12278   pt_height = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCpt_height, NULL);
 12279   in_height = FIXNUMP (pt_height) ? XFIXNAT (pt_height) / 72.0 : 0;
 12280   in_height *= FRAME_RES_Y (f);
 12281 
 12282   if (! (in_width <= INT_MAX && in_height <= INT_MAX
 12283          && check_image_size (f, in_width, in_height)))
 12284     {
 12285       image_size_error ();
 12286       return 0;
 12287     }
 12288   img->width = in_width;
 12289   img->height = in_height;
 12290 
 12291   /* Create the pixmap.  */
 12292   eassert (img->pixmap == NO_PIXMAP);
 12293 
 12294   if (image_check_image_size (0, img->width, img->height))
 12295     {
 12296       /* Only W32 version did BLOCK_INPUT here.  ++kfs */
 12297       block_input ();
 12298       img->pixmap = XCreatePixmap (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
 12299                                    img->width, img->height,
 12300                                    FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->n_planes);
 12301       unblock_input ();
 12302     }
 12303 
 12304   if (!img->pixmap)
 12305     {
 12306       image_error ("Unable to create pixmap for `%s'" , img->spec);
 12307       return 0;
 12308     }
 12309 
 12310   /* Call the loader to fill the pixmap.  It returns a process object
 12311      if successful.  We do not record_unwind_protect here because
 12312      other places in redisplay like calling window scroll functions
 12313      don't either.  Let the Lisp loader use `unwind-protect' instead.  */
 12314   printnum1 = FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f);
 12315   printnum2 = img->pixmap;
 12316   window_and_pixmap_id
 12317     = make_formatted_string (buffer, "%"PRIuMAX" %"PRIuMAX,
 12318                              printnum1, printnum2);
 12319 
 12320   printnum1 = FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f);
 12321   printnum2 = FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f);
 12322   pixel_colors
 12323     = make_formatted_string (buffer, "%"PRIuMAX" %"PRIuMAX,
 12324                              printnum1, printnum2);
 12325 
 12326   XSETFRAME (frame, f);
 12327   loader = image_spec_value (img->spec, QCloader, NULL);
 12328   if (NILP (loader))
 12329     loader = intern ("gs-load-image");
 12330 
 12331   img->lisp_data = call6 (loader, frame, img->spec,
 12332                           make_fixnum (img->width),
 12333                           make_fixnum (img->height),
 12334                           window_and_pixmap_id,
 12335                           pixel_colors);
 12336   return PROCESSP (img->lisp_data);
 12337 }
 12338 
 12339 
 12340 /* Kill the Ghostscript process that was started to fill PIXMAP on
 12341    frame F.  Called from XTread_socket when receiving an event
 12342    telling Emacs that Ghostscript has finished drawing.  */
 12343 
 12344 void
 12345 x_kill_gs_process (Pixmap pixmap, struct frame *f)
 12346 {
 12347   struct image_cache *c = FRAME_IMAGE_CACHE (f);
 12348   ptrdiff_t i;
 12349   struct image *img;
 12350 
 12351   /* Find the image containing PIXMAP.  */
 12352   for (i = 0; i < c->used; ++i)
 12353     if (c->images[i]->pixmap == pixmap)
 12354       break;
 12355 
 12356   /* Should someone in between have cleared the image cache, for
 12357      instance, give up.  */
 12358   if (i == c->used)
 12359     return;
 12360 
 12361   /* Kill the GS process.  We should have found PIXMAP in the image
 12362      cache and its image should contain a process object.  */
 12363   img = c->images[i];
 12364   eassert (PROCESSP (img->lisp_data));
 12365   Fkill_process (img->lisp_data, Qnil);
 12366   img->lisp_data = Qnil;
 12367 
 12368 #if defined (HAVE_X_WINDOWS)
 12369 
 12370   /* On displays with a mutable colormap, figure out the colors
 12371      allocated for the image by looking at the pixels of an XImage for
 12372      img->pixmap.  */
 12373   if (x_mutable_colormap (FRAME_X_VISUAL_INFO (f)))
 12374     {
 12375       XImage *ximg;
 12376 
 12377       block_input ();
 12378 
 12379       /* Try to get an XImage for img->pixmep.  */
 12380       ximg = XGetImage (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), img->pixmap,
 12381                         0, 0, img->width, img->height, ~0, ZPixmap);
 12382       if (ximg)
 12383         {
 12384           /* Initialize the color table.  */
 12385           init_color_table ();
 12386 
 12387           /* For each pixel of the image, look its color up in the
 12388              color table.  After having done so, the color table will
 12389              contain an entry for each color used by the image.  */
 12390 #ifdef COLOR_TABLE_SUPPORT
 12391           for (int y = 0; y < img->height; ++y)
 12392             for (int x = 0; x < img->width; ++x)
 12393               {
 12394                 unsigned long pixel = XGetPixel (ximg, x, y);
 12395 
 12396                 lookup_pixel_color (f, pixel);
 12397               }
 12398 
 12399           /* Record colors in the image.  Free color table and XImage.  */
 12400           img->colors = colors_in_color_table (&img->ncolors);
 12401           free_color_table ();
 12402 #endif
 12403           XDestroyImage (ximg);
 12404         }
 12405       else
 12406         image_error ("Cannot get X image of `%s'; colors will not be freed",
 12407                      img->spec);
 12408 
 12409       unblock_input ();
 12410     }
 12411 #endif /* HAVE_X_WINDOWS */
 12412 
 12413   /* Now that we have the pixmap, compute mask and transform the
 12414      image if requested.  */
 12415   block_input ();
 12416   postprocess_image (f, img);
 12417   unblock_input ();
 12418 }
 12419 
 12420 #endif /* HAVE_GHOSTSCRIPT */
 12421 
 12422 
 12423 /***********************************************************************
 12424                                 Tests
 12425  ***********************************************************************/
 12426 DEFUN ("imagep", Fimagep, Simagep, 1, 1, 0,
 12427        doc: /* Value is non-nil if SPEC is a valid image specification.  */)
 12428   (Lisp_Object spec)
 12429 {
 12430   return valid_image_p (spec) ? Qt : Qnil;
 12431 }
 12432 
 12433 #ifdef GLYPH_DEBUG
 12434 
 12435 DEFUN ("lookup-image", Flookup_image, Slookup_image, 1, 1, 0,
 12436        doc: /* */)
 12437   (Lisp_Object spec)
 12438 {
 12439   ptrdiff_t id = -1;
 12440 
 12441   if (valid_image_p (spec))
 12442     id = lookup_image (SELECTED_FRAME (), spec, -1);
 12443 
 12444   debug_print (spec);
 12445   return make_fixnum (id);
 12446 }
 12447 
 12448 #endif /* GLYPH_DEBUG */
 12449 
 12450 
 12451 /***********************************************************************
 12452                             Initialization
 12453  ***********************************************************************/
 12454 
 12455 DEFUN ("image-transforms-p", Fimage_transforms_p, Simage_transforms_p, 0, 1, 0,
 12456        doc: /* Test whether FRAME supports image transformation.
 12457 Return list of capabilities if FRAME supports native transforms, nil otherwise.
 12458 FRAME defaults to the selected frame.
 12459 The list of capabilities can include one or more of the following:
 12460 
 12461  - the symbol `scale' if FRAME supports image scaling
 12462  - the symbol `rotate90' if FRAME supports image rotation only by angles
 12463     that are integral multiples of 90 degrees.  */)
 12464      (Lisp_Object frame)
 12465 {
 12466   struct frame *f = decode_live_frame (frame);
 12467   if (FRAME_WINDOW_P (f))
 12468     {
 12469 #ifdef HAVE_NATIVE_TRANSFORMS
 12470 # if defined HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK || defined (USE_CAIRO) || defined (HAVE_NS) \
 12471   || defined (HAVE_HAIKU) | defined HAVE_ANDROID
 12472       return list2 (Qscale, Qrotate90);
 12473 # elif defined (HAVE_X_WINDOWS) && defined (HAVE_XRENDER)
 12474       if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xrender_supported_p)
 12475         return list2 (Qscale, Qrotate90);
 12476 # elif defined (HAVE_NTGUI)
 12477       return (w32_image_rotations_p ()
 12478               ? list2 (Qscale, Qrotate90)
 12479               : list1 (Qscale));
 12480 # endif
 12481 #endif
 12482     }
 12483 
 12484   return Qnil;
 12485 }
 12486 
 12487 DEFUN ("image-cache-size", Fimage_cache_size, Simage_cache_size, 0, 0, 0,
 12488        doc: /* Return the size of the image cache.  */)
 12489   (void)
 12490 {
 12491   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
 12492   size_t total = 0;
 12493 
 12494   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 12495     if (FRAME_WINDOW_P (XFRAME (frame)))
 12496       total += image_frame_cache_size (XFRAME (frame));
 12497 
 12498 #if defined (HAVE_WEBP) || defined (HAVE_GIF)
 12499   struct anim_cache *pcache = anim_cache;
 12500   while (pcache)
 12501     {
 12502       total += pcache->byte_size;
 12503       pcache = pcache->next;
 12504     }
 12505 #endif
 12506 
 12507   return make_int (total);
 12508 }
 12509 
 12510 
 12511 DEFUN ("init-image-library", Finit_image_library, Sinit_image_library, 1, 1, 0,
 12512        doc: /* Initialize image library implementing image type TYPE.
 12513 Return t if TYPE is a supported image type.
 12514 
 12515 If image libraries are loaded dynamically (currently the case only on
 12516 MS-Windows), load the library for TYPE if it is not yet loaded, using
 12517 the library file(s) specified by `dynamic-library-alist'.  */)
 12518   (Lisp_Object type)
 12519 {
 12520   return lookup_image_type (type) ? Qt : Qnil;
 12521 }
 12522 
 12523 static bool
 12524 initialize_image_type (struct image_type const *type)
 12525 {
 12526 #ifdef WINDOWSNT
 12527   Lisp_Object typesym = builtin_lisp_symbol (type->type);
 12528 
 12529 # if HAVE_NATIVE_IMAGE_API
 12530   if (image_can_use_native_api (typesym))
 12531     return true;
 12532 # endif
 12533 
 12534   Lisp_Object tested = Fassq (typesym, Vlibrary_cache);
 12535   /* If we failed to load the library before, don't try again.  */
 12536   if (CONSP (tested))
 12537     return !NILP (XCDR (tested)) ? true : false;
 12538 
 12539   bool (*init) (void) = type->init;
 12540   if (init)
 12541     {
 12542       bool type_valid = init ();
 12543       Vlibrary_cache = Fcons (Fcons (typesym, type_valid ? Qt : Qnil),
 12544                               Vlibrary_cache);
 12545       return type_valid;
 12546     }
 12547 #endif
 12548   return true;
 12549 }
 12550 
 12551 /* Array of supported image types.  */
 12552 
 12553 static struct image_type const image_types[] =
 12554 {
 12555 #ifdef HAVE_GHOSTSCRIPT
 12556  { SYMBOL_INDEX (Qpostscript), gs_image_p, gs_load, image_clear_image },
 12557 #endif
 12558 #ifdef HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK
 12559  { SYMBOL_INDEX (Qimagemagick), imagemagick_image_p, imagemagick_load,
 12560    imagemagick_clear_image },
 12561 #endif
 12562 #ifdef HAVE_RSVG
 12563  { SYMBOL_INDEX (Qsvg), svg_image_p, svg_load, image_clear_image,
 12564    IMAGE_TYPE_INIT (init_svg_functions) },
 12565 #endif
 12566 #if defined HAVE_PNG
 12567  { SYMBOL_INDEX (Qpng), png_image_p, png_load, image_clear_image,
 12568    IMAGE_TYPE_INIT (init_png_functions) },
 12569 #endif
 12570 #if defined HAVE_GIF
 12571  { SYMBOL_INDEX (Qgif), gif_image_p, gif_load, gif_clear_image,
 12572    IMAGE_TYPE_INIT (init_gif_functions) },
 12573 #endif
 12574 #if defined HAVE_TIFF
 12575  { SYMBOL_INDEX (Qtiff), tiff_image_p, tiff_load, image_clear_image,
 12576    IMAGE_TYPE_INIT (init_tiff_functions) },
 12577 #endif
 12578 #if defined HAVE_JPEG
 12579  { SYMBOL_INDEX (Qjpeg), jpeg_image_p, jpeg_load, image_clear_image,
 12580    IMAGE_TYPE_INIT (init_jpeg_functions) },
 12581 #endif
 12582 #if defined HAVE_XPM || defined HAVE_NS || defined HAVE_HAIKU   \
 12583   || defined HAVE_PGTK || defined HAVE_ANDROID
 12584  { SYMBOL_INDEX (Qxpm), xpm_image_p, xpm_load, image_clear_image,
 12585    IMAGE_TYPE_INIT (init_xpm_functions) },
 12586 #endif
 12587 #if defined HAVE_WEBP
 12588  { SYMBOL_INDEX (Qwebp), webp_image_p, webp_load, image_clear_image,
 12589    IMAGE_TYPE_INIT (init_webp_functions) },
 12590 #endif
 12591  { SYMBOL_INDEX (Qxbm), xbm_image_p, xbm_load, image_clear_image },
 12592  { SYMBOL_INDEX (Qpbm), pbm_image_p, pbm_load, image_clear_image },
 12593 };
 12594 
 12595 #if HAVE_NATIVE_IMAGE_API
 12596 struct image_type native_image_type =
 12597   { SYMBOL_INDEX (Qnative_image), native_image_p, native_image_load,
 12598     image_clear_image };
 12599 #endif
 12600 
 12601 /* Look up image type TYPE, and return a pointer to its image_type
 12602    structure.  Return 0 if TYPE is not a known image type.  */
 12603 
 12604 static struct image_type const *
 12605 lookup_image_type (Lisp_Object type)
 12606 {
 12607 #if HAVE_NATIVE_IMAGE_API
 12608   if (image_can_use_native_api (type))
 12609     return &native_image_type;
 12610 #endif
 12611 
 12612   for (int i = 0; i < ARRAYELTS (image_types); i++)
 12613     {
 12614       struct image_type const *r = &image_types[i];
 12615       if (EQ (type, builtin_lisp_symbol (r->type)))
 12616         return initialize_image_type (r) ? r : NULL;
 12617     }
 12618   return NULL;
 12619 }
 12620 
 12621 /* Prune the animation caches.  If CLEAR, remove all animation cache
 12622    entries.  */
 12623 void
 12624 image_prune_animation_caches (bool clear)
 12625 {
 12626 #if defined (HAVE_WEBP) || defined (HAVE_GIF)
 12627   anim_prune_animation_cache (clear? Qt: Qnil);
 12628 #endif
 12629 #ifdef HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK
 12630   imagemagick_prune_animation_cache (clear);
 12631 #endif
 12632 }
 12633 
 12634 void
 12635 syms_of_image (void)
 12636 {
 12637   /* Must be defined now because we're going to update it below, while
 12638      defining the supported image types.  */
 12639   DEFVAR_LISP ("image-types", Vimage_types,
 12640     doc: /* List of potentially supported image types.
 12641 Each element of the list is a symbol for an image type, like `jpeg' or `png'.
 12642 To check whether it is really supported, use `image-type-available-p'.  */);
 12643   Vimage_types = Qnil;
 12644 
 12645   DEFVAR_LISP ("max-image-size", Vmax_image_size,
 12646     doc: /* Maximum size of images.
 12647 Emacs will not load an image into memory if its pixel width or
 12648 pixel height exceeds this limit.
 12649 
 12650 If the value is an integer, it directly specifies the maximum
 12651 image height and width, measured in pixels.  If it is a floating
 12652 point number, it specifies the maximum image height and width
 12653 as a ratio to the frame height and width.  If the value is
 12654 non-numeric, there is no explicit limit on the size of images.  */);
 12655   Vmax_image_size = make_float (MAX_IMAGE_SIZE);
 12656 
 12657   /* Other symbols.  */
 12658   DEFSYM (Qcount, "count");
 12659   DEFSYM (Qextension_data, "extension-data");
 12660   DEFSYM (Qdelay, "delay");
 12661 
 12662   /* Keywords.  */
 12663   DEFSYM (QCascent, ":ascent");
 12664   DEFSYM (QCmargin, ":margin");
 12665   DEFSYM (QCrelief, ":relief");
 12666   DEFSYM (QCconversion, ":conversion");
 12667   DEFSYM (QCcolor_symbols, ":color-symbols");
 12668   DEFSYM (QCheuristic_mask, ":heuristic-mask");
 12669   DEFSYM (QCindex, ":index");
 12670   DEFSYM (QCcrop, ":crop");
 12671   DEFSYM (QCrotation, ":rotation");
 12672   DEFSYM (QCmatrix, ":matrix");
 12673   DEFSYM (QCscale, ":scale");
 12674   DEFSYM (QCtransform_smoothing, ":transform-smoothing");
 12675   DEFSYM (QCcolor_adjustment, ":color-adjustment");
 12676   DEFSYM (QCmask, ":mask");
 12677   DEFSYM (QCflip, ":flip");
 12678 
 12679   /* Other symbols.  */
 12680   DEFSYM (Qlaplace, "laplace");
 12681   DEFSYM (Qemboss, "emboss");
 12682   DEFSYM (Qedge_detection, "edge-detection");
 12683   DEFSYM (Qheuristic, "heuristic");
 12684 
 12685   DEFSYM (Qpostscript, "postscript");
 12686   DEFSYM (QCmax_width, ":max-width");
 12687   DEFSYM (QCmax_height, ":max-height");
 12688 
 12689   DEFSYM (Qem, "em");
 12690 
 12691 #ifdef HAVE_NATIVE_TRANSFORMS
 12692   DEFSYM (Qscale, "scale");
 12693   DEFSYM (Qrotate, "rotate");
 12694   DEFSYM (Qrotate90, "rotate90");
 12695   DEFSYM (Qcrop, "crop");
 12696 #endif
 12697 
 12698 #ifdef HAVE_GHOSTSCRIPT
 12699   add_image_type (Qpostscript);
 12700   DEFSYM (QCloader, ":loader");
 12701   DEFSYM (QCpt_width, ":pt-width");
 12702   DEFSYM (QCpt_height, ":pt-height");
 12703 #endif /* HAVE_GHOSTSCRIPT */
 12704 
 12705 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
 12706   /* Versions of libpng, libgif, and libjpeg that we were compiled with,
 12707      or -1 if no PNG/GIF support was compiled in.  This is tested by
 12708      w32-win.el to correctly set up the alist used to search for the
 12709      respective image libraries.  */
 12710   DEFSYM (Qlibpng_version, "libpng-version");
 12711   Fset (Qlibpng_version,
 12712 #if HAVE_PNG
 12713         make_fixnum (PNG_LIBPNG_VER)
 12714 #else
 12715         make_fixnum (-1)
 12716 #endif
 12717         );
 12718   DEFSYM (Qlibgif_version, "libgif-version");
 12719   Fset (Qlibgif_version,
 12720 #ifdef HAVE_GIF
 12721         make_fixnum (GIFLIB_MAJOR * 10000
 12722                      + GIFLIB_MINOR * 100
 12723                      + GIFLIB_RELEASE)
 12724 #else
 12725         make_fixnum (-1)
 12726 #endif
 12727         );
 12728   DEFSYM (Qlibjpeg_version, "libjpeg-version");
 12729   Fset (Qlibjpeg_version,
 12730 #if HAVE_JPEG
 12731         make_fixnum (JPEG_LIB_VERSION)
 12732 #else
 12733         make_fixnum (-1)
 12734 #endif
 12735         );
 12736 #endif
 12737 
 12738   DEFSYM (Qpbm, "pbm");
 12739   add_image_type (Qpbm);
 12740 
 12741   DEFSYM (Qxbm, "xbm");
 12742   add_image_type (Qxbm);
 12743 
 12744 #if defined (HAVE_XPM) || defined (HAVE_NS) \
 12745   || defined (HAVE_HAIKU) || defined (HAVE_PGTK) \
 12746   || defined (HAVE_ANDROID)
 12747   DEFSYM (Qxpm, "xpm");
 12748   add_image_type (Qxpm);
 12749 #endif
 12750 
 12751 #if defined (HAVE_JPEG) || defined (HAVE_NATIVE_IMAGE_API)
 12752   DEFSYM (Qjpeg, "jpeg");
 12753   add_image_type (Qjpeg);
 12754 #endif
 12755 
 12756 #if defined (HAVE_TIFF) || defined (HAVE_NATIVE_IMAGE_API)
 12757   DEFSYM (Qtiff, "tiff");
 12758   add_image_type (Qtiff);
 12759 #endif
 12760 
 12761 #if defined (HAVE_GIF) || defined (HAVE_NATIVE_IMAGE_API)
 12762   DEFSYM (Qgif, "gif");
 12763   add_image_type (Qgif);
 12764 #endif
 12765 
 12766 #if defined (HAVE_PNG) || defined (HAVE_NATIVE_IMAGE_API)
 12767   DEFSYM (Qpng, "png");
 12768   add_image_type (Qpng);
 12769 #endif
 12770 
 12771 #if defined (HAVE_WEBP) || (defined (HAVE_NATIVE_IMAGE_API) \
 12772                             && defined (HAVE_HAIKU))
 12773   DEFSYM (Qwebp, "webp");
 12774   DEFSYM (Qwebpdemux, "webpdemux");
 12775   add_image_type (Qwebp);
 12776 #endif
 12777 
 12778 #if defined (HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK)
 12779   DEFSYM (Qimagemagick, "imagemagick");
 12780   add_image_type (Qimagemagick);
 12781 #endif
 12782 
 12783 #if defined (HAVE_RSVG)
 12784   DEFSYM (Qsvg, "svg");
 12785   DEFSYM (QCbase_uri, ":base-uri");
 12786   DEFSYM (QCcss, ":css");
 12787   add_image_type (Qsvg);
 12788 #ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
 12789   /* Other libraries used directly by svg code.  */
 12790   DEFSYM (Qgdk_pixbuf, "gdk-pixbuf");
 12791   DEFSYM (Qglib, "glib");
 12792 # if LIBRSVG_CHECK_VERSION (2, 32, 0)
 12793   DEFSYM (Qgio,  "gio");
 12794 # endif
 12795   DEFSYM (Qgobject, "gobject");
 12796 #endif /* HAVE_NTGUI  */
 12797 #elif defined HAVE_NATIVE_IMAGE_API                     \
 12798   && ((defined HAVE_NS && defined NS_IMPL_COCOA)        \
 12799       || defined HAVE_HAIKU)
 12800   DEFSYM (Qsvg, "svg");
 12801 
 12802   /* On Haiku, the SVG translator may not be installed.  */
 12803   if (image_can_use_native_api (Qsvg))
 12804     add_image_type (Qsvg);
 12805 #endif
 12806 
 12807 #ifdef HAVE_NS
 12808   DEFSYM (Qheic, "heic");
 12809   add_image_type (Qheic);
 12810 #endif
 12811 
 12812 #if HAVE_NATIVE_IMAGE_API
 12813   DEFSYM (Qnative_image, "native-image");
 12814 
 12815 # if defined HAVE_NTGUI || defined HAVE_HAIKU
 12816   DEFSYM (Qbmp, "bmp");
 12817   add_image_type (Qbmp);
 12818 # endif
 12819 
 12820 # ifdef HAVE_NTGUI
 12821   DEFSYM (Qgdiplus, "gdiplus");
 12822   DEFSYM (Qshlwapi, "shlwapi");
 12823 # endif
 12824 #endif
 12825 
 12826   defsubr (&Sinit_image_library);
 12827 #ifdef HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK
 12828   defsubr (&Simagemagick_types);
 12829 #endif
 12830   defsubr (&Sclear_image_cache);
 12831   defsubr (&Simage_flush);
 12832   defsubr (&Simage_size);
 12833   defsubr (&Simage_mask_p);
 12834   defsubr (&Simage_metadata);
 12835   defsubr (&Simage_cache_size);
 12836   defsubr (&Simagep);
 12837 
 12838 #ifdef GLYPH_DEBUG
 12839   defsubr (&Slookup_image);
 12840 #endif
 12841 
 12842   DEFSYM (QCanimate_buffer, ":animate-buffer");
 12843   DEFSYM (QCanimate_tardiness, ":animate-tardiness");
 12844   DEFSYM (QCanimate_position, ":animate-position");
 12845   DEFSYM (QCanimate_multi_frame_data, ":animate-multi-frame-data");
 12846 
 12847   defsubr (&Simage_transforms_p);
 12848 
 12849   DEFVAR_BOOL ("cross-disabled-images", cross_disabled_images,
 12850     doc: /* Non-nil means always draw a cross over disabled images.
 12851 Disabled images are those having a `:conversion disabled' property.
 12852 A cross is always drawn on black & white displays.  */);
 12853   cross_disabled_images = 0;
 12854 
 12855   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-bitmap-file-path", Vx_bitmap_file_path,
 12856     doc: /* List of directories to search for window system bitmap files.  */);
 12857   Vx_bitmap_file_path = decode_env_path (0, PATH_BITMAPS, 0);
 12858 
 12859   DEFVAR_LISP ("image-cache-eviction-delay", Vimage_cache_eviction_delay,
 12860     doc: /* Maximum time after which images are removed from the cache.
 12861 When an image has not been displayed this many seconds, Emacs
 12862 automatically removes it from the image cache.  If the cache contains
 12863 a large number of images, the actual eviction time may be shorter.
 12864 The value can also be nil, meaning the cache is never cleared.
 12865 
 12866 The function `clear-image-cache' disregards this variable.  */);
 12867   Vimage_cache_eviction_delay = make_fixnum (300);
 12868 #ifdef HAVE_IMAGEMAGICK
 12869   DEFVAR_INT ("imagemagick-render-type", imagemagick_render_type,
 12870     doc: /* Integer indicating which ImageMagick rendering method to use.
 12871 The options are:
 12872   0 -- the default method (pixel pushing)
 12873   1 -- a newer method ("MagickExportImagePixels") that may perform
 12874        better (speed etc) in some cases, but has not been as thoroughly
 12875        tested with Emacs as the default method.  This method requires
 12876        ImageMagick version 6.4.6 (approximately) or later.
 12877 */);
 12878   /* MagickExportImagePixels is in 6.4.6-9, but not 6.4.4-10.  */
 12879   imagemagick_render_type = 0;
 12880 #endif
 12881 }
/* [<][>][^][v][top][bottom][index][help] */
